text:
F: big, tan, good retention.
C: orange amber, hazy.
A: malty, caramel, toast, light toffee, fruity.
T: malty, toast, toffee, bit of alcohol, caramel, bread, light spicy, decently hoppy, mellow fruity, medium to full body, medium carbonation, very good balanced, enjoyed, 355ml bottle from Whole Foods Market  Piccadilly in London.
12oz bottle. Hazy reddish orange, thin off white head. Malty fruity nose. Sweet malt flavors, dark fruit, cereal. Light hops on finish, but overall this is a malt show.
Приятны& бок, красивы& цвет, хорошая горчинк& приятно испить в компани& с бургеро& хорошим&

På flaske til Øl-mødet. - Klar ravfarvet med en Off-white skumkrone - Smag. Karamel, citrus og nogle krydrede noter. - Stærk maltet og en mediun krop.
Samlet set en rigtig god bock.

Sweet honey and caramel notes, slightly spiced. Such a beautiful dark amber colour, clear with no deposits, the head is fine too at first but sadly its very volatile. Tastes sweet, light body, medium-high carbonation, subtle finish. While not exactly shocking, everything about it is above average

One of my favorite beers. Smells like roasted honey and caramel. Has a great bright warm hue for an ale. Taste like an expensive cologne in a good way. Finishes perfectly. I buy sixers of this beer too regularly.
Keg at the Rake, Borough. Amber pour with a white head. Nose of toffee, caramel, apricot, candied peel. Taste of apricot jam, vanilla, caramel, toffee, tangerine. Quite nice.
Arômes de houblon, grain et quelques notes dorange. Robe orange claire et mousse blanche. En bouche, beaucoup de corps, amertume moyenne, caramel.

Very smooth for Michelle dark but not to dark rates high for smooth balance


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bière dune belle couleur de rouille qui fournit une mousse blanche persistante. Goût puissant qui perdure. Agréable.
Draft Rogue dead guy ale. Hazy dark orange with an off white head. Aroma of roasted grains, malt, caramel. Flavour is the same with a long sweet aftertaste. Good!
Nose: caramel, malts. Taate: sweetness going into a soft hoppy bitter. Very inoffensive beer: easily quaffable.

Excellent beer. Smooth and easy drinking, but still decent ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровь& Na zdravi
Slightly hazy amber. Thin head, high retention. Aroma intensity 3.5/5. Pear, malt and cut grass aroma, with notes of vanilla. Medium bitter on anise-like sweet. Medium body
Bottle from Liquor Barn into a pint glass. Aroma of caramel malts and something astringent.

Cerveza de color ámbar anaranjado turbia con una pequeña cabeza blanquecina.
Aroma a maltas caramelo tostado dulce con un leve toque cítrico.
Sabor a maltas caramelo, especias, afrutado y maltas tostada con un toque de lúpulo cítricos y un poco dulce. Una buena interpretación del estilo y una cerveza agradable.

Aroma: caramel, baked potato, malty.
Appearance: amber color and white head.
Taste: caramel, celler, roasted dark malts, malty, semi-sweet.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: an average maibock, only sweet.

Bue en pression chez John Circus. Ambrée, col de mousse moyen bonne tenue, carbo moyenne. Aôme malts grillés. Assez bien équilibrée, final légère amertume mais surtout malt grillés. A part le malt grillés, pas grand chose à dire.

12 oz bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a darker golden orange with a thin ring of white head and no lace as it falls down. The aroma is really malty and sweet. There is a strong caramel going on, but its very bland and plain. The flavor is much of the same. Its god a light caramel sweetness and a lingering bitterness from the hops. There is not a lot going on, and its kind of a bummer. The mouth feel is a little light with a brighter carbonation and a lingeringly sweet caramel and bitter hop on the back end. I dont know how I feel about it.

Can shared with koleminer20. For the book. Aroma is fruity, caramel, slight metallic, toffee, it smells pretty good. Appearance is amber, off white head, mostly hazy. Taste is slightly caramel, slightly malty bitter, toasted, slightly fruity, really light flavors all around. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, toasted caramel aftertaste. Overall, this one is pretty boring flavor-wise.

Kolor ciemno bursztynowy, delikatnie miedziany. Barwa jest prawie klarowna. Piana bia?a, puszysta, jest do?? wysoka i trwa?a.
Aromat bardzo mocno chlebowy, s?odki, s?odowy. S? kasztany i orzechy z chrupi?c? skórk? z wijskiego chleba.
S?odowo??, jest odrobina ?wie?ego chleba, ponownie troch? kasztanów i orzechów. Jest przypalony karmel i "przypalona" goryczka. W tle delikatne akcenty miodowe.
Wysycenie ?rednie. PIwo jest dosy? ci??ki, pe?ne ale g?adkie.
Bottle from Bitter Virtue, Southampton. Slightly hazy amber pour with small white head. Aromas of pine and roasted malts. Taste is quite sweet with caramel flavours. Decent bitter finish.
On tap at local pub: Rich amber color with semi fizzy head. Pleasant aroma of roasted malt, pine, and tropical fruits. Nice hoppy taste with hints of citrus flavors.
Nice amber/orange color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of caramel malt, & hops; Flavor of sweet malt, hops, caramel, and light fruit; Finish is slightly bitter; Pretty decent overall.

Bottle. Hazy honey colour, moderate off-white head. Medium-lacing. Pleasant melon smell. Nectar, honey, Sherry. Medium to full body. Relatively dry flavour. Nice maltiness. Melon. Nutty, Sherry. Pleasant esters. Solid grassy bitterness finishes the whole thing. The ending lingers. Very good.

On the the occasion I am having a finicky palate this is my go to beer. Sure Ill switch things up but this is always a good beer to get things started. Maybe its just the kid in me but sometimes I like the sweet, carmel malty taste vs the bitter taste of pine sap.

From a beer hawk mystery case. Pours golden , little aroma, sweet, no hops I could detect. Little non-descript. Not one I will be looking out for again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy amber colour on pouring. Very malty, has a caramel sweetness. The hops give a slight citrus note but its in the background.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 Birra dal colore ambrato. All?olfatto sentori di caramello, malto e zeste. Al palato mediamente corposa con note di malto, frutta candita e ricola. Nel finale lievemente amara. Una birra mto beverina.
Sweet malty, caramel. fairly low carbonation, medium body and soft mouthfeel. Children would like this.

Bottle. Pours light hazy brownish amber with medium white head. Aroma is grain, green malt and deep bitter notes of hops. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter and light acidic. Body is watery to light oily with light fizzy carbonation. Finish is medium long and balanced sweet and bitter with notes that follow the nose.

Aroma is malty like an Oktoberfest. Very light crimson color with an off white head. Tastes slightly sweet with a bite that is a mix between hops and orange rind. Good slick palate. Maibock is not my favorite style but this is one of the better representations I have had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
At BKL - The beer is rather sweetish, malty, full body, ripe mandarina, boozy finish. There are better Böcke in the world.

Bottle at home. Pours amber in colour with a thin head and good lacing. Pleasant aroma: malty, nutty and some leafy hop. Slight sweetness leads to a strong bitterness. Creamy, smooth and nutty with fruit and peppery hop. A slight alcoholic glow, dry bitter finish.
Bernsteinfarbend, wenig Schaum, schön süßlich in der Nase, dafür relativ leicht im antrunk, leichte malzsüsse im Abgang nicht schlecht

Pours a slightly opaque red. Mild, fruity aroma. Fairly heavy carbonation. Taste has peachy undertones with hint of herbs and roasted malt. This doesn?t really taste that much like an ale, which is probably why I like it all right.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 Leichte Trübung. Kupferfarbe, weisser Schaum, bildet sich nur sehr wenig. Gutes Aroma, Orangen und Gräser. Bocktypisch deutliche Malznoten: Honig und Karamell. Milder Antrunk, sehr süffiger Körper. Gute Mitten, süsse Noten, feine Malznoten. Abgang kräftig, typisch Bock, leichte Säure am Gaumen. Geil!

65 cl Bottle fr.o.m. sB. Pours amber with small white head. Malty, grainy, spicy aroma, hints of citrus and soap. Malty sweet taste with a medium bitterness. OatBiscuits and caramel coming in. A bit too much of grassy notes
Leicht trübes Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, süßlich, Karamell, leicht fruchtig, Orangen, Kräuter, sehr süffig.

From tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear orangy amber with a small off white head. Aroma has lots of heavy, sticky malts, caramel, banana, sweet overripe fruits. Taste is very very sweet, heavy malty and with a tiny bitterness that not even is close to balance this beer. Very intense for the 6,5%, but other than that i havent got a whole lot of good things to say..

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2017 Non ho capito bene lo stile della birra ma credo sia tipo bock. Il malto però è poco evidente, in particolare il caramello non l?ho percepito per nulla. Il luppolo non si sente per nulla come aroma ma abbastanza come amaro, aiutando la bevuta. In generale non mi è piaciuta particolarmente.

Bottle @ Køge øldag w senior & friends/the chef. Appearance: clear amber with good off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: grain, light caramel, biscuit, citrus and some spicy notes. palette: strong malty and medium hoppy aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium sweetness, somewhat dominated by a medium to notable bitterness, average tolong duration and a watery texture. Overall: very nice hoppy bock.
Honey color, pours with a small-medium head, medium body, mild sweetness and noticeably hoppy. Good beer but not excellent.

Nice bottle and you can find a lot of information on the website.
Cloudy amber beer with short white head, full body, malty, light sweet, hopy, oily, 
(I have 0.65l bottle with best-before 30.04.2017)

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2017 Clead deep peach golden color with small tan foam. Aromas of tropical fruit type hops, youghurt and peach and floral notes. Palate, medium to full body with biting bitter texture leaving short dry finish. Taste, lighty bitter sweet of tropical fruits, more like not amazing IPA. Overall, okay beer, reminds more of IPA, quite hoppy still light though.
Bottle @ home. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma is malty with grains, flowers, pine needle, caramel. Medium body. Taste of caramel, grains, flowers, pine, bread, fruits. Balanced bitterness.

Bottle at home. Hazy amber with white head. Big sweet caramel malty, light resiny hops. Cara malt and some fruitiness. Light sweet and bitter. Over medium malty body. Soft carbonation and soft smooth mouthfeel.
Overall bitter and blunt.no specific aroma except malt and caramel.Tastes caramel, malt, bitterness.

650ml bottle from Systembolaget. Slightly hazy amber, small creamy white head, poor lacing. Malty bread aroma, spicy, crisp bread and caramel. Medium carbonated, full-bodied, sweet and silky mouthfeel. Malty taste, crisp bread, rye and grains. Woody finish mid-dry with mild sweetness.

A rich golden light orange color with a thick creamy head of white foam. The aroma and flavor is balanced impeccably between sweet cereal grain, light roasted malt, fresh florals, and lightly sweet blend of stone fruits and hints of berries.
Amber coulered beer with white head. Aroma grain, caramel. Taste is Bread, grain/malt with floral and fruit notes.
Poured from 12 oz bottle amber in color small head light debris little funky smell and taste at first but gets alot better as you drink dried fruit and sweet malt at the fore front

Had a pint at Pub Italia. Arrived with very minimal head, and leaves a thin ring around inside glass. Has a dark amber colour appearance. Weak lacing. Aromas are mostly of roasted malts and a bit of yeast. Flavours are also of the roasted malt variety, with spices and hops readily apparent. Hints of caramel. Has a good balance of hops and malts actually. Mildly bitter aftertaste but not offensive. Average carbonation. Warming mouthfeel. Pretty good and lucky to try on tap. Held its flavour with the spicy italian sausage pasta I had with it.
@ fillepolo 20161210. Bottle (650 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty and caramely, dried fruits, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter and malty.
Beer rating @ fillepolo 10/12-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty and fruity/overripe fruity and banana. Body is medium, the finish malty and fruity/overripe fruity.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a amber colour beer with a medium head. Dried fruits with malt and caramel. Dry finish

12oz bottle from Beer52.com. A hazy golden amber pour with a thin cream head; grainy aroma; smooth with a sweet caramel taste to start with some rye grain, then developing a sour bitterness give a clean crisp finish.

330ml bottle. Bb 2017/2. Thanks, Martin! Slightly hazy golden yellow colour. Thin line of white froth around the glass. Grainy, malty, caramelly, sweet aroma. Grainy, caramelly beginning. Caramel in the middle. Grainy, caramelly, slightly sweet finish. Slightly bitter, grainy aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, slightly oily, rather low carbonated brew. Not really my cup of tea, but still descent brew.

Bomber from web SB cons 2016-12-09 Göteborg, must have had this before!
AR: wetabix and caramel,
AP: orange glowing, high frothy cream orange foam - nice
F: Wetabix, pop corn, wee hollow, bread, herbalish, dry, dried tropical fruity

Obtained a bomber of Dead Guy Ale from a local Albertsons. Poured a orangey amber with a thin veil of light tan foam. Introducies itself with a scent of tropical fruit and pine. Malty opening taste with a touch of butterscotch perhaps and some bread too. A small bitterness, does not linger. All fine by me.

Pours clear amber with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of caramel, citrus, orange rinds, rye bread. Taste is malty and floral with some fruity notes. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation. Funny, I remember drinking this in my very early craft beer days and at the time thought it was quite extreme. Funny how my palate has changed. Still a very good beer mind you, just not challenging in any way anymore.
Sweet aroma with some fruity hops and light malty presence. Taste is smooth and fruity with summerflowers and light peachy hops. Very easydrinking and pleasant.
355ml bottle. Clear amber colour with a small head. Aroma: malty, caramel, light fruity. Taste: sweetish malt, dried fruit, caramel. Medium body and carbonation.

Caramel, grass, toffee, light coffee, dried fruit, slightly spicy.
Amber colour, small beige head, lacing.
Salty, noticably sweet, lightly bitter, caramel, grass and lightly spicy and light coffee.
Medium body, average carbonation, slick feel, malty finish.
Solid.

650ml bottle. Clear shiny brown with one finger slightly off white head. Aroma is caramel, candi sugar, rich malts, light alcohol, slight ripe banana and a light fruitiness going towards citrus. Taste is light malty with some roasted tones, light caramel, candi sugar, grass, light citrus peel and some slight ripe fruitiness. Medium mouthfeel, light carbonation and warming malty aftertaste.

35,5 cl. best before 08/01/2017, aperta il 27 novembre 2016.
Ambrata con riflessi oro antico, schiuma ocra di buona persistenza.
Aroma biscottato, caramello, chinotto, note di prugna.
Attacca dolce, caramellata, con una punta di prugna e chinotto, butterscotch, finale amaricante erbaceo ed agrumato con un tostato finale che arricchisce la bevuta.
Retrolfatto con chinotto e caramello.
Corpo medio-pieno, non molto carbonata.

355ml bottle from Jumbo Costanera Center. Santiago, Nov. 2016. Pours a beautiful hazy orange with a big white rocky head that diminishes slowly and leaves a gorgeous 3mm film. Aroma is malty, high on melanoidins. Notes of caramel, wood, some burnt sugars, dried peach, toffee, biscuit, raisin and nuts. Very elegant and well layered. Taste is sweet following the same tonality in the flavors. Nice hints of peach, apricot marmalade, well-balanced with grainy and biscuity malts. The caramel is clear but not overblowing. Very, very good. Medium body and carbonation. A really rich, fulfilling "Ale" Bock.

One of my great favourites. Malty and characterful while being quite unique at the same time. Great aroma, wonderful complex flavour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Sportsman, Bkk, Thailand. Dark clear amber. Quite sweet and lightly bitter. Hoppy, Malty, caramel and floral. Medium bodied.

Lovely deep golden/amber color, small white head. Aromas of caramel, butter, apricot, marmelade and sugar. Sweet taste of malt, sugar, caramel, marmelade and slight hop during the finish. A bit too sweet.

Poured from a 22 oz bottle into a shaker. Beautiful honey color, slightly hazy, small off-white head. Nose of sweet malts and caramel. Medium body, average carbonation. Lightly bitter and a malty finish.

Bottle from beer 52. 
Fruity, malty and hoppy on the nose. Great flavour, very fruity with prominent hop presence. Not had that many Bocks but this seems a bit too sweet and hoppy for the style. One things for sure though, this is a very tasty beer.
Sourdough bread aromas. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a rocky off-white head. Round banana flavors with notes of leather and a little licorice. Broad mouthfeel. Extremely nice beer.

Nada más verterla en el vaso su color ya enamora. Ámbar limpio y muy anaranjado y una corona de espuma cremosa y persistente.

En boca entra muy dulce, recuerda a miel o caramelo que quizás hace que no refresque mucho pero que sea facilísima de beber. Además su final es amargo pero discreto.
340ml bottle. Pours amber with a large off-white head. Aroma is caramel, biscuit, toasted malt. Taste is sweet, caramel, resiny hops, small alcohol kick.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2016 Pours a slightly opaque red. Mild, fruity aroma. Fairly heavy carbonation. Taste has peachy undertones with hint of herbs and roasted malt. This doesn?t really taste that much like an ale, which is probably why I like it all right.
Sample from bottle, poured a Amber colour with slight off heat. Nose of caramel, cookies, big malt notes, dough, light floral, sweet dry malt aftertaste
Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Smell of oatmeal cookies. Sweet and malty smell with some oats, nuts and caramel.

Opalescent golden with a fluffy off white head. Aromas of hay, some light toasted malts with a light floral and herbal touch. Fine carbonation, soft texture with a medium body. Well balanced malt sweetness with a floral hop bitterness profile. Moderately lasting finish. Nice.
From bottle. Hazy copper with off-white lacing. Caramel and malty aroma. Sweet with hoppy notes. Good beer.

The aroma is malty, roasty and a little caramel. Pours a clear copper with white head, mostly diminishing and excellent lacing. The taste is bitter and a touch sour. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish long. Very good!

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 From decervecitas. In Teku glass. Watching Los Soprano 4x08. Sweet caramel, molasses, with good herbal hop bite to compensate it without removing protagonism from the malty profile. Very drinkable, invites to long sips, specially as it warms up

About as clutch as a beer can get, Rogues Dead Guy might be the best workhorse in craft beer this side of Sierra Nevada Pale Ale. Big, doughy, caramel malt front with a brisk, euro-hopped finish, piney and herbal and bracing, with a gentle fade. Easy to drink, even easier to order a second.

tap at street taco in ulsan amber color with creamy white head, mostly lasting with fair lacing. Aroma is heavy malty. Midium bodied, sticky texture, lively carbonation, Long duration, light sweetness,

Bottle 0,33l. Pours amber colour. Aroma of bread, caramel, toffee, some sweet wood. Taste balanced towards hoppy, salt, artichoke and caramel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 Im sure glad I decided to try this one...excellent!The aroma is pleasant and the taste is very impressive...a little sweet and as I always praise...No Bitter!
On tap at TCB. Good enough for an autumn afternoon. Nice malt, enough sharpness to keep it interesting. I could happily do a couple pints, but any more would probably prove too much.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2016 Draft at Bru Craft. Clear orange copper pour. Lots of soapy beige foam and sloppy lace. Mop water aroma. Medium caramel malts. Wet wood. Pumpernickel. Dried apricots. Cinnamon. Nutmeg. Clove. Toasted bagels. Not awful but not a go-to.

Dried fruit and malt aroma, hazy copper red color, head dissipates quickly. Medium body with chewy texture and warm alcohol finish. Toffee, dried fruit, licorice, and floral flavor. Excellent fall beer for cold afternoon.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ive had this many times over the years, and what keeps me coming back is 1) how complex it is -- is it a malty bock with all of the sweet caramel flavor? a pale ale from the hop bitterness? a Belgian ale from the yeast? and 2) how incredibly well-made it is. This is a great, balanced, complex beer.

I bought this bottle at amstein. I drank it yesterday at home. In my opinion, it is a really nice ale, we already could say an IPA. The body is clear, copper and troubled, thin foam, average carbonation. The taste is well balanced, I love this side of sweet malt and bitterness, a bit citrus, small side of apricot and nice final touch.
While it smells like dirty dishwater, the taste is quite pleasing. It has the Belgian yeast overtones, with subtle caramelly flavor. Ive become a very picky beer drinker, and this is delish!

Bottle from Brdr. Schmidt Vinhandel, Viby. Pours golden amber with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is sweet malt, caramel, some fruits, honey, hops. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Light bitter finish.
Pours a clear light orange color with a very thin white ring. Not much of an aroma. Very smooth but not much flavor. OK but not great.

Copper pour. Loads of toasted and sweet malt in the aroma. Full, syrupy body. Flavor is mostly toasted cereal grains, sweet caramel malt, light spicy and mildly earthy hops, and some fruit lingering underneath. This has never been a go-to for me but it is a well brewed and enjoyable brew in the right circumstances.
Great caramel color, bubbles are good. sweet smell, moderate taste strong sweet flavor.

650ml bottle.
Sweet fruity malty biscuit aroma.
Hazy light amber color with good sudsy head.
Mild bitterness with smooth malty finish.
Not bad.

Rogue Dead Guy
	Aroma (9/10): 
Miel, resinas, madera y vainilla. Un muy rico aroma
	Apariencia 4/5:
o	Cabeza (color, consistencia y duración):
	Cabeza abundante, color crema, sólida, deja una abundante y gruesa nata.
o	Cuerpo (textura, carbonización, partículas y color): 
	Muy burbujeante. Color ámbar, un poco turbio.
	Sabor 9/10 (inicio, final y duración): 
o	Inicio: Inicio salado y un tanto amargo.
o	Final: Principalmente ahumado. Presencia intermitente de dulzores en las muelas.
	Paladar 4/5 (Cuerpo, textura, carbonización, final). 
o	Cuerpo ligero, cremoso, con burbujas un poco picantes. Final medianamente amargo y de corta duración.
 Resumen 18/20: Un aroma complejo y una apariencia espectacular. Una cerveza que se gana el calificativo de sabrosa. Se me antoja para comer embutidos. La recomiendo.

If this brew didnt cost so much, I could pound a couple of sixers in an evening. This is an outstanding brew that stands alone. Is it the yeast? I dont know. But whatever it is, it works. Rogue rocks.

Una Heller bock de color anaranjado y baja carbonatación. Su aroma a frutos secos, miel y bizcocho. Su sabor es refrescante con toques de miel y un suave amargor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle. Pours an amber color with a brief off white head. Aroma is mainly malt with a touch of hops. Medium body, taste is sweet, not much of a hop presence. Finish is also sweet. Notice more hops after the swallow.

Tight, but malty and yeasty nose; a bit of cheesy Quaver crisps, babyleaf salad, a little honey? A lightly sweet, wry/rye and slightly malty  and rich  middle. Like pine nuts and hazelnuts? Whilst neither the flavours nor the ingredients are showstoppers, there is a v nice balance about it  very rounded bitterness in finish, but right at the end a little bit of bourbon biscuit. V drinkable.

Bottle at the Draft House, Tower Bridge, London. ABV 6.5%. Poured a golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, hops, grass and yeast. Light sweetness, medium+ bitterness. Medium bodied, slick texture, average carbonation. Finish has a good level of dry hoppy bitterness.

This is a really smooth, really drinkable beer. I dont pick up much on the nose from it, but its a nice shade if dark amber in color and it tastes like something between sweet and full bodied. Its right there in the middle with something extra to separate it from an average beer.

After all this time, I still dont think I have ever tried this beer before now. Seems like its the most widely produced beer in the style, one in which my experience with is limited to random beers I hear of for the first time upon trying. This beer recipe seems to be older than I am, so it must be good. I get a lot of banana bread notes in the aroma and flavor. Sweet malt, but it finds a way to work. I probably couldnt drink a lot of this. I think the sweetness would start to become too much. A 22 Oz split was just right. Enjoyable beer here. Unique too. Good stuff.

Pours amber, crystal clear with white dense head that dissipates slowly. Aroma of bread, caramel, toffee, some sweet wood. Taste balanced towards hoppy, salt, artichoke(!!!), caramel. Aftertaste is similar with taste but a bit more hoppy. Low to medium carbonation, light to medium body. Nice but nothing special.
Nice label, nice aroma, ok palate, reasonable aftertaste. An average of 3.5 seems to be overrated imo however.
Little to no aroma, with excellent presentation, sweet taste and really thick palate, a great experience

Bottle, 355mL. Home. A brown-orange opaque beer with a medium white foamy head ; ok retention. Candied fruits, caramel, roast, sugar, herbal note. Medium sweet, dry refreshing note. Medium body, average texture, light oily, soft carbonation, sweet finish. Overall, enjoyable beer :)

Sweet aroma of malt, caramel and with hints of fruits and hops. Clear and light brown appearance with a small white head. Medium-high sweetness and light-medium bitterness. Average lively carbonation and medium-full body. Really great ale!
Tasty beer with a carmely after taste but definitely a beer I would have again.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Colore quasi ambra, limpida, schiuma compatta fine. Aroma di malto con note floreali. Al palato generale dolcezza del malto, con sentori floreali e fruttati in evidenza. Chiusura quasi dolce, il luppolo non si fa molto sentire. Carbonazione medio bassa. Una maibock molto americana.

BOTTLE. Hazy bronze pour with medium off white head.. Floral to grassy hoppy nose with a hint of sweet malt.. Biscuit and caramel malt throughout, some earthy quality in the middle finishing with solid sweet hop kick. .Sourced Cellarbrations @ Capel

330ml bottle at the Head of Steam, Durham. Orange pour, with a fine, pale yellow head. Vibrant aroma of apricots, faint haylage, and golden ale. Soft flavour of wholemeal bread, oats, with a rounded overall taste of hops.
Cerveja com coloração âmbar e espuma com média duração. Agradável e com amargor que predomina.

Cant believe i never rated this. Citrus aroma with something else I cant place. Never have. Its always been dead guys x factor for me. Bit bitter forward that evolves into sweetness. light carbonation. Orange and slightly cloudy body. Smooth, a little viscous.

12oz bb04/2017 from BH. - An interesting import, a Heller Bock to its home terroir...like importing German IPAs to CA... - Bref: smells, tastes and feels like a Heller Bock with crisper than average malts joining the starchy honeyglue show. - ar: on-point Tapetenkleister/wallpaper glue proteins and thin starches, dry honey and herbal grasses. Crisp, un-stodgy mouthfeel making the best out of grainy, cereal malts. Surprising: does not forward any of the high-alpha hops, opting to blend in Saaz and Perle subtlety into the wild honeyflower. Well done cover of one of my least favourite DE styles...beats Ganter Maibock.

At Kufle i kapsle, Warsaw, February 2014. Shared with lovely Anja. Sample on a "deska piw" (beer plank for tasting). Copper colored, small white head. Medium aroma, sweetish, honey, alcohol, raisins, blueberry. Sweet, like a cake with dry fruits, lasting sweetness. Drinkable, but strong. Soft carbonation, full body. A strong fruity beer, balanced. Value for money.
Sample at Omaha Beer Fest, Stinson Park. 6-11-16. Bottle. Poured dark amber, slight off white head. Aroma was toasted malt, dark fruit. Taste was sweet, caramel, dark fruity. Very good.

355ml bottle into shaker. Sweet aroma of caramel toffee and brown sugar. Murky orange/brown beer with thin film on top. Oily texture, fresh and bitter taste. The finish is burnt caramel and bitter fruit. Very pleasant, well balanced.

Aroma and taste is sweet with notes of caramel and toffee and honey, nice hoppy backing, bready malts, solid bitter finish. Nice.
From a bottle, smell of toffee and caramel, big brown sugar and chocolate chip cookie notes. Taste follows, rich and buttery in texture with a long sitting almost smoked aftertaste.

Pours dark amber, a little head. Nose is malt, some pine. Taste is malty, maybe graham cracker, with piney hops rounding out the background and balancing out the hint of sweet from the malt. Mouthfeel is slightly heavy, with some bitter and a cleanish finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice amber colour with a cleaner thick but quick disappearing head.
The aroma is sweet, full of caramel, honey and malt; maybe a little of ananas.
The taste is weaker and more bitter than I expected from this style, expecially in the end.

Nothing exceptional. Its ok, but a bit of a let down.

Growler to wine glass
Appearance:	dark amber color, hazy, tan head that disappears slowly quickly	
Aroma: Slightly hoppy on the nose	
Taste: Medium bitterness
Mouthfeel:: medium body, fizzy, 
Overall: Good beer, good to repeat, not to look for
Drank in 2012
12 oz bottle: Red amber color. Candy-caramel malt aroma. Rich malty, lightly toasted flavor. Substantial body but not cloying - a good beer.

Appearance- amber, cloudy, half a finger off-white head. Aroma- lots of caramel malt, honey, biscuit, dried fruit, cereal, hops. Taste- caramel, toasty malt, honey hints, sugary dark fruit, malt loaf, biscuity malt, sweet slightly treacly finish.

bernsteinfarben, leicht opal mit weißem Schaum. Schöner Duft nach Malzbonbons, Honig, etwas Karamell, leicht fruchtig. Geschmack ist malzig, Sahnebonbons, leicht kräuterig, Honig, nicht zu süß. Tolles Bier!

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Bottle. Almost no head. Really beautiful amber colour. Medium to high malt aroma. Strong barley and caramel flavour. A bit sweet. Light bitterness with some lasting on tongue. Medium alcoholic taste. To me (I am no Heller Bock specialist so maybe it?s one of the style criteria) I see it as a almost barleywine : not as much alcohol, no so malty. But a great compromise between everyday Belgian beer and a great barleywine. Really a very good surprise

Top 50? Really? OK bottle at Qbrick and other places. Its a decent malt forward beer with decent flavor but doesnt really wow nor disappoint. Worth trying but Im still trying to wrap my head around the fact this is a tope 50 heller bock...

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2016 Farbe: Bernstein 
Schaum: kaum, fein 
Nase: malzig, Waldhonig, bisschen Gras Geschmack: auch ziemlich malzig, aber nicht platt breit süß, sondern mit ner deutlich bitteren Komponente die das Bier nicht zu schwer werden läßt, sondern einigermaßen spritzig hält. Das gute ist auch dass das bittere den Abgang dominiert, im Nachgeschmack aber wieder weg ist, bzw durch Gerste ersetzt wird.Sehr sehr gut.

Bottle from LCBO. Pours dark, very hazy orange with a small creamy white head. The aroma is sweetish malts with grassy hops, tastes along the same lines, its somewhat grainy with a dry wheaty dry finish thats also grassy of hops. Quite fruity too. Mouthfeel full, carbonation active but pleasantly thin. At points very pleasant.

De couleur cuivrée la mousse à une tenue correcte et finne 
Au nez on va trouver des arômes malté et orangée
En bouche on va trouver des saveur douce sur le caramel lorange confite et les épices

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 355ml bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured a hazy, cloudy amber with a two finger ivory head. Aromas of orange peels, bread, bubblegum, caramel, chocolate, banana, toffee. Taste: Orange, spices, caramel, banana, milk chocolate, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, nuts, haagsche hopjes (Dutch sweets with coffee and caramel). Wow this almost drinks like a chocolate/vanilla milkshake. Very smooth. Some hoppy bitterness in the background. A medium to full body with lots of caramel and some spice in the finish. Absolutely love this brew!

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Greg & Janes Beer and Wine. Aroma is bready malt with caramel, noble hops. Appearance is clear copper/amber with nice sparkle, finger-width off-white foamy head with poor retention and trace lacing. Taste is caramel dominant moderate sweet malt. Palate is medium bodied with smooth, creamy texture, average carbonation and sweet caramel finish. Overall, a perfect example of the style, which is pretty straightforward.
A very well produced heller bock with a strong malty body packed with sweet caramel flavors. The crispy and balanced hoppy finish creates a fresh aftertaste.
Een troubel blond bier met een mooie schuimkop. De geur is wat citrusachtig. De smaak is verfrissend met weer een toets van citrus erin.
Aroma of clementine & flowers. Clear golden with tanned head. Sweet & lightly sour taste. Medium body, creamy texture & soft carbonation.

een rood bruine kleur en mout smaak als van een bok donkere toon licht bitter en toch watervlug een drogerrige mond.
persoonlijk mis ik de volle smaak van mout die door hop opgehaald mogen worden.

Clean amber colour, small white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, grain, honey, biscuit, apples, banana, grassy hops. Lightly sweet bitter taste worth long hoppy aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Quite enjoyable beer.

Bottled. No clear date. Pours dusty copper, off white head. Aroma is fig, cherry, esters, little bit of a cola aroma, little bit of hop citrus. Flavor is cherry, fig, its almost toffee but not quite. Orange hop citrus. Nice hop bitterness. A little heavy in the astringency but its really solid. I quite like it. Its pretty complex and good. Especially for a German style beer which usually isnt my cup of tea (or beer).
Poured from draft at Century House nice copper color with a one finger white head. Aromas of malty biscuit dark fruit caramel and yeast. Taste is fruity malty hints of spice and balanced bitterness.
Bottle:355ml Price: 1,49 . Gintaro spalva. Malonus kvapas, labai geras skonis... didoka kaina

Dark golden color, slightly hazy liquid; Quickly dissipating white head - Aroma is malty, caramel, biscuits, some hints of dark fruits, some hops too - Taste is sweet at first, getting bitter towards the finish - full body, rather sticky mouthfeel, below average carbonation. Long, rather bitter, dry finish.

Nez: Malté, miel, raisin
Bouche: Maltée, caramel, biscuitée, miel, raisin, fruits secs
Très bonne bière qui fait penser à un Barleywine en plus léger

It is deep honey in color with a malty aroma, rich hearty flavor and a well balanced finish. Dead Guy is created from Northwest Harrington, Klages, Maier Munich and Carastan malts, along with Perle and Saaz Hops.
12oz Flasche. Hellbraunes Bier mit luftigem Schaum. Fruchtig herbes Aroma. Kräuter und Süsse im Geschmack. Langes bitteres Finish.

From bottle in beer stein. An amber brew with fleeting head and aroma of fruit bread and a hint of banana. Broad malts dominate the taste with a bit of spice and smokiness on the palate. My first venture into the lighter side of the bock family.

the aroma is malty and herbal with hints of grain, flowers, garden fruits and spicy grasses... the taste is malty and, a little bit, fruity with notes of toffee, apple, pine and spicy herbs... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...
Copper color with white head. Malty aroma. The malt is present also in the taste, caramel but nice dry finish. Enjoyable.

Originally rated on 8/14/08. Didnt know this was a bock until i just looked it up. The body looked more like an APA or even a IPA with an orangish-copper colored body, ample carbonation, with a mid sized light tan head. Aroma of spicy hops, flavor was balanced between the hops and malts, a little sweet, with hints of berries. Overall a pretty good beer no matter what style it tries to be
Bottle. Amber, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2016 Pours Light and clear with a bit of foam that disappears quickly . slightly bitter taste. Overall quite good but not great
Enjoyable lager slightly hazy Amber rich yeasty taste hints of cocktail cherry very nice stuff.
Yum! banana, bubblegum, butterscotch, herbs, caramel, bread, dough. Lovely sweet notes. Almost a bit like a light barley wine. Surpisingy good!

Bottle. Golden color with white head. Aroma has malt, grass and noble hops. Taste is malty with quite long bitter and dry aftertaste. Flavors of malt, hops, citrus and spices. Nice drinkable beer with good aftertaste.

Bottle, 330ml. Pours beautiful clear golden-red, head is very short and beige colored. Scent is of fruits and berries, malt, bread and yeast. Mouth feel is oily with a light body and gentle carbonation. Tastes nicely bitter with some sweetness and light tartness. Flavors are of ripe fruit, malt, hops, caramel, lightly herbal, fruity hops, phenol, light buttery note, yeast, light spice and clove, some tart fruit. Very nice, fresh, not heavy, well balanced with interesting flavor.
UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 Surprenante couleur rouge orangé, levure au nez, goûts de fruits (pêche?, abricot?), résineux, miel, caramel, Un peu acide. Alcool sur le retour, un peu fade quand même...

Tap at msp airport. Pint glass. Hazy copper with very thick frothy white head. Sweet and grain and slightly spicy nose. Malty, heavy grain, then yeast. Nice finish. Very full body for the style. A bit of a meal. Lots of sugar. To me, an ipa reminiscent version of a maibock. Good stuff. Would be one of my go to beers in this region.
Clear copper color with a off white head thats impassive at first but doesnt last very long. Aroma of honey, caramel, and a bit of veggie note. Taste is honey, veggies, and metal. Pretty awful

11.02.2016 İstanbul, şişe.

Görüntü: köpük zayıf, bulanık maun renkli. Küçük parçacıklar gözle görülür şekilde yüzüyor.

Koku: tatlı, şerbetimsi.. Karamel, malt, tatlı tınılar önde.

Tadım: orta gövdeli, tatlı.. Damakta kara üzüm, şerbet, karamel, malt, mayası hafif tatlı-ekşi bir burukluk var

Genel değerlendirme: son tüketim tarihi 1 yıl geçirdiğim bu Amerikan butik blrası damakta tatlılık, ama ve hafif üzümsü ekşi tınılar barındırıyor..
Pesada para beber em quantidade, mas saborosa. O gosto forte e pouco amargo desaparece logo.
330 ml bottle. Hazy semidark orange colour with small head off which goes down really soon. Aroma of oranges,caramel, malts. Taste of caramel, sweet, tangerine, bread, dry bitter finish. Good beer

Bottle poured into a tall tulip. Surprising, almost unique, flavors evident on the first sip. Color of a dark honey, aroma of sweet malt and bread. Very smooth, rounded nut-like flavor. Malty, floral hops, sweetness, creamy texture, quite complex, easy to drink, tastes and looks more like an amber ale than anything else, I would certainly drink this one again.

EIN HELLER BOCK!!!!!!! WAHNSINN!!!!!!! So malzig,hoppy und rundum lecker. Sehr eigenwillige Interpretation eines deutschen Klassikers. Die Rogue Brewery spricht übrigens von einem Maibock!!!!!!!& HELL YEAH!!!!!! Flasche von Beyond Beer HH 2 Euro 0,33.

L:
-pours a hazy amber-red with a medium to big,foamy,offwhite head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-orange,tangerines,caramel,honey,goos grapefruit
T:
-Follows the nose with a toasty finish
-low to medium bitterniss
-finishes dry
F:
-medium carbonation
-light to medium,creamy body
O:
This is not a Maibock,hell its not even a Lager.
Aside from that,a great Amber Ale though
From notes: sweet, malty, lots of body, a bit more balance with the alcohol would be nice.

33cl bottle
orange color
aroma major of honey
taste a bit malty, lightly hoppy
fine beer
The taste isnt too bitter and no after taste which pretty good for me. Aroma itself isnt hoppy.
Bottle, bubbly fluffy head, hazy deep orange color, biscuity fruity aroma, biscuity jammy flavor with some honey in the back, herbal bitterness, a bit too sweet. Decent.

Introduced to this at a local pub that had it on draft. Now one of my top picks, i just wished that in the northeast it wasnt considered such a premium brand at typically close to $14 a 6 pack. Highly recommend visiting one of their bars in Portland, OR - enjoyed a flight and still come back to this.

22oz bottle 1/12/16 (Old Notes)-Pours copper with a decent head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, and slight dark fruit. Taste of the same with a bit of grass and biscuit. This medium bodied brew is well done.

35.5cl Pours clear orange, with thin head, that goes immediately. Fain aroma of caramel and some malts. Slightly sweet, medium bitter, with some clear caramel and candy sugars. Reminds a bit of faro with extra ABV. Medium bodied, smooth with some sharp alcohol bites. Not fizzy in the glass, but livens up in the mouth. A pleasant drink overall.

Bottle: Amber in color with a quickly dissipating white head. The aroma is malty and some dark fruit esters. The flavor includes bread and caramel along with the fruitiness. The tastes is sweet up front and a mild bitterness on the finish.
Pours clear copper with a fine white head. Nose is weak and generic sweetness. Flavor is a balance of bread, licorice, and european hops. Finish is quick. Drinkable but unremarkable.
12 oz bottle. Didnt know much about this...malty, almost stout-like but pale-ale in color. Surprising, interesting, good beer.
Along with Yves at his home amber coloured body with a white head and a spicy yeast malt hops aroma a spicy herby hop bitter sweet taste with a slight bitter finish

Pours nice golden and clear. Aroma contains some cereal, yeast, sweet bread, malts. Taste is balanced, some grain, cereal, roasted white bread, grass. After lasts surprisingly long and follows to balanced taste line. Very nice ale!
Decent ale. Not my style but not a bad choice when selection is limited. Once of the more standard of Rogues lineup

This used to be one of my favorite beers, yet I havent had it years. Time for a revisit. Nice golden color. Light carbonation. Lovely malty aroma of nuts, caramel, and breakfast cereal. Balanced flavor, a bit on the hoppy side. Grass, caramel, and a touch of yeast fruitiness. Still delicious, but it has fallen from my favorite beer pillar.
This is a great beer. A good stand by. Honestly, Ive drank it for so long it no longer commands my attention but I still dig it.
