Amber, smooth off-white head. Aroma bread, plums in alcohol. Taste even more plums in more alcohol. Finish plums in alcohol. A consistent ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared with wim at my home. Hazy amber colored beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Malty yeasty aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet bitter yeasty cartonnage hinted.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Bottle from the LCBO. Malty, toasted, orange, mild bitter, chocolate, sweet bread, raisin. Satisfying and tasty.

The sweet hop aroma mutes itself a bit with the typical hop character of most smaller brewed American beer. Very pleasing, surprisingly balanced flavor dutifully follows the aforementioned olfactory qualities. Absolutely nothing bad about this beer. But not much to write home about either. It is quite good, but the price cant be justified. Ideally, this is what a seven dollar six pack should be.

Pours murky copper with a thin sticky head. Initial taste of ever so slightly sweet caramel. With a chocolate/caramel middle that fades quick but with a sweet lingering taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
600 ml bottle at Laughing Buddha, in Sudbury. Pours an amber colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is grain, yeast, hops. Aroma is floral. Very good beer.

Rated from old notes. A yeasty, hoppy concoction ... actively bitter at the start, but mellows as you progress. Faintly smells like apple cider, although no such taste is present. Floral notes. Remains dry and bitter for the duration with only a slight mellowing.
Pours clear amber with a thin off white head. Aroma is very grainy. A lot of carbonation on the tongue with a sweet finish. The yeast is very unique and adds a ton of flavor. Really good Hellerbock.
Bottle. Pours amber with yellowish head. Aroma: caramel, toffee, white chocolate, slight hay, Taste is sweet, caramel, hazelnuts, toffe, some bitterness, hay. Medium body.Nice beer.

Bottle. Opaque Amber color with thin off-white head and very little lacing. Malt aroma with some dried apple notes. Malt upfront with caramel notes. Dried fruit, including Apple and apricot, and mouthcoating woody bitterness in the finish that is slight powdery. Lighter body than expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5 draft. Hazy, tea color and a medium, white head. Aroma of hops, pines, some malts, hints of bread. Taste is malty with a noticeably strong hop touch. Medium body, slick texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is sweeter, more biscuity - props for that. Overall, not a bad beer, quite drinkable.

Sampled from a bottle at The Tilted Kilt S. Wabash, Chicago. Deep amber colour with a white head. malty aroma and very malty taste. Also honey and butterscotch with lots of floral notes. Powerful flavours and very full taste in the mouth. A really nice flavoursome beer.
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 No muy aromática, toques a malta. Color miel oscura. Sabor dulce, caramelo, tostado. Persistente en paladar, con cuerpo, cremosa. Recomendable.
Bottle. Smell is honey, herbs and gas. Comes in harsh and malty, bitter like earwax. Some sweetness in the back. Wishy washy finish. Eurghh dont know what to say about this - it just isnt very nice!
330 ml bottle. Pours hazy amber colour with small white head. Aroma of fruits, malts, honey, caramel. Full body with soft carbonation, taste is sweet with bitter finish.

Bottle @ dining room! 
Pours a hazy light orange color with a big fluffy white head and some nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is sweet malt and leafy hops.... I mean, that sounds like bullshit I know... but thats about it... I mean its lightly fruity, its got some fall time leaf rot, its got some honey. But more than anything it smells like the raw ingredients from whence it came, which is not wholly bad. 

The flavor is spicy, with a medium to low level of hoppiness & really pretty honey and apple forward. The bitterness level keeps things balanced pretty well here, nothing is terribly out of place. 

Honestly Ill always consider this more of an Amber Ale than anything, but its not a bad Amber Ale, even if I dont care about amber ales.

Great beer for the flavor, a bit sweet you can feel the hops on this one
 good one from Rouge
Nice looking ale. nice aroma & mouth feel. Bu,t too much of a bitter aftertaste. Decent beer.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber with medium, quickly diminishing head. Aroma is malt at first, some sweet citrusy notes can be sensed. Taste is very full. First thought is very carbonated, but it is not. It is a hard rocking body of the beer that gives you this sensation. It is slightly sour with a bitter finish, that is not too strong. A nice ale.
Bottle. Sweet, thickish, full bodied in a caramelly and bready way, quite a lot of fruity esters, some spicy hop notes. Dryish, light astringent alcoholic finish that balances the main part. Good.
Bottle thx Stefan. Pours nearly clear amber with a white head. Aroma caramel, grain, light fruit. Taste is malts, caramel, grainy, touch of citrus, syrong body.
From bottle. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of bread, grains, cereal, nuts, loooots of sweet caramel. Taste is the same. Sweet, grainy, corn. Meh...

On tap in Stamford, CT. Amber color - malty nose. Taste is malt bomb with some alcohol up front and a touch of bitterness on finish. Not really for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slight alcohol at first. Higher carbonation rich full body. Slightly bitter aftertaste.

Presenta ámbar oscuro con buena cabeza de espuma blanca de burbuja fina y buena retención; aromas a fruta tropical, caramelo, bizcocho, pino y miel; en boca entrada media y maltosa con ligero amargor, notas terrosas, herbales y a caramelo toffee, cuerpo medio y gasificación media baja, buena cerveza, bien balanceada en el lúpulo y malta pero no resulta excesivamente compleja.
Couldnt believe I havent rated this one yet. Definitely one of the first craft beera I remember getting in 95 I think.
Couleur ambrée, légère mousse. Nez malté, caramel cremeux. Gout malté caramel, note caramel cuit et candy puis fruits confits en fin de bouche. Bon corps. Fin amère houblonnée et note sucrée.
De couleur orangée avec peu everfesssance . On sens tout le le côté Malte légèrement caraméliser . C est une bière légèrement houblonner mais herbale.

Bottle in LA. Pale amber, hazy, tiny head dissipates fast. Some malt and noble hop aroma, otherwise clean aroma. mildly sweet malt flavour, moderate bitterness. Hint of alcohol warmth. alcohol could sneak up you. Well balanced, easy drinking.
This was a surprisingly good beer very smooth easy to drink not hoppy and bitter plenty of good malty yeasty flavor would recommend.
From tap. Almost clear dark amber color with off white head. Malty aroma, caramel, bread, light hoppy, grassy and fruity. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Nice hoppy beer, light and refreshing. Not one for a winters night but I would drink again!
Bottle from Gotts in Palo Alto, CA. Malt and honey up front with a nutty mid and slightly bitter finish. Reminded me of something from Anchor. An American craft beer staple.
Прекрас& сбаланс& вкус : солод, хмель, присутс& нотки карамел& специй. Горьков& послевк& Цвет жёлтого янтаря, немного мутнова&

Unclear amber colored beer with a small white head, medium carbonation.
Tastes hoppy, malty, caramel.
Nice hoppy bitter aftertaste.

The foam is coarse and moderate. Fine small pearl bubbles rise from the glass, releasing good flavors of caramel. Lovely bock with good caramel malt as first impression. Fine nuances of fruit and a lovely and well-balanced hop bitterness contributes semi-dry finish. Nice and tasty bock, which certainly falls in my taste.
Rich malty and hop aroma. Dark Amber garnet pour. Malty and hoppy, flavor is really rich, hops balance it very well. Great malt finish.

Ambar anaranjada, escasa espuma blanca. Aroma malteado y herbal. Excelente sabor de malta acaramelada, perfectamente balanceada con lupulos que aportan notas verbales y terrosas. Cuerpo moderado, perfecta de gas. Moderado amargor. Muy sabrosa.
Fles gekocht @The Beer Tree. Een moutig en licht hoppig bier, rood-oranje van kleur. Fris van smaak. Een lekkere grassige nasmaak. Heller Bocks zijn niet mijn favo bieren, maar deze is wel aardig.

Bottle at home (650 ml, best by 08/2015). Pours light hazy orange amber with a fast disappearing head. Aroma of sweet malts, honey, caramel, yeast. Taste is sweet, malty, honey, yeast, light orange, hint of hoppy bitterness in the end, sweet malty aftertaste. Not bad, maybe a bit too old.

Opaque blunt copper-coloured beer with a weak head.
Smell is intense raisins, apples with a hint of alcohol. Hint of strawberry, cherries, lemon. Spices.
Taste is initially watery sour, then bitter with a hint of zest. Touch of caramel, alcohol. Bitter malty finish.

Bue en bouteille de 355ml chez Victor.
Couleur ambrée mousse moyenne effervescence peu présente.
Nez sur le malt frais.
En bouche attaque sur la bêtise de Cambrai. Sucre et houblon mandarine.

Tap pour at Rogue in the Portland airport. 16 oz pint glass. Copper in color with minimal head. Aroma is mostly malty with mild caramel and toffee notes. Taste is also leaning towards malt with very minimal bitterness that only pops up at the end. Sweetness of malt comes through pulling some familiar toffee and caramel characteristics with it. As the most noteworthy Rogue offering you can taste why its nearly a flagship. Easy to drink without overwhelming the drinker with anything abrasive. Much like Bernie this is a fun dead guy to have around.

35,5cl bottle. Second time having this one. Pours lightly cloudy dark amber with small, creamy, diminishing, off-white head. Average malt character, cookies and caramel taste, average hoppyness, mostly citrus. Hints of butterscotch and toffee. Medium to full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, bitter finish. Moderate sweetness and bitterness, well balanced, light acidity. A great brew from Rogue, maybe the best Ive had from them so far. Pity they have a poor distribution where I live.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2016 
Aroma:

Malts, caramel, bread, yeast, fruit and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid amber/brown with a lot of yeast and with a slight/medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, yeast and fruit; ends slightly dry and bitter with bread and hops.
Ambar dourado, espuma amarela boa formação e retenção. Paladar de aroma de Caramelo, pinho, dulçor intenso. Impactante, preciso tomar outra pra poder avaliar melhor.

12 fl oz bottle. Gorgeous deep gold / honey colour with decent cream coloured head which settled to a ring but left plimsoll lines. Gentle aroma of caramel, toasted malt, two fruits and alcohol. Light to medium sweetness and minimal bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth texture and slightly boozy in the finish. Easy drinking. 8.

La notas de cereal con un toque acaramelado son las que aparecen en primer lugar, con un perfil afrutado sutil, pero sabroso, el punto cítrico me recuerda a la naranja sanguina, y remata la faena con un fondo a hierba refrescante, adornada con trazas florales. La intensidad del componente carbónico es moderado y el cuerpo de nivel medio. Aunque esta cervecera tiene esta cerveza no me convence, No está mal del todo pero no es una cerveza de la que vuelva a repetir
A little dark for an heller bock. Malty, caramel, nuts, toast, butterscotch, roasty. Wunderbar heller bock. malaise.
Golden Amber body under no head. Slick, moderate mouth feel. Satisfying heartier drink. No offensive flavors but no really positive notes.
Айм нот э бокер, но этот бок заценил, даже открыл глаза по-новом на все бокию
Nice looking ale. nice aroma & mouth feel. Bu,t too much of a bitter aftertaste. Not horrible but for the price, middle of the road.

Bottle from The Roebuck, Leek (Titanic) Pours a hazy amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma is malty of caramel, honey, some bread, spicy orange, subtle nuts and red berries. Taste of caramel, molasses, honey, red berries, bread then orange, cranberry and slight apple. Medium bodied and a slick texture. A quite dry, caramel then orangey, earthy bitterness in the finish. A very malty, sweetish start and then a fruity, citrusy end. Really decent.
Pours amber with thin beige head. Aroma of malts, caramel, pine and herbal. Taste is sweet with some bitterness at the end. Medium body, low carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours slightly hazy dark orange. Nose is orange, malts, sweetness, fruitcake. Taste is caramalts, dry toffee, sweet fruits, syrup. Decent.
Dark brown with a quickly fading head. Nose is barley sugar and somewhat metallic hops. Palate is rich, sweet, malty and a little fruity (fruitcake?), with a bitter finish. Decent beer.
Dark orange bronzr appearance with a white hrad. Malty sweet aroma. Sweet taste of syrup, malts and a slight touch a fruits. Low carbonation. A solid beer.

Dark orange-brown with thin beige head.
Malty aroma with notes of syrup, soysauce, chocolate, cream, alcohol and fruits.
Fruity flavour with notes of chocolate, caramel and cream. Round with dry bitterness.

Bottle. Pours clear copper. Small head disappears quickly. Aroma of fruit caramel apples pine. Taste of caramel some citrus and light bitterness. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle. Bread and caramel with a hint of nuttiness. Earthy and pine aroma. Deep rich and dark golden hue with a healthy amount of lacing from a white frothy head that retains for a descent amount of the beer. Nice balance of sweetness to a soft bitterness and dry finish.
Smell is sweet and grainy. Taste is sweet, a little fruity and bitter with a long bready finish. This is the second rogue beer ive had and want to try more if they are nearly as good as this.

12 fl oz bottle. Deep amber colour, off-white foam head and aroma of bready malt, grain, toffee, caramel. Taste is malty, bready, with some tangy spicy grassy bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry grassy bitter finish. Quite drinkable.

Bottle 35.5cl. Clear medium amber, small frothy off-white head, diminishes slowly, thin layer remains, almost no lacing;  arosweet malt aroma, grain, caramel, orange peel, biscuit, grass, light alcohol; taste medium sweet and bitter, fruity, spicy notes; medium body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste moderate bittersweet, spicy and alcoholic notes; nice but not really a Bock.

One-finger head on top of chesnut brown body. Slightly cloudy. Aroma is malt fruitiness, some apples and toffee. Taste contains a hop bittering which punches through the malt character at the end. Very well balanced and moreish.
Creamy ale, not as much of the sweet German influence as I was expecting, decent, but no better.

Líquido turvo,alaranjado,espuma mediana na formação e duração;no aroma malte,caramelo,notas torradas e um leve herbáceo;sabor inicial maltado,adocicado,seguido por notas cítricas e finalizando com leve amargor,corpo médio,refrescante,boa drinkability,final seco,retrogosto agridoce.
Caramel aroma, light aroma and nice light yeast aroma. Taste is simple, caramel, 1/27 of a quad :)

Výčap Zlý časy. Bledia jantárová farba, biela pena. Vôňa sladká, ovocná, ľahko karamelová. V chuti stredne plné telo, nízka nasýtenosť. Zo začiatku sladkosť ovocia, neskôr karamelové chute a v pozadí veľmi príjemná dochuť prezretého ovocia. Výborné.
Plain old ale, nothing surprising, medium carbonation, nicely balanced malts and undercurrent woody notes.
Bright amber. Sweet caramel and floral aroma very smooth and intense. Hoppy finish. Very tasty ale.
The Cannery Row Beer Club enjoyed the Brewery's beer that made them famous. This cost $6.

Fresh and malty. Smooth, hints of sweetness. The mainpart is a bit sharp, typical Heller Bock flavours, sweetness with a nice bitter aftertaste. Round and fresh with not too much depth. A bit sticky in the end without being too sweetish. Nice.
Draught. Amber body with white head. Aroma is malty caramel with hints of toffee and some hints of floral notes. Tasis malts m caramel and some biscuits. Aftertaste is sweet with hops.

Good, but nothing exceptional. Slightly dark with a little after taste that hangs in your throat.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Maybe I got an older bottle but not much going on with this beer. Some syrupy caramel malts and wheat flavours. Not too shabby but nothing exciting.

Toffee and orange on the nose, not as bold as id expected. Pours a nice burnt orange colour with a thin but robust, stark white head. This is a very complex beer but in a really subtle and understated way. Quite malty - biscuit and toffee dominant with a slight bitter hit intertwined. Theres some floral flavours in the back end, with an ever so slight lemon twang. Superb levels of carbonation and great density. A little sharp on the back end but leaves a good mouth coating.

Shared bottle. Pours is orange to light amber, thick white head. Aroma is fruity, pear, herbal, some peach. Taste is malty, sweet, light bittery, fruity, light pear. Medium body, flat carbonation. Very good.
Bottle at brewfellas pub in nicosia. Pours copper/amber with a nice white head. Malty with some caramel notes, a bit sweet but well balanced with some hop bitterness

0,355l bottle at Cafe Restaurant Aumann / Wien 18. Malty aroma and taste. Perfectly balanced between sweetness and bitterness. Excellent bock.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow, I dont know how many times Ive walked past this over the years. Silly me! Pours a clear orange-copper with thin white head - no retention. Smell is wonderful - semi-sweet with malt and bread and citrus. Flavor also has a slight honey sweetness, balanced well with some hop bitterness. Finish has a trace of alcohol, but smooth and again semi-sweet. I must have more...

From the bomber, has a nice cloudy two tone (brown on the bottom, orange on top) look to it, little to no collar. Smells of sweet malt. Starts out really sweet but once the palate adjusts it evens out with carbonation and is very drinkable. I dont remember having a maibock when I spent time in Germany, but then again I dont remember a lot of things I did there. This is a delightful change of pace from what I usually drink, and I like that they made a German beer to celebrate a Mayan custom. Cheers.
From tap, dark yellow-orange coloured non filtered ale, medium bitterness and light malty sweetness. Rich mouthfeel. Nice one!

Bottle from BeerMerchants.

Pours hazy amber orange, with a single finger off white head. Aroma of sweet malts, dark fruits, and some hops too, faint.... Taste of initial fruits, then some light malts, then honey and extreme fruits and bitterness. Very good.

Tough beer for me to rate. First of this style. Most beers I like have a stronger flavor. I didnt get much of a distinctive smell out of it. Pours a nice amber color with lasting lacing. There is tingling on the tongue upfront. The middle is a smooth malty feeling. Sweet, somewhat caramel or butterscotch hints, though not overpowering. A bit too much carbonation at the end for my liking (considering the middle felt so smooth). There are hints of hops bitterness, but nothing that even compares to a pale ale.

Very drinkable beer. Came to the conclusion that this is one that will not stand out on unique or powerful tastes, but a great beer to go to if you just want to enjoy a good beer.
Honey aroma , bright cooper color,. Malty flavor but not over powering , clean finish.
Pours copper with a thin head. Aroma of honey. Taste is like a sweet honey hot toddy. Lovely.

Goede kraag van schuim, helaas weinig geur die opvalt. Groente smaak maar niks extra. Beetje zoet met lichte bitter. Ik mis iets fris of een citra.
Hij brand een beetje na in je mond, ik vind hem niet super slecht maar een topper is het ook niet. Iets beter als een middenmotor.
A well-balanced, substantial ale with a clean finish. The Dead Guy has a pleasant amber hue and a nice hippy bite.
Only slightly better than a generic/cheap beer. Not as bitter but no discernible flavors. Not very good.

Bottle 33 cl.
Clear amber, off-white head. Malty caramel, toasted, slight alcoholic and a hint of yeast. Moderate sweet and bitter, long.
This is there most popular beer. It is their original beer. It is smooth and well balanced. Good mix of hops and malts.

Pours a dark slightly hazy amber-orange with an average size fizzy off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt, fruit and a touch of hops. Taste is fruity with fresh floral hops along with caramel malt and honey-- sweetness and bitterness are incredibly balanced.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2015 Bottle. Deep orange colour. Medium white head. Flavour of caramel, honey and dried fruits, light cookie notes. Flavour of caramel malt, dried fruits, light cookie notes. Bitterness in the background. Medium bitter dry finish with dried fruits notes. Medium body high carbo.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2016 Dark golden appearance, with almost no head. Fresh aromas of citrus and honey. Complex taste of honey, anise , dark caramel, tequila and vanilla. Medium body, fine carbonation and a lasting aftertaste of honey and caramel. Quite good

Bottle. Caramel to brown in colour, low carbonation, slightly opaque. Aroma is, well, malty with some timid hops. Taste is rich and round, slightly bitter aftertaste. Good mouthfeel. Perfect (or close) beer in the sun!

Pours golden from 12 oz with medium persistent tan head. Malty honey aroma. Complex malt flavor with honey, hints of tangerine/citrus fruit, and decidedly bitter end. Medium bodied with ample carbonation to support malt. Fantastic beer, complex and drinkable though wouldnt really call it a maibock.
Muffiger Geruch. Relativ Restsüß, nachhängende Bittere. Aromen nach himbeere bzw. Waldbeere.

Bottle at the Free Press, Cambridge. Amber/copper, clear with a bit of cream/beige head. Odd aroma: forest berries, bubblegum, pine resin. A whiff of plastic. Not unpleasant, actually quite enticing, but as I say, odd. Taste is a full on malty bittersweet hit. Finish is more bitter, fades slowly, and creates the perfect denouement for this exciting drink. Loved it.

This is a bit hoppy for my liking. I like the hop with certain beers, like an IPA or something, but didnt work for me with this one. Not quite an extra bitter, but pretty close. A good overall beer, and was able to drink it no problem. I just prefer some of the other types that Rogue makes.
Geruch malzig bis fruchtig und nach Karamell. Geschmack ebenfalls malzig bis karamellartig.
How : bottle Appearance : cloudy copper, small white head. Aroma : fresh fruits, hops, caramel, floral and some herbal tones. Palate : medium body, smooth carbonation.
Nice American beer it is Always asking for one bottle and another and another worthy the try

341 ml bottle poured at home. Pours a copper color with a bit of carbonation and minimal head. Aroma is spice and orange peel. Taste is slick in the mouth with some carbonation and bitter finish. Definitely a drinkable beer.
Dark reddish colour with little compact head. Smell of malts, hops, herbs, honey. The taste is the same with well balanced carbonation and bitterness. For me very tasty beer.
Been drinking this for years, even when they sold growlers at bev mo. Big malty for IPA almost arrogant bastard like. Hops are dark fruit flavors. Slightly sweet on palate. Otherwise great big brew.
geil! xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear amber ale with a medium beige head.
Smells malty, caramel.
Tastes bitter and a bit sweet.
Leaves a malty sweet palate.
Okay beer.

Bottle from Bierzwerg!

Pours amber colored with nice off-white head. Smell has sweet malts, spicy. Starts sweet malty, spicy, with some floral hops. Finish is lovely malty and slight fruity.
Bottle. Malty, caramel and fruit notes, a slight candy sweetness. Full bodied and flavourful, pretty well balanced. Nice.
Pours with a heavy foam, beautiful color. Muted aromas. Tastes like an American ale, toasty, malty, not heavy on the alcohol. Great beer for tapas.

Pours a hazy copper gold with fluffy eggshell head. Aromas of caramels, toasted bread, and a touch of campfire smoke. Taste is of caramel malts without too much sweetness. Alcohol shows as it warms. Finishes with a light tang and a caramel flavors. Full bodied with a faint astringency.

Light fragrance of flowers. The taste is very bitter and fruity. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth a weak moment. For bitter beer for me to like it. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours brown. Aroma of red licorice, brown sugar, malt, molasses: nice. Tastes of the same: smooth and sweet. Lingering bittersweet aftertaste. Flavourful yet sessionable.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2015 I could tell you about the aroma, the appearance the palate. But I wont waste your time: This was simply, the most delicious beer I have had the pleasure of drinking in a very, very long time. If I had the choice, I would drink nothing else. Spectacular work Rogue.

Pours a caramel color. Aroma is very sweet- caramel and toffee. Taste contains more bitter or dry elements than I would expect based on the coloration and taste, and I think thats a good thing. Hops upfront quickly melt into a Werthers original candy type taste that is sweet, but not overly sweet. I guess Im a little picky in some respects for a guy wholl drink adjunct lagers when finances dictate- I enjoy some malty beers, but when they taste a little too much like candy, that can be a turn-off, and when they get a little too roasted and burnt, that can be a turn-off. This definitely is not the latter. It has some aspects of the former, but skirts the line nicely with the upfront hoppiness and not overdoing it on the backend sweetness despite the base backend flavor being similar to beers that cross the line. I would say a good beer, but not spectacular.  Nicely avoids some common pitfalls, but its aim isnt to the side of the bock equation Id aim for.  I think I would raise my rating a lot if it were only relative to beers that smell and somewhat taste like candy.  But in a world where not all beers do, just a solid beer (Which is nothing to sneeze at).

Amber with a small white head. Aroma is bread, biscuit, caramel, honey, bananas, apples, oranges. Taste is malty, citric, fruity, grassy and light alcohol presence. Sweet and light alcoholic aftertaste. Warming mouthfeel.

355ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Small tan head. Hazy light amber body with quite a bit of sediments. Low carbonation. Aroma is mostly earthy yeast and marmelade. Rich malt body. Slightly bitter on the tongue at first with a sour/sweet finish. Slightly spicy.

355ml bottle at Van Zanten. Hazy amber with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with low carbonation. Nice sweetness with some bitter tones. Malts, caramel, honey, raisin and herbs. Quite a tasty brew.

pours a light copper with a medium beige head. aroma of grass/hay and malt. Nice malty taste. Some mild hop bitter arrives in the middle and goes into a pleasant hop presence on the finish. Not syrupy like many bocks. A really good balanced beer.
Pours with almost no head. More on the malt (caramel, nutty feel) side but with a nice touch of extra hops in the end which is a bit unusual for this style (but expected considering it s made in USA)

Aroma is strongly malty with notes of marmelade, fruits, raisin and slight vanilla. Mouthfeel is nice and slick with a medium amount of carbonation. The flavor is definately malty, sweet and marmelade-ish with some butterscotch and vanilla. Finish has some slight spice, probably from the hops. Definately a really nice beer!
Bottle. Orange-amber color. Aroma: toffee, plum, jam, caramel a bit of marsala. Taste malty, honey, some wine, hop bitterness in finish.

Small off-white head; medium to dark Amber color; just a bit hazy.

Malt dominates with molasses and bread aromas; some hop balance though with some mild grass aroma.

Medium to full body; texture a bit oily and creamy. Long finish with moderate to heavy sweetness and bitterness.
Bottle at home. Pours reddish amber, nose is caramel, fruity, taste is malty, toffee, caramel, raisin.
Bottle. caramel, earthy, alcohol, raisin, black currant, vanilla, butterscotch, amber color, cloudy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness. medium body, creamy, soft carbonation.
Wow. Quiet, calm, refreshing. Nothing unwanted upfront, nor aftertaste. I might be giving this more credit cause it is Oregon Craft.
355ml bottle. Small white head leaving. Hazy red apple lemonade color. Aroma is rose hips, raspberries, raisins, prunes, syrup. Taste is light bitter of berries.

Old rating. Ive had many 6-packs of this over the years. An absolute American craft beer classic. One of my gateway beers that changed my palate. Nice yeast and malt aroma. Great malt-forward taste. As it warms up cinnamon and cardamom become slightly noticeable. Sweet on the palate and nose. A bit of bitterness on the way out that lingers.
Second beer on the BJs dinner pairing. This is a classic. Great malt backbone. Moderate hops.

Pours a frosted amber, good carbonation and no head. Rich malt aroma with decent hops balance. Complex and spicy taste with very good balance. Light bitter hops aftertaste with caramel follow-through. Slightly sticky mouthfeel.
The aroma is similar to barley wine, but the taste of soft, slightly sweet, enough beverages. Well fine of course, but 2 times would not take this.

Bela breja! Cor laranja acobreada, meio turva. No aroma, predomina o malte, com um sutil toque herbal. O sabor acompanha o que indicou o olfato, com uma bela dose de malte, seco, com corpo medio e final curto e um pouco amargo. Drinkability excelente

Been almost 20 years since I had this. Was a very bold beer for the time.
Very sweet malty nose almost reminiscent of a candy apple. Body is both flat and fizz. Hazy deep holden brown amber. Not bad.

12 oz undated bottle served in a pint glass. A little sediment at bottom of bottle ... added mid-tasting (recommended).

Clear, then cloudy (see above) light amber color; 1+ finger of cream head after a light pour has good retention.

Aroma is mainly citrus hops and some floral and apricot elements.
[from notes]

I didnt know what to expect, because I had bought the bottle blindly :) But I surely didnt expect a Heller Bock. Its my first Heller Bock actually and I quite liked it. Nice, sweet aroma and taste of the malts, some caramel, vigs, honey. Sweet, but very pleasant.

Pours a reddish copper colour. Head and lacing are not notable.
Aromas are a lovely mix of cherries, coconut, and malts.
The palate totally follows suit. The malts are quite sweet. A sweet vanilla biscuit lingers on the tongue after the swallow. This is good beer.
It has a small head, decent lacing, has a funky yeast aroma, orange peel, medium to strong bitterness, malty.
Color amber with small head. Aroma sweet, malt, yeast. Taste sweet, malt, yeast, fruits.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a very small quickly diminishing beige head that leaves no lace. Weak aroma of sweet malt and brown sugar. Lightly bitter and medium bitter tastes, average to soft carbonation, light body, oily to creamy texture, flavors of caramel and brown sugar found especially in the finish. Definitely not a Maibock as is claimed.

From 0,355l bottle, BBD: 08/2015. Pours cloudy amber liquid, medium foamy tan head, Aroma: apricot, caramel, candied fruits, very aromatic, nice, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, candied fruits, malt, caramel, very nice and pure taste, very drinkable, Palate: medium body, slick to creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation, long malty candied aftertaste, Overall: perfect, very drinkable, enjoyed.

Pours a fairly clear orange amber color, topped with a decent and lasting off-white head. Fruity aroma, slight honey notes and quite some soy sauce aroma (not completely pleasant). Taste is sweet and fruity, honey notes in there with bitterness in the end. Not bad, though nothing really special.

Draught at Taphouse, Cph. Slightly hazy golden-amber colour with a thin off-white head. Sweet aroma with caramel and toasted malts, fruits - a herbal sweetness from honey. Citrus hops. Taste is sweet. Medium body, creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and fruity. A very nice take on the German beer style. A bit far from the originals.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 Poured with almost no head. Orange in color. Fruity smell and a sweet aftertaste. I didnt like it as much as I thought it would.

Bottle at Piccadilly, Bodø. Has a slightly hazy, red orange colour with a small head. Aroma of fruity hops, berries, leather, caramel and apricot. The flavour has more leather, wood and fruity hops. A little dry in the ending. Has a slick mouth feel with a balanced bitterness. A fruity and nice pale bock.
355ml bottle at Rhode Island, Cherry Hinton. Poured reddish brown with a thin white head. Hoppy on the nose, flavour dominated by caramel and orange
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts yeast citrus fruits flavor malts spicy citrus fruits and bitter hops

Brun clair / peu de bulles / un style de bière que je découvre avec celle-ci.
Un gout sans doute malté certe mais aussi cidré sans la fin de bouche aigrelette. Un côté très liquide en bouche. Je ne sais pas trop quoi en penser finalement. ça a le mérite de mintriguer

Cor alaranjada com tons âmbar e uma leve turbidez; espuma marfim de baixas formação e persistência com pouco lacing;
Aroma de mel, Carmelo torrado e um leve cítrico (pinho?) 
Sabor de início de caramelo evoluindo para um fim amargo e levemente alcoólico bastante equilibrados. 
Retrogosto de leve picância, alcoólico e de amargor discretos; Corpo e carbonatação médios.
 Boa, mas nada ROGUE!!

Pours a pure Amber colour with creamy thick white head. Fantastic aroma of juicy oranges. Just so powerful and clean with a biscuit and bread malt nose. Amazing. Taste is a fruit and spice explosion with sweet orange, earthy herbs, toffee, biscuit. Finishes with something thats not quite pear but somewhere near. Wow is it a fantastic taste and aroma. Finish leaves a little sweet biscuit behind with a little pithy orange too. Very clean yeast character, no overpowering or cloying esters. Love it.

Smooth honey aroma. Enjoyed from a bottle, so I couldn't judge the appearance. Smooth going down. Good mouthiness. Finishes caramel and malty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a clear copper with a decent head and large bubbles streaming up the side of the glass. Aroma is a bit like a season. Taste is a beery hop. Not bad but definitely different. Medium mouth feel
Pours a light copper from the bottle. Sweet honey yeastiness is underwhelming. Thin mouthfeel, quick effervescence that flattens to nothing. Okay beer.
33cl bottle from cerveteca Lisboa. Hazy orange appearance. Thin head. Medium high sweetness. Aroma is malty, bubblegum, spicy.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tumbler on 03.25.14.

A: Somewhat opaque, milky caramel color. 1 finger head that receded quickly. Great lacing.

S: Strong, sweet caramel.

T: Caramel dominates. Has lingering red apple. Some flower on the back end.

M: Creamy smooth. It floats on the tongue and fades away slowly. Beautiful.

O: The creaminess is apparent first, then a wash of caramel takes over. The sweetness fades and then a slight bitterness comes on until fading into a red apple and flower back end that lingers. This is a very well balanced and fantastically smooth beer. Unfortunately, I wont ever buy anything from Rogue again after what Ive heard about them, but that shouldnt affect my rating of this beer.
Tåkete lys brun med beige fingerhøyt skum. Lukter maltekstrakt og noe sviske. Søt smak med lett bitterhet i avslutningen. Kort søt ettersmak.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2015 14 jan 2015, tap. Light orange/Amber, clear, no bubbles. Nose is orange citrus and granola malt. Med body and mildly fizzy. Really reminds me of unpasteurized apple cider. It doesnt taste bad or off but it tastes appley. There is some orange citrus finish an moderate granola malt throughout. Decent.

Bottle at home (glow in the dark!?). Nicely almost clear, copper colour, big foamy white head. Strong malty tones, sweet honey, bready and grainy too; clearly reminiscent of German (alcohol free) ales. Little fruity with orange and mandarins, light pilsener-like bitterness, Belgian yeasty. Medium carbonation and body. More like an imperial pils.

0,355 l bottle, best before 8/2015. Clear, bronze yellow with a thick, creamy, stable, white head. Massive lacings on the glass. Sweetish, fruity aroma of honey, gooseberry, lemon and tangerine. Very appetising. Sweetish taste of honey, lemon and tangerine. Finish is crisp and medium bitter. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Quite good and highly quaffable. Would love to drink that on a warmer day!

Bottle from Seoul Plaza. Full malty aroma, toasted, toffee, biscuity. Almost clear orange-amber colour. Poor head. Taste is once again rich and malty, seems even stronger than the ABV suggests. Toasted, caramelly malt sweetness and only light noble grassy complementary hoppiness. Rather sweet, but not too much so. Really nice, pleasant drink. Finishes with a hoppy flavour.

Ambrée claire voilée. Mousse blanche peu persistante, lacings.
Aromatique très maltée léger toastage, un peu sucré caramel, notes dalcool et on décèle quelque peu les houblons nobles. Sensation boisée un peu.
En bouche très sucrée avec une amertume de lhoublonnage venant ensuite. Belle longueur en bouche bien balancée (bien sur le sucré tout de même). Fin de bouche légèrement alcool. Touche boisée toujours présente.
Petite carbonatation.
Bière intéressante et une des meilleurs dans son style (qui nest pas le mien)... à goûter.

Dark golden with a white head - Malt aroma with tropical fruity aroma from hops - Good malt body and a gentle hop profile with tropical fruits and some bitterness - The malt and some hop bitterness goes into the finish - This was good

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 Botella. @La Taberna de Hank, Luanco 05/01/2015
Color ambar y espuma blanca. Sabor dulce
Pours a light copper, decent off white head. Nose is malt and candy sugar. Bittersweet. Middle is honey and bready malt. finish comes slightly bitter and clean. Interesting beer.

Hazy amber color, minimal off-white head. Aroma of honey, floral hops and lots of caramel. Taste is grassy caramel. Some sweetness and bitterness. Well balanced. Thin body, creamy, flat to soft carbonation. Good one.
Amber color, beige head. Caramel malt nose, ripe fruit, yeast, hint of citrus. Caramel malt taste, sweet fruity, earthy, dry finish. Medium body, soft carbonation.

It pours a dark golden colour with a small white head that doesnt hang around long but leaves some lacing.
The aroma is malty and sweet and that follows through on the taste...in saying that there is a slight hop bite and a dry balanced finish.
A lovely beer!
Bottle at home. Pours bit hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is malty, biscuits, honey, bit citrusy. Taste is sweet, malty, biscuits, some honey.
Very smooth ale. Nice light brown color. Almost no aroma. Not bitter at all. It goes down very easy.
Medium white head, chestnut orange amber colour, yeast malts honey warm smell, medium carbonation, medium spicy bitter, honey maple sirup malts warming medium firm body warming yet refreshing

Bottle. Dark pale body with low to no head. Aroma is malty, caramel, light toasty, but very light. Taste has high crist malty biscuit sweetness, medium to high earthy bitterness. Well balanced, heavy. Body is full, medium carbonation.
Aroma from bottle is ale, taste is Carmel sweet, malty and roasted notes, gently hopped to cut the sweetness, this is a great overall beer

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Dark copper, quite clear, dense beige head. Smell of caramel, hay, spices and burnt malts. Medium sweet, distinct caramel, quite vinous, almost like port, dark fruits, very good. Moderate bitter finish. Probably the helles bock ive tried, but i think its more of a crossover to dunkler bock than a classic helles bock

Milder than I first expected. Good aroma not much carbonation. Good color and mild taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy amber color, minimal off-white head. Aroma of honey, floral hops and lots of caramel. Taste is grassy caramel. Some sweetness and bitterness. Well balanced. Thin body, creamy, flat to soft carbonation. Good one. (Pivoljub 0,33l bottle)
Very nice! Dark honey color, malty and boozy on the nose. Great malt flavor, hearty, and surprisingly boozy flavor for the abv. Overall a great beer
Bottle from Katsuragawa Aeon. Nice deeo copper colour. Aroma is zesty malts. Flavour has a decent hop profile, good pine bitterness.

12 oz bottle--> pint glass. Amber pour, good head. Aroma is hoppy, toasty with an almost pungent sweetness. Drinks dry with notes of pine tar and cranberry. Pretty exotic but still very decent. Stick with it if you're just tasting and have doubts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma: sweet malts, dried fruits, caramel, honey. Taste: malts, hops, caramel, orange peel, dried plum. Small head, no lacing and medium carbonation. Price [Warsaw, Poland] 14PLN (bottle)

Keg at Rogue, PDX Airport, 12/11/14.
Hazed golden orange with a moderate off white swirl and edgeing.
Nose is caramel, rich malt notes, nutty, candied sugars.
Taste comprises caramel, dark fruit rinds, candyfloss, sweet notes.
Medium body, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: One of my favorite beers from the Portland area, Dead Guy is particularly good from the tap. The Wild Hare in little Canby, Oregon serves it at the perfect temperature. Its also good in a growler and holds its flavor and bite well.

12 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pours a deep copper color and perfectly clear with a nice off white head. Smells of sourdough, honey, and a hint of orange. Tastes of sweet malt, honey and caramel with a dry finish. Palate is perfect for style. Very good will definitely drink again.
Pours murky orange. Nose has orange peels, caramel and grapes. Mouth has citrus and is quite bitter. Sweet finish.
UPDATED: NOV 25, 2014 Botella de 35,5 cl, adquirida en La Birra. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, lupulo, ligeramente dulce.
0,33 bottle from Pivoljub. Pours hazish amber witih minimal white head. Hoppy nose. Aroma is hoppy, caramel. Sweet taste with hints of bitterness. Good one.

Fruits, bread, malts and hints of orange peel in the aroma. Amber with a white head. Medium + sweet and medium bitter, Medium to full body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall quite a well accomplished brew, just not my favorite style.

355 mL bottle. Orange gold pour with a medium off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of fruit, orange, earth. Taste is slightly sweet, honey, caramel. Lightly bitter finish with some nice floral hops.

Pours a pretty clear copper with a thin head that disappears fast and leave only few traces on the glass. Nose is of cereals and alcohol, bready. Taste is of same all-bran-ish cereals and lightly bitter. This isnt what I remember this dead guy being but maybe my tastes evolved. Body is medium-full, carbonation somewhat low and mouthfeel really oily or maybe even a little sticky. Alcohol shows and warms you pretty much throughout, quite surprising for such a "light" brew. Overall I thought it was OK but not much more, I wont be back.
There are (as the description states) indeed references to the Maibock but in my experience it is much more an IPA. And a very good one, wonderful balanced taste, very lively and fruity. I love it!

I'm a fan of IPAs and I really sharp, sometimes bitter, high alcohol brews. This selection was very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle from BevMo. Nose is nothing too distinct, sort of nutty and toasty. Flavor comes across big, though, with an excellent malt/hops balance. No floral overtones here. Just a deep roasted caramel taste that is rich, powerful and thirst quenching. The heller bock category needs choices like this. Not overly complex. Just good...

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2015 Drank with Masum @ Kandinsky 13-11-2014. I liked the beer. It is well-balanced and has a sweet taste. It is a pleasant beer to drink, okay. Not spectacular but nice, fine.

Edit: drank a bottle that was best before 05/2015 at 06-10-2015 with Rik at my place. Agree with my previous rating. This beer is fine. Like the subtle sweet, malty (nut?) taste.

Classic Rogue beer, apparently a true, i.e. bottom-fermented, German light bock initially but top-fermented nowadays, like many Dutch spring bocks. Off-white, thinly structured head breaking open quickly but leaving a steady rim and some lacing, colour a warm and deep orange blonde, clear with slow fizz, cloudy with deposit. Fruity aroma of orange peel, passion fruit, cake, honey, dough, cookies, mango, single malt, something very earthy especially after adding the deposit, hints of cigarette tobacco, chicken soup, hazelnuts, fried eggs, cooked pear and a kind of faint rotting smell I cant quite put my finger on - and which fascinates me rather than putting me off. Vivid fruity onset, mango, red apple, hint of orange, rounded and slick, somewhat flat and undercarbonated mouthfeel (which explains the limited head retention), nutty, caramelly, soft bready backbone, finishing in nutty maltiness covered by a resinous, somewhat oily, citrussy and herbal hop bitterness, long and dry and being accompanied by some slightly warming, gin-like alcohol. Id say this is a typical American take on the style; other top-fermented helles bockbiers I tasted were a lot sweeter and less hoppy. Interesting, not the most complex Rogue I had so far, but very enjoyable even in autumn.

12oz bottle poured into pint glass. My first heller bock. Thought it was a solid beer. Head dissapated rapidly, had a rich, dark golden color. Would suggest it if youre trying to switch things up for sure.

Draught pint at the Tipping Point Brewing Co on Wyndham Street in Hong Kong. 6.5% ABV. Small head, quickly dissipates. Aroma of fruits and caramel. Cloudy amber colour. Sweet taste of honey and light bitterness. Caramel and lightly hopped. Bitterness on the palate. Pleasant.

On tap at Ourlaws in Watford City. Appearance: finger of white head, copper color, slightly cloudy, good lacing. Aroma:pine notes, floral hops, wheat notes, heavy caramel. Palate: medium-light body, average carbonation, bitter finish, sticky texture. Taste: sweet caramel with hints of what and pilsner yeast, moving into floral hops bitterness with pine notes. Overall, pretty drinkable, good balance, pretty unique. Enjoyable beer, especially if you want more than 1 or 2.

06.11.2014, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel malts, dried fruits, nuts, grass, toffee, chocolate, broth, sugar, almond cake. Taste is slightly dry grassy, wet grass, minerals, weeds, hops, old leafs, paper, caramel malts, alcohol. Medium bitterness, slightly watery and mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough, too grassy / hoppy as a bock in my mind...
Tap at 23 Craft Beerz. Caramel, light bitterness, alright. Very inoffensive. Remember this as being less nice, but theres nothing wrong with this. Caramel and light bitterness, thats about it.

DAA; Bottle 550 ml. Pours hazy amber with a lacing, frothy creamy, moderate lasting, off-white head. Nose is heavy malt and caramel, dark fruit and light spice. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a moderate lasting, warming finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Yum yum yum good good good good good happy Halloween everybodeeeeeee! A must try
The most prominent taste with this beer is honey. It is oddly sweet but nothing to write home about.

Probably my favorite "easy goin" craft beer.

Golden, hazy, white foam, caramel, medium sweetness, low bitterness, medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish.
Nice malty offering well balanced by the hops. This beer was better before rogue started using their own farms hops and malt.

Bottle. When given a beer, I usually dont refuse. This is one of those situations and I have time to rate. Anyway, murky burnt orange body. Sweet caramel and faded citrus hops, with some fruity notes in the aroma. Flavor is not my thing, and Ive never really enjoyed this beer. Grassy, dusty citrus, some sweet caramel and just kinda gross. Medium body.
Bottle (12oz): Had at party from bottle. Need to rerate but shows some promise

Strong, instantly recognizable aroma. Vigorous even. Appearance is nice and clear, dark orange in colour. Taste is almost thrilling, like a punch in the jaw but a tasty punch in the jaw. Agree with others that theres not a lot of nuance, but the powerful malt and bread impact is tasty. Palate is smooth and bubbly. Very tasty.
Kers en cassis aroma. Smaak prima, maar niet uitmuntend. Wat thee op de achtergrond. Al met al oke maar geen hosanna
Pours cloudy orange with a smallish head. Bread, caramel, but mostly honey on the nose. Low hop profile. Over all, a nice expression of the German-Style Maibock.

6-pack from Biggie Wine & Liquor. Cloudy amber appearance with an off-white head. Aroma of toasted grains, breaded malts, light toffee/caramel, light earthy notes and a touch of spicy hops. Similar flavor, malty and somewhat rich with mild sweetness and light bitterness. Medium body, smooth and balanced feel with a creamy, lingering finish.
0,33 bottle bought at Vinmonopolet, something is wrong, flat co2, no head retention smells vegetal, flat taste, Very disapointing beer
Pours cloudy amber with tall white head. Aroma is fruity with light malt hint. Taste is a classic boch with some fruit notes.

Piękna miedziano bursztynowa barwa, niezła piana.
Aromat zdecydowanie słodowy z nutami owocowymi, skórką świeżo wypieczonego chleba i rodzynkami. W tle alkohol i karmel. Bardzo przyjemny.
W smaku zdecydowanie słodowe, ze średnim wysyceniem, mocno owocowymi nutami, i delikatnym goryczkowym finiszem. Bardzo udane piwo.

BOTTLE 355 ML from Douberd.

Look: clear amber, white frothy head.
Aroma: clear strong caramel - nothing more.
Taste: sweet caramel, a bit stale, light bitterness, thin finish.

"dead guy is a somewhat unique beer, and worth a try, but its a little harsh for my tastes. i like strong beers, but this has no subtlety whatsoever in the flavors. Theyre not bad, just too in your face."
Possibly the second "craft" beer I ever had. Wow, that seems like a long time ago. Hazy amber with a thin white head. Honey, brown sugar, flowers and citrus.
Couleur ambré avec un col assez résistant. Nez de caramel et des notes terreuses. En bouche cest assez simple, caramel, notes terreuses, un peu de bois. Rien dextraordinaire.

Cloudy dark orange color with medium head. Intensely sweet malts, a bit of yeast. Mostly tastes like the sweetness of long-chewed bread. A bit of hops in the finish as well. Very sweet lingering aftertaste. A well-made sweet bock.

DATE TASTED: October 5, 2014... GLASSWARE: Brew at the Zoo pint... OCCASION: Os clinch, while the Browns complete the largest road comeback in history... APPEARANCE: slow, steady bubbles are mired within an opaquely beautiful orange brown body; creamy, substantial off-white head; lacing creates white fencing... AROMA: strong citric cleansing power--peach, tangerine, and orange--weds with soft pine to produce a sweet, rewarding allure... PALATE: smooth, active and bubbling to the tongue; simmering and balanced, if not a little difficult to place--could be the ale/bock moniker coming to fruition; still, highly drinkable for a beer nearly 7% ABV.....TASTE: intense melon, ear-tingling hops, and a solid malt base at the throat creates a full, demanding taste; nothing Dead here! ... OVERALL:this hybrid beguiled me at first--seeking the ale, malt made me rethink everything--the style, the glass, the night...then, seeking the malt, the crunch of West Coast hops puts me square back in a pint glass... this beer makes me ask too many questions and, frankly, I do not mind--complex and rewarding....

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2015 330ml bottle served in a Weizen glass. A: Pours a beautiful clear dark orange to copper-amber color forming a medium thin bubbled light yellow head. Good retention. Forms lots of lacings in the glass. S: Sweet and grainy. A bit fruity. Strong notes of toffee and caramel. Bready and biscuity yeasts. Quite biscuity. Light notes of dark fruits. Flowery and citrus hops profile. T: Sweet upfront. Strong notes of toffee, caramel and crystal malts. Bready and very biscuity. Notes of brown sugar. Moderate but very balanced and pleasant bitterness in the end. Citrus hops profile in the mouth. More Lager than Ale, in the mouth too. M: Smooth medium, creamy and a little bit molasses body. Medium carbonation. Sweet, bready, biscuity and slightly bitter end. O: Great drinkability. Nice Ale which is well disguised into a Bockbier :)
 [ BA Review @ 12/24/2013 ]

Poured from 650 mL bottle. Aroma of bread and hay. Pours a cloudy amber with white head. Has a medium bitter taste. Medium body, thin texture, average carbonation, and a slightly dry finish. Overall a nice, easy drinking brew.
12ox bottle from Tasty Life, Xiamen. Pours amber brown with a thin white head. Sweet malt aroma, a little musty. Some pine too. Bittersweet finish. Nice.
Bottle pour. Hazy copper with creamy tan head. Malty aroma with chocolate. Light to medium body. Toffee, chocolate, and light coffee taste.
Draft in Gainesville. Smells like domestic lager but tastes wonderful. Honey overlaying rich lager. Dark gold pour. One of the first craft beers but still one of the best flavor wise
Really enjoy rogue across the board this one is one of my favorites. Cant wait to try the pumpkin ale specialty and hope its as good as the chocolate pb banana ale

On tap @ The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Copper, dark orange color, slightly hazy, with a thick beige head. Aromas of caramel, bread, some dark fruits, biscuit. Sweet taste with caramel, malts, bread, toffee, biscuit, some fruitiness and herbal hops to balance. Aftertaste is pretty nice and lingering, sweet. Medium body with medium carbonation.

Appearance: opaque brown color with a tan head, head dissolves slightly quickly but still stays in tact, nice lacing on glass 
Aroma: malt, caramel
Taste: not too flavorful, flavor comes more at the end of the sip and is bitter 
Palette: bitter at end 
Overall: not as expected, not as flavorful as I hoped

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle into lager glass, no bottle dating. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy orange copper color with a 1 finger dense light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, light nuttiness, herbal, grass, light dark fruit, light pepper, and herbal/toasted earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/bready malt, earthy hops, and yeast ester notes; with solid strength. Taste of caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, light nuttiness, herbal, grass, pepper, light dark fruit, and herbal/toasted earthiness. Good amount of earthy/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, light nuttiness, herbal, grass, pepper, light dark fruit, and herbal/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity and robustness of dark/bready malt, earthy hops, and yeast ester flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, and lightly sticky/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a very nice maibock style. All around good complexity, balance, and robustness of dark/bready malt, earthy hops, and yeast ester flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Hazy orange copper colored body with tan head. Caramel malt, biscuit, fruity & lightly floral hoppy notes. Nicely balanced and very tasty.
Bottle 33cl. Pours clear amber with tiny white head. -aroma - Malt, citrus and caramel.
Pint at Rogue pub in Portland, OR.Excellent beer, lovely mix of sweet and dry flavours, highly recommend trying this beer

So so beer. Dry taste. Not bubbly. Bad aroma. Cool bottle graphics...that's about it..

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the pour I got a good thick and creamy off white head. This sits on top of a beautiful medium orange amber body with a light haze. As I drink the head slowly fades to a wispy covering and leaves some nice lacing on the glass. The aroma is full of bready sweetness, bready yeast and mellow hops. The flavor has good toasted and bready maltiness with some mild caramel, toffee and light nutty notes. This is backed up with nice herbal/floral hop balance. It finishes well balanced and extremely drinkable. The palate has a smooth full feel with soft carbonation.
2nd beer from Rogue. Seems like a top brewery. Pine, honey in the aroma. Sweet perhaps mandarin. Wouldnt have been wrong with more carbonation. Plenty of hops.

On tap at Union Jacks Columbia MD. Slightly cloudy yellow (perhaps a hint of copper color), small white head. Aroma is biscuit malty and light fruit but not a strong aroma. Flavor is some caramel malt with slightly fruity notes. Some grassy hops in the dry finish. Not exciting, but a solid craft beer.

Poured from a 12OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a nice roasted malt smell
Appearance- poured a nice copper color with a nice white head
Taste- A good malt flavor with a rather bitter hop finish. 
Palate- Medium body with a fair amount of carbonation. 
Overall- A really good Maibock, one of my first Rogue Brewery tries.

I'm pleasantly surprised with this one. Strong biscuity malts, but overall it's well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I know Ive had this one multiple times and never rated it. Pours cloudy copper color with off white head. Aroma is caramel malt with fruitiness. Flavor is caramel malt with some biscuity flavors followed by some fruity notes. Some orange flavors in finish. Finishes smooth. This is a really balanced malty brew.
Dark, cloudy orange. Cherry aroma, some bourbon; fruity. Butter flavor, slightly tangy, black cherry juice. Slightly dry finish. OK.
Orange colour, aroma is very malty... honey, apricot. Sweet malty taste with a sticky texture, mid-low bitterness. Quite rich aroma and flavor, too sweet and malty for me though.
Pours an orange honey color beer with a small white head. Smells malts, caramel, hops and honey. Tastes honey, malts and some hops. Low carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.
Amber. Beige head. Caramel and orange. Similar taste. Round.mourhfeel. Moderate bitterness.
This to me is a perfect beer. Not over the top well balanced and very sessionable for its 6.5%. Big fan

Szivárványszínű illata sok jót ígér a továbbiakat illetően, ez az intenzitás és komplex aroma egy bak sörnek sosem válik hátrányára, ha egyáltalán van, amelyiknek nem tesz jót. Linzer, frissen sült kenyér, vajkaramella, csipetnyi likőrösség, harapható illatjegyek. Ezek az egymásba karoló, stabil aromák idővel azonban némiképp összeesnek, a hőmérséklete túlzott emelkedése sajnos nem tesz jót neki, bár nyilvánvalóan ezen tulajdonságában is sok hasonlóságot mutat a többi söritallal. A lehetőségekhez képest a körülményektől elvonatkoztatva kissé mézes, virágos, fűszeres és alkoholos, kenyérhéjas szerkezet bontakozik ki egy jól körülhatárolható grillázsos, karamellás keretben, amihez később egy füves savanykásság is csatlakozik. Szerethető karakterű, jól eltalált ízvilág, valódi természetét azonban érdemes lenne a teszt során rendelkezésre álló feltételektől eltérően olyan körülmények között felfedezni, ahol a nyári hőségben megemelkedett hőmérsékletét fogyasztáshoz alkalmas mértékűre csökkenthetnénk le.

Not my favorite type of beer, but an awesome specimen for helles bocks/maibocks overall. Nice light color but not lacking at all in flavor. Good sweet light caramel malt flavor with breadiness and no hop flavor except for maybe some spice on the swallow.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Smooth as eggs. malty backbone dominated along with hints of the noble hops. caramel and honey by the fuckload in between with whiffs of herbs and earthiness. This beer is sensational.
Dark orange, honey like colour body with an off white head. Aroma is fruit, wood, and caramel. Taste is very sweet with medium bitterness.

Bottle 0,355L. Hazy, copper colour with creamy, off-white head. Sweet aroma of orange, mandarin, pineapple, biscuits and vanilla. Taste starts slightly sweet and crispy. Finish is moderate bitter and fruity. Light to medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation and still a lot of fruits. Damn, this beer is so good...

Aroma: caramel, earthy, malty
Appearance: amber, off-white foam, no lacing
Taste: malty, yeasty, caramel, a bit sweet
Palate: full body, well balanced

Orange-rötlich im Glas, golden. In der Nase Aprikose, Honig, Hefe, Malznoten, Bonbons und etwas Kräuter. Sehr komplex, sehr schön. Am gaumen Honig, Bitterkeit präsent, hopfig, süßlich. Normaler Körper, interessantes Bier.
UPDATED: OCT 9, 2014 Pleasantly bitter, yet malty orange bock with a substantial amount of fruity notes. Alcohol pops into the finish but not so that it is disturbing.
Malty and bready. golden in color. white head. decent lacing. Aroma and taste of bread and malts. Not great, but not bad.

Slightly hazy honey/amber, thin dense off-white head that leaves also lacing. Really malty aroma, bread, bit earthy, semisweet. Light body, thin to almost watery, dry and malty with semilong finish, low carbonation. Bit one-sided and lacks body.
Dead guy, what can I say this is a beer that you can drink anytime (anytime drinking is allowed, that is). Nice malt flavor, hint of caramel, smooth and finishes crisp. Love it.

Eh its okay. I think its a little overhyped. The taste is alright. Its kind of sweet and earthy. A little grassy. Biscuity malts for sure. Its just alright. I have had it so many times and each time I have the same reaction. I just think this is one of those hype machine beers. Im not a huge fan of rogue beers as it is. I think they are overpriced and taste average. I want to like this its just hard, its not that great.

Pours a medium clear amber in color with a frothy white head. Aroma of caramel, nuts, grass, earthy hops and yeast. Taste is rich melanoidins, caramel, toast, earth and grassy hops with a mouthfull of moderate bitterness. Bitterness isnt harsh but seems too balanced towards the bitterness and isnt as clean as a bock should be...very crisp with a dry finish but not clean enough.
Pours a clear copper color with white head. I remember the first time I tried it I couldnt drink the whole thing because it was too bitter, but now its fine.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 Appearance: Clear amber with finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Fruit cake, citrus, pine notes, resinous, light golden syrup, caramel.
Taste: Medium bitterness, low/medium sweetness and low sourness.
Palate: Thick smooth texture, thick body, average carbonation, lingering fruity, grapefruit, pithy, rich, caramel, fruit cake bitter sweet finish.
Comments: Good and glass lace. My rating is for XS Dead Guy Ale 9%. Added to site but rating moved to this beer?
Bottle at home. Not my cup of tea, i must admit. Lemony kind of citrus note. Sweet finish.
Bitter caramel with brady character in the taste and somtehing similar in the aroma. Good foam and average quality. On the same time very good body.
Belle couleur orangée; arômes et goût fruités et houblonnés; légèrement sucrée avec une amertume moyenne en finale; me fait plutôt penser à une APA

Draught @ Bar Brouw Oost, Amsterdam.
Not so Helles as you think, mild malt nose. Malty banana bubble gum, hard candy (zuurstok!), with mild bitter finish.
Not really my thing, but not bad.

Bottle 0.355l. Pours hazy orange with minimal off white head. Aroma is very malty, caramel, hints of honey. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter, malty, slightly fruity, hints of caramel and honey. Aftertaste is quite bitter, soft carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden. Average but with a really good label at least.
Cloudy amber with thin white head. Aroma of caramel malt. Medium bodied. Malty flavor with a bit of hops. Pretty good.

Bière limpide, à peine voilée, sur levure et où une timide écume pointe sans marquer le verre. Au nez, du biscuit au beurre, de lalcool, des esters fruités. Elle est moyennement amère avec un peu de sucre résiduel et une légère acidité. Elle est de corps solide, de texture huileuse, moyennement effervescente et se termine sur une douce amertume et de longs arômes.

Ni vet den där känslan av att man har glömt något. För att inte bli söndergnagd av denna oro går man i tur och ordning igenom sin "att göra"-lista. Inventeringen är för det mesta resultatlös. Och så ligger den där känslan kvar och jäser till sig, tills den framåt kvällningen är färdigbryggd: nu minns jag, det var ju en Rogue Dead Guy Ale jag skulle dricka!

UPDATED: APR 25, 2016 Hazysh orange color, thin white head. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Aroma is very friuty, honey, caramel, hops. Medium sweet taste, light bitter. Finish is dry. Very interesting and complex beer.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber with nice tan head. Nose and taste are malty and citrus. I need to try this again.

Pours clear amber with tiny head. Aroma is heavily malty, sweet, caramel. Taste is also caramely but balanced well with noble hops. Clean simple taste profile and good carbonation. As a German I can say this is a spot-on recreation of a Maibock.

It has a sweet aroma of malts and delicate touch of peach with lemon in it. Its deep orange/amber color, a bit hazy, with small head. Its very drinkable and so refreshing. In taste you can feel a bit of hops. The flavour is mostly sweet but it has this pleasant bitter aftertaste. Alcohol is nicely covered but it leaves a tiny tiny warm touch in your stomach.

Bottle. Slightly hazy orange-amber with a small creamy head. Floral hops, spicy, fruity and caramel aromas. Mild sweetness, fruity, caramel and toasted bread, strong bitter finish. Dry and clean. Smooth with medium body. Nice.

Cloudy copper colour with a white head. Malty, sweet aroma with caramel, toast, plum, raisins and resin. Medium, nicely carbonated body. Very nice, balanced to sweet flavour with caramel, resin and toast, with a nice sublte bitter finish.
Fruity homebrew aroma. Cloudy deep golden near amber colour. Taste is malty, warming high alcohol. Minimal hops, slightly earthy. Slightly furry yeasty mouthfeel. Tastes just like my last homebrew!
Had a six pack in Augusta with Erik. Decent beer. Malty with little hops. Not sure how to describe.

Shared a six pack with Wayne in Thomson. Great initial taste and very smooth. A "unique" aftertaste. Can't quite place it. Would be better on tap I think.

Aroma: Rich malt, Munich malt, toasty, Hops, light spicy. No DMS, no diecetyl.
Appearance: Hazy, copper body. Small, off-white head. lacing.
Flavour: Malt: Rich, bready, toasty, licorice, Hops: Fruity, Balance: Sweet malts, but strong bitterness in the finish. Medium-dry finish.
Mouthfeel: Medium body. Medium carbonation, creamy.
Overall: Very nice! 

330 ml bottle, poured. 
5A. Maibock/Helles Bock
From geers. Clear amber body.nice malty aroma and taste. Soft fizzy carbonation. ****
Ljusbrun öl med smutsvitt skum. I doften: karamell, gräs och citrus. Smakinslag av rabarber, karamell, malt och gräs. Lätt beska. Medelstor kropp.
Bottle. Pour is light amber, aroma is fruity, sweetness and berry. Taste is juniper, berries and tartness. Very good

355ml bottle at home , poured into a glass tankard, ABV 6.5%
Dark orange colour on the body, slighty hazy, with a small but quite thick white head, with quite good retention, leaving light lacing around the glass. The appearance only is much better than any heller bock I had till now.
Aroma has olenty of hops, caramel, sweet malts, tropical fruits.
Taste is very hoppy and bitter too, with the bitterness multiplying on its way to the aftertaste. Again tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, little caramel.
Medium body, average carbonation, very dry palate.
Great beer, definitey the best heller bock I had.

Bottle sample at Rogue Brewery tasting at Beer&Beyond, Tel Aviv. Nice clear light golden with no head. Aroma of sweet syrup, caramel, biscuit and fruits. Sweet malty flavor, biscuit, raisins, light bitterness. Sweet dry aftertaste. Light body.

From 22oz bottle to shaker, bought as Yellowstone Ale. Pour is a clear copper color with thin white head. Nose is light malt, hop, caramel. Taste is light bodied and sour with a crisp finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at La Cerveteca, Barcelona. Pours orange amber with white head. Hoppy and malty caramel.

Appearance is golden with an orange hue and cloudy with a white foam cap that dissipated quickly. Aroma is caramel malt and honey with a distinct floral hop/yeast quality. Taste is rich caramel malt with residual sweetness and honey, with a well balanced hop bite and fruity yeast character. Almost has a slight tea character. Mouthfeel is medium with a medium-high carbonation. Finishes crisp and dry with a lingering caramel malt

Amber color with a very small head. Aroma is a little malt and slight hops. Taste is a little weird to me. A lot of malt then a lot of hops and then some alcohol at the end. I guess its well made but its not for me.
Light aroma. Clear amber color. Crisp and clean. Nice malt flavor, no bitterness. Leaves a residual malt flavor.

0,33l fles uitgeschonken in een glas diep oranje amber van kleur, met een volle net niet witte schuimkraag. geur is een mix van vers brood met rijp fruit en ook wat kruidig als kaneel. Smaak is zoet met sinaasappel, graan broodachtig. Body is vol en de afdronk blijft mooi staan. Lekker, zeker voor een zoet bier.

Aroma of banana, raisins mixed with hops spicyness. There is also nice touch of bread and caramel notes. In higher temperature alcohol is really noticeable. Taste: Very malty (bread, caramel) with toasted flavours. Spicyness, flowery notes which reminds me of black tea. It is quite sweet with dry, little sour finish. Good balance, malty and fruity beer. We can see that they used much hops. High drinkability. Good one.

Appearance: Hazy amber color with a fine tan head. Lovely lacing.Aroma: Ehhh almost no aroma at all. Quite strange. A bit fruity and mild hoppy after a while.Palate: Medium + body. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Soft carbonation. Oily texture.Taste: Bready, fruity and mild hoppy.Overall impression: A bit to mild and anonymous.Personal stats: Bottle Roberths daughter bought in New York
330 ml bottle - Murkey brown dark orange colour, no head and a slight carbonation. Smooth taste with a spicy aroma.
Bottle, bangkok, wishbeer. Amber color, caramel note. A little bit of citrus flavor? ちょっと麦茶
Poured from 12oz bottle into pint glass. Poured a hazy amber with two finger tan head. Excellent taste. Somewhere between citrusy and dark. Not sure but I dig it. Overall a very good beer.
Bottle 12fl oz. Malty aroma with caramel notes, smooth creamy taste. Medium bitternes.
This is an above average beer. I dont have much else to say beyond that about it, I mean it just doesnt blow me away.

Dead Guy is a German-style Maibock made with Rogues proprietary "PacMan" ale yeast. It is deep honey in color with a malty aroma, rich hearty flavor and a well balanced finish. Dead Guy is created from Northwest Harrington, Klages, Maier Munich and Carastan malts, along with Perle and Saaz Hops.

Clear amber pour with a slight dark ruby cast. Massive head with normal lacing that retains well. Nose of caramel over sweet floral against a very subtle spiciness. Medium body with a smooth texture that hints at oily resin. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence on the finish. The complex flavor profile is quite nice and well balanced. It begins with a citric tartness, flows into a softer caramel light sweetness that gradually comes to the forefront with a bit of spicy heat. It finishes with a sweet fade into light hop bitterness coupled with a light spicy hop flavor. An outstanding and well crafted maibock.

Butelka 355ml.
OCZY : piwo ma kolor bursztynowy z odcieniami pomarańczy. Piana jest mała o kolorze kości słoniowej. Niezły lacing. 

NOS : aromat tarty i owoców takich jak banan, morela, słodkich muskatowych winogron i rodzynek. Do tego można dodać delikatne aromaty surowego ciasta, sernika i alkoholu. 

USTA : piwo jest średnio gazowane. Gęste o konsystencji tłustego mleka. 
Słodkie o nutach słodowych słodkiego biszkopta i bezy. Nuty owocowe są bardzo intensywne i nadają kwaskowatość. Ta również przypomina śmietanę. Gorzkość jest bardzo delikatna ale uporała się z przełamaniem dominujących słodów i drożdży. Wspomaga ja w niewielkim stopniu alkohol. Posmak przypomina mi uczucie jakie miałem po zjedzeniu tarty z białymi winogronami. Delikatnie cierpki jak goździki i pestki winogron. 

ODCZUCIA : mocno słodowe piwo ale dobrze skomponowane. Przyjemne w ustach. Intensywne i bardziej ma charakter piwa degustacyjnego. Można go parować do cielęciny i wieprzowiny, do sosów grzybowych i beszamel. 

OCENA : 
smak : 6/10
pijalność : 6/10
styl : +1

Amber color with a two finger tan head. Aroma is bread, caramel, brown sugar and slight hops. Taste is predominantly sweet with a nice bitterness. A balanced beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce bottle. Amber orange color. Big rocky beige head. Rich malty nose with notes of fresh baked bread. Spicy hops lead to a complex toasted malt palate. Finish is. Slightly sugary with a cloying mouthfeel, but 
Tasty none the less. Very enjoyable.

Pours a clear deep amber colour with two finger of rocky white head. Grainy aroma with notes of grapes. 
Taste is complex; floral, elderberry, caramel malts and a hoppy bitter finish. Med body with 
moderate carbonation.

Bottle from AmmersinO, Vienna. Amber, hazy body, with a small, creamy, white head. Aroma of flowers, red berries, citrus, caramel. Taste with about the same aromas, also some more grain and slight black tea notes. Mouthfeel is medium, creamy, with a medium carbonation and it finishes bitter-sweet and fruity-sour. Really nice, quaffable bock. The well balanced fruit and caramel notes are tasty, although not very complex. But overall this a great example of this style.
The stand alone beer, not too intense, not too light. An overall perfect beer in my opinion. I could drink this as a session beer and be good to go. Just yes.

Nice copper color, but fairly flat, with almost no head when served on tap. Nose and flavors were nice, but not nearly what I expected given the reputation of this beer. Maybe my palette had an off night - I will try again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Medium carbonation, aroma is subtle with the taste of hops, malt, slight nutty flavor at the end. The carbonation seemed to wash over my tongue at the first sip, but the finish is nice.

Pours clean, almost no head. Smell is mild and hoppy. Hazy amber color. A lot of carbonation, a little bitter, but overall pleasing. Love the label. But Im somewhat divided on the actual ale. Its complex but vague and Im not sure how to label it, but overall, its just okay.
Pours nice, Big white head. aroma is mild. color an amber haze. not much for flavor. how did this ale get such a reputation? The label is quite memorable.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle, its darker than I expected, with very little head. Aroma is subtle malt, color is dark amber, darker than other maibocks that I have tried. Dry after taste, medium carbonation. Very drinkable.

On tap at the Pine Room Tavern. A deep gold-orange pour. This is really good. A mild hoppy aroma. A very balanced beer, but a lot going on.

Láhev 355 ml. Aroma je velmi výrazně znát po zrajícím sýru, Pěna je jasně bílá jemná, nízká a mizící. barva samotného piva je opálová a jemně kalná. Chuť má nádech zkvaeného pomeranče na ořechovém podkladu, fini je výrazněji hořký a drící. V ústech pivo působí vcelku mohutně, má slabí říz a je hůře pitelné. IPA se vskutku lahodným aroma a robustní chutí.

330ml bottle. Clear dark amber color. Small size, yellow head, stays. Hops, sweet, malts, candy in aroma. Sweet, malts, hops, grainy, faint alcohol, mango in taste. Sweet and sticky body. Medium dry bitterness in aftertaste.

Nothing wrong here but not spectacular. Dont get me wrong, I would gladly accept one everyday and even pound a few but I aint searching it out. Copper cutey with malty muscles that it likes to flex. Some light smoke, earth, peat, resin and floral flave. Dangerously "everyday".

A nice gold copper color. It has a mild almost sweet starts which finishes smokey. It is really easy drinking and could see myself drinking many on a hot afternoon.
