Smells of nutty malt and some hop. Tastes of bitter hop but not much else, crisp with good carbonation, slightly sudsy. Very drinkable.

22 FL. OZ ($6.99) First Rogue Ive tried... I hope that the others are better... this was an orange taste beer and its had a bit of that but over all it just tasted like spoiled orange juice. A serious case of 2 great things combined to make them not as good as they were apart. got for Hangar 24 Orange Wheat over this... well if you can find it.

Copper hue with white head, smells of floral notes. Taste is slightly bitter with floral notes, citrus and caramel. Pairs well with BBQ.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a copper color with a white foam head. Aroma is very slight, with hints of hoppy citrus. Flavor has some citrus, some hops, caramel, and I think I detected some banana in there. Has a decent amount of carbonation. Body feel is light to medium. This is okay. A little light on flavor and aroma, but still enjoyable.

650ml bottle. Clear amber with a frothy off-white head. Flavors are cereals, wet grass, biscuit, honey, caramel and citrus with herbal and floral notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Transfer from BA reviewed 1-14-12 - 
Poured from bottle into pint glass

Appearance A nice orange color with a billowy head upon pouring. The head slowly fads leaving a small it of lacing.

Smell - Some malty/bready aroma first meets the nose. Caramel sweetness then comes on with the slightest bit of orange citrus coming through.

Taste - It matches the smell, but takes it up a notch from what would be expected. A nice malty flavor first hits your flavor. Sorta bready. Then comes a bit of sweetness of caramel, which is followed by some citrus hoppiness. Nice transitions.

Mouthfeel - A good level of carbonation with a medium and smooth body. 

Overall - A good beer. Balances flavor, mouthfeel and smell nicely.

12oz bottle from Winslows in G-Vegas. Orange hue, hazy clarity with fully lasting frothy white head. Excellent lacing. Citrus, malt, sour milk, floral and light fruit aromas. Floral and lemon taste up front with a long medium malt finish. Watery on the palate lively carbonation. The appearance was the best part of this beer.
Nice smooth ale. Drank on big bottle. Could be better though. I would prefer stronger taste. More bitter
Copper color with light head. Very simple, balanced flavor with some caramel. A great tasting beer.
12 fl oz bottle. Pours a clear amber colour with a small white head. Aroma is malty with some caramel. Flavor is sweet with malty caramel notes. texture is oily. Good but not great.
Bottle. Pours a dark golden with thin white head. Very malty aroma. Taste is nice and soft, very nicely balanced. Malty, some honey for sweetness, and a pleasant aftertaste. Lovely smooth beer.
This beer doesnt really do anything for me. Its by no means bad, but theres nothing exciting about it to make me order it again if theres something else on the menu which seems interesting.
This is an excellent drink. I like to get one at my favorite pizzeria to drink before my pizza arrives.
Yum...poured from bomber...great hops and malt balance....taste is great ....smell is average....this one is a winner!

Poured from 12 oz. bottle at McGlynns Pub in Dover, DE. 

Clear, bright amber with a 2-finger antique ivory head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of toast, caramel, and a hint of light fruit and floral hops. 

Taste of toffee, orange, toast, biscuit, light fruit and mild earthy hops. 

Medium body and medium carbonation.

A - is dark brown but clear
A - toasted malt with slight piney and dank

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2014 Cervesa molt acaramelada, però amb un petit toc amarg molt ben equilibrat.
Cerveza muy acaramelada, pero con un pequeño toque amargo muy bien equilibrado.
Bottle. Caramelized malts intermingle with herbal notes extracted from hops. Totally not my style, but, appreciative of the brewers skill, I stay ambiguous about this one...

Malty aroma, hints of caramel. Thin white head, light honey color. Mostly sweet, honey and caramel, tea, light citrus, like spice. Medium sour finish. Creamy and syrupy. My first experience with Rogue, promising start. This beer is surprisingly sweet, reminds me of Mexican malty beers. Very good taste but something in the mix is slightly off, this restricts it from a certain satisfying quality, but just barely.

While Im not usually one super sweet beers, theres something about Dead Guy that I like. Its pretty sweet up front, with hints of honey and caramel and has a bit of a syrup like consistency, but it seems well balanced. I enjoy the way it finishes, it has a bit more of sour note that I really like.

Bottle. Pours a reddish amber with a large, yellowish-brown head. Pretty nice. Aroma is a lot of caramel, semi-sweet, a lot of honey, some grain. Somewhat barleywine like. Taste is semi-sweet again with honey, caramel, some grain, grass and light herbal note. Very rich in flavor. Light spiciness as well as some fruitiness of the citric kind. Medium with quite a bit of carbonation. Really nice.

Have I really never rated this? Wel. Thanks to company outing now i will. Pours orange amber with nice head. Nose is light malts and yeast. Tastes of malt, yeast, bitter hops, some caramel. Straight forward but tasty ale.

dark amber, thin white ring, no lacing. Meaty orange and earth nose, murky tea with some burnt caramel. Burnt marshmallow flavor up front, thin watery mid with light orange, faintly papery oxidation and orange in the sugary finish.

Pours orange with an insubstantial ringed-white head.
Aroma is soft and light fruit, sweet ,sugary. Some honey, toast and caramel.
Palate is oily, syrup-like. Very sweet on the front palate, honey, with some caramel malt creeping through. Noble-hop spicyness also prevalent. The dry medium bitter-finish offsets some of the cloying nature. What initially starts as a refreshing drink, quickly becomes sickly.
Poured from bottle. Clean orange. Nose is mild malt and thrashed hay. Taste follows with nice hop backing.

Half gallon growler from the liquor store. Pours clear amber with an orange tinge, small white head that quickly is gone and leaves little lacing. Aroma is toasted grain (almost like corn), honey, brown sugar, pear, and apple...pretty nice. Taste is medium sweet, mild to medium bitter, fruity with some caramel sweetness and a nice bitter bite at the end. Medium body, slick, watery texture, soft carbonation, and bitter finish. It seems like a cross between a German Oktoberfest and a British Pale Ale more than a Maibock. Its OK but I dont think I will revisit this one, too watery, bitter, and generic tasting.

Pours a yellow/orange color. Cant really decipher the aroma, has some metallic in it. The taste is sweet, caramel, syrup and honey, complemented by hops and warming the throat. Unusual taste, but its pleasant alright.
Pour is light orange with a medium white head. Aroma and flavor of spice, caramel, honey, biscuit, and tart fruit. Finish has a bit of booze and more fruit sweetness.

Aroma: citrus, floral; Appearance: hazy orange, foamy head; Taste: medium bitterness, slight sweetness, slight sourness; Palate: astringent finish, medium carbonation, medium body, thick texture

Well-rounded ale with much delight.
Bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig süß, fruchtig malzig, Karamell. Geschmack sehr malzig süß, fruchtig, Karamell.

Pours a half finger of head on a clear dark straw colored body.
The aroma is bright orange and tangerine with a little caramel.
The taste is a hardy malt caramel with a slightly sweet pine finish.
The texture is fizzy, a bit too much.
An enjoyable beer.Earlier Rating: 8/7/2013 Total Score: 3.9Poured two fingers of head on a mostly clear, medium straw colored body.
The aroma is quite "grainy." Like sticking your nose into a grain silo. Theres a little lemon in the background though.
The taste is wonderful, great balance. It has a big dose of bitterness upfront, then a big malt bill comes through. Finishes clean.
The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation.
Enjoyable.

Bottle LCBO: Orange glow with nice tight beige head. Malt, toffee, and biscuits in the nose. Tastes malty and yeasty with some mild hop content. Soapy mouthfeel and highly quaffable despite the higher alcohol content. Balanced bittersweet finish. Very good then.

Bottle.
Appearance: Light haze with a copper body. Creamy light tan head.
Aroma: Malty like a doppelbock. Caramel and brown sugar, very malty and complex. Hard to really pinpoint the flavors.
Taste: Malty through and through. Caramel to brown sugar throughout.
Palate: Medium bodied, moderately carbonated.
Overall: I dont see the fuss about this. Its not bad and I see why its a gateway beer, but there are so much more, like Troegenator.
Draft. Pours a deep amber. Sweet aroma of malts and toffee. Taste is sweet with some mild hops. Prefer other Rogues but this is pretty good.

Amber, clear, tall but quickly fading head, little lace. 
Yeasty, earthy nose. 
Medium body, clean mouthfeel, simple and moderate flavor profile. 
Balanced bitter-sweet character. 
Malty, earthy, yeasty, hint of hop, pp in the finish.
Good, within the style, which is not mine. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep gold pour, thin off white head. Not much on the nose except caramel/malt. Taste - sweet, malty, a little bitterness but mostly just caramel goodness, goes down very easy

355ml Bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£3.50):
Hoppy at first with some caramel and toffee notes coming through along with some burst of citrus and faint pine. There is a malt base that is a semi-sweet one and I could detect bread and sweet fruits and yeast too.

Copper amber colour with a half-centimetre tall, foamy head that is a very slightly off-white colour and settles as a thick lacing on the top that covers the entire surface.

Pine hops and some citrus kick things off along with some caramel malts and a floral taste that is a little hoppy and hints at some bitterness. There is some sweetness and bread with a few fruits as well, notably some apple.

Medium bodied, a fairly good balance and medium carbonation as well, this beer is smooth with a dry and bitter tang from the citrus and some sweetness throughout along with a crisp finish.

An interesting one, almost seems like an American pale ale & definitely an unusual take on the Maibock style with the beer growing on you as you work your way down the glass. A good beer but I imagine this will be a one off for me and I wont be trying to pick it up again.

12 oz. bottle poured into shaker. Hazy honey color with a modest foamy cream head that reduces to a slick in a few moments. Carbonation is slight but persistent leaving minimal lacing. Slight aroma of caramel malt with some light floral notes. Flavor is malt forward with honey sweetness giving way to a spicy middle and some welcome bitterness in the finish.
A really tasty malty brew. Goes down smooth. Deceptively strong. Lots of malt and a beautiful amber pour. Could session this all day.
Draft. Pours a deep amber. Sweet aroma of malts and toffee. Taste is sweet with some mild hops.
Orange colour, white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, honey. Taste is Light sweet, candy sugar flavour. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Very nice and interesting.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a semi transparent amber with a ring off cream colored head. Aroma of slightly hops and bread. Taste of hops.
Medium dark copperish / amber color pour thats hard to describe. Nose & taste are hops, fermented fruit & bread. Excellent beer from an excellent & one of my favorite breweries.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark golden beer with a small white head on top. Aroma is malty, chocolate and light grassy hops. Flavor is bittersweet, touches of white chocolate and earthy hops. Chocolate and caramel shine in the aftertaste. Medium sweet and bitter. Nice beer, nice take on the style.

355 ml bottle
Appearance: Pours clear dark yellow allmost orange with white head. Retention could be better. Leaving light lacin.
Aroma: Caramelised malts, citrus hops, some caramelisde hops.
Taste: Sweet caramelised malts with some light hops. With some light spices.Finish shows slightly more bitter notes. But still overall sweet and very easy to drink 
Soft carbonation, medium body.

Barwa: głęboko bursztynowa, piana znikoma, bardzo szybko znikająca, wysycenie nieskie.

Aromat: raczej nie porywający - słodowo karmelowy.

Smak: słodycz z chmielową kontrą. Goryczka niemal mietowa oraz nuta alkoholowa na końcu. 

Dość interesujące piwo, jak na jasne ale czy też koźlaka. Pod tym kątem smak wręcz zaskakująco dobry, a samo piwo pijalne.

The aroma is mild hop scent. It has an amber, orange, color with minimum head. A light bitter taste with medium body. This ale has a combination bitter and astringent finish. I would be interested in their other products.
Killer beer. Super well balance, awesome sweet malty aromas with an amazingly balanced sweet malty taste. Awesome beer.

Good beer. Rusty amber color when it pours. Smells sweet with a bit of hops with it but nothing overpowering. It has a sweet maltyness to it. The hops are there on the palate but just enough to notice. Good overall beer

33 cl, flaske, 6,6 % ABV, købt i Ølbutikken på Istedgade på Vesterbro, 21. marts 2014. 
Ravfarvet ufiltreret amerikansk Bock med tysk inspiration. 1 1/2 cm offwhite skumtop.
Duft af humle og appelsin. Malt. Nåletræ. 
Smagen er humlet, som i en genuine American Pale Ale, dog med en anelse mere sødme. God humlesmag og god balance mellem sødme og bitterhed. God, rund og blød eftersmag. 
Dejlig mundfølelse med lettere nedjusteret kuldioxid. 
Og helt igennem fedt design med etiketten.
Hvis øl er sådan, når man engang er blevet en "dead guy", er der intet at frygte - More!
Tap, a hazy amber with a small white head. Tastes of bread, caramel, and some fruit notes with a little bit of bitterness. Nice beer.

355ml. Bottle. 
Pours clear yellow/orange with white head. 
Aroma malts, spicy hops, some caramel. 
Taste nice malty sweets, some spicy bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Good beer!.
Koper van kleur met een zoetige geur. De smaak is prima, alleen wat simpel. Prima bier.

aroma has malts, caramel and some spicy hops... bitter sweet taste and a bitter malty finish... dry bodied, soft but persistant carbs... nice color and head.. ok bitter-ale, refreshing but a bit boring
Pours dark gold with an off white head. Aromas of malt and honey. Flavor has a mix of sweet and bitter.

Bottle. Pours a dark golden with 1 1/2 off white head. Smells sweet with dominant malt. Tastes good! Sweet honey covered biscuit. Palate is a medium with not too much carbonation. I definitely would drink it again!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(bottle) bright reddish amber colour with a small white head; aroma of stewed fruit; balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish
Nice malty aroma. Very nice malty taste. Not bitter. No aftertaste. Very nice beer. Recommend

It has a malty aroma with a touch of honey. There are other sweet aromas as well. It is amber in color with a fluffy head that contain mostly compact small bubbles. It has a complex taste that tastes of malts but later touches off sweet notes.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2014 Tap: Deep amber, nearly brown, capped with a tiny, flimsy off-white head that leaves small traces of lacing behind. Aroma is a somewhat bland mix of spicy hops, light caramel/toffee malts, & a touch of woodsy, nutty undertones. Pretty laid back, not much going on. Flavor is malt heavy, lots of toffee, caramel, & toasted biscuit up front with a big, yeasty back-end. Light spats of spicy, grass-like, bittering hops linger into the toasted nutty finish. Decent beer, nothing to rave over, but certainly not bad.
Backlog. Tried bottled @ Nya Tröls. Caramel is dominant with a spice from herbs and loads of floral hop-aromas, a hint of sweetness.

Hazy, deep golden, smaller off-white head with a little lace, sweetish bisquity to bready nose, some well hidden herbal hops in the background; almost solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium to full bodied; sweet caramelly and bisquity finish with a tart-hoppy aftertaste and a tinge of alcohol. A chunky Bock, a bit too sweet,
Bottle. Nice honey/amber color, but head is minimal. Aroma of caramel and floral. Quite sweet but with bitterness. Something like bock but floral accents made this beer interesting.

Cloudy amber/gold color with small head, dissapear quickly. Aroma: floral, malts, sweet fruits, bread, caramel, hops. Taste is sweet with a tiny bitterness in the finish. Bread, caramel, floral, sweet fruits, apple. Medium body with medium/low carbonation. Good, easy drinking beer. More like a British versions of IPA than Bock.

On tap at Delirium Hoppy Loft. 
Nose: intensely malty, biscuits. Taste: very sweet and malty, overripe fruits. Not bad, just but not my cup of tea.

Bottle. Pours cloudy orangish amber with huge foamy tan head. Aroma is toasted malt, caramel and yeast. Taste is very sweet with tart finish with an spicy alcohol bite. Body is medium with soft carbonation. Not my favorite style.

Clear golden amber pour with small off white head. Aroma of malts, bread, caramel and slightly floral. Taste of malts, caramel, bread, slightly fruity and faint hops. Full bodied, medium carbonation, slightly cloying. Good beer.

Bärnstensfärgad med liten smutsgul krona. Fyllig med något återhållsam doft. Smaken är kraftfull med stor kropp. Smakinslag av russin och lite mörk choklad. Lite låg kolsyrenivå i övrigt en trevlig öl.

Bottle: Hazy, deep golden, smaller off-white head with a little lace, sweetish bisquity to bready nose, some well hidden herbal hops in the background; almost solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium to full bodied; sweet caramelly and bisquity finish with a tart-hoppy aftertaste and a tinge of alcohol. A chunky Bock, a bit too sweet, a bit too alcoholic
The taste is unlike the typical high caliber IPA and It does not strike my fancy. It's not bitter but the sweetness undermines the effect.
TAsty as hell. First craft beer that I enjoyed and still enjoy it to this day.

0,355L bottle (shared by suurjuust, thanks!). Pours very slightly hazy amber with white head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma: intense sweetness, malt, floral, and caramel. Taste: very sweet, caramel, fruity, grapefruit bitterness, noticeable alcohol, and also little bit watery. Overall: good, but a little bit too sweet for me.
Hazy amber colour. Pleasant malty aroma and flavour. Also a touch of hop too. Has a fresh, sharp edge and a touch of spicy yeast in the finish which seperates it from the typical US Pale Ale.
Pours golden with two fingers of fine, white head. Smells of malt which is also predominant in taste with light hops. Very good.

On tap @ Beer Temple (had this before - years ago). Clear light amber/copper color. Steady, rocky off white head with good lacing. Aromas: sweet malts, fruit-sweets, caramel malts, bready malts. Flavor is moderate sweet with hints of bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes with a delicate bitterness, slightly dry. No spectacular but solid.

Flaska på Bishops Arms, Sundbyberg. 
Grumlig bärnsten. 
Doftar pepprigt och saltlakrits. 
Smakar ganska trist tycker jag, tråkig beska som ligger kvar en stund.
Tap från Bishops arms Sundbyberg. Klar bärnstensfärgad vätska med lågt ljust skum. Söt inbjudande doft. Pepprig humlig smak utan direkt beska.

Decent aroma and upfront taste seems like something could be happening. But then nothing really does. Has a slight nice drinkable honey hop flavor. But any good flavor goes out the window quick. Drinkable brew but not the best.

Great beer, reminds me of an amber. The yeast shines. very well balanced easy drinking, but little in the way of aroma, didnt pour as well as it could have, hence lacked head and retention of it. Overall a good beer I would definitely re-visit.

Slightly hazy amber, off-white head. Nose is caramel, malt, hints of diacetyl. Taste is caramel, hops,sweetness, pine, grapefruit. Semi-dry finish, lingering herbal bitterness. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation, smooth texture. Pretty easy drinkin bock.

Pours a very nice hazy deep dark amber with minimal white head. Has the aroma of caramel, molasses, slight hoppiness. Very smooth taste. Medium bodied. Has the flavor of hops, caramel, malt, molasses, and a belt like flavor. Very nice.
bread, caramel, resin, leather, alcohol, orange, hazy, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body,
A heller bock tick! 355 ml bottle. Nice light hazy amber pour. Aroma is sweet, earthy with malts and some light yeast. Quite nice taste with raisins, malts and biscuits.

Pours hazy amber with small white head. Aroma of caramel, bread crust, hay, grass with some fruitness. Taste is sweet at first, but then background fruitness and hop bitterness balance it. Medium-low carbonation. Nice, easy going, balanced beer.
Quite a simple one. Hay with straw, some grass, hops and even caramel. Drinkable, thick, warming. But not special in any way.

I expected something like an IPA and was little bit disappointed at first - but when seeing that it is supposed to be a Heller Bock everything went back to order and I was quite happy and satisfied. It pours out of the bottle in a deep amber colour with low head and medium body. Aroma of hops, citrus and straw. Taste of biscuits, butter, mild hops, malt, bread and flowers. Dry-bitter finish. Very easy and nice to drink with a high smoothness.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy amber with small off-white head. Clear aroma of hops, with notes of malt, citrus, and grass. Sweetish, malty flavour, with bitter, hoppy and citric notes, and touches of grass. Lingering, bitter aftertaste. Nice.
2014 - 02 - 17 355ml bottle. clear amber colour. medium, fading to small, off-white head. grass and leather in aroma. bitter-sweet taste. dry palate
Clear deep amber pour. Aroma is sweet malts and bit of grassy hops that's almost like apple juice. Taste is bitter up front then sweet honey malts with a slightly dry bitter finish.

Appearance with amber color, cloudy liquid medium head of foam. 
Hoppy and sweet aroma. 
In the mouth a strong sweetness is perceived, like ripe fruit. 
Hops are also well inserted.
Its a great beer!
Super malty, fairly sweet ale. Tastes good, refreshing. Texture is fairly chewy, smell is malty and not much else. Average.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance has a golden orange-brown color with a small white head that lasts several seconds and then disappears. There is some minimal lacing, slightly spotty and spreads out.
The smell has some caramel, malts and definite aromas of fruit with some slight hops in the background.
The taste has some sweet caramel notes with light fruit in the background.
On the palate, she sits about a medium, comes across fairly sessionable, but has a bland watery aftertaste and dry finish.
Overall, this is a decent tasting beer that Im unsure if I would have again as it just seems just a tad weird on the palate.
Draft. Clear, copper colored. Low carbonation. Nice, smooth flavor, with perfect bitterness.

Hazy deep amber with a creamy white head. Aroma of bready malt, caramel, tropical fruit, especially pine. Flavour is moderate malty/fruity sweetness with a nice bitter aftertaste. I enjoyed this one very much.
Bottle - Orangey Amber in colour. Hoppy; piney, resiny, oily hops. Fruity; citrus-orange. Malty; caramel, toffee, toasty malts. Moderately bitter hoppy throughout. Very drinkable. Decent.
Pretty good. A lot of hops and its very refreshing. A unique beer. Its very light bodied and a little boozy for how low alcohol it has, but overall a great beer.

Rood/Caramel met minimale witte kraag. In het aroma overheerst een caramel zoetigheid met daarnaast de mouten. De smaken zijn matig bitter, matig zoet, caramel, lage co2, medium body, afdronk bitter, wel een mooi helder maar verder niet zon bijzonder biertje

Botella y caña en el lúpulo. La primera en agosto de 2014.------ la caña en 31_01_2014 en el momento. Color marrón miel turbio con espuma blanca poco persistente. Cuerpo medio con 6.6 vol. bastante fácil de beber. Aromas maltosos y cereales con algo de uvas pasas. Sabores también bastante maltosos. No está mal, se podría repetir. 
08-02-2014 De nuevo con ella y el mismo barril. Aumento de los sabores maltosos, madera y dulce de frutas pasas con un amargo final bueno.
12oz bottle. Cooper color with one finger white head. Malty smell and taste. Not a big fan of this beer.
330 mml Bottle tasted on 07/02/2014. The colour is amber golden. The carbonation is very good and balanced. some bananas and some vanilla on the mouth. I like this Ale! Next one please!

12 floz bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Incredible sweet, luscious fruity aroma.. taste was both unique and invigorating, blending a curious swirl of caramel, grain, orange, citrus, malt and cereal, intense on the tongue with a deeply satisfying finish. Definitely my beer of the year so far.

Well Crivens. A Maibock. This is a little new to me, although I have probably had a heller-bock before. Yay!
Rich golden amber with just a faint haze and a pillowy cream coloured head. The aroma is toffeeish and sweet with emphasis on lighter caramels. Its a short description, but doesnt do the sheer loveliness justice. Just the one powerful snort of the aroma isnt enough. I gave my mother-in-law a sniff of this beer (and she is noted for not being a beer drinker) and she was impressed at the caramel and toffee aromas. A taste confirmed that she wasnt a beer drinker, but also that the aroma is the most enticing part for me also. It is a bit sweet with toffee (again) and caramalt. I suppose it is well within style in this area and there is no doubt it is well made. I found this grew on me, the longer it was in my mouth, as the actress said to the bishop.
Fruity and malt driven. A charming drop.

Slightly hazy amber with small white head. Honey, lightly roasted malts, lots of spices. Medium bodied, slightly thin feel. Medium carbonation. Sweet taste with biter finish. Ok stuff, not unlike Belgian dubbel.
Heldere koperen kleur met een aardige kraag. Ruikt caramel, gebrande mout, hop, kruiden. Smaakt zoet, caramel, iets bitter. Iets aan de te zoete kant.
Foamy white thick head, deep ale taste with some amber teasing.... Dry, light fruity and a nice subtile hop taste. Nice one!

Bottle
Aroma-yeast
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-lightly bitter, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, sour finish
Overall-interesting

Pours a burnt orange color with a thin white head, no lacing. Aroma is malty, with caramel and some toast, but also a little apple like citrus from the hops. Having a bit of a hard time identifying what tastes Im getting as they dont seem to match the aroma, making this beer a bit of a thinker. Sweet malt backbone with a nice dry finish, lingering hop flavors, but also a bit of roasty malt that last till the end. Nice mouthfeel, lively and bitter.
Bottle, aroma is light toasted sweetness with some pine resin hops. taste is well balanced with a light sweet finish, tasty

12oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. An aromatic combination of cantaloupe melon and toasted asiago cheese bagel jump out in strength. Some faint notes of white grapes, lemon, and some spice notes (coriander or clove maybe) can be drawn out there too. It pours a clear, syrupy orange liquid with a light, thin head that doesnt leave much lacing. Its a medium/medium-high syrupy sweet with a light, clean, balanced bitter & sourness filling in a secondary role as well as a bit of saltiness. The medium-full bodied beer is slick with an average amount of carbonation that keeps it texture on the thinner side. The asiago (maybe parmesan) cheese flavor is fairly prominent on the tongue too and is accompanied by honey notes and a bit of apricot-fruit flavors. Its very crisp with a resin feel in the mouth and finishes with white grapes and apricot. Grapefruit and pine hop flavors leave a light aftertaste.

Bel équilibre entre malts torréfiés aux notes caramélisées, mielleuses, sirupeuses et houblons dévoilant des notes de fruits (sucrés): raisins secs, orange confite et légères notes de fraises. Le tout relativement discret, peu expressif (difficile de puiser les arômes) à cause dune mousse peu généreuse, qui retombre rapidement. Cest une bière de fermentation haute, une ale - qui rappelle dans le houblonnage une IPA - et non une bock selon moi...Bière dapéro que je commanderai volontiers.

I drink this regularly but yet never bothered to read about it and didn't even realize it was a bock! But it has all the bock characteristics, tons of malt in the aroma and taste. Palate and appearance are awesome. A nice full bodied beer that is balanced very well.
Geruch weinartig, Trockenfrüchte. Süßmalziger Beginn, getreidig. Mitte Honig, Trockenfrüchte, klebt. Abgang malzig, schokoladig, bitter. Unrundes Bier. Nicht gut.

Deep amber with creamy white head. Aroma is caramel, honey, hoppy spice, and vanilla. Slick and sticky mouth feel with low carbonation. Aftertaste is dry, sweet caramel, spicy and floral hops, and lasting dry spicy alcohol. Overall: very enjoyable. Very nice hops in this one.
Ambel coloured. Aroma is wheat,bread,caramel. Tastes malty sweet,fruity. I really loved this one.

Just so so. Reminds me of my American wheat batch. A bit bitter without a lot of hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle in the Head of Steam, Durham. Pours a hazy amber colour. Quite sweet at first with lots of tropical fruit flavour, especially pineapple and grapefruit. Some caramel too. Very fruity. Nice.

This is one of those beers that must have blown the minds of people when it was new, but its so prevalent now that its like Sam Adams, you take it for granted if its on tap or on the bottle list of a bar. For most beer lovers, this is not going to blow your mind, but it is a nice session beer with very nice and smooth caramel malt flavor with some resin northwest hops. Nice
Draft. Copper/Amber with thin off white head. Aroma of spicy hops, caramel, and honey. Medium body with some sweetness and hop bitterness upfront with notes of honey and malt.
Draft pours gold with red hues and a thin white head. Aroma of wheat, honey, floral, caramel and hints of fruit. Taste is malty, floral, honey. Sweet on the front with a slightly bitter finish.

12oz bottle - pours a transparent medium amber . Some caramel and bready aromas . Taste is a bit yeasty with some malty sweetness . Ok , probably won't have a second . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark amber with some head, but dissipates after a while. Aroma is spicy, malty and caramel. Body is slightly sweet with more caramel and some spicyness. Aftertaste leaves some alcohol and ends in a drier more bitter, hoppy flavour. Generally well balanced, drinkable and enjoyable.
Pours a clear copper-golden color with no head. Fair fruity and biscuit aromas. Wet, smooth texture that becomes lightly scrubby at 2/3 palate. Light apricot fruitiness and cracker flavor. Nice beer.

A light, IPAesque beverage that is deceivingly strong. A great session beer with a light balance of hops & sugar. 

Rated by BrewTom

Bottle. Gold/amber colour with a finger of well retained cream coloured head along with heavy lacing. Gentle aromas of yeasty bread with just a hint of citrus flower. Immediate caramel and toast flavours with a hint of orange. A considerable bitterness for the style follows, which goes deep into the palate with a hint of pine. A rich malty mouthfeel, yet there is a long, delicate balance with the hops which means they do not take over, but complement. Delicious beer.

On tap @ T Phillips Monrovia because somehow I havent rated this yet. Copper pour with a finger of white head. Caramel, toast, and slight spicy hops. A bit of orange and apple. Flavor is quite sweet and malty. Kind of one note. Just a bunch of caramel malt. Toast, toffee, spicy hops, and apple. Light orange notes as well. Not as enjoyable as it was a number of years ago when I first tried it, but not terrible.
Ég fíla hvað hann er með mjúka áferð en allt annað er frekar pedestrian, svo ég sletti. Smakkað af krana á sunnudagseftirmiðdegi, jólaljósin enn á Hlemmi.
Bottle. Aroma of caramel malts with hints of dough and yeast. Taste is smooth and malty, with caramel and ending with spice. No bitterness present. A bit too spicy. I will try it again. N

Pours a slightly cloudy honey colour, with a thin white lively head. Aroma notes include banana, cream, honey, slight floral, bready malts, otherwise quite muted. Tasting notes include banana, esters, slight bitterness, "clean" taste, and a smooth caramel finish. This is an excellent heller!!
Bottle. Pours clear amber with a white head. Aroma is caramel, some hops, pine, floral and toffee. Taste is moderate bitter and moderate sweet. Medium bodied.
Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Orange colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Long moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Very nice.

Poured from 650mL bottle. Clear, light orangey yellow with white head. Caramel malt aroma. Flavour is malt and cereal, some light hops. Starts with mild sweetness, ends with mild bitterness, medium body. Nice balance, but nothing stands out. Very easy drinking, could have a lot in one sitting.

Poured a hazy pale orangey amber colour with a two-finger of-white foamy head that diminished fairly quickly to a small collar. Laced OK as curtains. Carbonation very high with medium to large bubbles streaming. Aroma subtly of musty malt - not much; tending towards a larger aroma more so than an ale. Taste initially of sweet malts followed by moderate hops bitterness. Light body. Crisp, clean ,dry and slightly bitter finish.

i have had this beer many times in the past ,, I liked it then and I like it now,,,,, very creamy , caramel, cereal, toast, floral, grass, citrus, dough, cheese, golden, amber, hazy, rocky head, frothy, white foam, tan foam, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, fizzy, lively,
Amber with little to no head or lacing. Grainy tasting with some hop profile. Moderate carbonation but overall kinda bland.

strong complexity but not overwhelming, still relatively light. Deep grain profile but not bitter. Nicely hopped. Subtlely beautiful color. Or maybe Im just jaded by how expensive it normally is...;) Tastes like straw, in a good way.
Always a great ale, reminds me of an English Ale, malty aroma with some fresh hops, hazy amber color, easy to drink with a nice bitter finish
I'm glad I finally tried this beer as it's just plain GOOD. It's flavorful enough to keep me interested and easy drinking to boot.

Rogue Dead Guy Ale is great, drinkable beer, but I dont really get the official descriptions and the other ratings from my experience. Aroma is fresh hops and pronounced like an IPA. The color is light amber and head retains pretty nicely although it dissipates as it gets lower in the glass. Taste is well-balanced with quite a bit of hop character -- somewhere between a pale and an IPA. Finish is gradual without a lot of bitterness. The Dead Guy I had doesnt seem like the same beer everyone else had and doesnt see to fit the profile of a Heller Bock, but I thoroughly enjoyed it!

Maltata in mondo elegante e impeccabile. Aroma e gusto combattuti tra sentori fruttati e note caramellate, forse solo un po più forti nel gusto. Leggeri sentori di lievito. Quando mi dicono che è una bock, non ci credo. Rogue è sempre in grado di meravigliare.

pours a copper color that is slightly hazy. there is a thick creamy white head that left a lot of lacing around the glass. the aroma ripe fruits, sugar, grainy. the taste is amazing with this beer. there is some breadiness up front and slightly sweet. in the middle you pick up the hop bitterness but its faint. the beer finishes very nice leaving a sweet caramel aftertaste. i highly recommend you try this beer.
12oz. Pours clean amber with a white ring. Not quite a rad and not lacing. Aromas of fruit, caramel, and bread. Sweet fruit, dough, citrusy hops, and a clean finish. Easy drinking and enjoyable
Reminds me of an English bitter more then a heller bock. Not a bad beer, quite balanced on the caramel malts side. Not too bitter, but quite ok. Not very special, just a well made beer.
Bottle @ home. Aroma is fruity hops, some yeasty notes, more fruits, faint caramel. Flavour is caramel, fruits, raisin, some yeast, liquorice. Nice.
Pours a light amber color with a white head that sticks around and causes lacing, smells of malts, bread and caramel. Taste is a bit sweet and encompasses most of the nose.

Ambrée. Beau collet. Très légèrement voilé. Nez: mielleux. Biscuit. Fruité. Orange. Légèrement florale. Un peu d'épice. Gingembre. Café crème. Bouche: ronde. Malté. Biscuit gingembre. Crémeuse. Orange confite. Légèrement banane. Mielleuse. Noisette. Belle amertume qui coupe le sucre en finale. Ça coche.
Cerveza dulce, con sabor a nueces y un pequeño toque de chocolate, color ambar, poca espuma

Copper pour with a thumbs worth of head. Good lace retention. Malty aroma, caramel, dark bread, some pine in there as well. Caramel, nuts, cereal, bread with some pine hoppiness in the background. Medium body.
Poured from a bottle. Had a nice malt flavor of caramel, not sweet. No bitterness. This was very smooth and easy to drink.
Interestingly unique and odd flavor, great vibrant reddish brown color. Smooth and not overly bubbly for my taste.

On tap at zombie burger in des Moines, Iowa. Aroma of caramel malts with hints of dough and yeast. Taste is smooth and malty, with caramel and ending with spice. No bitterness present. Smooth on the palate, easy to drink.
Refreshing and complex, a rare combo. Flavors ranging from floral hops and citrus peel, to caramel and sugar. Hints of pine and lime. Solid hop presence. Very crisp.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2015 Rogues Dead Guy Ale is a true craft beer staple. With flavor like this, I can see why. It has a dark blond color and a floral aroma. The taste is smooth, crisp malt with a clean and abrupt hoppy finish. This is the kind of beer that just doesnt get old. Can I just say that Dead Guy Ale is an awesome name, too? Alright then, Ill say it.
I thought this beer was a bit flat. There is some flavor of malt, fruits and hops, but its all too modest.

Had this on tap. Poured dark reddish in color with light head. Had a nice aroma, maybe ginger or something herbal. Taste was spicy and bitter with maybe a hint of sour. Light carbonation with a bitter finish. This was recommended to me but was somewhat disappointing.

Draft at the Barn. Pours clear medium copper brown with a thin white head. Tastes like smooth mild hops with some caramel, nuts, mild citrus and pine, creaminess, and malt. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like malt, caramel, some orange, and some resin.

Tap. Pours clear copper with fizzy off-white head. Aroma is cereal and toasted malts, caramel, dates, raisins, and faint floral hops. Flavor is dry toasted malts, light caramel and dark fruit sweetness, and medium hop bitterness; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Pours honey brown with a foamy white head that dissipated quickly. Good lacing. Nose is malty with hints of honey and apple. Taste is mildly sweet, with a faint hint of subtle bitterness in the aftertaste. Full bodied brew. Mild carbonation. Good, solid brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Pours a copper apricot ale with brilliant clarity. Single finger head of loose off-peanut foam dissipates to thin sheet of the same. Spotty lacing.

S: Sweet malts with earthy hops. Nice, and forgettable.

T: Tastes like a helles. Sweet backbone, earth hops. Not too much to say here. A little too much residual sugar for me.

M: Medium body, smooth feel with light carbonation. Leaves a wetness in the mouth.

O: well done. Great for a flagship, can see why so many people drink this on a regular basis.

Serving type: bottle

04-04-2011
On tap. The nose has subtle notes of floral Noble hops, straw, and cereal. Lively mouthfeel. The taste is lightly bitter, with some hops and barley coming into play.
5/5/2011. From bottle. Light amber color with a tan head. Sweet malty aromas with honey and spice. Light hoppy finish. Not bad at all.
This is a great ale that I have been drinking for years. It has never disappointed me.

Sandy head and nice lacing. For a dead guys beer this thing is pretty lively. Some spice on the taste and rich honey malt character. The hops linger long after the sip has gone down and are earthy in flavour.
Amber pour with thin off white head. Nose is faintly hoppy. Well balanced amber. Not too sweet. a little toasty. bittersweet finish. Easy drinking and inoffensive.
Buona birra inserire stile bock, di facile beva. Al naso ha un buon profumo erbaceo e resinoso mentre in bocca predominano i sapori del malto.

Bottle (22 oz). From TheJester, thanks! Clear bright golden/orange with a medium fully lasting white head and good lacing. Aroma is of light sweetness, cereals, floral notes and light fruitiness. Taste is about the same with the toasted cereals and a light bitter finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium body. Good carbonation. Decent Bock. Drinkable.
Shared with Rock_Buffalo and Shark_Pants. An enjoyable brew with sweet flavors that linger and dabble on the palate. Becomes noticeably more appreciative as the pour is allowed to warm.

Django with my boyz, mike, Matt, and Jammer. Good beer, ya!  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bread, dough, amber, clear, white foam, long lasting foam lightly bitter, medium sweetness, normally I dont like sweet beer, but this balanced sweetness I love.

Ret meget karamel, lidt humle og lidt ristet malt i duften.
Ravfarvet.
Meget varm og sød men balanceret af humle. Smag af karamel, lidt nød og choko. Dejlig rund.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 26, 2014 A complex and enjoyable brew, featuring a wide range of flavors from citrus to herbal hops and strong sweet malt with fruit notes. Smooth with a pleasant bitter and tangy bite. The finish definitely is bock-ish. Nice mix of German and Pacific hops. Also has appetizing strong aroma with same flavors. Hazy amber appearance. The flavor profile is great, my only criticism is that the flavor could perhaps be stronger. That being said, this is definitely one of my new favorites.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy

Odeur clean et rafraichissante de céréals, de miel et de houblons traditionelles. 
Une bouche pure, céréale, caramel avec une final légérement sucrée.
Une excellente bière puissante et clean à la fois.

Subtle flavours initially build to a strong taste with impressive longevity. Best served after rested to warm up.

Frangimus

Shared by Rock_Buffalo, thanks! Aroma is caramel, toffee & light citrus. Taste is honey, caramel, banana, grapefruit and tangerine. Really good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells like a nice beer. Non homogenous appearance throughout. Darker in the middle. Taste is complex but bitter. Palate similarly complex but a difficult finish. I found this beer in a 750 mL bottle at my local Costco. Good beer to give as a gift for sharing and celebration. Would not drink a whole bottle in one sitting myself.

(Bottle): Pours a hazy dark-ish amber with an off white head. Aroma of bread, caramel, rich sweet malt, honey. Flavour is really rich sweet malt, caramel, bread, honey, hoppy, slightly yeasty. I love the flavours going on in this beer, perfect for a cold night.

Growler pour, courtesy of Greg. Pours a murky amber with thin beige head and some spotted lace. Nose of caramel, honey, cardboard, dark fruit. Medium body, really hot for 6.6%, mild bitterness on the finish. Havent had this in years but remember it being better.

Pours honey with a moderate off-white head that disappates quickly to a rim. Aroma is bread and slightly roasted caramel malt with a hint of honey. Taste is only slightly sweet malt upfront and well-balanced into a slightly boozy, quite well-hopped and bitter finish. Very crisp and alive mouthfeel. Notes of caramel, honey, citrus in the taste as well. This beer is growing one and I could easily drink more than one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kaatuu SOPP-lasiin punertavan ruskeana ja melko sameana, vaahdon ollessa noin 3,5 sormen paksuinen ja melko paksu. Hajussa vahvimpana on pähkinäistä maltaisuutta, johon yhdistyy lähes yhtä vahvaa toffeemaisuutta ja heikompaa puumaisuutta. Maussa on melkoinen sekamelska pähkinää ja toffeeta. Karheaa puumaisuutta ja hedelmää on jonkin verran joukossa. Suutuntuma on hieman karhean humaloitu, mutta loppuu hieman kesken humaloinnin jäädessä suuhun. Melko erilainen bock, jossa ei viljaisesta maltaisuudesta ole tietoakaan, vaan tämä on kuin brown alen ja english strong alen väliltä.
Pleasant copper color with mild aroma and light head. A tad too hoppy / bitter for me, but it still tastes pretty good. Pairs well with meats.

Bière ambrée, avec un nez houblonné, sur lorange, le caramel, un peu résineux. La bouche est légèrement amère, sur le caramel, un peu de miel, des agrumes. Finale de longueur moyenne. Probablement pas la meilleure version de la Brasserie Rogue, qui est capable de produire de vraies tueries.
Bottle from best market, NYC. lots nutmeg and pine. A bit malty in the nose. Mediocre alkaline taste. Abrupt palate. No much to say about this one really.
A good ale, with a strong hop presence, this ale is light amber, with a good head. It is medium bodied and has a good malt taste, but it is dominated by the hops. Overall, a good ale.

Poured from the bottle a copper color with full white head. Good lacing. Malty aroma. Flavor is a balanced sweetness and bitterness, but not too much of either. Pleasant. Medium mouthfeel with good carbonation. Bitter finish. This is easy to drink.

Well this one was a very pleasant experience to have with a crispy skin roast chicken and I could imagine it would be beautiful with a nice spicy curry. It is a very malty ale in both aroma and taste, the after taste is a lingering sweetness and a slight bitterness. Unfortunately the head of the beer is small and does not last long but still a very tasty offering from Rogue.

Fra fad. Tåget rødbrun bryg med en lille gullig skumkrone. Heftigt næse. Sød malt i spandevis. Abrikos. Brød. Nødder. Kiks. Ligeså voldsom og fyldig i munden. Sær og hård at drikke, men ok på sin egen måde.
Depuis le temps que Rogue me tentait... Pas du tout déçu par celle-ci. Très bon équilibre, belle ambrée avec des notes de caramel. Puissance juste.
Aroma is full of caramel sweetness and malts with some wheat sweetness. Taste is medium sweet with malts, some bread and yeast. Lively, sweet brew.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy amber with nice white head. Lacing present on glass. Fairly strong aroma of bread, caramel and toffee with some moderate spicey and earthy notes. Taste is definitely sweet to start with caramel and toffee. Some mild to moderate bitterness creeps in but not too much. Actually a very nice balance to the sweetness. Medium bodied overall. Great beer overall that actually is pretty sessionable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml bottle. hazy amber with thin head. aroma of malts and caramel. sweet taste with malts and caramel with hints of hops.

Bottle. Light amber hazy appearance with foamy beige head, doughy aroma, sweetish bread taste, low carbonation, sweet medium finish. I was disappointed with this brew, expecting a much more impressive beer.
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~
Pours out a light orange with no head at all and a bitter aroma. Flavor is fairly standard for this type of beer. Overall, its pretty good.
650 mil bottle from Dans at Ringwood sweet honey aroma nice amber colour malty sweet flavour pretty good

Bottle. Poured cool into warm glass. Lots of head that fell off in a couple minutes. Color is a nice medium amber. Amazing apple and pear aromas abound. Flavor is malty sweet with light to medium bitter finish. Well balanced. Huge fan of the PacMan yeast. Medium to full body. First time drinking this. No wonder its so popular.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours amber colored with a off white head. Taste malt, Carmel, sweet. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2014 Birra che ha addolcito il mio Halloween.
Si presenta, inizialmente, di un bel giallo oro, vivido, con una schiuma non troppo abbondante ma abbastanza persistente. Sebbene sia una birra primaverile, come stile, è comunque pensata proprio per il periodo di novembre, visto che si rifa al giorno dei morti inteso nella maniera Maya. Lodore che sprigiona è di pane, miele e anche di burro. Il sapore, inizialmente, è acidulo, con un retrogusto lieve ed amaro. Il finale è decisamente astringente, pulito e stilisticamente perfetto. Lintensa luppolatura si sente, ed il grande lavoro fatto da Rogue è percettibile. Una birra che ho adorato. ottimo lavoro, Rogue.
Nice caramel malty aroma. A little fruit. Big malty flavor with yeasty bread notes. Slightly sweet. Some hoppiness in the finish. A very nice beer. I enjoyed it.

650ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours a deep slightly hazy amber with a one finger off white head that clings to the glass. Nose is honey and bread with a bit of fruit. Malt sweetness dominates with some raisin, caramel and some spice. A bit of nice hop bitterness but that is definitely not the focus here. Medium slick body with lively carbonation and a rather short balanced finish. Quite nice but the sweetness is a bit cloying for every day consumption.

This one takes some getting used to but it improves with every sip. Starts with an orange and caramel flavor, finishes very clean but then blasts you with an intense Hoppy Aftertaste that quickly disappears.
12 oz bottle. Medium amber pour with a off-white head. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, and bread. Nice malty sweetness balanced by hoppy bitterness. Nothing too exciting.
On draft. Pours a caramel color with nice tan head. Aromas of malt, bread and caramel. Taste matches nose. nicely balanced with big sweet malt flavors. Very sessionable. Will drink again.

650ml bottle. Pours a crystal clear copper with a bubbly, one finger, khaki head that fades to nearly nothing fast. 
Aroma is noticeable and malty. Big notes of caramel, bread, and a hint of fruityness, dark fruits, and German hops.
Taste is malt forward but balanced with a good amount of hops. Caramel with a touch of earthyness, rasin, and a hint of spice.
Medium body and carbonation. Smooth texture creates that is a touch thin creates a very drinkable brew.
Overall nice. Malty but balanced very well. Big bready caramel flavour that is smooth and drinkable. Would buy again when Im in the mood. Cheers!

One of my all-time favorite Oregon beers. Pours a dark amber hue with a nice collar of frothy white foam. Aromas of carmel malt, spicy orange and a light pine/floral tease the nostrils. Carmel, vanilla, honey flavors with a slight hoppy bite lead to a very balanced finish. Great mouth feel- sip after sip after...

Keg at The Cluny. Pours clear dark amber with a good white head. Aromas of honey and orange. Taste has a honeyed sweetness and lingering spicy orange bitterness. Medium bodied, creamy texture, long finish. Nice.

From 750 ml bottle. Pours a clear burnished bronze with a one finger white head and moderate carbonation. Aromas of caramel, raisins, citrus and a touch of pine. Taste starts out with rich malty caramel flavours before a restrained orange zest-like bitterness emerges in the mid-palate. This slips away leaving some residual sweetness at the end. Moderate bodied with a lingering orange aftertaste. Like it.

Pours murky rust with average off-white head. Love the appearance. Nose is doughy malt with citrus undertones. Bready malt sweetness on the tongue with thick honey and fruit notes. Pleasantly sweet, but deserving of more bitterness. Smooth, nearly flat palate. Solid beer. Very drinkable.

Bottle bought from Y Delyn Wine Bar, Mold. Pours a dark amber colour with a quickly dissipating head. Disappointing appearance-wise, but makes up bigtime with the aroma and taste. Aroma is malt and caramel notes, with a little honey to boot. Plenty of malt in the taste, with caramel. Mildly hoppy but pleasantly sweet. Definitely my kind of ale!
Thin, light, not at all delicious or necessarily refreshing. Had the characteristics of an APA without the balls.

Pours a dark amber with small white head. Tastes of hops and spice and smells of malts

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler poured a murky orange hue w/ large light tan head and some lacing. Moderate doughy biscuit aroma. Initial flavor is a moderate sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish. Taste is caramel, honey, lemon, and bready malts. Medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel, and a long lasting copper taste in the finish.

355ml bottle. Clear dark amber colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white to ochre head. Caramel malty aroma, toffee notes, hoppy overtones. Taste has citrusy hoppy notes that mingle with the malt to orange and mandarine, additional hints of bitter almond; crisp, bitter hoppy finish. Superbly balanced, refreshing, seeming lightness makes it dangerously drinkable.

650ml bottle from DMs. Pours dark amber with large white head that lingers. Nose has honey, junipers, caramel, oranges and bready malts. Flavour is not as sweet as the nose would suggest with a well balanced fruity hop bitterness to the finish and a smooth crafted palate. Very drinkable.

A lovely looking amber beer with a pleasant nose or orange, strawberries, honey, nougat and a hint of lemon. The malt is honey and nougat and the hops are more prominent than youd expect for the style (Im told). Theyre quite bitter but not overpowering. A pleasant drop.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear amber color with a small foamy off white head. Aroma of oranges, honey, caramel malt, a slightly yeasty. Taste is similar. Malty, citrusy, and slightly yeasty, with notes of honey.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2013 Aroma: hint of caramel, sweet malts, nutty. Appearance: dark gold. Taste: slightly and pleasantly sweet, hints of bitterness. Palate: soft carbonation, medium body, light bitterness. Bottle at Montecito Sequoia Lodge, California and pint at the Smokehouse, London.

A: Hazy Orange Hue, Mild White Head Ring, No Lacing

S: Malty, Bready, Mild Orange Finish

T: Malty, Floral, Oranges

M: Average Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Dry, Mildly Bitter

Overall, its been a while since Ive had a Dead Guy and it is a nice malty, mildly hoppy beer, not over powering and drinkable.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Alla spina. Limpido color arancio pallido con un velo di pannosa schiuma bianca. Sentori di biscotto, frutta e pasta frolla (ricorda una crostata di mele-pere); gusto maltato e dolciastro con note fruttate, debolmente nocciolate e con un pizzico di luppolo nel finale. Corpo medio-lieve, effervescenza debole, struttura setosa. Particolare e dissetante!

Jeśli to był heller bock to ja jestem Adam Małysz. Kolor bursztynowy, fajna sztywna piana. W zapachu żywica, akcenty chlebowe, amerykański chmiel. W smaku pełnia słodowa, gdzieś w tle cytrusy, oczywiście akcenty żywicy, lekka trawiastość, średnia, arcyprzyjemna goryczka. Doskonale zbalansowane. Miałem zagwozdkę, czy to megawypasiony bitter czy APA, ale że heller bock? Nie przestaje mnie to zadziwiać. Tak czy siak - bardzo dobre piwo!

Bottle. Apple juice aroma. Amber body with thin lasting head. Flavor begins sweet with candied malts, apple and honey. Notes of hops and citrus follow. Sweet finish with a subtle bitter/resin aftertaste.

Poured from bottle to glass. Nice orange-amber with creamy white head. Aroma is huge malt with floral notes, honey, sugar, caramel, and yeasty. Flavor is a bit heavy on the malty sweetness followed by a decent bittering. Great carbonation lends to a bit of a CO2 bite at the end and really helps round out this beer. This "old-school" offering from the craft beer industry definitely still holds its rank in the present day. Still one of my all time favorites.
Nice dark honey color. Crisp. Hoppy taste fades into citrus flavor. Not much of an aftertaste.
Bottle. brown with some haze. Lots of malty caramel. Tastes a lot like the aroma. Fairly smooth.
Bottle. Hazy brown. Lots of caramel and malt. Apples and sweet. A bit spicy.

Bottle 12 fl. oz. Bought at Half Time (Poughkeepsie). Pours dark amber with medium off-white head. Some lacing. Aroma: very malty, wet wheat, along with small fruits. Taste: wheat and dark fruits. Balance is good. Not too sweet. Alcohol completely hidden. Gets better as its gets warmer. Interesting for the style.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest.
 Opálos belsejű, vöröses narancssárga színe van, habja közepes méretű, sárgásfehér, hamar elolvad. Illata fügés, mazsolás, malátás, mézes és égetett cukros, édeskés. Ízében először aszalt fügét, szagos szőlőt, mustot, mézet, sok malátát érezni, aztán jönnek a gyógyfüvek és egy szép adag komló és egy kis fűszer. Közepesen testes, nem túl szénsavas. Utóíze aszalt gyümölcsös, keserédes, kissé csípős és száraz. Érdekes sör, kellemes is, de nem sok köze van a német heller bockokhoz.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 Damned good - one of the few malt forward ales that I can enjoy - great fruity after-taste - cant drink a lot of it - pretty solid bodied - this pint bottle has taken a while to finish - would seek it out if on tap. On tap at S&A - exactly same as bottle!

Bottle from Dan Murphys. I had had this beer before many months ago and didnt rate. To be honest, I couldnt remember how it was after a big session... anyway, I thoroughly enjoyed this. Poured a nice colour with decent head. Not too malty to my liking and not sweet. Hints of citrus and lime with a slight bitter finish. Good beer and thoroughly enjoyed. Ill be back for more.
Flaske delt med Børge på Cardinal okt-13: lite skum men mye og god aroma - silohøy sier B som er vokst opp på et nordnorsk småbruk.
Good overall beer. Nothing stood out to me that would suggest this is a knock your socks off beer. However, it does have a great malty taste with very little bitterness.

Bottle from Erzbierschof - Orange, amber color, good white head, nice lacing - Malty, caramel, yeasty aroma with hints of citrus - caramalt, honey, hoppy citrus flavor - fizzy carbonation, low bitterness, sweet, crispy, medium body, long malty and bitter finish - Good beer, really interesting but too sweet.

Bottled, 0.355l. Pours slightly hazy golden orange with medium frothy off-white head, nice lacing and sparkling appearance. Aroma of caramel, dry fruits, berries, mild yeast and floral hops. Taste starts with moderate sweet caramel malt, followed refreshing sour fruity, with crisp mouthfeel, astringent finish and long bitter aftertaste. Full body, thick texture and fizzy carbonation in palate. Funny, but Dead Guy Ale makes me alive :)
Copper colour with a nice head with good lacing. Aroma of malt, strong malt taste with a sour dough finish.
Bonita cerveza de color ambar, sabor intenso y con un marcado olor al lupulo. Una corona de color crema que permanece durante la cata, da una nota bien equilibrada para otra gran cerveza de Rogue.

Tap.
Beautiful opal amber body with a small white head on its top.
Deep malty, fruity nose.
Aroma ruled by fruits and burnt sugar/caramel underpainted by alcohol and herbs.
Mouthfeel is syrupy.
Long sweetbitter, distinct hoppy and warming finish.
Not too sweet, balanced, enjoyable brew.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2013  bottled version:  
From memories it was kind of amber in color with beige, medium top.  Aroma - intense caramel sweet with hints of honey and yeast. Taste - caramel sweet with deep fermentation bitter from yeast, dry mouthfeel, weak notable hops touch at the end. Medium to full body, thick mouthfeel, long sweetish dry yeasty aftertaste. Must compare with on tap version, this - I didnt liked.  (6/3/6/4/12) 
on tap version: 
Same sweet pattern flavor with not so dominant yeast tones, color- unclear pale amber, seems some wheat malt in flavor, in aroma caramel is a bit candy alike - fruity, thick texture and above medium body, finish was light dry in this version. On tap version was much better, more enjoyable, smooth and better balanced to me.  
(7/3/8/4/15)
Malty, caramel, decent hops, honey (?). Sweetish, nicely balanced and interesting brew. Would like to repeat
pours a hazy amber with off-white head. aroma of yeast and hops, though i didnt get strong scents. tastes of citrusy hops and subtly sweet floral tones. palate is balanced and full bodied.

Rouge delivers another great staple beer. Easy to drink... I'd tell u the aroma and how it poured but 12 guys before me already stated the same thing...



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

hazy dark golden to amber colour, minimal off-white head; aroma of honey, flowers, caramel and hints of parfume; taste is also domintated by sweetness (honey and some caramel), maybe some figs, and some bitterness; I really like it, great ale

On tap. Slightly hazy orange body, off-white head. Aroma of toast, caramel, orange zest and some peaches. Taste has the same notes as the aroma but it also has some grassy hoppyness to it. This beer is somewhere between an ESB and a maibock, more towards the ESB I think. Anyways its an awesome beer.

Bottle: amber red. Haze. Creamy white frothy head. Very aromatic. Malt, fruit, floral, hops. Cold black tea. Fresh but complexed aroma. Medium sweet. Medium bitterness. Good balance. Floral, tropical palate. Medium richness and length. Caramel. Layers of flavour. Nice Maibock. Maybe a new house beer.

Nice aftertaste of cinnamon and hints of butter. A classic maibock with a delicate aftertaste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dunkel gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av karamell, malt samt noe siyrus. Smak av karamell, malt og frukt. Cardinal.

355 ml bottle bought at CitySuper in Harbour City, Tsim Sha Tsui.
Cloudy hazy amber red colour; with dusty yeast sediments; One finger head and off-white foam which lasts for 1 minute; Very good sticky lacing and notable small carbonation; Pretty fragrant aroma of grapefruit, pineapple, honey, molasses, ale malt, light orange, and light caramel; Pleasant light sweet taste of ale malt, with fairly light grapefruit, shades of red fruits, molasses, very light liquorices, light spices, light citrus and slight grass; Medium body, slick palate; Taste profile is lightly sweet and pretty refreshingly hoppy ale base. Grapefruit is not expressive but fairly refreshing, plus the low dose spice makes the ale base pretty enjoyable and somewhat seductive. Yum! Hoppiness is typically Bock-like - very low citrus and grass in nose but quite refreshing in taste, the Perle and Saaz is at work here. Very little bitterness but detectable astringency for a slightly comfy finish; Slightly dry after taste; Very easy to mouth.

Comments: This is quite a well-made brew in every aspect - aroma, ale base, grapefruit nose and taste, spicy hops, and so on - is expressed in low key yet quite refreshing and layback kind of way. All this sums up to be strangely seductive. Should have enjoyed this one on a lazy weekend instead. Oh well, theres nothing wrong to enjoy it right now!

22oz bottle pours slightly hazy amber into tulip with about 2 finger head. Nose is orange, fruity, cherries, musty. Mouthfeel is malty, medium carbonation. Taste is caramel, fruity notes, bready, toast, corn flakes, graham cracker, cherry notes, medicinal notes. Finish is bitter corn flakes, fruitiness, doughy. A little strange. OK.

Pours a nice cloudy amber color. Very little yeast aroma but almost non- existant. Has a strong crisp initial bite to it with a bit of yeast and a stong grassy flavor that is very sharp. Overall not a bad beer but a little different, thought it would be a little softer mouth feel this is like putting a porcupine of sharpness in your mouth. Very carbonated.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2014 Cloudy golden pour. Weak aroma. Taste is bitter in the front malty middle bitter end. Smooth complex transition. Decent overall
Bottle. Cloudy, unfiltered medium amber color. No initial aroma. Smooth. Interesting flavor. Not an enjoyable beer for my taste.

Nice maibock red in color. Sweet aroma and flavor. Dank hops but not too sweet. One of the better maibocks

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 On tap @ La Capsule - Lille, FR. Color: clear amber beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: bread, citrus orange, floral and malt. Taste: bread, yeast and citrus. Aftertaste: small malt taste, honey. 
-----
Bottle shared with happyhoppy. Color: clear amber brown beer with small carbonation and small ivory foam. Smell: bread, caramel and malt. Sweet brown sugar and black bread finish. Spicy. Taste: medium body, sweet caramel malt. Black bread. Spicy notes. Aftertaste: caramel. Black bread.

Rated from backlog. Golden colour with no real head. Very light aroma, slight caramel sweetness and hints of dough. Up front a nice crisp malty beer, bread dough and toasted malt. Nice sharp hop bitterness, piney and a little resinous. The finish is malty, yet crisp, sharp and clean hop bitterness.

Bottle @ bere buona birra. profumo maltato, ma visto che sono americani hanno dovuto fare luppolata anche questa (anche troppo per lo stile). Profuma di grano e di caramello, oltre che di luppoli tedeschi (credo Saatz). 
Color rame perfettamente limpida con schiuma finissima e compatta. Gusto di caramello, un po di melassa, con un sottofondo di luppolo rotondo e morbido.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2014 Restrained aroma and cloudy copper colour leads to a dicey malt balanced taste and a low profile finish.  An enjoyable change from the usual IPA. Close enough to not be a stretch - but different enough to invite comparisons.
Honey, orange aromas. Sweet malt, citrus hops, some spices, bitter finish. Quite sweet but overall a pleasant and smooth ale.
UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 Aroma of light caramel and malts. Nice white head and amber-brown hazy color. The taste is malty and perhaps somewhat fruity.

Bottle at North Bar, Leeds. Pours a clear amber-brown, with a pillowy white head. Aroma isnt really that present, some malty caramely stuff going on. Taste is very nice, though, soft toffee, a little orange, kinda juicy with soft caramel and malt. Fairly long finish, too. Very nice, better than the 3.5 suggests. Shame the aroma lets it down.
Very light malty aroma with hints of fruit. Pours a cloudy honey amber with foamy white head. Earthy, light hops. Not much else.
Bottle. Dark cloudy amber. White head. Aroma is caramel, citrus, nuts. Taste is medium sweet mild bitter. Decent body
Rated this beer with an earlier app and unfortunately not able to import my comments. Will add them later if I have this beer again.

pours a nice amber color with about a finger and a half of cream colored head that persists pretty well. aroma is more of bread than anything. Flavors of malt, caramel and hops. medium soft carbonation. slightly bitter finish.

Appearance has a cloudy orange amber color supporting a thin head leaving nill lace. Smell and taste of sweet malt with a nice balance of hops with a bit of fruit and spice thrown in. Mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation.
Malty caramel/alcohol aroma. Small head. Average carbo. Sweet malty finish. Expected a bit more.
Bottle. Malty-sweet. Nuts. Amber Color. Small white foam head. Medium body. Medium carbonation.
Nice color and smell but the hops falvor is pretry sharp. A bit pricy for an every day type of beet

Bottle. Dark hazy gold with a thin white head. Aroma is nutty. Taste is fruity and sweet lager with a nice crisp palate. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

True to the style, this a very malty beer. Pours amber with thin head, aroma is malt, pine, citrus. Taste is malt, candy, toffee, hops. This pour was kind of flat, light carbonation. A good but not great representation of the style

Its not bad. The alfa acid content is a kick in the teeth at first then the malts seem to tame them down. Flavor is slightly chocolatey and lots of grainy, malty tones. Carbonation is great. This beer is drinkable and very lite in the mouth. This beer is one I would recommend.

Bottle 12 oz, BBE 01/2014. Pours amber in color with a creamy off-white head. Ripe garden fruits, a bit of nuttyness and pale syrup sweetness in aroma. A bit of syrup sweetness, but also some quite dry and slighty bitter hoppy notes in taste. Enjoyable sweetish notes and slightly nutty in aftertaste.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2014 12oz Bottle. The beer pours to a light amber color. The head was small & white in color. The aroma had some bread & caramel notes to it. The taste was more malty than hoppy & a slightly sweet flavor to it.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Poured golden orange with a short, white head. Aroma was orange, caramel, bready malt and a touch of butterscotch. Taste is quite sweet, lots of orange and caramel flavour with a light grassy hop profile. Light bitterness on the way down. Wasnt sure what to expect from this, interesting but un-sessionable beer.
Good beer, but not what I was looking for. Needed more happiness for my taste. Not bad, drinkable.

(Bottle 0.651 l / 1/3 of a bottle) Thanks Blade 86 for sharing. Amber, moderate hazy color. Small, white, fast falling head, moderate lacing. Medium body, oily texture, moderate carbonation. Aroma: Sweet ,alcoholish, strong notes of malts, grain, fresh fruits. Moderate aromas of caramel and honey. Slightly notes of floral hops.Taste: Medium sweet, soft to medium strong notes of alcohol. Strong malty notes, caramel, fruits, soft bitterness and moderate increasing toastiness. Dry, medium alcoholic finish. Interesant and complexive, a bit too strong sweetness and notes of alcohol.

Caramel, fruits, bready, alkohol; dark golden/amber color, small white foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium body, oily feel, rather soft carbonation, bittersweet, honeyish finish
Overall: very good beer, complex

(Bottle 651ml shered with geophagus and Blade86) Amber color, hazy, small yellow head, fast falling, decreasing to foam. Aroma: Sweet, bready, caramel malts, toasted malts, fruity raisins, hoppy resin, a pinch of alcohol notes. Taste: Toasted malts, caramel malts, warming, hops, resin, some woody notes, fruity, raisins. Medium carbonation, medium to full body, very nice, pleasant bitter/toasted finish, a bit creamy texture.

smells like a yeast hop meadly. Looks mid amber golden in color. with a mostly white slightly tan heads. Has a malty start with an incredibly balanced finish. Has hints of caramel and smoke. fucking love it.
Aroma of this beer had a nutty smell to it. The taste was exceptional and on the palate it was great. Overall a very good beer.

Honey brown body / off beige head. aroma well balanced aromatic malts, toasted cereals, bread, roasted nuts and caramelized brown sugar. Flavor is intriguing with its array of bitterness, sweetness and breadiness. Notes of ripe plums, bananas and brazil nuts. Rich and full mouthfeel. Damn nigh perfect!
Appearance had a nice amber hue. Taste was more malty than hoppy. Good beer, not one of my favorites.

Can you be a malt head rather than a hop head? If so this is a beer for you. Still enough his to balance the loveliness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

.33l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar
Pours murky dark amber with medium head. Aroma is malts, syrup, dark bread, caramel and herbs. Flavor is malts, alcohol, dark bread, syrup. Nice malty palate.
Bottle at home, 28th July 2013. Whilst stoking a BBQ, ok beer, good flavour, mostly malts, caramel, pretty smooth, bitter finish, but well balanced

Bottle. This is kind of a hybrid lager/ale (w/ Pacman yeast). It doesnt quite fit the Maibock style. Nice malty spine - the Munich malt does it - and a warm hop presence. Im surprised its Saaz. Tastes more citrusy to me. But the blending of malt and hops is excellent here. Finishes dry and, in truth, somewhat ugly, the one blemish on this beer.
caramel, light bread aroma,golden, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, watery, light dry finiah.
Sweet/brown sugar/caramel malt aroma. Similar flavors; but the sweetness is balanced with bitterness. Cherry-ish fruity flavor. Interesting creamy mouthfeel.

Pours cloudy dark amber with low white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, toffee, light resin. Taste is toffee sweet balanced by a light refreshing bitterness. Overall very full taste. Medium, creamy body with soft to average carbonation. Nice!
Dark golden coloured and clear. Has an off-white head, lasting. Aroma of light bread and caramel, flavor is starting sweet, light caramel, moderate bitter finish. Creamy texture.
golden, clear, white foam, roasty, toast, nuts, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium bitterness,

Honey in colour with no real head. Very light aroma, slight caramel sweetness and hints of dough.
Up front a nice crisp malty beer, bread dough and toasted malt. Nice sharp hop bitterness, piney and a little resinous.
The finish is malty, yet crisp, sharp and clean hop bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Klar guld-orange öl med liknande men ljusare färg på skummet. Doft: Blommor, malt, honung, druv juice. Smak: Samma som doft men med lite jäst.

330ml bottle from Beer Hawk - Cloudy copper body, with no head. Aroma is a nice balance of nuts, dough, and grapefruit, slightly buttery and sweet as well. Dry and moderately hoppy. Good hop finish that grows in intensity then gradually fades. A refreshing bock, but seems to be missing just a little something.

Aroma of sweet caramel, bread, and yeast. Hazy tan, orange in color...virtually no head...white. Caramel, bready yeast, with sweet malt tones in the beginning, finishes with an even bitterness that balances somewhat with the sweetness, Bitterness lingers on the tongue for a while. Medium body and average carbonation. A little too much bitterness for me for this style, but not bad.

pours golden honey with a persistent white head--
big malt with lots of flavor and a mild hop finish--I think it IS Maibockish and a little boozy--good beer!

Color anaranjado oscuro. Aromas dulces, herbales y cítricos. en es ligera con toques dulces iniciales seguidos se un agradable sabor a pan, levadura, cítricos y un final ácido equilibrado muy agradable. Buena.
Bottle 355ml, a very sweet beer with caramel and grain notes, agrume and "fruit confits" fruit notes, not clean at all. Lot of resin, grain and orange notes. Not a heller bock at all.
12 oz bottle - good tasting brew, more on the malt side then the hops. Low hop flavors but bittering notes on the palate.

650ml Bottle. Pours a golden copper colour with a frothy white head that bubbles away slowly. Aroma is rich, light citrus, hint of grassiness, mild alcohol. Taste is medium to full bodied, and the alcohol is masked slightly with the earthy, floral hops and grassiness,but certainly brings a heavy warmth and a bit of a hoppy bite. Great flagship brew.

Bottled 355ml. -from Za Popent Pivoteka, Ljubljana. Golden coloured, small to medium sized off-white head, light malty nose. Sweet malty, light fruity and caramel with mild hoppy notes in the finish. No trace of alcohol.

Pours golden honey in color with an unfiltered appearance. Antique white head that lingers. Nice malt aroma. Good balance of malt and hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is an interesting style and for what its worth a great example of it, at least American-style. The aroma was faint with grainy malts. The color was a dark honey and amber color, like the description. The palate had weight and was pretty smooth. Good balance as neither malt nor hops took over . Good carbonation. Some bread-like character too.
Was a good beer, but was expecting a bit more, maybe because of all the hype I herd about the beer
bottle, I really enjoy this style. Excellent brew, well balanced, clean crisp flavor. "Good call"
Im such a huge fan of the pacman yeast and use it from wyeast at my local brew shop. This is a great example of a maibock from the westcoast. Tangy and prompt.
Amber color, slight white had. Taste is Carmel malty,  with an almost ice tea taste with bisquety finish. Very nice Heller Bock.
Cloudy Amber honey color. Sweet earthy aroma.Great taste on the tongue and leaves a pleasant tart finish. Excellent beer for a Friday night.
Pours light amber with little head. Sweet with a bright yeast flavor and kind of boozy. Pretty good.

Love the pour, love the mouthfeel, & the taste is well balanced but just not quite flavorful enough. Still a very solid drinkable beer & far less hoppy than I imagine. Pretty good for a warm summer night. Decent!

Small bottle at Hop & Vine on Burnaby Mountain, served in a St Bernardus snifter. Surprising its taken me this long to get around to this Westcoast classic. Lots of fruit and malts here, less so with the hops, which are well in the background. Sweet, malty finish. Nice!

Ver weak aroma. Good balance of hops and malt in taste. Drinkable but nothing special.

Pours amber with a off white head. The malt aromas dominate the hops. Very smooth and light. Great session brew.
Aroma was not strong when opened. Slight sweet hints. Clear brown appearance. The non aroma carried over to taste. smooth with only slight bitter aftertaste. It is nothing to write home about.

Pours a darkish amber color with an off white head. The aroma was of light floral hops and sweet grains. The flavor was sweet grains with a little bitterness. Goes down smooth with a light bitter aftertaste. Overall a good beer.

Takie sobie. Po ocenie i renomie tego piwa spodziewalem sie chyba fajerwerkow. Piwo z mizerna piana o kolorze ciemnej pomaranczy mocno slodowe i lekka nuta alkoholowa wyczuwalna w tym piwie byla nieciekawa. Slodowosc dosc spora chmielu jak na amerykanskie chmielenie przestalo to niewielkie bylo. Ale ogolnie piwo bylo tresciwe i pijalne.

Not much hop aroma. Little below mild bitterness. Slight kinda black liqourish very end after taste. On the sweeter side. Med. amber color. 

Pretty enjoyable beer. Since I hate black liqourish it was a slight turnoff. Otherwise would choose this over this so called craft beer I jus had that tasted liked rice beer.

Bomber at club w. one of my favorite rouges. Some floral and hops. Really good!!!
