On tap pour at prohibition in Toronto amid the yuppies & families (kids in bars, really?). Pours ruby gold with a hairline smokey cap. Tastes of America trying to do Germany poured in Canada. Maybe a bottle pour would be more decisive? Interesting & probably my session for the night (considering the beer list here).
A good smooth ale. A bit sweet with flavours of caramel in the malt. Also floral. Overall very malty and heavy. Solid.
Did not like this much. Taste was unusual and unbalanced not one i will go back for.

Great tasting IPA. Crisp. Hoppy. Goes down easy. Tastes of hops and a bit of clove. A little lighter than your standard IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark amber mahogany. Slightly sweet malty nutty, almost dried figs-y, brown maltiness on nose. Body is quite full, loads of malts. Nutty, a bit musky, brown. Really a nice beer.-- bb/h(n9)
Poured from a bottle into pint glass. Dark Brown with a strange Brownish head that sticks around. Smells a deep caramel with malt and hops. Taste is sweet and caramel, some spices and mildly bitter.

Definitely a great brew from this brewery. I've only tried this one and the Yellow Snow IPA, but this one is better.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Location/Date:Bottle on May 23rd, 2013.
Appearance: APPEARANCE 
Aroma: Aroma of caramel, bread.
Taste:Caramel sweet, light bread, toffee, light bitterness.
Palate:Medium light body, slightly slick, lingering aftertaste.
Summary: Im confused that I havent rated this. Well, here it is - a well made amercian version of a german style. Something I always appreciate.

Nutty, malty with good and clean hop taste. It is subtle yet straightforward. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dimpled mug. Sweet smell, hints of malts and barley. Pours a cloudy copper, quick dissipating head. Thick heavy mouth feel, finishes sweet. A really sweet tasting beer and not necessarily in a good way. Just average.
Really disappointing due to the rankings and fanfare. Unspectacular and standard save for increased sharpness and caramel & citrus moments.

Pours a cloudy golden brown with enormous head and good lacing.  Aroma is tons of caramel malt and a little bit of piney hops. Aroma is complex and changing - very nice.   Taste is similar, with rich malts and full flavor, with the right amount of fruity hops to cut in at the end.  Palate is full bodied, smooth, and rich.  Overall very well done.  Might be an old bottle - label was peeling and it poured cloudy.  Would love to re-rate to confirm this one.

Clear amber gold colour, slight off-white head. Aroma of hops, malt and honey. Quite herbal. Sweet malty flavour, bitter hops, rather fruity. Bitter finish, hops, light honey.
Feels a bit old, no best before date though.
(from 35cL bottle @ home. Courtesy of tderoeck. Thanks!)
Very smooth smell, malty with hints of cereal and toast.  Pours vibrant clear orange with a thick white head.  Good flavor, layered with a long finish.  Medium bodied with good carbonation.
Thought this would be better from Rogue, but I guess every beer cant be perfect. Drinking from a bottle, but has a bitter aftertaste that is not pleasing.

650ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy burnished copper amber, with a medium off-white head, which lasts well and leaves reasonable lacing. Burnt caramel and fresh white bread mix with a touch of honey and some mild herbal hops in the aroma. Light herbal and floral hops up front are overcome by sweet burnt caramel malt. Honey and mild chai tea in the mid-palate lead into a slightly spicy finish. Quite a pleasant malty ale.
Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, brunt socker, honung med toner av blommor. Citrusbeska.
Dead Guy Ale has a sweet and honey- like aroma. It is an orange carmel color.It has a sour, light, and tart flavor. Full flavored beer.

The appearance of this beer is a hazy golden brown color with a substantial white head, and the aroma is sour with hints of dough yeast, fruity hops, and sweet malts. The taste is mildly bitter, mildly sweet, and slightly sour, which makes for a bold yet unemphasized flavor, and the palate combines a medium body, soft carbonation, slightly bitter finish, and a slick texture.

I avoided this beer since its one of the more pricier beers in Canada (stupid taxes...). This is the real deal. Full flavored stuff that remains in the mouth for a long time. Theres a bit of adventure in every sip... (I dont think Ive said anything of substance in this review yet...)

Bottle 12 fl.oz from erzbierschof.ch. Orangy amber with a short but sticking foam, average to low crackling. Sweet malt flavors dominate, honey and sweet fruits, point of DMS noticeable. The mouth is similar, round, soft, toffy, bready, bitter and roasted notes. Finish rather long, creamy, always sweet with grassy hop.
Dead guy ale is a great beer. It had a great flavor for a stronger than norm beer. Rouge makes a tadty beer.
On tap. amber colour with white head. Honey, caramel and malty aroma. Sweet, caramel and malty taste.
Not a great taste ...sour old malty taste that lingers throughout ...taste is consistent but bad
Full body. Medicinal taste and brown sugar. Smells like oranges and caramel.
Pretty good beer! A great example of the style. aroma was impressive and all round good weight with long sweet finish

Caramel and sweet grains in the aroma and the flavor, rounded out by citrus hops. Malty with bits of orange peel to it. Theres a bit of an earthy/grassy note as well. Alcohol is very present, which is surprising. Pacman yeast is noticeable.
Clear amber with good, lacing head. Honey bread aromas fade into some sweet orange notes. Orange and caramel on the taste that the hops cut thru for a clean finish. Good, med/high carbonation.

From bomber into pint glass. Pours a golden brown/amber, with citrusy aroma, moderate carbonation. Big citrus and sweet flavour up front with dry bitterness on the back half. Light-tasting despite the abv.

Dead Guys Ale has a beautiful deep golden honey color just an eye gazing site for a beer. It has a great citrusy aroma, with hints of caramel and toasty note. Goes down smooth with a mild Bitterness towards the end with a lingering flavor of citrus bitterness. Just a great balance of flavors and aroma.
Aroma:citrus, caramel. Flavour starts sweet citrus drying out into a nice strong bitterness. Low body,  Very easy drinking.

Amber, grat sweet German hop and malt aroma. Excellent flavor. Perfect balance of malt and hops. Great balance of flavor and lager drink ability. This beer is exceptionally well done. Would definitly enjoy this in spring/fall in sessionable amounts.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a hazy dark orange with a fizzy one finger head that quickly fades into almost nothing. No lacing to speak of.

Aroma of rich caramel and honey along with some raspberries and toasted nuts. Very floral as well and sweet smelling almost like the aroma of cooling wort. Pretty nice but a little flat as well.

The taste continues the maltyness with loads of honey, iced tea, and sweet caramel. Not a ton of sweetness in the flavor which is nice but the malt also tends to fall off a little too quickly. No hops to really speak of but a nice moderate bitterness to balance out the sweetness.

Overall, an ok beer but pretty unspectacular. If it wasnt so expensive it might be something to pick up on occasion.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines;  clear copper pour with tiny white head, burnt toffee aroma, sweet caramel taste some dried fruit, alcohol is very present, ok.

Bottle from Fresh Market in Boca Raton, FL. American pint glass. Pours a very hazy orange-amber with a thin white head. Medium lace. Aroma of flowers, sweet fruits, malts, and spices. Taste is similar but somehow the aromas dont come to fruition. It does have a floral, sweet taste to it. It actually finishes rather dry which was a surprise. The malts really come through overall. Not bad.

Bomber. Pours a clear amber with a big, fizzy head that fades quickly. Light caramel and smoke aroma. Flavor salty, smokey, light with a smooth transition to a slight bitter aftertaste. A little fizzy and light in the mouth. I prefer something with a little more character, depth and body.
Malty caramel taste and smell. Great match! Nice little hope finish. Not for hopheads. Low carbonation.
Decent pour from a bottle for me with this beer.  Lacks complexity that Id like to see.
Clear golden amber color, medium white head, good lacing. Aroma floral, malty. Taste malty, caramel, full bodied, citrus, a slight bubblegum at first. Very good
Smell of apples, trappist. Red amber colour, white head. Very Sweet. Aroma of alcohol, raisins, rum, some oak.
Bright amber, med head. Smells.. Malts, bready, yeast and some floral action. Tastes.. Sweet malts, caramel, honey, a little yeasty. Pretty nice.

March 17, 2013; 6.6% abv, 650 mL, tulip
Hop aromas dominate the malts. Resin and citrus come through strongest. Sweet dates and mango are also evident. Pours deep amber with almost white head that is fairly short. Appears to be low carbonation and leaves little lace.  Though not particularly strong, resin hops cut through the sweetness. Caramel malts, dates, and light fruitiness. Medium body with smooth light carbonation.  Complex and pretty easy drinking. Resin is surprisingly clean.

Appearance: Pours a nice, super hazy apple cider-like color. The head is creamy and about a finger thick. I figured the lacing would be awesome, but its just decent.

Smell: This is my first of this style. It smells interesting. No doubt a load of malts, but almost a caramel smell as well. The alcohol is also very present.

Taste/feel: Much like the smell, to be honest. Theres also a slight "funk" in there thats actually not too unnerving. I also pick up some dark fruits in the back somewhere (prunes?), as well as a tad of tartness. A pretty sweet beer on the start, but a bit of bitterness and spice at the end. Rather balanced, and nothing overwhelming. The feel is creamy and perfect with the amount of carbonation, which is low. Alcohol is also present.

Dead Guy Ale grew on me throughout the glass, but I still dont quite believe its worth the $2.79 I paid for the bottle -- SLIGHTLY overpriced. Regardless of that though, this is a tasty beer. It looks great, it feels great, and it has a very solid taste thats fairly mild, yet keeps you drinking.

Great color and taste. The mild honey with a touch of bitterness gives it a little bite on the way down.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nov 2012 - bottle.  This is quite nice.  Sweet buttery, mild bitterness, flavour is all at the start.  Slight funkiness.  The maltiness is offset with a fruity flavour that I cant pick out.  Unusual.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2016 Pours a rich amber color with thick two finger off white color head. Aroma is of caramel, citrus, malts and hops. Tastes is of citrus hops and caramel malts among a complex layering. Overall a fantastic ale.
Bottle pours a honey-orange with a thin tan head. Aroma is light, sweet malts. Taste is bready, slightly sweet malts, and a bit of hops on the finish. A bit of an oily palate.
Pours a hazy copper. Light aroma of bread, straw. Nice taste with more bread, a little spice. Nice round palate.

Pours a slightly hazy orange/golden with a fairly robust white head that settles and minimizes quickly.  Aroma is a jar of fruit pieces in syrup.  Smooth clean mouthfeel.  Taste is sweet caramel malt, biscuits and some mild hop bitterness.  Simple and well balanced.  Very good, but not a bock of any sort.

(bottle) pours a clear dark amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of herbal hops, straw, oranges and yeast, with a hint of sweatsocks and gravy. flavour is fruitier, with pronounced notes of kiwi, physalis and oranges, some light peppermint, caramel, pale malts and a medium-bitter finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.
bottle. Pours honey gold, decent head. Bright aroma of malts, flowers, something else...bubblegum maybe? Taste is smooth malty, light cloves, soft mouthfeel. Pleasantly subtle beer, enjoyable.
The head is robust, the body orange-brown. It smells soft, flowery. The taste is smooth, a bit bitter, flowery, aromatic, less CO2. Good start at the Braukunstlive 2013. 12/11/12/11/-/12

This was better with perle and saaz in my opinion, but the honey grain maltiness is perfectly balanced by what I believe are rogues own noble-like hops. I think this used to have more alcohol in it too, but I could be wrong. Love the glow in the dark Halloween bottles

Pours a cloudy amber with a small white head. Delicate aroma, sweet toffee and caramels. Taste is bready, fruity, and malty, with interesting clove spiciness to it. Slight bitterness as well. Good beer, refreshing yet filling

Draught at the Rogue Ales Public House. Notes from tasting session. Maltier than Brutal Bitter. An unusual malt flavor, and a somewhat odd 
malt aroma, English Strong Ale, If you like these malt  characteristics, youll love this. I have mixed feelings. As my palate adapts, I like it more,

Aroma is hard to detect, mostly of sweet malt. Poured on draft and didnt have much head. It has a beautiful deep gold color. Flavor is of sweet malt followed by a bitter hops finish. Easy to drink. Good beer.
Bottle 0.355l at Bar Molotov, Helsinki. Colour is clear dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, sweetness,malts, raisins and hints of alcohol.

Couleur sirop dérable, avec consistance mi-mince. Assez peu de	bulles réussissent à crever la surface. Un peu de orange, et totalement claire. Forte odeur de caramel et de sucre cuit, avec des guimauves et de lorge. Un peu de houblon en finale. Tangerine et zeste dorange, avec sucre cuit et légère amertume. Très savoureuse. Lamertume gagne en complexité avec le temps. Alcool complètement à la merci du goût prédominant, à savoir malt grillé et sucre. Superbe ale toute en force et en audace ; si elle sait charmer le dégustateur insouciant, elle conquiert aussi lexigeant. Goûteuse, fonceuse, complexe, parfaitement balancée. En fait, elle ne présente aucun défaut notable, tout simplement. Une américaine à découvrir avec plaisir.

355ml bottle from Cotteridge Wines.2nd march.Orange pour with medium sized white head.Caramel and toffee aroma with a little fruit.Sweetish malt flavour with some hop and dark fruit.Pleasant and tasty beer of its type.

Poured from a 22 bomber yields a nice translucent amber color with a small off white head. Smell is malt, yeast, sweet caramel, and sourdough bread. Taste caramel sweetness and malts. Kind of sticky mouth feel, but good body. Not really my style.

23 oz on draft. Amazing deep orange pour with a bubbly white head. Aroma of sweet bread, caramel and toffee. Yeast is present. Huge sweet malt presence, fruit, banana, slight hint of hops on the tail end. Great mouthfeel with a dry finish. Extremely drinkable. This is everything that I had expected!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Im a little obsessed by skulls. Im sure its a passing fad. On my wish list is a book called Skullface. Ive got a paisley skull hanging by my front door. Ive kept the Beavertown bottles with skulls on them. Ive got a photograph of a skull on a pebble beach. I really want a skull on my skin but Im not allowed. This bottle has a skull (attached to a skeleton) on it and I like it. Dead Guy. Great name, beer fails to live up to it a little. I may watch some dead guys now but as its a zombie apocalypse I doubt there will be much ale.

Sweet n malty. Not really my thing, but ok. I wonder who I know that has contemplated my death and had a little buzz from the idea, not that they wanna kill me, just, you know... do you know? Does anyone know what I mean? Am I terrible? Im not saying they wouldve actually wanted me dead, just that it seemed, well, I dunno. You dig?

Bottle. Pours a gorgeous honey color with nice bubbly white head. That's the only thing I like about it. Not a fan of maibocks. Don't like the yeast strain nor the finish. 

----Hophaze out
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2013 Didnt like this beer as much before. But its grown on me. Nice, reasonably thick mouth-feel complements this tangerine-tasting beer.
It?s like sipping cool sweet honey from the jar. Malty sweetness wrapped in a smooth caramel shell.

Very smooth taste with a malty finish dry finish. A solid balanced brew and a recommended try to all interested.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

NOTE: this is a re-evaluation of this beer.  First time was reviewed from 12oz bottles.  This time is from a bomber.  

Coppery and mostly clear, two finger head that lasted and left good lacing. 

Smells malty with notable hops. Some bready character and fruity aromas. 

Tastes very caramel-malty, with a hops bite and lightly spiced bitterness that are noticeable but not too strong. A bit of dark fruits is also present. Its a flavorful beer, but not too overpowering. 

It feels tangy and well carbonated, medium bodied.

I like this beer better from the bomber, or at least this time around I do.  Thats probably psychological, BTW, but for some beers, bombers are just king.  If you like this maibock/helles bock, this is a very nice and hoppy example.

Appearance:  Deep orangey golden, small bubbly off white head, disippates quickly.
Aroma:  Lovely combination of toffee and fruit, some light resiny&citrus hop aroma in the background.
Flavour:  Nice juicy malt front and centre, which quickly makes way for some ale like fruit flavours and finally a lovely dry bitterness.
Mouthfeel:  Medium bodied, snappy carbonation on impact, malty and sweet through the center and a quick, dry and bitter finish.  Some alcohol warmth creeps back into the picture.
Overall:  Bloody great!
Draft pour orange color.  Faint hop but mostly malt on the nose.  Initial malt sweetness with just a hint of tropical fruit hop in the finish.

355 ml bottle.
Originally rated on 20090604.
Pours dark amber color with a small head. Aroma of caramel, licorice, dark malts, ripe fruits and some hops. Flavor of ripe fruits, caramel malts and licorice. Very nice.

Bottle from Beers of Europe into a Gouden Carolus glass.  Orange-red, with a nice creamy head - but it doesnt hang around for long.  Lovely complex hoppy aroma.  Great hop bock taste with a nice malt base.  Very dry aftertaste however.  Good stuff.

(From notes 2011)
Poured from a bottle at Durgin Park, Boston, Massachusetts.

Pours a very coppery orange color. Very little head and which fades quickly.

Spicy aroma with some malt notes as well.

Taste is a sweet although slightly hoppy to start, slightly bitter to finish but not overpowering.

Medium mouthfeel and very drinkable, would definitely enjoy another.

Serving type: bottle
Bottle to pint glass. Little to no head, cloudy amber color. Smells of yeast. Very malty flavor with slight hop bitterness at the finish. Not one of my favorites, but very drinkable
From a 12 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a clear amber with a thick off white head.  Sweet malt aroma.  Bitter hops take over in the flavor.  Quite crisp and lively mouthfeel.  Bitter finish.
Poured a cloudy amber color from a 12 oz. bottle, not much head. Aroma is malts and yeast. It had a medium sweetness, a light hoppy finish and was very smooth. One of my favorites.

Color miele di arancio con due dita di schiuma che si attaccano al bicchiere creando una specie di merletti. Aroma complesso dolce con una componente di legno e zucchero di canna che la rendono simile a un rhum. Cè anche un sentore di caramella al miele. Al palato ingresso dolce cremoso poco carbonato. I sentori dolci fanno di nuovo capolino si distingue ancora il rum e un retrogusto di caramella al miele.  Un lieve amaro erbaceo di fondo equilibria tutto. Non sembra una Heller Bock ma è davvero una splendida bevuta.
A strong sweet aroma and perfect rust orange color. Starts of sweet with a bit of a hoppy ending.

Bomber. Pours a clear copper color with an average head that fades to nothing quickly. No lacing to speak of. Aromas of sweet malt and toffee. Taste is smooth and sweet; almost a burnt toffee kinda sweet (bleh). Creamy mouthfeel and no hop bitterness. Not my kinda thing.
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Tasty. Not too familiar with the Bock style, but this brew is tasty and easy to drink.
Bottle at the game, bangkok, thailand. Hazy reddish brown color, white head. Light hoppy aroma with honey. Balanced sweet malty taste with some hoppy finish.
Probably my favorite bock beer and one of America?s best brew.  A complex taste in an easy and smooth swallow.

2012/01/05 - Pours a hazy amber with a thick, off white head which dissipates quickly. Smells of toasted and citrus notes. Taste similar to smell. Sweet up front with a dry hoppy finish. Pairs perfectly with BBQ ribs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 Oz. Bottle, Poured dark amber with a nice white head, nice carbonation. Aroma of bread (yeast) and malts. Very sweet beer with a light but nice bitterness towards the end. Taste of malts and caramel. Tasty beer, quite enjoyable.

Bottle. Pours a mostly clear yellow body with a rather large frothy off-white head that left some nice lacing. The nose is lightly hoppy with some light yeastiness and slightly sweet honey laced pale malt. The flavor is pretty odd given the style of Heller Bock. Rather hoppy, that Rogue house character yeast, lots of fruitiness (which doesnt fit at all) and fairly noticeable alcohol. Chewy and slightly sticky on the mouthfeel with light fizzy carbonation. Not sure what to think of this one, its kind of all over the place. A Heller Bock thats fruity and hoppy?  Meh.
An old favorite, and though its not quite as adventurous as I remember it, but still delicious. Light hoppiness, malty, creamy, fruity.
Very good beer....poured from bottle cloudy orange...white head that has staying pour...little bitter back notes.  Big thanks to Rogue for this one.
Tasty beer that is easy to drink. They serve this beer on tap at my local ale house. This beer seems more bitter when it gets too cold. It has almost of an iron taste when too warm.
Couleur ambrée avec une mousse beige moyenne. Larôme de malt légèrement sucré avec un peu dhoublon. Le goût est pareille avec lhoublon dans la finale.

Bottle from ORI Supermarket, Ampang Park Shopping Centre, Kuala Lumpur.  Poured a slightly cloudy dark amber with a thin broken white head.  The aroma is BIG and is of malt and a little caramel and honey.  The flavour is rich, smooth and malty with some honey on the palate.  A very tasty ale that tastes better on the warm side I feel.
An excellent "maibock" (Rogues nomenclature), although a maibock is a LAGER, and for some unfathomable reason Rogue calls it an ale! Whatever its called, it is a winner.
From tap. Pours copper in color with small head. Citrus hops aroma with dark sugars. Taste follows with bread, caramel malt and bittering.
Bottle in NYC sept 2012. Amber a bit hazy beer with a offwhite not lasting head. Hoppy, malty aroma with some brown sugar notes. Similar flavour. Nice full body beer :-)
Ce doux nectar est très agréable au palais et ce parfait équilibre entre malt et houblon est grandiose.. Une bonne longeur aussi ! jadore..
Slightly reddish copper with beautiful off white head with extensive lacing. Aroma is light citrus. Taste of malt and hops. Initial sweetness with mld bitter finish. Nicely balanced.
Amber color on the pour, bready, yeast, very clean, just nice balanced hops, very smooth.
Lighter brown pour. Yeasty aroma. Bready malts, fresh hops, honey sweetness. Very balanced and drinkable. Very good.

Pours a nice amber color. Smells of grain and bread. Head dissipated quite quickly but left a small white layer. Bitter in flavor, yet lacked a strong hop presence. Decent ale, not for the hophead enthusiast.

Pours a dark amber with tall mousse like head. Decent retention and lacing. Aromas of caramel, subtle rasin and spice with a rich breadiness. Taste is bready and sweet with a touch of dried fruits. Finish is medium and semi dry.

Bouteille 12oz, courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou de Blankboy. De couleur ambrée-orange et voilée. Nez de grains de malt sucrés, léger de caramel doux, de houblon floral aux petites notes citriques avec des notes fruitées (agrumes, traces dabricots) et de miel. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture très légèrement sirupeuse. Goût légèrement amer de houblon floral (présent en arriêre-goût toute la gorgée) accompagné dun goût de grains de malt pâle sucrés aux notes croustillantes ainsi que de notes fruitées (agrumes, traces dabricots) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun léger goût de pain avec des notes de caramel doux ainsi que quelques traces de toffee rôti et de miel puis en finale lon retrouve une amertume de houblon légèrement herbeuse. Post-goût moyen-long et légèrement sec, légèrement amer de houblon floral et herbeux..

Very good and drinkable.  Bit of sweetness with malt and slight hop taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a yellow, cloudy copper color with white head.  Smell is yeasty with some citrus and honey smell.  Taste is bread with bitter taste that starts up front but trails off quickly and only lingers slightly.  Slightly oily mouth feel. Pretty good for style and okay personally.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
More alive than dead, this ale seems scary malty at first but the hop blend allows it to finish smoothly.  Drinkability swag for days!

Comprada en Cervezorama. La etiqueta no dice nada de lo que te vas a encontrar. Lo que probamos era una APA muy correcta, maltosa, con un punto seco y amargo. Carbónico justo, espuma persistente, muy bebible casi de trago. Cuando he leído en la ficha que es una bock entonces me he sorprendido mucho. De cualquier manera una estupenda cerveza de sesion.

Not a ton of aroma but what is there i think comes from yeast and malt, that is ok given the style. surprised it uses the subtle perle and saaz hops which i think is what gives this beer a great smoothness to the hop profile. I have had this beer a few times before and always assumed it was a higher gravity ale. overall i liked it and is a good beer with a balanced malt and hop profile.

Bottle. Golden color with slight white foam. Malty with good bitter hop balance, very smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tempting malty aroma with an active brown pour and quarter inch head, balanced taste and warm mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Expected more from this one. Pours a hazy amber. strong aroma, citrus notes. Sweet on the taste and smooth . Nothing too special.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 On draught at Rogue Distillery and Public House. Amber colored with foamy head. Malty, bready aroma. Satisfying sweet malt flavor with slight hop bitterness.One of the first craft brews I had years ago. Forgot how sweet, citrusy, and overall great it was.
Light amber color, earthy aroma, smooth caramel taste with slight floral overtones, pleasant mildly hoppy aftertaste, very drinkable but a bit pricey

This beer surprised me. Went out on a limb and bought a six of it. Really nice amber sunset color with a frothy head. Malty at first but very well balanced by immediate hop intervention. An overall great tasting ale.

Enjoyed a couple of these brew on New Year's Eve 2012. Not a bad brew, but nothing remarkable about the beer. The coolest part about the beer is the name. Dead Guy ale just sounds cool. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Poured from bottle into glass with a honey color and medium head. Aroma of malts and caramel. Taste was smooth with a hint of honey on the finish.
A good drinking beer.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2013 Aromas of caramel, honey, golden raisins, and slight citrus fruit.  Mostly clear orange-honey with a small, lasting, white head.  Off-dry with flavors of caramel and herbaceous, spicy hops, with a savory, nutty quality as it finishes; very balanced.  Light-medium body, very smooth, maltiness lifted by fresh-feeling carbonation and a quenching burst of hops.

The beer has a honey amber color with a medium head. The aroma has some nice malts with some sweetness like caramel. Taste is extremely smooth. There is a honey like sweetness perhaps some toffee and some chewy malts. Well balanced beer.

355 ml. bottle shared @ home // purchased from another RBer who procured it from an American base in German // age shouldnt be too bad & probably even better than most imports, price was very good fro an import & even quite a few non-imports. I remember being interested in this one in my brief before RB ticking days because I saw this mentioned somewhere as the first American craft beer  a statement that is probably erroneous but this was definitely one of the first ones. Although Rogue is bit of a joke these days, I am still interested // I am quite digging the graphics on this one as well. // This is apparently a bock of some kind, I always figured out it would be an American ale of some nature, a bock makes more sense since the US craft breweries initially took existing styles. The beer pours a darker clear amber with a solid white head. Nose has that total German lager yeast profile or whatever you call it going on & it is a tad sweetish as well, some sweet spices, caramel malts, touch molasses, grains & light sugar, light beginning sings of an aged German lager. // Taste is that German lager yeast thing, sweet, herbs, caramel malts, touch brown sugar, touch of molasses, hint of banana, finish culminated in this herbal, quaint bitterness, hint grass, light signs of age. Mouthfeel is totally DE & bock, tad fuller than usually. Not picking up on any of the pine / American notes that others are talking about. Took a bit getting used to at first but once I was into it, I was totally getting it // This definetly could make a lovely session beer.  Def. exceeded my expectations.
Orange color and light soapy head. Aroma of citrus hops, esp orange. Same with flavor with sweet orange citrus. Hops flavor well integrated. Creamy medium body. Clean, refreshing, and delicious.

Remembered trying this on tap in Chaleston, SC- found it in a bottle at Zillys on Ocracoke.  Definitely was better first time around on tap.....Pours a nice copper color- slightly cloudy with an almost non-existent head.  The taste is sweet- malty and honey are evident.  Has some bitterness from the hops, but overall well balanced.  Easy to drink but nothing really jumps out at you.  Sort of like a Merlot, this beer is lacking its own identity.
A good beer, but not worth the $$ in my opinion.  Sort of in between your New Belgium/Sierra Nevada range and something really special- Stone, Founders.  Next time I find it on tap, Ill give it another try.

Strong sweet honey/malt aroma as the beer is poured in the glass, with what seems to be a bit of fruitiness from the hops. Clear copper brown, white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Sweet taste, get the honey/malt again as expected from the nose, almost no hop bitterness but a bit of hop flavor. Medium bodied. A bit of alcohol showing itself. OK beer.
Pours a huge head, copper colored, nice malt aroma.  Bitter after taste lingers around longer than it should.

Reviewed 10/22/2012. 12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass.

A: Pours a dark copper color thats clear, but not perfectly so. Theres about one fingers worth of barely offwhite head which retains itself sufficiently. A nice film of lacing is left on the side of the glass, as well.

S: Theres quite a bit of caramel on the nose, and - dare I say - its faintly chocolaty as well. The noble hops give a nice grassiness to it, and makes it different from the dime-a-dozen IPA with crystal malts and Cascade hops. I dont know why Im comparing it to the average IPA, I should be thinking of it as a maibock with ale yeast...

T: Tastes exactly like I expected it to - which is a maibock with ale yeast. It has that sort of pumpernickel bread flavor to it I expect from the average bock, only a bit lighter. The finish is pleasantly hoppy, but the problem is, the initial flavors and the finish dont really do much to differentiate itself, so its kind of one note. I can see why this has a following, though.

M: Rogue did a decent job of keeping this crisp without the lager yeast, but the body itself is too heavy for the flavors they present and the carbonation doesnt make it seem any lighter. Despite that, this is easy to drink.

O: This beer represents a conundrum for me. Its the kind of middle of the road daily drinker I envisioned it would be - but its priced just out of said middle of the road daily drinker range at $12/6 pk. For that reason, I wouldnt pick this up over offerings from Sierra Nevada, New Belgium, or the like.

Dark amber pour with a decent white head. Aroma: hops, malt, pine, grapefruit, orange. Taste; hoppy bitterness, creamy malt sweetness, citrus, grapefruit, toffee.

Very nice
Pours a light gold color, slight caramel flavors with a sweet malty finish,awesome
My favorite all time beer.  Great flavor, smooth taste, and excellent aroma.  You cant go wrong with Dead Guy.
Smoothy and creamy. Sweet and hoppy. Caramel color and flavor. No head. Some bite. Medium body. More hop
Orange amber colour with a nice yeasty aroma. Spicy flavour, slight toffee flavour. at Beer Bistro

Very smooth aromatic beer, with some tropical fruit aftertaste.
Nice beer, nothing special, but nice...

355 ml bottle. Pours a somewhat clear, orange amber with a nice white head. Taste is sweet, caramel, somewhat woody, vanilla. Finish is earthy, with a touch of chemical-feeling windex window cleaner. Average body, foamy mouthfeel. Good, but has some flaws.

Excellent ale.  Smooth drinking with a real pleasant taste. Would definitely drink over and over 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice foamy head, with lacing to follow.

Cloudy, orange amber color, with a balanced malty taste.
Completely intoxicating, no pun intended. Aroma is mild, slight fruity undertones come with the taste, and after your done, you immediately want another one.

I had this on tap at a restaurant.  The color was a pale amber with an average head, and a little nominal lacing.  The aroma was mild, there were some bready notes and a little citrus, but nothing distinct or surprising.  The flavor was buttery with a subdued malt.  Nothing special, but it did go well with crab dip.
Pours orange gold with a super thin head. Aroma is honey clay with some floral notes. Taste is sugary orange woth plenty of thick glueyy hops

0.355l bottle as gift from Denmark. Hazy, oragne colored, medium white headed. Honey, malty lager beer odor. The honey flavour continues at the aroma, besides that a light herbal hoppy flavour appears. Light bitter taste. Light to medium body, creamy texture, light carbonation. Honey finish. Its a very delicious beer with a nice honey flavour. Very well balanced taste and aroma. The hoppy flavours goes well with the grainy honey feeling. The bitterness and the sweetness are in harmony. Easily drinkable, pleasant and delicious.
Bottle. Light brown like a herring - if herring were light brown like this.  Which they arent.  Tastes of bitter citrus with a buttery, suet pudding aftertaste.  A little watery but very drinkable.

12 oz. Bottle. A solid brew with lots of flavor. Sweet roll scent, cinnamon, bready, grain. Clear bronze pour with a foamy white head. Medium bodied, silky feel, slightly dry finish. Perfume hop fronted taste, slight caramel undertow. Great!

A very good beer. I am not one to judge, but all Rogue beers seem awesome by the bottle (and their names). This one did not disappoint. Not too heavy, not too hoppy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft. A decent beer that can be found around Shanghai. This particular pint seemed a bit off and oxidized. This seems to be happening more often and concerns me the beer is getting old. Regardless its still better than the macro lager crap from the big brewers. The alcohol is deceiving as its easy to drink for 6.6%.

I like this, theres a thing about it that makes it both familiar and yet a beer that makes you smile with excitement at the same time. The tastes are not alarming or disappointing, they are spot on for a beer that you could sit down with and have a quite and pleasant evenings fun.

Pours deep reddish brown. Aroma of malt, dark fruit, and caramel.   Taste is more of the same dark fruits, spice, lots of caramel malt sweetness. One of the first good beers I ever had back when I was in college.  Need to put this one back into the rotation.

Finally ventured beyond the void and purchased a bottle of this one, so here goes...Into a snifter at just on cool. Bright copper with fine carbonation that is hasty in its ascent. Head little more than a wafer thin, compact pad of white that does hold. Biscuity sweet, malty and edged by notes of Ceylon tea, pumpernickel, burnt toast, rolled oats and puffed wheat is the breakfast cereal-esque aroma - drabby and stale. Unremarkable and honestly ho hum on the palate had me asking is this it!? Creamy, frothy, light and unconsuming on the palate. Burnt fruit dominates and is long lasting. Candyish but on the scorched side. Burnt toast, light tannins, overbrewed Earl grey and then its oily in the finish to boot. Residuallly sweet and sticky and generally not much fun to drink. I was up here now I am down there type of beer. Disappointing! ( 12fl.Oz, no date stamp, Cellarbrations Carlisle)

Amber hazy. Dark sugar molasses notes. Some Caramalty as well. Sweet dry taste. Short finish. Tasty.
Pours a reddish amber, really quite pretty. Bready aromas backed by honey and malt. Sweet upfront, but balances out with hops and finishes off slightly bitter. Would happily drink again.
Bomber->SA glass. Cloudy light brown with 1/2 inch offwhite head.  Aroma is malt with overripe fruit.  Taste is wet barley, sour and a little rotten.  Ok.
Bottle from devilles pad. Straight from the stubbie. Aromas of honey, malts and caramel biscuit. Taste is quite hoppy with a heavy malt backing. Nice strong bitterness to finish. Pretty good stuff.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Bottle @ astral beers. It pours amber with a huge head on top. Malt and sweet honey for nose and mouth. A little hoppy hint balances the sweetness... no more description... A GREAT BEER!!

Delicious, fragrant, satisfying and complex. Spicy yet smooth. Awesome pint glass, too!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2012 Bottle in providence airport. Red amber color and thin white head. Sweet initial nose and well balanced hop taste. Fairly sweet but consistent with the bock styling. ---Rated via my mouth

Toffee colored pour. Medium-sized khaki colored head. Tons of lacing as it slowly falls down. Fruity, malty aroma with some hop notes. Big malty taste with fruity notes. Sweet with a bitter finish. Nice bready beer with enough fruit and malts to make it worth drinking more than one of.
Light citrus and bread aromas.  Dark brown body.  A semi-bitter flavor with flavors of bread and grass with a bitter finish.  Flavors are muted and not particularly notable.
From the bottle poured a light amber brew with a thick white head. Nice malty aroma with hints of honey. Medium bodied with malty sweet flavor with nicely balanced finish.

Bottle. Amber with pretty creamy head and thick lacing. Smells like honey on sour dough bread. Sweet like dried fruits with a pleasant light hoppiness. Seems well balanced with a finish that is liqueur like.

Keg at Euston Tap, London. Smells deliciously malty, complemented by the rich colour bordering on light brown. Light carbonation fizz gives mellow almost nutty flavours a kick. Not entirely without hops but they stand off to the side. I preferred this beer in America, but its plenty nice this side of the pond too.

A clear, reddish-orange pour with a white head.  The aroma is vaguely malty and boring.  It has a medium body with oily texture and average carbonation.  The taste is mildly sweet with some alcohol flavor in the finish.
Incredibly drinkable beer. Nice texture.  Great flavorful malt character.  Merky copper color.  Excellent smell of caramel malts fesh barley and light flowery scents.  Love this beer.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2012 Pours an opaque amber with a respectable two-finger head that recedes quickly releasing a huge hit of citrus and yeasty, biscuity notes of aroma. Also some sweet malt smell present. Medium carbonation makes for a good mouth feel. Taste is very earthy, yeasty and of herbs with some citrus. Short finish on the sides of the tongue make for a great drinking beer, but it doesnt have the IBUs or intense floral hoppiness that I  was expecting. Overall though, a very enjoyable beer.

small frothy white head. virtually none lacing. mostly diminishing. clear thick amber body. aroma: light malty, caramel. if and ff: moderate sweet light bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic light alcoholic finish. Delicioso aroma frutas vermelhas, lembra conhaque, mas menos alcoólico, sabor ligeiramente maltado, com delicioso dulçor de frutas vermelhas e toques de madeira, permeado por leve alcool, picante no final, lembrando gengibre 135 s

At first I thought it was any old brew.  Honestly I almost didnt like it. But then I realized it was what I was eating with it. Dont drink this while eating stir fry!  I had some left in my glass at the end of my meal and drank it after cleansing my palate, completely different ball game.

Nose: plum, yeast, sweet
Taste:sweet, belgian yeast like, thick body
Aftertaste: acidy, riped fruit, malt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(old notes) Clear orange pour with a decent lasting white head. Roasted malts and orange blossom honey on the nose. Flavor is dried fruit, malts, a little hops at the end. Bitter and dry finish. Not one of my favorite Rogues, but fair enough.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 Bomber, thanks Hoop! Caramel malt aroma with notes of bready malt and light grassy hops. Pours honey golden colored with a thin off white head that has some retention and lacing. Starts with a large amount of caramel malt sweetness that sticks to palate as well as a bit of bready malt. Finishes dry and smooth with a little bit of grassy hop bitterness cutting the sweet slightly. Have enjoyed this many times in the past and this time is no different!

Pours a lovely cloudy gold.  Almost gave it full marks on that front as it does look like liquid gold.  Quite a bit of malt on the nose, but this did not translate into the beer which is quite sweet without being too rich.
Does anyone else think this beer has an aftertaste that resembles blood/rusty iron?  Those are my only complaints, the buzz is good and the bottle looks awesome.
Pouts a hazy orange. Aroma is a spicy hop. With a similar taste. Another great beer from rogue.

This was an OK beer for me, maybe cellared too long.  Otherwise, the beer was fairly dry, no sweetness but a little maltiness, almost no hops.  Slight warming alcohol.  Solid but nothing great for me.

One of my go to beers. First time i drank this i wasnt to impressed. But that quickly changed for me. Rich hoppy flavor with a bit of citrus. Drinking it in october with a fire going watching football and the vp debate... booyaa

Draught at BrewDog Manchester. Hazy orange with a white head. Pale caramel malt is the base for a really nice and unusual taste profile with a very herbal, medicinal character. Orange and light tropical fruit coming through. Lots of interesting stuff going on. Hard to tell if this was a good introduction to the style since it confounded my expectations so much, but I would gladly try one again.

Subtle hop aroma on first pour. Strong malt nose. Taste is very indicative of a German style ale, although borders on tasting like a lager. Sweet malty finish with some fruity esters on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark orange clear beer with lasting beige head. Intense US hop nose with hints of chocolate limes. When I say hints I mean completely unsubtle flavors. Really nice in mouth, got good strong mouthfeel with malts and alcohol coming through. Then smooth choc lime finish with drying intense hoppiness. Superb with good lasting flavors

Rich dark fruit on the nose coupled to a rich malt note. Biscuity malt which is deep and rounded. A real one for a malt-head this, mild balanced hops that add a mild bitterness in a classic Germanic style. Perhaps a little sweet for me though, but pleasant.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a hazy dark amber with a nice off white 2 finger head that subsides into nice pillows of foam.

S: Nice malts right away with a light citrus hop poking through. Im picking up some light wheat as well.

T: The taste follows the nose. Typical nut-like malt and some light wheat with a little orange hop zest.

M: Medium body with good carbonation. Not much on taste left on the palate.

O: A very solid beer. Decent flavors and is definitely a beer I could drink a couple of in a night.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-29-2011
Pours anber with a slightly off white head. Aroma of caramel, bread and some light yeast. Not much hops character. Decent

From notes, 9/25/11:

Poured a 22oz bottle into a pilsner glass.

A: Hazy orange/amber with a good white head. Head retention great that settles into a nice hat on top that laces all the way down the glass.

S: Sweet malts, grassy hops, bready yeast.

T: Sweet malts (caramel, honey) and hops in the background, but pretty well balanced.

M: On the lighter side of medium, very drinkable.

O: Really enjoyed the balance on this one. Reminded me of an English Ale, as I dont have that much experience with Maibocks that arent fruity.

355ml bottle @ Angleterre, Helsinki

Pours dark reddish with a foamy head. Aroma of bready malts, hints of earthy notes and grass. Taste is malty and sweetish with notes of caramel and bready malts. Finish is malty and sweet with some sticky notes and hints of fruits. Okay, quite malty and sweet bock.

355 ml bottle @ Angleterre, Helsinki.
Pours a hazy amber orange colour with a white head. Aroma of grass, mandarin orange and strong butter. Flavour of grainy sweet malts, butter, grassy hops, hay and sweet fruitiness. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and high carbonation. Finishes grainy, light sweet and grassy. Good.

bottle.  Poured hazy amber with a small white head. Nice malty aroma. Medium mouthfeel, creamy texture and a slighty dry sticky finish. Bready malt flavour with some subtle citrus notes. Just a hint of alcohol at the end.
UPDATED: OCT 2, 2012 Very good, sweet and slightly fruity, malty, and dry. Refreshing and good with food and a football game. Was an excellent change of pace ale. Enjoyed it.
There is an odd, unsettling malty sweetness that over powers the hop bitterness and malt profile.  Cool bottle, neat name, lame brew.
Aromas of rich honey and slightly earthy. Golden brown colour. Nutty autumnal flavours, dry finish.

Foamy head over 	deep hazy bronze. Smells sweet from an odd mix of malts and yeast thats a little funky like old fruit. nice medium body with a bitter dominated taste and hoppy flavor to match. Almost like a dark IPA. Finished long, bitter and dry
Not my favorite style, but this is a nice version of it.  Beautiful amber color and very solid aroma.  Doesnt go down particularly easy for only 6.6%, but a nice changeup from an IPA or Stout.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2012 On tap...This beer is delicious! It smells sweet and yeasty indeed, mmMmm. The appearance is clear and ambery and small off white head. This one is a easy and delightful drinkability!

One of my first beers back when I was just getting in to good beer. This one continues to knock my socks off every time I have it. It is one of the best tasting, easily drinkable beers I have had the pleasure of tasting. Rogue did an excellent job on this ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
slight malt aroma, amber in color with a nice head. taste is malty but well balanced

Bottle from trade with coldbrewky, many thanks, sir. Hazy amber color with medium white head. Malty, fruity aroma together with honey. Taste, malt, honey, orange, orange zest, floral hops in background. Nice bitterness in finish. Nice, I enjoyed this beer.
Bottle from liquid treasure. Fairly malty before a quite sweet, honey like after taste. Very enjoyable indeed.
Dark copper color, smells of malt and hops. Nice clean finish with a little hop bite at the end. Decent brew.
Pours golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malty, with toffee and toastiness. Taste is also malty and toffee with notes of orange leading to a toasty and light bitter finish. Pretty good.
Earthy honey brown color, with a hearty hop flavor and a balanced finished. Not too sour or intense, this is a great ale for fans of hops who dont want to be punched in the nose.

Not bad...pours a caramel color and leaves a nice white head. Aroma of caramel and malts. Has a rich taste with notes of fruit and malts but quickly followed by bitterness that lingers after the swallow. Overall, an ok beer in my opinion.
A good beer, similar to the terrapin styles, with some honey in the nose and a honey malt taste.  A sweet medium bodied beer with some fruit notes and a hint of chocolate malt.

This is truly a great beer.  The cost is a little higher than I usually like.  But I enjoy diving into different beers and lagers and I am glad I decided to try Dead Guy Ale.  Mellow taste, Great palate, and bad ass bottle.  Ill be buying a few of these from time to time for sure.
Mid honey-amber with rich honey nose, dry Resinous hop bite, medium carbonation and long bitter finish.
not a big fan. too "earthy, skunky" tried a few bottles and really couldnt wait to get back to something german.
On tap in Beer Temple. Not impressed. Hazy orange colour and a malty and  caramel aroma. Flavour of bitter sweet malty fruits, dry hoppy aftertaste. Loads there but it just didnt seem very balanced.

I get something fruity and something a bit cough syrup.   Can't say its really pleasant.  Surprising since I'm a big fan of rouge hazelnut and coffe porters.

Clear amber color, fruity smell.  Low carb, which could be the bars fault.

As it stands, I wouldnt order again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - good size thick head, medium copper color, sweet malty aroma and flavor, with a little dry piney hop kick at the end
Bottle at 20 Railroad in Great Barrington, MA.  Hazy orange in color.   Aroma is malty with a good balance.  Very drinkable.  This is a very good ale.

A favorite of mine, with a rich dark distinctive taste. The label art is very cool, rogue has some the best art out there. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orange hazy in appearance with a sweet smelling malt aroma. Lite bitter taste and medium carbonation. Fits very well with the german oktoberfest style beer. Nice and simple just malt and bittering hops.

Bottle at Tekehtopa, july 31st 2012.
Amber body, big offwhite head.
Sweet aroma, malt, red berries, chocolate. 
Flowery taste with caramel, nuts, lemon. Good bitterness, dry finish
Very malty flavor, with just a hint of citrus and bitter finish, but not overpowering.  Very smooth and easy to drink.
Such an amazing beer, not overly strong upfront, sweet and bitter with mild hops make this just my style.

Had on draft at The Publik House in Peoria Heights, IL. Came in a 16 oz. English tumbler. Pours a nice reddish brown with a 1" head which slowly dissipated. Had a nice malty aroma. A rich, hearty flavor with a nice malty finish. Had understated citrus notes with a biscuity, malty finish.

Tap, pours hazy dark amber with medium off white head. Aroma is caramel, biscuits, sweet malts, some citrus. Taste is caramel, sweet biscuits, toffee, lemon, some woodyness. Medium mouthfeel, low-medium bitterness, medium sweetness. 
Nice, easy drinkable.

On tap at Fabulous Ferns 22oz pour
One of my favorite beers, so good I named my dog Rogue.
Pours a hazy orange, yellow  head. Slighty bitter. Very well balanced. This beer made me a craft beer drinker.

Draught @ The Rover. Pours tiny hazy pale amber with a creamy offwhite head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with sweet dark bread, caramel, slightly dry grass, lemon zest and toffee. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and fruity with sweet dark bread, dark grapes, grass, prunes, wood, caramel, hazelnuts, cereal and orange zest. Mouthfeel is round, tiny oily bitter and medium bodied. Finish is sweet, bitter and malty with sweet dark bread, dark grapes, caramel, wood and hints of pine. Nice and malty...

This may be the best ale I have tried. I am normally a darker beer kind of guy but this is a great all around beer. It has a perfectly even mouth to it, hits your palate with just the right amount of carbonation. It has a hint of the wheat flavor, with hoppiness but not too much. Total package with this one. Lives up to expectations.

Hazy orange colour, small off-white yellowish lasting head, little in the lacings department. Aroma of dried fruits, malts and slight caramel. Fine bitterness in flavour, sour fruits and hops, bits and pieces of sweetness for balance makes for a very tasty brew.

1 Pt bottle poured into snifter glass.  Color is a dark amber, off-white head disappears fast.  Aroma of toffee, maple, honey and general maltiness.  Taste is sweet and ends a little hoppy.  Overall kind of one-dimensional, dont hate it but I dont see myself buying again.

A-- Poured a brownish gold color. Had a thin head that quickly disappeared.

S-- Sweet (carmel), malty and a touch of hops.

T-- Malty at first and sweet carmel as well. Finishes with the hops.

M-- Good carbonation. Medium body and flavorful. Like how it goes from sweet to a slight amount of hoppiness.

D-- Good beer. Plain and simple. Easy to drink 2-3 of these. My favorite Rouge beer and always worth drinking.
Nice amber pour with a big head. Pretty cool lacing. Maple, honey, and a really nice smoothness. Very little bitterness. Nothing bad, nothing exceptional either. Kinda right in the middle. 041012
Just one good ale. Good color, smell and taste. The light nutty taste of this ale toe makes it one of my top 20

Mildly nutty aroma with hints of cheese.  On the palate its well balanced and goes down easy and smooth.  Little banana fruit and citrus hops round everything out.  I could probably drink this beer in any occasion.  Well done by Rogue.
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2015 Dark copper color..on draught at Dubh linn square.   Bitter spicy flavour.  Strong, but easy drinking.

Bottles and on tap tons of times. Pours deep reddish brown with small to medium white head and alright lacing. Aromas and taste are very boozey, realy take you back. Notes of bitter stale hops, dark fruits, spice, lots of caramel malt sweetness. This was probably one of the first 10 craft beers I tried, my palate has changed since then but this one isnt a bad choice if your at a run of the mill bar that serves this stuff.

Light oak notes with caramel and toffee. Lighter body and pale character. Great afternoon ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy copper pour.  Earth hops on nose. Some citrus on taste but they blend together nicely. Good ale as most know

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
FINALLY a nice hoppy beer in India. Nice bitterness with fruity notes and nice roundness. Dark amber and reddish in color with a white head.

Unique aromas of sweet bread, cloves and floral hops. Perfect copper color with a small foam at the top. Quick bitter hop bite upfront with a nutty, caramel malt to back it up. Alcohol is slightly noticeable on the finish. Overall, Dead Guy Ale brings some nicely balanced flavors and easy drinkability. Id give this a B- rating.
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2014 Great beer. Copper color giving way to a great flavor. Would buy again and again.

Very malty aroma.  Maybe some caramel.  Not much taste up front though sort of sweet.  Perfect amount of hoppy finish.  Dont love it but I think its good.  Not a huge pale ale guy but this I can definitely drink again.

Malty with a nice citrus flavor good balance of sweetness and slight bitterness 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle: Malty caramelic aroma. Light notes of hops. Dark amber color, creamy head. Flavor is malty sweet, caramelic, hoppy.
Good drink in the fall, loads of flavor so not a session beer. On the edge of  my hops limit but still pretty balanced.
This beer has a good flavor and a great name. I love the skeletal tap topper and get excited when I see it at a bar. If its on draught, Im almost always going to order one.
Draft to pint.  Looks good; amberish with nice carbonation and lacing.  Smells and tastes malty with good balance.  Average on the palate.  Good.

Tastes like bread, caramel, and more hops than Im used to in a bock. Lacks the German beer taste that most bocks have, probably due to the ale yeast. This is a solid beer, though it tends to be overpriced.

Bottled.  Light-to-mid amber in color.  Initial pour resulted in a slight cloudiness which dissipated after about 10 minutes.  Head was tan and frothy.  Had a lightly bitter taste with a clean finish.  It was medium body with little-to-no aftertaste.  Overall, a decent beer, and one that I would drink again, but I wouldnt go out of my way to get it.

This is my favorite beer, not just from Rogue, but from anyone.
Smooth, full of flavor, not too hoppy, a hint of honey and malt.

Drank this dozens of times, but just now getting around to rating.  Clear amber pour with fair khaki head ring.  Somewhat sweet toffee nose gets much sweeter in the flavor.  Earthy sweetness and caramel pervade, but there is a distinct bitterness on the tail for balance.  I dont know, I used to like this beer a lot, but now its not really my cup of tea.
Pours light amber. Bitter taste with a strange to me finish. Overall not horrible but disappointing. This is not the droid I am looking for. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep amber color, lots of flavors to me and I taste malt, and carmel. Crisp and fresh, very good ale.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a small white head. Aroma is malty and caramel, toasted with alcohol notes. Taste is sweet and malty, citric notes. Quite bitter finish. Nore like a IPA than a bock.
Amber colour. Taste is very malty, notes of caramel, sweet.

Bottle from my other brother. Pours a clear dark reddish-brown with little head. No real lacing; quite non-carbonated. Aroma has caramel malts, earth and a bit of sweet fruits. Taste is of heavily malted sweet caramel, some spiciness. Lighter body than expected from the look or initial taste. Somewhat earthy with a nice bitter/sweet, somewhat subtle, finish. Actually better than I remember it being. Much more an amber than any sort of bock (mai or helles), imo.
Draught @ George and Dragon, Barcelona. Amber colour with  a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt. Malty, sweet flavour.

Draft at the Fastnet Pub in Newport.  As with most things from Rogue this one is exceptionally good.  Lots of caramel richness and plenty of malt to sink your teeth into.  Exotic is not an exaggeration to describe all the flavors and malts youll find here.  Highly recommended as a starter ale for those wanting to come over to the heavy side of things.
A bit light for my taste. Honey notes bordering on fruity, probably a good summer beer if it werent so bitter. Not my favorite by Rogue.
NIce beer. Not to big on its taste but its drinkable. Tried other Rogue beers and this one is my favorite so far.
Medium body thst is one of the more crisp and refreshing Rogue beers. Hearty with hints of citrus and herbs. Alcohol is well masked.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2012 This has been one of my favorite ales over the past few years, although I am not as big a fan now as I was about two or three years ago.  Although considered a Maibock, it is somewhat darker and maltier than most Maibocks.  It pours a slightly cloudy amber with a white head that dissapates quickly.  Strong aroma of sweet malt.  Very well balanced, flavorful and easy to drink. Dead Guy is a fine all-around ale that I enjoy throughout the year.  I would also like to note that I experienced amazing customer service from the staff at Rogue Ales.
One of my favorite beers, some hoppyness, roasted, mocha taste. Pretty easy to drink, surprisingly. After a few of these, you can really feel it! A+

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a fairly large white head that fades leaving a little lacing. Aroma is sweet malt with a hint of honey. Taste is also plenty of sweet malt with just a tiny hint of hops.

On tap @ Georgetown Liquor Company. Pours dark amber with thin head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Taste is a handful of malt flavors: dark roasted ones with some light sweet ones thrown in as well. Nice hops on the back for balance but make no mistake, the malts are the star here.
A little malty, slightly bitter.  This is a very refreshing beer that has a little more bite than I expected. But finished very smooth.

Not bad, not bad at all.  Its all about balance here, I think - hoppy and malty, flavourful but not overpowering, boozy but drinkable.  It deserves its reputation, and I dont think I can add more than a hundred-and-one other commentators - its very nice!
Smells slightly malty, its a crystal clear amber color and has little head retention. You taste malt and biterness, with a bitter aftertaste. It was a medium body. Worthna try
This beer was good great taste but still get the hip flavor i got it at the cheyenne brew fest

Dayton, OH, airport, from the bottle, no pour. Pretty refreshing, but nothing stupendous. Goes down easy, could imagine drinking a case. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2012 On tap at Mellow Mushroom. Amber color. Small white head. Smell not strong. Nutty, some hops. Smooth, good taste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
very enjoyable beer coming from Oregon. Rich flavor with a malty aroma and a beautiful color.

355 mL bottle. Pours an orange tinted amber, frothy white head of tight bubbles, nice lacing left behind as it fades to a thin cap.  Complex malt aromas, brown sugar, earth, sweet spices and roasted meat. Good orange scented hop balance.  Medium bodied with medium carbonation, clean on the palate with a lingering malty finish. Another great product from Rogue, too bad theyre so hard to come by up here.
Surprisingly high alcohol content for its moderate taste.  Great flavor in mouth, short-lasting aftertaste.
Aroma is sweet with malts and honey.  Pours amber with a nice off white head.  Taste is sweet and malty.  Very good.
a nice light aroma with hints of hops.  a lovely blend of flavors with light maltiness and medium body.  a great crisp dry finish.

Bottle at Brewery Tap, Brighton. It pours clear deep amber, with a big white head. The nose is caramel malt, toast, dark fruit and some tanginess. The taste is toast, caramel, wood, leather, dust, metal and alcohol warmth, with a long dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Not bad.
12 oz bottle.  Pours a thick head with nice lacing. Complex flavors, raisin, smoke, licorice. Great beer

Draft at the Beer Temple.  Pours almost clear amber with a small off white head.  Aroma of fudge, toffee and malts.  Flavour is sweet with a lovely fudge aspect but also slightly fruity with citrus and light bitterness.  Medium bodied with soft to medium carbonation.
Cloudy dark orange with thin head. Sweet caramel, dried fruit, light hops. Sweet flavor, with only the slightest bitterness. Very sweet and easy to drink. Light body goes along with sweetness.

Tap @ beer temple. 
Pour deep, slightly hazy amber, with a small White head. 
Aroma of slight pine, grass, caramel, fudge. Big malt profil. 
Taste is a little bitter, with a lot of sweetness. 
Medium body, with a slight lively carb.
Pours cloudy amber with a low head. Aroma is malts and honey. Flavor is malts, honey and hops. Splendid.

Pours an amber color with some frothy light tan head. Aroma is mostly sweet malts with a bit of vanilla and also some light hop citrus character. Flavor is initially tart and then begins to sweeten up and then finishes with a slightly bitter hop profile but a little bit of tartness persists throughout. As the beer warms up, some of the tart flavor wears off and a more caramel sweet flavor presides. The profile of the aroma also becomes much sweeter. Good stuff.

Least favorite beer from rogue. Pours out a bright orange amber with a big fluffy head. Overly grainy nose and taste with some sickly toasted notes. Very one toned beer...just gross griny malts and nothing else,
Bottle. Hazy amber with small tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops andd caramel. Flavour is malt, fruit, caramel, medium sweet, hops, little bitter, toffee, spices, little bread and nutty.

Beautiful amber color - but it doesnt look like a bock to me.
Citrusy and slight sweet aroma.
Very light sweetness, bitter aftertaste.
Smooth, very drinkable.

A pleasant if unexciting beer.

Mostly clear bright golden orange pour with solid head.  Aroma is nice.  Light malt, lemon, orange, raisins, yeast.  Taste is sweet malt at first which turns to lemon and fruit with little yeast at the end.  Very smooth and delicious.  I could drink a lot of these.  Seems hoppy for a Heller Bock but thats probably why I like it a lot.

This is a bock? Apart from mouthfeel, this seems more like a Pale Ale to me. Orange in appearance aroma and taste. Caramel, but less than I usually get from the style. Flavour remains the same from sip to belch. Lightly hopped.

Poured from the bottle into a 4oz sampling glass to drink.  The beer had an amber color with a smallish foamy white head that had low retention and cling, but good lacing.  Its aroma featured a floral and fruity blend with touches of caramel, and also lemon and citrus hops components.  The taste was somewhat sweet and had floral and fruity notes, along with a mixture of grainy and citrus bitterness.  The beer had a wet body with low carbonation and fizz, but a dry finish, with an average thickness and mouthfeel.  Thank you to Eric and Siobhan for the tasting.

Poured from a 12 ouncer to a burnt amber color, white head with decent lacing. Theres not a very lively body to the beer, but it has a refreshing malt front end and a honey and very slightly herbal taste. I enjoyed this beer.

Pours a lovely amber color from the bomber with solid white dissipating head and decent lacing. Aroma is slight, but some decent german malts and wheat. Taste is malty, a bit of sweetness, and a nice bitter back end. Great beer, and you can?t even taste the alcohol.

Aroma is a beautiful mix of a creamy orange smell and slightly sweet, maybe a bit of honey and grapes as well. It poured a nice honey/orange that was slightly cloudy and a thick white head. Taste is pretty much like the smell, which is a very good thing, kind of malty and a little bit of hops towards the finish.  Feels very creamy and smooth in your mouth. Love it!

I rather liked this. The nose is honey and bread malt character with just a whiff od hops. The beer is amber with a billowy white head that leaves big lacy rings all down the glass. The taste is malt forward with notes in the bread and honey range complemented by a slight herbal spicy hop note. The beer is medium bodied and very smooth.
Clear copper, short light tan head Spicy malt aroma, caramel, yeast. Taste is a slight bitter/sweet mix. Overall, Im not crazy about it though.

Decent aroma. Really love the dark, clear color of the beer. Bittering hops are not terribly overpowering. Rather, enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
amber wth small head. nice full maltiness with sweetness. touch of hops in the finish.

Pours dark amber with low thick white to yellow head
Aromas of caramell malts, barley, raisins and some tropical hops
Very sweet barrel like taste, honey on tongue afterwards. Low bitterness, low carbonation. Quite nice palate but could use more bitterness and depth
Pours a cloudy slightly thick apricot colour. Smells like sweet malts and grains and bread. Nice sweet malty grainy flavors. Balanced beautifully with a slightly bitter finish. Delicious ale.

On draught at Spritzer's NYC. This beer is wonderful American representation of the Maibock style. It poured light amber with a quickly dissipating head. Couldn't get much aroma, slight malt. Full malt flavor with a bit of finishing citrusy bite from the Saaz hops, but balanced. It resurrected this dead guy! 

---IdealBrew "Good People Good Beer"
Bottle from super market. Amber color, white head. Hoppy taste with a lot of caramel, some grape and dry bitter finish. Great pale ale.

Ive tried this on tap at the Bottom Lounge, Chicago, IL in 08 and at the Subterranean, Chicago, IL in 11. Also several times times bottled between  07 and 12. I have found this to be a very unsavory beer. Every time it has been the same.  It is astringent, somewhat sour and most acidic. It is skunky as well.  When I drink this beer I am most reminded of two experiences. The first is the taste that was left in my mouth after experiencing gastroesophageal reflux. The second experience is from my childhood when I accepted a dare and touched a 9V battery to my tongue. I will not allow my tongue endure this beer again. I would love to try the beer that is described above, but this is not it.

Bottle- good malt aroma, amber in colour. Good malt taste with enough hop bitterness too make it interesting. I enjoyed this beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Copper color with small white head. Aroma caramel malt. Medium body with a little carbonation. Flavor is malty and sweet but not too sweet and with just a touch of bitterness

341ml bottle. A little cloudy orange-reddish body with a moderate yellow head, good retention. Oily look. Aroma is hoppy, sweet caramel, orange peel, hint of nutmeg, some cheesiness.
Taste is a little sour, malt, grassy hops German style, hints of pine and citrus. Not too complex.

Copper color with small white head.  Aroma caramel malt.  Medium body with a little carbonation.  Flavor is malty and sweet but not too sweet and with just a touch of bitterness.  Simple and satisfying.

Clear warm golden oragne with a good-looking, long lasting white head and lace.  The taste is an unexpected pleasure: a big start of warm caramel malt, followed soon by a hop bittering that takes charge, but never obliterates the malt.  The finish waffles back and forth between bitter and sweet for a totally satisfying experience.  A real winner!

My May Day beer cause this was the closest thing to a Mai Bock that I could find. Always have loved the label name or this beer. Classic.

Amber-orange coloring with nice head and lacing. The aroma has a lot of sweet maltiness. Touch of hops too. The taste follows pretty well. Big sweet malt. Caramel, caramel. A solid bitterness throughout. Fairly normal medium mouthfeel. 

Nice enough for a May Day sacrifice to the beer gods.
12oz bottle. Very nice looking clear copper colour with some sparkles and a small frothy head. Medium body, thick with lively carbonation. Tastes nice too. Very good ale.
Light amber with off white foam that settles nicely. Great beer smell and nice bitter hop taste. Some caramel but not much. Nice bitter lasting taste in mouth, dry. (Galveston 201205)
Pours A orange amber color with a white head. Aroma of caramel and citrusy-hops. Taste is sweet with a lot of caramel malt undertone. Goes down easy. Medium body.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2012 Note: points are for the last sampling, as the first one was clearly a bottle that was kept too long. Glad I got a fresh one!
3/VIII/2012 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from Exchange Shopette (Ramstein Airbase) @ Nadines place - BB: n/a, but it was fresh! - (2012-xxx) 
Clear pale amber beer, big creamy yellowish head, pretty stable, adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, peaches, pineapple, citrus, red berry jam. MF: ok carbon, medimu body. Taste: pretty fruity, citrus, some passion fruit, piny bitterness, pineapple, some caramel malts. Aftertaste: grassy bitterness, peaches, bit piny, dry herbal finish.

1/V/2012 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ home - BB: n/a (2012-454) Thanks to Jacob and his parents for the bottle!
Ar: 8, Ap: 3, T: 5, P: 3, O: 12, Total: 3.1
Very little cloudy amber beer, small off-white head, dissipates quickly, little adhesive. Aroma: very sweet, malty, milk chocolate, caramel, lots of strawberry jam, bit of hay, boiled grains and somewhat sugary. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: some citrus up front, followed by a bit of dark chocolate with orange peel, bitter hops, some caramel, tastes a bit like an English bitter. Aftertaste: sweet malts, honey, little flowery, overripe fruits. Not bad, but probably drunk too old. (+- 1yo)

Originally reviewed: 10/13/08. Had this on tap at the First Street Draught House here in Winston. Came out a nice deep golden color with about an inch worth of head. Fairly good retention that left excellent rings along glass edge. 

Smell of spices and citrus. Nice floral hop scent over all.

Taste was very good. A little malt sweetness that was kicked out of the way by the crisp hop bitterness on the finish. Nice aftertaste. 

Moderate bitterness. Creamy and smooth characteristics make this highly drinkable. Recommend you try this one.

22 oz bottle pours a clear orange/amber color wityh a tiny white head and a bit of lacing.  Nose is nutty.  Aroma has caramel and almonds. Finish is a little more bitter than the first taste.  Medium body with average carbonation.  Quite enjoyable, with wide distribution,  but too expensive to be my everyday beer and not fantastic/outrageous enough to be my weekend treat.

On tap at Schouskjelleren
Medium body & complexity
Sweet beer & ok aromas
A bit disappointing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a cloudy amber with little head. I cant get much smell of this one. It has a lighter finish and a very easy taste.
Brown with some red coloring caramel malt slight hop flavor and slight alcohol flavor.  Great summer time beer.

Tap. Aroma a spicy hop scent that is mouthwatering.  Zero head.  Minimal lacing.  Taste is spectacularly complex with sweet pine hops and a wonderful not harsh aftertaste.  This beer is in my top 20 I really enjoy it whether its bottled or tapped.   Weird I really like a rogue beer (sarcasm)

Aroma is not bad little spice little sweet and malty. copper tone and cloudy in appearance with a one in of white head that dimishes quickly no real lacing. I get a apple spice with a sweet carmel flavor. really easy to drink and very refreshing. overall a decent beer would drink a lot more if it did not cost so much. this is a recommend for sure.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2013 On tap @Barcelona Beer Festival 2012.Malty aromas, light copper color, nice white head. Medium body, long finish.
Update May 2013 on [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */úpulo Feroz, Oviedo: yeasty and some resin aromas. Pours amber, cloudy, with nice vanishing off-white head, some lacing. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Taste is sweet, dried fruit, some caramel, a bit spicy. Sweet aftertaste.

Pours a dark orange color with a small white head that mostly diminished, and Ok acing. Aroma is very malty. Taste is also caramel malty with a bit of grapefruit hops. Fairly smooth mouthfeel and medium in body.

May 2010: On tap in Ales and Aces (Las Vegas).

A pint, served in a Sierra Nevada Celebration glass. The bar is dark and difficult to see in, but the beer looked a copper-amber colour, slight haze to it and a white head on top.

The nose was more malt than hop, with a caramel sweetness tempered with a spiced sourness.

The thoughts of sour caramel carried on into the taste and I couldnt get the thoughts out of my head. A faint hop bitterness came through, but otherwise I couldnt get past my thoughts.

Interesting, but Id never have considered it a Maibock if it had been a blind tasting. Too weak in the mouthfeel for me.

Overall, a great beer.  This style is definitely under-valued, one of my new favorites!!  12oz bottle, decent head, medium copper color.  Great medium body, a little bit of hops, and a smooth aftertaste.  Another winner from Rogue.

Nice cloudy orange color with minimal head, has a bready caramel scent. Has a really nice bitter caramel taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color is dark amber, one finger head. Not much to the smell, it has a fresh sweetness to it. The taste is very light and crisp, with some sugar and malt barely peeking through. This is the first beer of this style I've had. If it was cheaper, it would be a good summer/session beer. But it's overpriced.
I got the 1/2 gallon of this, and I was pretty sure they got this mixed up with a shipment of Natural Light.

Clear copper, short light tan head
Spicy malt aroma, caramel, yeast.
Taste is a slight bitter/sweet mix.
A little hoppy.
Interesting taste, a lot going on,
Pretty good beer.
Pours orange wuth huge white head...aroma us fruity mild caramel malts..taste is bitter citrus full flavor goodness..like it alot
Deep honey in color with a malty aroma. Rich hearty flavor and a well balanced finish.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2012 Pours a hazy burnt orange with a thin white head.  Smells of caramel and light orange...some yeast.  Tastes really interesting.  Somewhat sweet at the front...a nice maltiness comes on stronger at the end of the taste.  Lovely on the palate....a lot going on.  Lightly carbonated.
One of my personal favorites. Nice blend of sweetness and bitterness very balanced. Bonus points for the bottle art

Draft.  Pours a redish amber.  Small white head.   Flavor is sweet with some spice.  Sweetness is nice, not overwhelming.  Lots of malt.  Medium bodied.  Enjoyed this with an excellent cajun meal while on vacation.  Very enjoyable.
Medium body, nutty and complex malts. Buttery mouth feel and sticky going down. Slight bitters and clean finish. Likeable.

06.04.2012. 0,33l Bottle. Thanks to Gunnar!! Golden orange colour with off-white head. Hazy and unclear. Strong beer with rich malty aroma. Very rich with lots of malty flavours. Gentle soft bitterness with a little sour aftertaste. There is also some sweetness. Complex and good beer.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. thanks DSG. Pours an hazy yellow to orange with a medium head, aroma of hops, marmalade, orange and apricot jam, flavor of hops, a bit dry with jammy sweetness, medium bodied

Poured from a 12-oz. bottle into a pint glass. Just about one finger of head. Color was orange caramel. Light lacing on the top that dissipated into a small circle rather quickly. No film on the sides throughout the pour.

Smelled caramel malts up front. Lots of malts actually. Got some light citrus notes, maybe orange? 

Tasted pretty close to the smell. Got lots of caramel notes. Also some sugary malts, honey and maybe even toffee. Slight hint of corn in there as well. Nothing too complex here. 

Medium body. Sticky texture. Below average carbonation. Abrupt watery finish.

Nothing special about this beer except the name.
