Pours a dark amber color with a white head and some lacing. Aroma is of caramel, molasses and sweet toasted malts. Taste is very sweet caramel. Medium bodied.

Dark amber in color. Very little light amber head and good lacing.  Aroma is strong bittersweet roasted malts. Taste is an interplay of strong roasted caramel malts with a bitter strawberry fruity hops and some hints of chocolate. Strong retention for aftertaste. Great beer.
Pours an amber color with a beige head and nice lacing. Aroma of cramel, dough, and faint citrus. The flavor is lightly sweet caramel  with a touch of hop bitterness. Medium bodied and smooth.

Bottle.  Hazy bronze with a small fast fading white head.  Nose is bready malt, light herbal hops.  Flavor is lightly sweet, flinstones vitamins, mild bitternes.  Less sweet than some bottles and draught Ive had in the past.  Light carbonation, very drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 Rogue Dead Guy Ale is bronze in color and has a nutty aroma thats immediately apparent once opened.  The initial taste is rich and complex: first you taste a bit of malt followed by bitter hops and a hint of fruit.  The taste lingers for about a good half-minute.  My only major complaint is the longer term after-effect is rather dry, and this dryness becomes more pronounced after a second beer.  Its also expensive here in southwestern Missouri - six-packs go for almost $13 at my local stores.  2014 REVISIT: Found a bomber that was cheaper, so wanted to see what I thought of this with a more experienced palate.  There is some nuttiness, but also a strong lager type of aroma.  The hops are not that bitter, but I stand by the malt and fruit descriptions from my original rating.  Dryness is spot-on.  This is a pretty flavorful brew, and it fits the heller bock descriptions Ive read rather well: dry, some hops, yet mostly malty.

Look: Golden - Orange. Creamy - type head thin but persistent 
Nose: loads- Sweetish, ?dried fruit, hops, almost cloves
Taste: mild carbonation, tons of flavour, almost sweet-ish, alcohol evident, lingers and expands.
Lovely

What makes this beer special are its complex malty tones. Its aroma before tasting is quite deceptive in that it doesnt give you really any idea of what you are in for. Once you taste it your senses come alive (pun intended) and you will really enjoy the full character of this complex beer
12 oz bottle pours amber with a white head.  Aroma of malts, citrus and a hint of nuts.  Taste is malt and a bit of citrus hops.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. thanks DSG. Pours hazy blond with little-to-no head. A little apple and sweet apricot aroma, tastes smooth, light bitterness and apricot. Hardly any carbonation, medium body.
orange color, aroma of toast, citrus fruits, flavors of toasted nuts, caramel, butterscotch, citrus fruits, great balance, and highly drinkable, very interesting brew
Poured a nice amber color with a white head. Aroma was sweet malt with a touch of citrus .Nice rounded feel with a light sweetness followed by a slightly tart finish and some alcohol undertones.

Bottle - pours a hazy light orange, thin head and some carbonation. I didnt detect much of an aroma but then again Ive been on a month-long IPA binge so Im sure something is there. Its only the second Heller Bock Ive rated but its head and dead guy shoulders above the other one (Covington Bayou Bock). Has a malty taste of bread and biscuits, a medium body and a slick texture for a mouthfeel. Decent.

Pours a cloudy orange color with a small white head.  It has a heavy toasty malt with hints of nuts and citrus/herbs as well.  A pretty complex taste with a little of everything, it has just the right amount of sweetness and bitterness with just a hint of sour.  The body is light with a thin texture and good carbonation.  The finish is slightly bitter with hint of sweetness and it leaves you wanting more.  This is a very interesting and good beer.  I havent really had a beer like this it is kind of unique so it is difficult to rate.
This is an OMG beer. I love it. enough so that visiting the brewery seemed worthwhile. Great color, flavor and its so smooth.
Great malty nose.  Deep copper-orange in color.  Maltiness dominates the flavor.  Hops are fairly mild.  Quite a good beer.

Aromas of honey, soft orange blossom touches, a nice malty backbone give this beer a really enticing scent. The flavour is malted wheat, hints of candy, some bitter orange and a long sweet, and slightly sour hopped, finish.

Aroma: Sweet malt and honey. Doughy, salty bread smell.

Appearance: Hazy, copper body. Dense off-white head that lasts. Huge carbonation. Sticky lacing. 

Taste: Malt flavours - virtually no hop bitterness. Sweet honey. Strange, off-putting salty flavour. 

Palate: Slick, oily texture. Soft carbonation. 

Overall: Totally lacking in hop character, so feels quite empty. Bizarre saltiness to the beer. Disappointing given Rogues reputation.

Pours a slightly hazy amber with a medium white head that doesnt last long.  The aroma is fruity, sweet malt, and perfume.  The taste is malty, caramel, butterscotch, and earthy hops.  Its well balanced with moderate hop bitterness.  Overall, pretty good.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2013 Dark Amber in color with a hazy appearance. Aroma of honey, caramel,floral hops barley and malts. Flavors are caramel, honey, butterscotch, sweet malts, yeasts and barley. Needless to say, its a pretty sweet tasting ale. Its a bit on the thicker side, but it comes off as being creamy and smooth thanks to the low carbonation. In general, its worth checking out and I think of it as a good beer for those new to the craft beer scene to try out!

Pours a beautiful amber color with a tan head. A very drinkable brew with a nice balance of malt to hops - balance leans to a mild hoppy flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

on draft pours dark almost red in color with no head and some decent carbonation. the aroma is of sweet malt followed by the same sweet malt flavor very well balance with not real bite of hops. just a good flavor that digs deep into the malt base. whats not to love about this beer.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dagans place. Hazy deep golden. Aroma of piney and resinous hops, slightly stale. Sweetish flavor with some malt, fruits, honey hints and a moderately bitter finish. Medium-bodied. Decent.
Just ok. Golden amber with a quickly disappearing head. The nose doesnt offer much. Malty palate with a hint of sweetness. Soft,  easy drinking mouthfeel.

Rogue Dead Guy Ale has a thick, creamy, off-white head and a hazy, amber appearance, that really hazes up once one swishes the bottom 20% of the contents and adds that in. There is a good amount of lacing and some streaming bubbles. Aroma is of grain husks, sweetness, and bread. The taste is of malt, a bit of over-ripe fruit, sweetness, syrup, and a decent amount of nice hop bitterness at the end. Mouthfeel is rather thick and gooey, but Rogue Dead Guy ale finishes fairly crisp and dry. Overall, this is an excellent beer. RJT
pours a light redish gold with a small head. This ale is highly carbonated with a light sweetness and malty.
Decent beer, mostly malty with a little bit of a hop bite.  Maybe a little bready.    Light to medium body.  I felt like this was sort of missing something.

355ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep gold bordering on copper with ample white head. Nice sticky lacing. Aroma is citrusy hops and brown sugar sweetness. Taste is grapefruit hops and fruity sweetness. Nice full body. Overall, quite similar to a good American pale ale.

Tasted as White Crane Bitter. Cloudy dark orange with a medium-sized off-white head. Sweet vanilla and doughy, bready malt aromas. Medium bodied, sweet malted attack. Creamy, slick texture, soft carbonation, and a sticky sweet, mildy bitter finish. Signature Rogue finish for their signature beer.

Bottle. Aroma is Mild citrus and very well balanced. Color is a medium gold with decent lace and good light head. Taste is malt that blankets your palette which then begins to lift with mild grapefruit. Great definition of an Ale. Nothing life changing.

Bottle at home. Pours a reddish amber with a faint white head. It has a fresh white loaf malty fruity aroma, thin on the palate but with quite a bite as it flows over the tongue. Dry and fruity with subtle cherry and prune there is a real honey sweetness in the aftertaste . This beer has a subtle lightness of flavour a little alcohol burn that is very pleasant. A nicely understated Maibock proving that great beer doesnt have to be bold and brash.

a: a light copper color with carbonation, good lacing, slightly cloudy

s: hops with some pine and citrus notes

t: nice balance between hops and sweet malt. A Very well balanaced beer

m&d: I would consider this a medium body beer, but the carbonation made this beer extremely drinkable. Nice taste and refreshing character made this a great brew to enjoy

Copper color, medium white foamy head. Aroma is malty,fruity and sweet. A medium bodied. Fairly malty, yet with a nice strong hop bite. Some hop spiciness. Smooth taste. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is crisp and smooth.
missing a level of hoppiness and malt that I typically prefer, but far better than most bottled ales.
pours deep amber and has aroma of doughy malt and caramel.  Taste has some mild bitterness.

On tap at old bag of nails. Clear reddish color with a light amount of carbination. Strong aroma of fruits with some roasted malts and hoppyiness. Taste is sweet and doughy balanced with the hops on the backend. Light to medium body. Had 2 pints that went well with my jalapeno sliders ~ sweet and spicey.

Pours dark amber with a small head.
Nose shows caramel, butterscotch and diacetyl. Very sweet smelling, very moreish.
Similar flavours but less sweet and less emphasis on the butterscotch. Finishes a little harsh with some industrial alcohol notes.
Nice syrupy body.
dark copper colour. sweet honey aroma, dense malts. full bodied malty flavour leading to a good degree of bitterness. Not overly carbonated which i like but perhaps lacking in a memorable aftertaste.

Bottle. Orangish colour with minimal off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, sweet and with fruity notes. Flavour is slightly caramelish at the beginning, fruity. The final is slightly bittery with an average duration. Carbonation medium. Body is light to medium.

Murky amber orange, foamy off white head settles down quickly. Aroma of rich sweet malts and faint citrus hops. Well balanced, dark sweet malts with a firm spruce hop background. Finishes bitter and dry with some alcohol. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)
I had a sip of this brew at a party so i am partially familiar with this thing.Has that american carbonation and skunky pressence on the hops as well as a sour aftertaste
Pours mid brown, pale head. Distinct fruity and slughtly floral aroma of hops. Caramel malts balanced by good bitterness. Dry, hoppy finish.

Pours a nice honey-amber colored ale with a decent head. Smells of sweet fruity esters with a hint of malt. Mouth feel is good, not too light. Tastes of sweet malt with a little bit of tang on the back end. Overall a great maibock, would drink again.
Nice medium bodied, copper in color, nice hop balance against the the malty goodness.  This is one of my favorite everyday ales, Id drink it more if it were priced lower.
Reddish-amber color, no head. Rich, sweet, tangy, and malty. Lively carbonation. Toasty, nutty, and brown sugar notes.

Quite possibly my favorite Ale! This has been one of my favorites since back in my college days (Florida State Univ grad. 2001). The pour from the bottle is a beautiful copper color with a cloudy/white head. The aroma is of hops, spice and has a medium body and the aftertaste finished strong. Just the right bitterness - every time I want a quality Ale Dead Guy is what I pick up.
Caramely malty aroma. Pours an orange color with a pale amber head. Tastes caramely with a slight bitter finish.
12oz bottle, pours a dark amber with frothy off white head.  A touch of hops in the aroma, very malty a bit sweet, overall a fantastic mass produced beer.
bottle. deep yellow gold. foamy white head. bready hop aroma. decent daily drinker. a step up from many other mass produced beers.

Fairly stern and well stewed signature hop scent. Bottle was perhaps overchilled but murky ear wax brown throughout, insignificant head - again perhaps due to the fact the bottle looked like it was in the fridge for weeks. Speaking of weaks (lol) a sticky zest on initial taste doesnt add much more to the undercurrent of lingering fizz. An earthly, honest malt stamp to finish but nothing special. I recall being more impressed with this on first tasting years ago. (Bottle, Blackfriars, Glasgow)

From a bottle in Japan. A somewhat strong beer with a lot of character. Hoppy, but not like a double. A bit malty, too. A bit creamy, goes down smooth. Not very thick or heavy for somewhat strong beer. Leaves a very pleasant, not overly bitter aftertaste. Solid drinking beer.

Pours clear copper with full white/tan head. Subtle aroma of caramel, dark fruits, sweet bread. Taste is medium sweetness. Medium body, slick texture, sweet finish. Overall quite good and good representation of the style.

Pours cloudy coper with a frothy off-white mostly diminishing head. Smells inviting, medium intensity, with caramel, hops, and spice. Medium intensity, body, and aftertaste. Round and creamy texture. Tastes sweet/sour and finishes with some bitterness and sweetness. Complex/well balanced quality. Appreciated
Red color with a smallthin white head. Fruity aroma (strawberry and cherry), malty. taste is metallic, malt. Dry finish and soft carbonation. Body is medium.

27/01/2012 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Bevuta al Rogue Beer Festival. Ambrata, viva, lievemente torbida, schiuma bianco sporca morbida. Aroma di malto, note di caramello, zuccherose, frutta matura (mela), lieviti. In bocca è dolciastra allattacco, caramello, ancora frutta matura, con un finale leggermente amaro. Corpo medio, consistenza oleosa, carbonazione corretta. Discreta, ma non è certo il genere di birra che preferisco.
Fantastic Oregon beer. Distinctive yet pleasing to many. Eminently drinkable.

Draft.  This is one of the beers that helped me get off the macro wagon years back.  Now I am enjoying one at the Portland airport for the first time in years.  I did hold this beer up very high back in college.  Now, while nOt nearly impressive, still good.  Pours a cloudy amber authors white head.  Smell is deep caramel, hops and some nondescript spice.  Taste is the same.
Pours dark orange with minimal head. Smells vibrant and rich, very malty. Very balanced and drinkable.

Very malty for what id expect of an ale.....but thats not a bad thing.  Im much more partial to a Porter or Stout, than i am an Ale or IPA.  
 Im picking up some sweet fruits, and maybe some coffee...
Friendly beer, good balance of caramel and bitterness, good body and aftertaste. Now I know why this beer is famous. Has a unique flavor, maybe the yeast?
Draft. Amber brown color, slightly orange. Hoppy aroma with cereal malts.very spicy and flavorfuk. Great beer

This is a good beer that the hop lovers and malt lovers should both enjoy . Pour is amber to orange with a large tight bubble off white head that is thicker at the top . Aroma is a little weak but nice . Flavors are all over the place malty and a touch sweet but with citrus and a nice hop presence .
Honey/caramel nose. Great golden orange colour with big creamy white head. Caramel hoppy flavour with crisp hop finish. Very pleasant.
Draft.Pours court with thin head.Smells of clove and cinnamon. Taste is lightly bitter and full of clove. Solid.
12 oz bottle  pours an amber color with a medium white head.  Aromas of bisciuts, bread, caramel, very malt driven.  Light bodied with a malty finish.
Pours a slightly hazy orange with a decent white head. Caramel aromas.  caramel, malt, biscuit flavours.  Not as bitter at the finish as expected.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Reviewed from notes (2007).

A: Copper-brown body with a small cream colored head.

S: Strong malty aroma with a healthy amount of dark fruit and hints of hop bitterness.

T: A solid maibock... strong malts, hints of fruit and a hoppy overtone.

M: A smooth, medium bodied beer.. not too much carbonation

O: A staple for me when I get a healthy sized hamburger at one of my favorite spots.
A nice cloudy orange with soft creamy head.  Aroma consists of malt, citrus, honey & pine.  A strong ale.
Bottle. Cloudy amber with a thin white head. Sweet, honey aroma. Lemon, sweet, malty then a piney bitterness.

Very hazy reddish pour with a clingy white head.  Slight citrus scent.  Nice balanced mouth.  Just a touch of that grapefruit taste you get with Pale Ales.  Rather enjoying this.  Something sweet in the middle thats rather nice.  Like this one a lot.  I remember having it years ago and liking it but I actually thought that may have been more because of the cool bottle and logo, I now know it was also the beer.
Pours a clear orange with a large white head.  Smells of honey, nuts.  Taste is very smooth, vaguely nutty, sweet.
Bottle. Hazy amber with a light head. Malt and caramel funky nose. Biscuit and malt flavour with a sweet finish. Almost lagery but definately not shite.
Bottle. Yellow with white head. Bubblegum on the nose. Taste is quite different. Light bitterness. Orange. Delicious malt flavour.

From bottle. Pours amber with thin white head. Ok aroma, slight caramel, bit yeast. Taste is much bigger, lots of toffee, caramel, slight raisin flavor. A very tasty beer. More
Like an amber ale

Bottled. Pours clear amber with an off-white head. Nose of caramel and slightly toasted mats. Mderately sweet flavor of caramel, oranges and yeasty notes. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and average carbonation.Slightly bitter finish. An elegant and well balanced ale.

Bottle. Pours an orange amber color with a modest white head. The nose is quite malty, brown sugar, some orange peel, yeast. The bodys malty and sweet, full, with a long finish. The textures a bit oily. Overall, an OK beer that I cant quite figure out.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2012 Pours hazy amber with minimal head. Citrusy and toasty aroma. More of that in the taste, with some toffee. There is some hop presence, enough to provide a nice finish. This is nothing insane, but its eminently drinkable should the situation arise. Unfortunately, $16 for a 6-pack at LCBO is not a good deal.
Pours a nice amber with a think, creamy head. Flavor is sweet and of malts and citrus. Finish is bitter, long, and smooth. Solid brew from Rogue.

33cl bottle. Pours a hazy, amber with a nicely proportioned head. The nose has toffee and raisins. The taste has biscuits, toffee and burnt raisins. The palate is medium bodied and textured with a dry though malty finish. Overall, its good though Im not sure its a Heller Bock. It tastes like a bitter.

A wonderful malty taste, abeit a tad thin with a hint of hops, a pleasant low carbonation and taste which lingers nicely.  I am looking forward to another.  It is a nicely built ale without overdoing anything.
Light, clean aroma with caramel, nut, and a little citrus.  More of the same in the taste, with a little hop bitterness and the carbonation providing balance in the finish.  Nice.
Dark amber color with medium sized head. Fine ale with a light fruity flavor, with a pleasant aftertaste and weak aroma

Draft from Hanger in a flight. Pours a clear orange with about half a finger of white head. Very malt-oriented. Toffee and toast. Taste is the same. Lots of caramel and toffee.  Very light citrus hops hiding in the aftertaste. Medium bodied with a somewhat thick texture. Lively carbonation and a decently bitter finish. Overall, not bad. Kinda reminds me of Buds American Ale. Something decent to drink on tap if there are no other choices.
Bottle.  Pours a medium amber color with a bit of a head. Has a sweet caramel-y scent. While the caramel flavor comes through, the taste is not overly sweet.  I would definitely drink this again.

Draught. Pours a hazy amber with a thin white head. Smells of malt and caramel with perhaps a hint of citrus. Tastes heavily of malt and yeast, providing a medium sweetness with a hint of bitterness and hops. Medium body. Texture is creamy. Finishes astringent.

Bottle from ølbutikken. clear orange, smooth offwhite head.
nutty and malty aroma. flavor is malty, mildly exotic fruity, white caramel, a bit strange bitterness.

Tasted from bottle into nucleated pint glass. Poured a clear, deep copper color with moussy off-white head, great retention and lace. Powerful aromas of noble hops, bread and caramel, glazed donuts. Complex malt-sweetness: suggestive of toffee, biscuit, brown sugar, coffee with cream. Id swear the was some kettle caramelization in the brewing process, like what happens with extract brewers. Love that pacman yeast! Clean, refreshing, with faintly fruity esters: apricots, plums, very faint citrus. Long-lasting, multi-layered aftertaste. A remarkably well-crafted brew. Sophisticated and super-drinkable at the same time.

Pours a cloudy copper with bubbly white head. Aroma is sweet malts, caramel, bread, and citrus hops. Taste is malty with a nice dry hop bitterness on the finish.  Notes of bread and honey linger after the bitterness diminishes.  Medium and dry mouthfeel.  Overall its flavorful and easy to drink.
Pours a nice coppery colour. Nice crisp aroma. Strong flavour for an ale, slightly sweet with a bit of caramel. Theres a good reason that this is the rogue beer that is in all the Portland bars.
Poured an opaque copper with a good sized head. Aroma is malty. Taste has sweetness up front and a bitter dry finish. Big fan of this one.

Aroma:  not much, mildly sweet yet astringent.  Appearance:  orange, copper, slightly hazy and a little thin sediment. Taste:  little bland up front, then mildly sweet in the middle and slight bitter aftertaste. Palate:  creamy, medium thickness. Overall:  nothing that special, not really that great to me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I was afraid this beer was going to be terrible based on the way Ive heard people bash it.  Once again, I was wrong.  This beer exceeded my (low) expectations.  It pours a clear orange color with a decent sized off white head that sticks around for a while.  Nice caramel and biscuit notes in the aroma, with toffee in there too.  Along with the maltiness, bready and biscuit notes theres something I just cant describe in the taste - but I like it.  This is a decent beer and well worth trying at least once.
Copper and murky, decent head, low carbonation; yeasty, hoppy, slightly toasty  nose, bitter and dry; quick finish, medium bodied

From notes: Pours hazy orange-amber with an off-white head and lots of carbonation bubbles along the wall of the glass.  Aromas of piney and grapefruity hops, with some biscuity yeast mixed in as well.  Medium-thickness, with a nice depth that lingers on the tongue.  Flavor is of piney hops that lingers nicely on the tip of the tongue.  Also has a nice, bright note of sweet citrus (maybe orange) in the finish.
slightly cloudy with good lace. aromas of grain, a kind of sweet caramel corn note and malts. big flavour for the style. some hops and a really balanced taste. good stuff.

Bottle bought from a store in Kuala Lumpur.  Pours a clear orange color with a nice beige head that stay for a while.  Aroma of hops, hints of ginger biscuits, spices and grass.  Flavors of hops, malts, hints of caramels, grass, ginger and citrus.  Light carbonations, light boddied, a bit too watery, long lasting little bitterness.  Interesting ale but nothing great.

Robe jaune orange brumeuse avec un beau col persistant.  
Une odeur de fleur de houblon fleurale
Le goût est exceptionnel.  Un peu de sucre malté, une amertume douce en parfait équilibre, un goût un peu boisé, peut-être un peu de miel?

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2014 Pours a dark and cloudy brownish-gold. Smells sweet with a light hop presence. Beer is very satisfactory, neither to bland or sweet the hops are strong upon first sip but wear off. Has a caramel malt flavor that is also very light. Finishes by leaving the aftertaste of the hops. Though medium bodied, a very good sipping ale whether you want to take your time or down it.

Appearance: Mahogany with an off-white head.

Smell: Sweet with a hint of Citrus.

Taste: Malty with a dry hoppy backbone.

Mouthfeel: Smoooooooooth and Crisp!

Overall: Well balanced and refreshing, great with spicy wings.  I am into craft beer b/c of this beer!

From bottle bottle pours amber with a large off-white head.  Aroma is soft mainly powdery malt with a light note of straw.  Flavor is mostly malt with a mild sweetness, honey, and very light grass.  Palate runs from sweet to just a touch of dry bitter, but very thick mouthfeel.  Overall, nice easy drinking, not much complexity.

Visited Portland Pub and restricted myself to only one pint of this gem. Could have had many more. Medium caramel, with light floral tones. This earthy, golden,deqd guy visited my taste buds with unnerving ease and its hazy, frothy, medium sweetnessliquid puored my soul to sleep. I forgot about how expensive it was to park in Portland and for a moment i was in beer bliss. Other notes: smooth and not bitter, average carbonation, long blissful finish,

Orange slightly cloudy pour. Aroma isnt heavy but fairly complex. Sweet honey maltiness, grapefruit hops, and a little yeasty. Medium body, quite smooth. Not  strong flavours - starts out with that malty caramel, a little orange in the back. Finish is fairly dry but bitter. Leaves a little nutty bitterness. I dont love it but its pleasant, smooth and pretty mild.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle bought back from the states. Rich malty nose, little bit of red fruit. Orange colour with White head that has disappeared in seconds. Im enjoying this quite alot just because its nice not to be tasting hops for a chance. Nice smooth mouthfeel. Taste is Lovely malty honey gorgeousness.

Orange color with off white head.  Very pronounced malty smell.  Sweet but not overpowering taste.  Spicy hoppy aftertaste is very welcome and cuts through the malt.  

Very surprising beer and very nice packaging.

Havent had this in a long time.  Pours slightly hazy, dark orange with a nice dense off white head.  Nose is very grainy, caramel, nuts and some earthy hops.  This smells like raw wort and sweet malt.  Wow.  Flavor is more mellow and rounded out sweet malts, nuts and toffee. Has some nice hop flavor as well.  Possible of the noble variety.  Medium full body.  Really a pretty good beer.  Easy to drink and sweet but not cloying.
Great malty taste and mouthfeel.  Perfectly balanced by floral and slightly spicy hops.  Really nice notes from the yeast.  Overall a great, solid beer.  I can drink a lot of this.
The smell isnt super strong save a bit of malt but the taste picks up the slack.  Theres a definite note of honey, though the beer isnt sweet by any means.   Leaves a touch of bitter. 350ml bottle

Nice dark amber appearance, plenty of flavor with a bit of sweetness and malt, short and dry finish, a nice smooth well balanced ale, very smooth and drinkable. A beer not meant for any real rogues.......try it  !!!
I realy liked this one.  Sweet finish, ballance, hops are present, but in the background.  This is a clasic example of the style by which others can be measured.
Poured from the bottle. Color is orangeish copper. Nice head with lacing. Aroma is kind of caramel and cereal. Flavor is actually nicely bittered.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2012 I could dig this. Very smooth. The aroma was as expected; Malty and sans excess hopping. Appearance was just. The taste was subtle; and I like that, malty and creamier than many browns or stouts I have enjoyed. Palate was great. Not too sweeet and not too carbonated or zippy. Just a great smooth seesion ale.

12 oz bottle at Metrovino...cant believe I havent ranked this one before....pours a dark yellow / lightish brown...thin head....mild head with balanced taste....good balanced bock....some hops to give it a bit of a bite but not too much....easy to figure why it is a west coast favorite
On draft at Philly Ale House. Pours an amber orange color with a thick head. Tastes of malt and sweetness. Pretty good.
Bottle.  Orange pour with a one inch head.  Aroma of fruit and bread.  Taste is a mix of bitterness, fruit, bread and alcohol.
Bottle, pours clear amber orange. with a voluptuous white head. Aroma is somewhat malty. Flavour of yeast and dry hops. Will give it a second try but not all that special.

A cloudy orange brown beer with a small off white head that leaves nice lacing.  The aroma is nutty and caramel malt though a little faint.  The flavor is nutty, bready, and has quite a bitter finish.  Certainly full flavored malt here, not too bad.

Pours a rich amber color with a huge, foamy, eggshell-white head that settles to a persistent thin film. The aroma is a complex but somewhat dull combination of light citrusy hops, earthy yeast, and a lager-like clean caramel sweetness. The flavor is much more hop-forward, with an assertive yet rounded combination of citrus and pine. A semi-dry, biscuity sweet malt provides some balance, along with a musty yeasty character. The texture is mouth-filling, but there is only a moderate lingering resinous feel, and the finish is actually a bit drying. Overall, this is certainly something different than just another pale ale or IPA to serve as the brewerys flagship, but despite that uniqueness, it just doesnt feel all that special.

Beautiful reddish golden amber, aroma of raspberry, honey and hops.  Taste is sharp with raspberry and hops, then lingers where the bitterness of the hops fights with the sweetness of honey.  I like the flavors but they seem at odds.  Well worth the try, not a regular drinker.
Bottle and tap. One of my favorite go to beers. Well balanced with a malty taste but not too sweet. A slight bitterness at the end that lingers just right. A very drinkable beer for summer or winter.

6-pack from LCBO.  Pours a nice clear amber.  Aroma is weak and yeasty.  Dissapointed with the taste - malt and honey.  A little lingering bitter aftertaste after a few sips.  Was expecting more due to the high rating.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2011 Pours light brown, light carbonation. Taste is mostly of malt, but not sweet. Lightly balanced with hops that leave a light lingering bitterness. A good beer when you want something more complex than a pale ale, but not heavy or bitter. A good daily drinker

It poured a clear burnt orange color with a beige head. The aroma was more malty and fruity, with caramel, bread, some fresh orange and dusty hops. The flavor was orange and caramel up front, moving to grapefruit, orange peel, bread, and a nice bitterness. A very enjoyable Heller Bock.
Now this is a highly enjoyable brew. Great nose, great mouthfeel, and great finish. This should be on everyones to-try list.
Pours a hazy orange color with a medium sized white head. Aroma of fruit, malts and some light hops. Flavor of fruit, caramel malts, and very very light hops. Very easy to drink.
Tap.  Poured a a golden amber with a medium head.  Has a nice malty taste balanced nicely by some bitterness.  Clean aftertaste.  Very good overall.
Bottle. Faint roasty hoppy aroma. Colour is hazy dark orange with a white lasting head. Taste of hops and cream/milk.

Purchased as a bomber from fresh market in Richmond va.  Poured into a tulip glass.  Pours a really nice honey tobacco color with awesome head and lacing. A beautiful beer.  Smells German. Yeah there is a smell.  Taste follows, perfect balance of malt and hop back bone, just enough on the back end to dry out pleasantly.  Feels nice, very quaffable.

Overall this beer is awesome. Best beer Ive had from rogue, however not worth the price tag.

Truly a brew for quality quaffing! This brew poured up an amber colored body with a bubbly thin head that dissipated rather quickly and left good lacing effects on the glass. Sweet aromas of malt, hops, and island fruits (almost like jack-fruit which is used to make Juicy Fruit gum).  Medium-bodied, smooth, easy on the drinkability scale.  Very malty so it has a good thickness to it. The finish is so creamy and clean with no harsh aftertastes of any sort.
strong full bodied taste with a slight sweet. fruity aftertaste. by far one of my favorite draft beers. golden, clear, light sweetness, medium body, lively,

Pours copper with thick off white head, aroma is very malty,hints of caramel,no real hop presence. Nice lacing in my glass flavor is malty caramel and has a slight nuttiness, small hops bitterness that isnt very noticeable. Good brew to grab when there arent any other craft options, you can find this stuff almost everywhere.
Draught at Køge Øldage. Dark golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and with notes of caramel.
Djupt gyllene med vitt skum. Viss maltighet i doften i övrigt doftar den inte jättemycket. En trevlig lätt pepprighet i smaken.

I poured a 22oz bomber into a large beer mug.Appearance: Dark amber color with an orange glaze. Slight cloudy body, but plenty of carbonation visible. Forms a large, beige, soapy head which laces and retains quite well.Smell: Light confectionary sweetness - mild toffee and caramel notes, otherwise mild and neutral.Taste: Theres a lot of debate whether Dead Guy Ale is indeed an ale (because its brewed with ale yeast), or a lager (because its brewed in the Maibock style). The first thing I notice about it is how much it tastes and feels like an ale. Its too thick, soft, and tepid to be a lager - but then again that describes many doppelbocks and other beers of the bock family. This is not a complex beer - its quite simple and to-the-point. Up front is a mild malty sweetness of toffee and caramel. The middle imparts noticeable bitterness along with some lager-like grainy texture and taste. Theres sweet caramel or butterscotch flavor in the immediate aftertaste, but it fades quickly and a slightly dry sensation emerges. Its tasty palate to be sure, but nothing mind-blowing. Mouthfeel: Full-bodied with a soft, comfortable texture. No fizziness.Drinkability: Although the name may be strange, I find Rogue Dead Guy Ale to be a great introductory craft beer for most people. The palate is rather mild with hints of lager quality, but has a genuine taste thats sweet but not obnoxious. Its smoothness makes it easy to slug down and the weight of 6.5% ABV seems higher than it feels. Ive seen people session this and I can understand why.Overall, Rogue Dead Guy Ale is an interesting beer for many reasons, but I dont think its quite the elite beer its reputation would have me believe it is.

Pours a deep gold with nice white head.  Aroma is sweet and malty.  Taste is just as sweet with some roasted malt coming through with a little bit of hoppy goodness.  One of the best Maibocks Ive had.   So good.

A solid everyday beer. Its nothing extremely exciting but its a good drinker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great tasting Ale. Rogue beers have a distinctive subtle spice to them that I just love. Beautiful dark amber color, great head, and a fantastic finish that is clean.

Very faint malty aroma.  Light/medium body.  Hint of sweetness.  Mild hop bitterness that lingers.  Malty taste with a slightly peppery finish.  It pleases the palate.  Very smooth and moderately robust.  This beer is better after number two.  The first one was "meh".  The second one was "mmmmmm good".
Well balanced . Good mouthfeel, Not much to be said about this one. First beer from Rogue, Need to try some more.

First of all, the label on this beer is great. Now onto the beer, the head was nice to start out. Aroma was good with a slight hint of fruit to it. Sort of reminded me of Magic Hat 9 in both aroma and taste. The beer finishes well and is a strong beer to boot. This was my first beer from Rogue Brewery based out of Oregon, but it wont be the last. Go out and find it, drink it, and enjoy it

On tap at Iron Monkey, Jersey City, NJ.  Clean lines.  Beer pours hazy brown, with a medium head that fades quickly.  Aroma is fruity and attack is smooth and full-bodied; nice rounded flavor profile, finish is tart and then clean.  Good strong ale.

12 oz bottle pours out a deep golden color and produces a good head. Aromas of malts with some hints of hops. Tastes of nicely balanced roasted malts with a crisp finish of the perle and saaz hops. A good overall brew for times when you want just a refreshing beer. Not a sour nor a coffee stout  the basics.
This might be my favorite ale...not a fan of them but this one is good!  Malty with a good finish not a bad after taste likeI get from most ales. Bonus: i really dig theogue line of labels!

12oz bottle from The Grapevine 
Appearance: Pours clear golden with a big frothy off-white head and lots of lacing 
Aroma: Toasted caramel, sweet, grainy and bready 
Taste: Toasted caramel, honey, grainy with a light bitter finish 
A nice full flavored, light tasting beer. Refreshing and clean. I havent had this in many years and was never interested in drinking it again, but either the beer or my taste for good beer has changed.

Nu är maj-bockar något jag inte brukar gilla. Men den här ligger ganska långt från de tyska förlagorna. Fyllig med massor av maltnyanser, sött bröd, honung, russin. Kanske lite sött i längden, men jag delade flaskan och uppskattade den.

Amber coloured beer with average carbonation and a small white head. Bread yeasty and light malty hinted aroma with grainy caramel sweet hints. Full light creamy hinted palate. Finish is bitter sweet malty with caramel hints and a slight alcoholic twist. Good
This beer had a large head and was orangey in colour. It had a silky texture and tasted slightly caramelly and was a balance between sweet and bitter. Nothing hugely exciting here.
Real subtle taste. Not to bitter just right overall i really like this beer just tried it today. =) good job Rogue thumbs up for this beer.
UPDATED: AUG 13, 2011 Bottle from Beers of Europe. Aromatic perfumed sweet aroma & flavour. Rich golden amber colour. Quite smooth. Nice one.
Nice Maibock/Heller Bock... It has slight licorice and clove overtones. Well balanced malt and hops
Bottle @ home. Clear copper colored beer. Boring: average smell and taste. Nothing special, expected better.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2014 rerate due to appreciation for hops has developed: taste is better and overall is better.  palate lost a point.

Bottle in a pint glass - pours clear amber with little head. Aroma is hoppy and malty. Taste is a little bitter. Crisp going down. About as much hop I care to handle and the aftertaste is not overwhelming as with hoppy beer.

Nice amber color with a short head.  Lacing clings to the glass but is not persistent.  There is a malty breadiness on the nose.  The taste is mildly bitter with a dry aftertaste.  This brew finishes smooth

650 ml bottle from A Tutta Birra. Served into a snifter. Pours a beautiful looking cloudy bright orange with a nice big off white head, moderate lacing. Very floral aroma from the hops, some caramel, bubblegum and bready malts.Medium body, nice carbonation, dry and oily texture. This is my first heller bock so I dont really know the standards, but flavour wise, it is very similar to an IPA with a much more aggressive malt profile. I like it a lot, Rogue never disappoint!

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2011 Bottle: copper orange with a nice off white head.  It has a malty sweet aroma with a florally hop aroma.  Flavor wise, it has a great bitterness, that is balanced out just enough by the maltiness and a lively carbonation.

In bottle. Pours a beautiful glowing red - orange colour with a fair beige head. Aroma of caramel, toffee and treacle. Nice silky mouth-feel. Caramel flavour again with some pepper and moderate carbonation. Has some of the metallic finish I would expect for this style, however, more caramel and toffee lingering flavours. Not bad, interesting take on the style.

Bottle @ home. Burnt orange appearance with an off white head. Light caramel malty, noble hoppy, light lager nose. Well carbonated. Light caramel malty later, moderately noble hoppy flavor. Malty, rich bock aftertaste. Nice session beer.

Date: July 28, 2011 Mode: Draft Source: Flying Saucer, Kansas City, MO Appearance: Translucent copper with little head, not much lacing. Aroma: Malty and hoppy. Flavor: Consistent with aroma. Other: It was good, just not great.
36 cl bottle. Rated on 29.10.2008Hoppy aroma has some herbs and sweet, aged fruits. Flavour has also aged fruits with some herbs and honey. Pretty far from a bock, but good!

On tap at the Dancing Cat Saloon in Bethel, NY. Pours a gold color with a soft short lasting white head. Aroma is heavy malt and sweetness. Taste is not so intense as the German versions. Taste is caramel and butterscotch. Palate is mellow and nice but the beer is a little unbalanced. But still nice.

On tap at the Nook. Pours a dark gold color with a medium, thick, off-white head and lots of nice lacing. The aroma is apples, bread, pine and earthy hops, and light spices. The flavor is sweet up front, with a noticeable spicy hop taste in the middle and finish. The palate is medium to heavy, lively carbonation, and a little clingy and astringent. Pleasant bitter aftertaste. Complex and reasonably drinkable. A good beer.
Pour copper with white head. Aroma caramel, pine, malty sweet, fruity. Taste fruity, caramel, nice bitterness, toffee, grapefruit. MF medium body nice carb. decent brew nothing memorable.

Pours a slightly cloudy copper color with a fat white head.  Medium bodied brew.  Nose is caramel malt and sweet dark fruit.  Caramel and breaded malt in the taste with moderate sweetness.  Hops take a backseat in this one, though they are there.  A rather mild beer in my opinion, but not exactly a bad thing.

From a 355ml bottle on 8/7/2011. Pours a relatively clear caramel colour with a small head. Has a strong aroma of caramel and butterscotch. The one is a malty monster, with more caramel and butterscotch coming through in the flavour. It also has a some nutty and marzipan flavours and some citrus fruit at the end. A slightly weird but very enjoyable brew.

Bouteille 355 ml. 6.6%. Couleur ambrée un peu voilée. Arôme de caramel, de malt caramélisé et houblon. Goût de malt, caramel, houblon frais. Douce en bouche. Finale avec un peu de houblon, un peu de caramel...très très bonne.

Definitely hadnt had anything quite like this before...I will say I enjoyed it. Certainly a departure from my IPA tendencies, but for a malt-focused brew, I didnt find it overly sweet but rather well balanced instead. Might pick up again on occasion when looking for a change of pace.

0.355l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a light hazy unfiltered mild orange body with a small bubbly off-white head. Aroma is quite fruity and malty with notes of yeast, red currants, ripe strawberries, some chocolate and light melon zest along with something that remind me of bourbon. Guess that sums it nicely up. Light oily texture, average to mild carbonation and medium-bodied. Flavor wise; mild malty, light fruit-yeasty. Theres a nice amount of hops thats leaving a mild almost peppery bitter finish. I quite enjoyed it, but since this is a dead guys ale, I guess its not my type of ale.

Single bottle thanks to my uncle. Nose: hard to get a solid sniff from the nose of the bottle but very rich with lots of complex grains and a hint of dark cocoa. Taste: light sweet, light sour, light bitter. Some over-ripe cherries, a touch of banana and lots of roasted (but extremely light) cocoa.

when I want to remember a good english ESB, I go get DEAD. 
has that great biscuity malt flavor that most of the mass marketed micros cant match. 
one of the best american strong ales that isnt hop-sided, yet is marketed as a German Mai-Bock? whatever! its good.
Love the style of the bottle. I love the colour of this beer also. Taste was a bit boring, mouthfeel fine.
Gustosa, amb bona olor i un regust bo que et deixa a la boca, com de caramel. Amb un punt amarg molon
355ml bottle.  Pours caramel with a medium, frothy head.  Aroma is malfunction caramel and apple.  Some grassy hops also.  Taste is watery caramel with a little apple on the finish.
Brownish gold in color with a full head. Spicy and yeasty, with a bit of a sour aftertaste. Yeasty smell. Quite bitter.

Very good beer one of the best if you can put out the money for $10 a six pack but very worth it i look forword to getting my hands on my next one. Great large head on it full flaver just a well rounded beer 24 oz is about $5 try it you will love it. I get this when I have the money to get somthing better then Red Hook ESB.

Very nice. Had this years ago at a Rouge bar in Eugene, OR I think.  It was tasty then and still as good today.  As a German Maibock, a strech for an American recreation, but with its own spin it tuned out excellent.  Dark, gold-red-amber color, nice bubbly head, from great yeast. Lacing and legs are top notch.  Aroma is nice, I would have expected more, but due to recreating a German style it is close to true. Taste is dry, dry honey-dark fruit and caramel malt, the yeast is what u truly get the style and flavor from.  I remeber this being hoppier, last time, but that was 2003 or so and I have drank a million IPAs and IIPAs since then, so maybe Im used to the malty and hoppiness of all beers now. All around great beer, if u havent had one, I strongly recommend this one.  However, dont go in thinking ur drinking an IPA, its not, but its a medium-full bodied, nice grain bill, decent ABV and alittle hops. NICE

From bottle to shaker @ home.  A very interesting brew, kind of grows on you after allowing it to fully dance across the palate.  Pours hazy copper, head is a tad short but retains well and laces pretty good.  Aroma is nutty-peach.  Flavor follows suit, with a distinct honey signature.  Very malt-forward, which explains why this hop-head needed some time to adjust!  This beer MUST be allowed to hit the whole tongue, otherwise you miss out.  It has a very complex character.  I enjoyed it, and expect Ill pick up a six-pack on occasion when looking for something different.

Bottle from Alexander Wines, Coventry, hand-labelled BB 12/15/11. That got me counting the months up on my fingers. Pours clear, streaming bronze with a fine white collar. Orange and rose, peach air freshener on wholemeal aroma. Sweet and honeyed with an overpowering Turkish Delight/tinned peach character. Some buttered wholemeal and ginger cake, peachified to death. Too smooth, too flimsy, too one-dimensional to awaken my interest. A pity.
Amber in color in a very cool bottle.  It tastes strong than it is and leaves a slightly sour aftertaste.  I did enjoy it quite a bit though.  At times it is sickly sweet.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. This beer is a complete package. Niced copper pour with a fluffy white head. Great balance of malts and hops. Aroma is rather sweet with a prominant note of honey. Lots of fruit and caramel malts in this one. Honey is the big winner here though. Love it
The Rogue Dead Guy Ale has a great aroma of sweet, complex hops along with caramel malt. A great beer that deserves a drink, if not multiple ones.
650ml bottle. Cloudy amber pour with off white head. Malty and spicy on the nose. A little strange on the palate; almost roasted with a spicy edge, hard to describe.

Bottle pour ---> Tulip. Poured a hazy copper, with a thick head and sloppy lacing. The scents were spicy with hops, tangy fruit and a hint of caramel. It tasted pretty darn good, with a touch of tangerine, bitter dry hops, and leaving the mouth sticky and sweet. Perhaps the best doomsday beer for now.

Bottle into tulip. Thanks to Chipalsa for this one.  Nice aroma, like hops and sweet malt with a touch of honey or agave. Light fruit mixed in as well. Great lacing and a clear, light brown body. This brew had some great fruit flavors and some malt in their as well. The hops were there but well hidden in the background. Fruits include peach and apple. Nice.

9/7/2009
White Crane Bitter
Saw this at the store the other day, and it called to me. Im not sure what to expect as the label is in Japanese.

Pours a slightly cloudy orange/amber with a big fluffy white head. Smells of citrus and floral hops, a bit of a mineral smell as well. Not much going on really in the nose. Taste is a little better with some sweet malts caramel and bread mixed up with some floral hops and that mineral tartness. Sparkling carbonation, sticky mineral-y mouthfeel, medium body. Im not sure how old this bottle is or how it came to be available for sale in NH, but I bet its not as fresh as it should be. Nothing objectionable here, but really not up to what I consider the norm for Rogue.

Bottle. Hazy amber with small off white head leaving some lacings. Funky and yeasty sweet with candy and overripe fruit and some wilted hops.
Taste is quite the same. Overripe peach, mango and passion fruit, candyish with some biscuit malt and wilted grassy and flowery hops.
Medium to light body, slightly sticky with soft carbonation. As you get it here its actually quite a disgusting beer.

the color is a dark amber to light brown, with a thin head that is white.  aroma is strong malty notes, with slight aroma of hops, caramel, and toffee.  the flavor is very strong malt body, thick and dissipates really fast. there is caramel, and honey flavors that i get form this.  ends with bitterness. this is really good!  full body and excellent mouth feel
Nice aroma, good mild malt, esp forward, nice finish.  Caramel and coffee.  An instant favorite.
Amber with decent off-white head. Rich malty nose.  Full palate. Rich, malty and toasty flavor.  hint of hop bitterness but its really about the meaty malt.  Excellently balanced.  Yum!
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2011 Great beer. Didnt know until reading this its a bock. Love the malt forward, but with some hop backing taste.

29-APR-2011, bottle @Barcelona appartment, from La Cerveteca.
Orange, beautifull with fine lasting beige head.
Wonderfull bitter nose with citric orange notes.
Bitter grape fruit taste that lasts long.
Taste not quite as forward as the nose.
A bit thin in body.
Very nice brew.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2012 Poured a  slight light brown reddish  but  more golden with an orange glowing hue.Looks great in a mug.Short layer of head with bits of lacing.Smelled of english yeast or grain faint alcohol-slight skunkiness almost but might be that hells quality or a tart-slight buttery english.

.Light to med bodied. Good body and mouthfeel.Malty grainy sweetness with classic bock taste,some citrus floral hop taste finishes pretty dry faintly stickyand maltyNice bittering somewhat minerally on the finish aloso.A good beer but I appreciate more of Rogues other ales.

Light amber-orange colored with a decent off-white head. Aroma of caramel, bread and some slight citrus. Taste is pretty much the same, malty, decent and full flavored for a maibock, but still just a kind of bland. Medium body and carbonation. Again, good for the style, but this isnt exactly an exciting style.
Nice multiflavor, you can get a good malty character both with the aroma and taste. Very good ale.
dark, nice head love it, big rogue fan this is one of my all time favorites, buy it by the case when I can find em
Servida en botella en La Cerveteca (Barcelona) Ligeramente amarga en boca y con un buen final. Buena cerveza.
Slight bitterness, but just enough... balanced with a nice, malty mix. This is my first heller bock. Fruity aroma. Definitley citrus... I detected pear? but my friends did not agree.

12 oz Bottle.  Appearance is amber color with medium head.  Aroma is light citrus with some notes of bread and caramel.  Taste is light citrus, bread, and orange rind with a slight but noticeable Saaz hops giving it a crisp and dry bitterness.  Palate is medium bodied with a somewhat dry finish.
yeasty citrus aroma. Appearance is golden amber. Taste is slightly malty with hints of citrus hops. Palate is slightly carbonated with a smooth long finish. Overall a good beer.

Oops!  Just downed a bottle of Dead Guy and didnt bother taking notes since I was sure I had rated it before.  Light and summery, lots of floral notes and sweetness, offset by a crisp and clean Saaz spice and bitterness.  Its good, okay?
Pours ruby brown with a nearly non-existent white head. Bits of yeast floating around. Nice malt action on the tongue. Not bad but nothing special.
perhaps my favorite beer. very creamy with light hops as is expected with the style. the best american example ive tasted.

Good beer. Appearance is a light amber/golden color with an orange hue. The aroma is full of carmel, citrus, and yeast. The taste is very similar. It is a well balanced beer but doesnt do anything to stand out. I would like to try double dead guy next based on tasting this.

341ml bottle. Pours a hazy light amber, nice off-white head that settles to a nice lacing. Mellow citrus, yeast, and bread aroma, smooth/creamy mouthfeel, not much of any overwhelming taste but a very slight hopiness for the finish, dries out the mouth nicely. Overall like the beginning and the end but between there is something lacking. Still havent had this in a long time and need to pick up a few when I feel like liquid dough :)
Deep amber color. Thin head. Malty aroma, bread, herbs, citrus. Slightly sweet on front of palace with a bit of hops on the finish. Very unique beer.

SCHIUMA:
bianca, buona presenza, persistenza media, non molto compatta
COLORE:
arancio scuro, tendente al marrone, leggera velatura ma senza residui
INTENSITA / FINEZZA:
abbastanza intensa con spettro ampio, giocando sul contrasto malto-luppulo
AROMI:
malto, caramello, erba 
GUSTO:
dolce di malto tostato e caramello, miele
RETROGUSTO:
un finale amaro di luppolo, piuttosto erbaceo ma molto equilibrato, non pungente che si fonde molto bene con il dolce dei malti che torna senza scomparire
CORPO:
corpo medio, morbida in bocca, carbonatazione medio-bassa
Ottima birra, nota di merito allequilibrio fra dolce e amaro che si alternano dando un buon dinamismo in bocca senza stancare. Rispetto ad una classica maibock tedesca, il malto non domina prepotentemente, 6.5 % alcol quasi inavvertibili; daltra parte si sentono i luppuli classici degli stili americani, con un amaro erbaceo pronunciato, però in questo caso non pungente e molto ben dosato. Birra che siddisfa, molto godibile anche se un po lontano da quello che ci si aspetterebbe da una maibock - poco alcolica, malto non dominante e corpo leggero. Ne giova comunque la bevibilità.

Tasted on 3/31/11 from a 12oz bottle at Inovasi.  Pours clear burnt orange with an average beige head that leaves thin but even lace.  The nose is more malty and fruity than anything else, with caramel, bread, and fresh orange, along with herbal and dusty hops.  The flavor is orange and caramel up front, moving to grapefruit, orange peel, bread, and a nice bitterness.  The body is medium with average carbonation and a long finish that features orange peel bitterness.
Aroma is of honey malt and a bit of Saaz hops. Pours a reddish golden color. Flavor is honey grainy malt and slightly bitter hops. This beer is very smooth and the flavor is very well balanced.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a moderate caramel-brown color with a light tan head and a bit of lacing. The nose brings some light floral hops over a body of caramel and some lightly-sweet bready malt. The flavor is a bit bready with some yeast characteristics. The body is medium with good carbonation. Overall, one of the first craft beers that I had, but not something that impresses me terribly these days.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-24-2010
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is malty and caramel. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Bitter and dry finish with a little alcohol. 170609
Pours an off-orange with a firm white head. Aroma is caramel and citrus hops. Crisp and nice; flavor is caramel, bready and citrus. Nice beer; would get it again.

The beer is dark cloudy gold with a white head that doesnt have much lacing or retention.

The aroma is light hops. The taste is the same light hops with a little wheatiness to it.

The feel is good for this style of pretty and its pretty drinkable.
Pours copper/gold with a thin lasting head. Lots of caramel malt on the nose. Smooth, lightly sweet with a lingering bitterness. Tangy, slightly metallic taste in the back of the palatte.

Pours tan brown out of bottle. Aroma is subtle. Mainly malt sweetness, caramel. However, taste is a bit of a surprise. Mainly bitterness. Complex. This is supposed to be a bock but way more hopping and bitterness than is the norm. Flavours are complex and subtle but a bit too much bitters and sours with the malt caramel sweetness for me.
bottle; clear amber-red with tan head; aroma-caramel and light notes of coffee; taste- mild sweetness with moderate bitter and carbonation-caramel-some fruits; OK beer, not enough hops to my taste

22 oz. Bottle. Amber orange color with short-lived fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, brown sugar. The first taste confirms the sweetness, but this beer is very nicely balanced with malt and Saaz Hops. The unique yeast contributes some fruitiness - apple, pear, raisin, which goes very well with the caramel flavors. The finish is short and leans slightly towards the sweet side with a bright lively fruitiness. Crisp, clean, and easy drinking but also a lot of flavor. A touch more on the finishing hops and it would have scored a "4".

Forever one of my favorites, I was awfully glad to find Dead Guy at the restaurant tonight, since the rest of their selection was mostly shit.  Not the greatest beer, but consistent, always with just the right amount of bitterness to offset the rather sweet leanings of the malts.  Toffee and caramel on the front couple with the familiar Pacman Yeast fruitiness, yet the fade is dry and German and surprising in an ale.  Good beer, and often pops up in the damndest places.

Appearance:  light coppery gold; light and bubbly head.  Aroma:  sweet caramel, malts and light hops.  Taste:  sweet and crisp, with a hint of hops to balance.  Finish:  crisp and clean, with slight hops.  Notes:  Solid and nicely balanced.  Creamy in the mouth, yet still refreshing.

Poured a honey like color with a generous velvety head.  Aroma of mostly sweetish malts; caramel.  Taste is a superb balance of sweetness and bitter (medium-lite for both).   Medium body, Ave carbonation, Long Finish.  Wow, I havent had this for awhile, and its tasting very good.  Such a great balance between hops and malt.  Smooth drinkin yet there is a bunch of taste.  Well done again Rogue.
Pours a nice Orange tan color. Thick white head. The flavor is very good, grain and bready. Very smooth flavor. Great beer.

22 oz bottle. Clear light amber with a thick beige head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of bread dough, herbal hops, light lemon and caramel. The flavor is lightly sweet caramel and bready malt with a touch of hop bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation and a smooth clean mouth feel. Solid beer, very drinkable and full flavored.

Bottle from Publix in Spring Hill, FL.  Pours hazy brown with a white head.  Nose is slight biscuit, caramel, and some citrus hops.  Flavor reminds me a bit of an ESB with a yeast presence.  Malt, caramel, yeast, and citrus blend to make this accessible, and easy-drinking session beer.

Bottle @ Hotelroom, Denver. Pours golden with a huge white head. Aroma of sweet caramel, toast, brown sugar. Taste is burned caramel, toast, some floral hops. Medium body, soft carbonation,creamy mouthfeel. Completely different from what i expected, very sweet, few hops, still quite enjoyable tho. 270211

Clear copper pour with a thin off-white head. Aroma has a lot of caramel and toasty malts, with an accent of toffee. Smells similar to a marzen. Flavor is very sweet, almost a sickening level of caramel, but with a balance of flowery hops. Finish is clean with a little dryness. Slick, medium body. Pretty good, but a little on the sweet side. Id probably enjoy it more if I was in an Oktoberfest mood.
i used to drink this beer before i was into microbrews. Easy drinkablity great malts and sweetness, light hop flavor. On tap at many places.
dead guy ale seems to be the most common beer from rogue. unique for the maibock style. Has a flavor all of its own. Can be a go to beer if I run out of options. Good beer.

Very nice copper/dark orange/amber color.  Off white head that was somewhat small, but tight.  Not much retention, but did leave some pretty good lacing on the glass.  Its hazy with some lighter orange highlights.  In the smell, I detected some well rounded caramel sweetness.  Hints of peach and a fragrance similar to a candy apple.  Some breadiness is there, but it seems to be pushed to the side to let the sweetness come through.  The taste revealed some caramel and some dry wheat bread.  Some candy sweetness with the ripe apple.  Very well balanced.  Some prominent bitterness tickles the tongue.  Only a small, welcome alcohol warmth and flavor.  Medium mouthfeel.  Smooth, crisp, dry and slightly refreshing.  Covers the palate very well.  Leaves plenty of flavor behind.  This, once again, is a solid, well rounded effort from Rogue.  They are quickly becoming one of my favorite brewers.  This brew is easily drinkable.  Would work well at any point during the year.  It is considerably sweet, so that may deter some, but it would still be enjoyable for me through several rounds.  Worth a try if you havent tried it yet.

Rouge Dead Guy Lager brewed with ale yeast. 22 oz bomber.No sign of a freshness date.

Pours with a decent white head and a cloudy dark lager color.

Smell is sweet, nutty, with a pinch of hops.

Pretty full bodied, has a bitter hop bite, slightly metallic, the malts are sweet and toasty.

Like Fat Tire, it is a popular beer because of its drinkability and not really taste.

Bottle purchased at Chesters beers of the world Hamilton. Pour is a honey/ gold colour with nice white head and some decent lace. Aroma is sweet, citrus and hops. Taste is hops a little bitter and lemon/ citrus. Awesome beer.
Golden with red hint. Fruity malt aroma. Sweet taste of orange, malt with very little hops flavor.  Ok, nothing special.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12oz bottle into a Rogue Dead Guy pint glass.

Appearance: From the pour I got a good thick and creamy off white head. This sits on top of a beautiful medium orange amber body with a light haze. As I drink the head slowly fades to a wispy covering and leaves some nice lacing on the glass.

Smell: The aroma is full of bready sweetness, bready yeast and mellow hops. 

Taste/Palate: The flavor has good toasted and bready maltiness with some mild caramel, toffee and light nutty notes. This is backed up with nice herbal/floral hop balance. It finishes well balanced and extremely drinkable. The palate has a smooth full feel with soft carbonation.

Notes: In my opinion this a very well made and wonderfully balanced Maibock. (Dead on for the style.)
Lemon and citrus notes. Hops are noticeable on this medium bodied joy. Slick and lively going down.

Pours a cloudy tea color with a thin ivory head.  Malty aroma with lemon and floral notes.  Starts sweet and malty and fades to bitter.  Caramel, bread, and citrus notes.  Medium to high carbonation with a medium body.  Nicely balanced beer.

Heavy golden pour with a very slight haze.  Modest large bubble off white head.  Mild toasted malt aroma.  Full mouth feel with a slightly sour taste with a strong presence of raisins when swallowing (I hate raisins).  I really wanted to like this beer as so many others have raved about it ... perhaps I got an old bottle.

Orange red in color... Aroma is caramel malts, citrus hops... Flavor is citrus hops, caramel malts, belgian yeast, candi sugar...Tastes like a bock, very malty, feel like the hops were much subdued as its been aging for over a year... Solid beer, feel like it would be way different fresh
Pour is hazy orange color with a small off white head. The smell is sweet and lightly hoppy. Light overall mouth feel and a generally fruity taste, of lighter fruit with some apple like notes.

Still trying to wrap my mouth around this one. I had it on tap. Hazy amber color with a light white head. At first taste, its a good sweet beer, but then the hops come in and there are some citrus undertones. Surprisingly good.
A little dry,  surprisingly refreshing for a pale ale.  This is a beer I would have when looking for hops but a decent sipping beer.
I had it on tap and it seemed flat. No real carbonation to it and the flavor seemed off. It was bland ale with not a lot of flavor.

Pours a beautiful amber honey color with a light white head that leaves nice lacing on the sides of the glass. Light sweetness in the start balanced with some citrus (lemongrass) and a light bitterness. Very drinkable and smooth.
On tap at Faccia Luna. Dark gold with an eighth inch white head. No discernible aroma. Flavor is caramel. Mild bitter finish. Good but not great.
Amazing beer for a hefty price. Nice malty dark beer with a nutty aroma. Beer is an amazing must try

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2011 From bottle, dark amber color not much head.  Smells alot like maple syrup.  The malt flavor isnt right up front but melds together with the hops to give a  really unique flavor.  Kinda like eating a Little Debbies oatmeal cream cookie and burping the next day after youve been drinking hoppy beer.  The thicker mouthfeel and hop dry finish make more refreshing than a bock to me.The hop flavor becomes less pronounced as you drink though and it can leave your mouth a litty sticky if you drink a few.  Everytime I drink DG I get different flavors (always good) so it definitely falls into the "Just go drink one" .

Does not taste like a helles bock, probably has to do with the fact that its an ale and not a lager.  Much more hoppy, and therefore drier, than bocks normally are, if this were called a different name it wouldve got rated higher because it is good, just doesnt taste anything like any other helles bock Ive had.
AMBER! Not bad at all. Got some from a friend and was pleasantly surprised.
23rd March 2009 Hazy amber beer. Reasonably soft palate. Mild creamy malt well balanced with the hops that leave a trailing bitter edge. Easy going well balanced beer.

12fl oz bottle poured into a pint glass.  Sparkling amber with tall, creamy, off-white head.  Aroma is sweet malt, spices, light hops.  Flavor is earthy hops.  Finishes moderately bitter with a hint of maple syrup.  Light and refreshing but a bit sticky in the palate.  The odd flavor puts me on the fence with this one.  Interesting brew.

Pours a very nice golden color with a thin white head.  The aroma is of sweet honey, caramel malts, some dark fruits, and a light cereal graininess.  The sweet caramel malts are really noticeable coating the palate with a slick mouthfeel.  The grains come out a little in a somewhat short and uneventful finish.
12oz bottle. Light copper pour with a medium ivory head. Pleasant bitterness is tempered by a vague fruitiness, maybe mango. Nice lacing. Slightly sour finish. Well rounded beer.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 One of the brews that made me realize how amazing beer can be.  Something so simple yet inviting about the aroma - begs to be tasted.  Im a fan of the Pacman yeast strain, I think it works well with lots of styles and this is no exception.  Possibly the most balanced beer ive ever had.  Just plain delicious!
Great tasting beer.  Smooth taste and great looking beer.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 pours clear dark amber with a large white head, good retention and lacing. medium body, average carbonation. malty grainy, caramel malts with a nice hoppy profile - floral and herbal. without being resinous. silky, good drinkability. great balance of hops/sweet malts. finish is floral with light bittering hops with a hint of sweet caramel malts. great brew!
Aroma is a little weak, but a beautiful amber/honey/nectar color combined with the not-too-hoppy flavor has me liking this ale a lot. Well-balanced all around with a depth of flavor.
Aroma is real hoppy floral like , appearance is a light amber with a minimal white head, first taste is pretty hoppy with some floral like flavors, pretty good beer

Pours a hazy amber, with a small, quickly dissipating head.  Heavy aroma of honey, malts, caramel and toffee.  Very rich and full bodied!  Flavor is very earthy and woodsy, with caramel and a little alcohol comes through as you finish.  Very Nice, and well balanced!

Bottle 355ml @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours hazy orange with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of caramel, dried fruits, and fruity hops. Taste is light sweet and bitter. Body is medium, textture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Poured into a flute.

4.5 A: Slightly hazy dark orange color. Absolutely lovely head with extremely good retention and tons of lacing.

4.0 S: Very sweet. Light fruity aroma (somewhat tropical). Rather complex, but not pronounced enough.

4.0 T: This is pretty damn good. Good balance between hops and malts, with a little more emphasis on the hops. Hop bitterness as well as an earthy taste. Some toasted light malts.

4.0 M: Medium body. Great carbonation. Really smooth and somewhat creamy.

4.0 D: This is my first Maibock and I like what Im tasting. I could drink a few of these without getting bored, but there is a hoppy aftertaste that gets old after a while.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-16-2008 00:50:19

12 oz bottle into lager glass. Pours a slightly hazy orange with a medium bone-white head with nice retention. Leaves some nice lacework. Malty nose; I smell cinnamon, Sweet Tarts--pretty muted. Smells a little boozy after it warms up a bit. Taste is mostly sweet with some bittering hops noticeable in the finish. Has a grainy flavor in the aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel; medium-high carbonation and body. Much better than I remember it.
Light brown, has a caramel malt aroma with some woody notes and some hops. Medium bodied with some bitterness. Very solid.

(null)
Malt: roasty, caramel
Color: golden
Liquid: clear
Head: frothy
Initial: light sweetness
Finish: light sweetness
Finish Duration: short
Body: medium
Texture: thin
Carbonation: average
Finish: abrupt
Smells of sweet malts and fruit background; taste is sweet, malty with some bittering hops to balance things out; sweet apples and fruit present; ok
12 oz. bottle. Strong caramel aromas.  Rich malty flavors followed quickly by hops.  Very well balanced.  Mild bitter aftertaste.  Still a very good beer.
Aroma is of sweet malts. Taste is bready malts with just enough hops for a bitter bite. Overall a relatively well balanced beer.
12 oz bottle: pours a light copper with a nice head. Aroma is bready and malty. Taste is bland with little complexity.
Malty, pilsener taste.  Good aroma of bread and malts.  A good session beer that Id definitely try again
sorry was not impressed as this was built up by friends to be something bigger and better then what it was
Beautiful amber-orange appearance; fits any season and just about any food.

Bottle pours orange-amber with touches of red and an off-white head. Aroma is sweet with notes of caramel, toasted grain, and a touch of floral/citrus hops. Flavor shows the same with additional notes of vanilla, nuts, and a touch of brown sugar. Overall body is moderate, sweet, and finishes with light to moderate bitterness.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2010 355ml bottle.  Pours light amber with an off-white head.  The nose is faint with mostly caramel notes up front, vanilla, metallic hops, banana and spice.  Initial sweetness, followed by caramel, dried fruit, grass, and a prominent floral note that makes the beer.  Perfectly balanced with a nice bitter finish.

Apricot color with thin lasting head. Nose with hops and sweet notes combined. Smooth intro with a malty mouthfeel, mild carbonation, and a finish with hints of vanilla, overripe banana and a modest lingering hoppiness to complete this balanced beer.
Bottle. Cloudy amber with a small beige head.  Aroma of sweet caramel malt, toast, and fruit. Flavor is sweet caramel malt, hint of spice, and a light bitter dry hop finish.

I am a fan, nice dark red color, nice hops, light malts and fruits, mixed with some nice spices, well balanced, nice flow, a little bitter flavor as well.  I like it, very well done brew.  Walks the fine line of a red ale and IPA for me.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2011 initial rate 12/9/10pours carrot orange, with medium yellowish head. faint aroma of hops. not much to the nose but the finish is a nice bitter hoppy taste. 

rerate 08/3/11: sweet hop aroma. the flavour was real pleasent, lots of fruits, apricot and cherry mostly. a nice refreshing beer, awesome for the style
Taste of malts and light hops. overall nice flavour, decent aroma and good taste
Bottle. Pours amber/brown with slight head that fades. Very malty. Im not getting a lot of hop aroma or flavour. Different in a good way.
great looking amber to red color with frothy white head. the aroma and taste is fruity esters and malt. theres a lot of sweetness in this beer- too much for my taste.
On tap, pours hazy Orange with a thin light tan head.  Aroma is clove, coffee and some toast.  Flavor is rich and malts lots of nutty and toasted malts ending ending with lots of yeast character.

Beautiful honey gold color with a thin, quick-dissipating head. Light citrus and fruit aroma with malt  sweetness to back it up. Hop aroma is there but lets the malt shine through. Flavor is sweet, malty and nutty with just enough hops to balance it out. Hops come forward at the end but leave a balanced aftertaste. Easy drinking.
Very excellent beer. This ale is the perfect size and flavor for any red meat event. Pours great and good to the last drop. Try this beer at least once.

Pale amber appearance. Good clarity. Lemony, zesty smell. Strong head that quickly dissipates. Tastes maltier than the aroma suggests. Hints of brown sugar. Not particularly hop-driven taste. Mouth feel is a bit flat.

A deep honey colored brew as advertised. Minimal head and light fizzy carbonation. Surprisingly heavy body. Flavor is sweet and malty. Yeast is apparent too. Some hop balance, but otherwise this one is nothing special.

640mL bottle
A beautiful looking beer; dense white inch of foam persists on a copper body that is more red than gold and brilliant with clarity.
Aroma of moderate intensity. Malt dominated, lots of light caramelly, husky Munich malts, bit of Melanoidin nutty toffee richness and mild roast. Subtle floral hops detectable, quite clean otherwise.
Lovely creamy texture with excellent mouthfeel and smooth carbonation, with a long palate that eventually dries out.
Plenty more of malt flavour on the body; toasted bread crust, vanilla cookies, golden syrup and sweet bran breakfast cereal.Subtle dried herbal hops linger on a very well finished beer; just enough bitterness to balance that initial sweetness.
Geez this beer is easy to drink! I was wondering why they call it Dead Guy, but at 6.6%, you could very comfortably drink a bit too much of this and...well you get the picture...

What a lovely beer.  Nice maltiness with a pop of hops and a clean finish.  I always saw them but never partook. the honey golden color is nice as well as the honey smell on the nose.  I shall be drinking this beer again
Pours a copper color with small head.  Raisins, aroma and taste, not overpowering though.  Very good drink.
good.  definitely going to buy it again. good taste, good look. after taste is a little off. overall good stuff.
Trevlig ale, men det känns som jag har druckit denna flera gånger tidigare. Trevliga toner, inte för söt, lagom balanserad.

Lucent dark amber, thin beige head, medium-full body, medium-high carbonation.

Aroma: chicken coop, fruity esters.

Taste: chicken coop, astringent malt, and a hint of nobel hop bitterness.

Would be pretty good without the coop flavor.

Pours a lighter copper/orange with a decent off white head. Intoxicating nose of bakery and paradise. Bready flavor with light malts and very subtle hops. The introduction of hops comes slowly after the initial swallow and then lingers for a while. Genius. There IS a flavor in the background I dont care for. I just cant place what it is, but it doesnt belong. Like a burnt sugar or burnt maple syrup or something. It seriously cuts the overall score of this down.
Picked up a bomber at Binnys, Chicago, IL.  Pours a orangish amber color with a medium white head.  Taste is sweet and nutty.  Strong finish.  Good beer.

Poured into a lager glass. Appearance is a hazy copper with a fluffy white head. Good carbonation. Lacing is splotchy. Aroma is of pilsner malts and hops distributed evenly. Taste is very even with a caramel type of taste to it.  This beer isnt necessarily sweet but thay is the closest association I can come up with. This is a fantastic beer and its made even better by the fact that it can be purchased almost anywhere that sells beer.

Dark amber, good head.  Aroma is dank - kind of a chocolately or roasty "dank" with some dried fruit.  Taste is malty - even sweet.  It also has a nice dose of bitterness to it.  Its always been a good beer to me.
Nothing bad to say about this beer.....tastes great...looks great...long live Dead Guy!   Rogue Nation!
I have had this in the bottle, the growler, and on tap.  All have been pretty good.
Pours a med brown with thin white head. Slightly spicy, slightly sweet, nutty flavor with a dry hop finish. Low to medium carbonation.  Very drinkable and nice flavor.

I have had this beer many times before but have never rated it. Its usually my standby when encountering a limited selection.
So When I go to "Save on " in Mentor Ohio, I get singles of beer I had, but never rated....this is one of them.
Pours a burnt orange with thin white head. Great sweet, nutty flavor with a dry hop finish.  Balanced, Medium body makes you want to drink several (and I have). Not a MUST have from rogue, but it is a great go to brew.

Never had this style before. Hazy and no head. I remember the aroma with malt, yeast, hops as well. Great drink to have more than one and still want good flavour. Little hoppy, good carbonation, nice bitterness. Suits my taste well. Recommended. (On tab at The Top)
In bottle; OK beer. Aroma was somewhat sweet, taste was was similar with almost a creamy texture. Not sure how I felt about this one...need to try again

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2011 Pours a lovely mix between amber, golden and orange with a smooth tan head. Smells of rich malts and tastes of dry hops for a splendid combination. Dead Guy Ale has a medium body  and a slightly creamy texture. There is a fair amount of carbonation present but it does not get in the way of the ale and has a nice finish that leaves one longing for more.
Had on draft at erbellis in kalamazoo, mich.  Ive had this a few times in the past.  This is a consistently average beer. Not great, but not bad either.

Pours hazy orange with white head, aroma is some pine hops, caramel, touch of spice.  Taste is some pine, resin hops, with an overwhelming caramel, spice, earth middle, slightly bitter finish.  Not bad.

Bottle:
