This was a really swell beer to drink but I confess to having bought it from the label alone; Id not heard of Rogue until this one.  The colour was a hazy dark red and the reasonably-sized head stuck around for a fair while.  Aroma was nice and malty, as was the taste.  Enjoyed it a lot.

Bottle. Pours a beautiful deep amber with a white head that doesnt last too long but leaves good lacing. The aroma is quite light but the taste is lovely and complex. The hops stand out, as with a lot of Rogue ales, but there are subtle hints of honey, oak and citrus. Great label too.

Pale amber, off white head. Smelled so fine; very malty, molasses, burnt honey, bread crust. To me this tasted like the smell of a proper sour-dough mother, with a grassy afternote. It was very well balanced, easy going, could drink alot of this. Very interesting.

12oz bottle:: poured orange with nice head and good carbination.  Smelled of hops with a brown sugur, carmel malt smell.  Nice smooth flavor with slightly bitter end.  The carmel flavors also lasts.  Pretty good.

pours up with a thick foamy white head that dissipates over a couple minutes.  pure amber colour with light to moderate carbonation.  
aroma is malty with some grassy hops and a touch of bready yeast.  
tatse really follows through with the hoppiness.  accents of grassy, floral hops throughout the mid palate and providing the bitter on the back.  malts provide a sweetness throughout, but are unbalanced with respect to the hops.  
a great, widely available session ale!

(bottle). Amber color with light cloudiness. Medium white head. Light malt and hop aromas. Sweet malt and hop (perfume) flavors. Avg duration. Smooth finish with light bitterness. Slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.

bottled, nice medium copper pour with mod/high carbonation with thick white head, floral hop aroma with the slightest malt back ground, medium body with full hop flavors and higher then expected bitters with hidden sweet malt notes, residual hop acids on palate

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2009 At Oregon Brewers Festival 2009 this was one of my top 3 favorites - about a 4.9. Id tried it several years ago in a bottle and thought it was about a 3 to 3.5. Then more recently I tried it on tap at Rogues location in the Pearl District and it tasted horrible (like a bad Pabst Blue Ribbon wannabe) - 1.0 to 1.5 (nothing at all similar to the way it tasted at the brewfest). My advice on this one is to only buy it on tap & always insist on a sample first!

Bouteille @ SAQ, cuivrée rouge sur le bord de brun. Gazéification médium, le col tiens bien le verre et dure longtemps. Des notes de caramel, une rondeur invitante, des saveurs intéressantes de houblon viennent envelopper le tout.
Poured a reddish orange copper. Nice hop flavor with a dry finish...left wanting more!

Darkish amber head with a little lacing and some decentish retention.  Nose is chocolaty malts with hop finishtaste is much the same.  Caramel and chocolate malts with hop finish, but malts are a little more prominent than hops.  Very drinkable.  Overall though a very balanced brew that is really, really tasty.  Big time recommendation.  Bought this in a half gallon jug, by the way, which only adds to its appeal.

Light amber with thin head, slightly sweet aroma of malt and hay.  Thin mouthfeel, sweet malt, crisp hops, crisp, slightly bitter finish.  Good for a session, but not much to it.  Well balanced and pleasant overall.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2010 Pours a lacing, off-white head with a clear amber body.  Aromas of toast, malt, caramel, resin.  Flavor is toasty, toffee, malt, pine.  Finish is dry with some toffee and dough notes.  Good body.

650ml bottle. Clear and coppery. Nice balance of body, maltiness, sweetness and hop flavour. Smells good too. Very smooth. A little citrusy bitterness. This beer was a great followup to some nice really spicy jerk chicken (@ Kingston 11 Reggae Cafe in North Van). This is described as a Bock brewed with ale yeast. Not sure how that works but there is no questioning the fine quality of the resulting brew. Another good one from Rogue.
Chewy, Malt, Bready, Warm. Almost no bitterness- this is what I look for. Smooth as hell. Bottle at Abraxas Lounge, Miami Beach

Draught at The Local Taphouse, Sydney. Pours amber with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt and floral/citrus and a touch of caramel. Good hop bitterness and a light peppery finish. A tasty Bock.

Amber color with a poor white head, aroma is hopy and notes od roasted malt and florals. A bitter flavor but balanced with sweet note, something like caramel or toffee. Great mouthfeel, some long bitterness.

Overall Impression: 
I have always really enjoyed this beer.  I may be a bit high on it simply because this and Arrogant Bastard are the two beers that really got me into beer, but it is really good.  Helped turn me from someone who enjoyed drinking beer into a beer lover...

This is one of the first microbrews I had in college.  This one is pretty good though I usually find Rogue beers to be a little overpriced.  It has a pale amber color.  The flavor is mild with a good aftertaste.

On tap at Bonefish Grill in Daytona.  First time.  Didnt take notes, but loved the flavor of this bock.

Poured from bottle last night.  Half my pint glass was a big, fluffy, white-ish, head that retained itself for several minutes.   Some lacing too, but not too sticky.    Nice caramel type flavors and not overly malty. Very clean.  Slight bitter hop in the back and there is nothing overpowering in this beer, which is good  as far as Im concerned. I like balance.  Great all around character and flavor.  This a favorite lately.

On tap at Sharx sports bar Virginia Beach.
 Has an Amber/honey appearance with a minimal head.
 The aroma is mild and slightly sweet.
 I like this because I taste both the hos and the sweetness of the malt

Sampled on tap from the Alamo Drafthouse in Houston.  Appearance clear amber with not much head.  Taste is very malty  and sweet with a nice mild bitter finish.  Complex in character.  Very nice, would try this again.

THIS BEER LOOKS LIKE HONEY STRAIGHT UP WITH NO HEAD AND LITTLE AROMA. IT TASTES MILDLY LIKE TOASTY HOPS THAT LACE THE MOUTH WELL. EVERYBODY WHO SAYS IT HAS A FRUITY FLAVOR ARE MISTAKEN, IT HAS A HINT OF SWEETNESS BUT NO FRUITNESS. STRAIGHT UP HOPS AND MALT AND VERY DELICIOUS, GREAT PACKAGING TOO. GETS AN A GRADE IN MY BOOK.

Pours a clear amber color with a thin white head. Smells of sweet malts, toffee, and light hops. Tastes hoppy with sweet malts, fruits, toffee, brown sugar, caramel, and some citrus and pine from the hops. Bitter finish.
UPDATED: DEC 1, 2009 Bottle and on Tap @ Shannon Rose. Dark amber pour with lots to offer. Great flavors and finish. Really enjoy this beer.

I like it. I dont get the "medium body" that others pick up, as it seems kind of thin to me. But it definitely delivers the hops, toasty caramel, and has a nicely balanced sweetness. Not overly sweet, but it works -- and I dont usually go for sweet beers. Not a fantastic price, but it was nice to try it on tap at the Zephy Pub in kent, Ohio.
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2009 Good very sessionable beer. Medium bodied, slightly sweet, very easy to drink despite moderately high alcohol content. Overall good beer. Caramel notes.
dead guy ale is alright, alright by the pricing wasnt really worth the whole deal of it. the taste is alright, and same with the effect. a little overpriced though but it is a microbrew.

White Crane bitter pours a clear amber color with a light tan head. Malty aromas of toasted caramel and pale malts. Smooth medium body. Very good  toasted caramel flavor with some spicy pacman yeast and hops.. Nice hot weather brew.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: 12 oz bottle.  Pours a very cloudy light amber copper with yellow hightlights.  Head is soft white and small.  Smells of brown sugar, toffee, and sweet malt.   Tastes of burnt sugar, roasted malts, sweet corn, some piney and citrus hops.  Aftertaste is slightly fermented friuts.  Body is nice and sticky sweet, almost syrupy, and carbonation is very good.  Some lacing.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2009 On tap in wildwood nj at Goodnight Irenes, I had DeadGuy after enjoying one of my favorite beers (Stone Bastard ale), so i was ready for a little let down but that failed to happen. it was a really nice switch to a  toasty malt-hop beer..the taste of cookie, toasted caramel malts  with resin hops coming through gave a very enjoyable amount of depth and character and  perfectly balanced out this beer..I really enjoyed this one after being very hesitant to order it so that was a nice surprise..Ill be trying this one again very soon, very nice beer...

Tasting at DØE, Aarhus Syd, DK.
Bottled, 170609.
Amber with white head. Aroma of malt and hay. Flavor is caramel, fruit and a hit of alcohol

UPDATED: APR 18, 2010 3,65$ plus deposit at SAQ.  The second american crafted beer available in Quebec after Samuel Adams Boston Lager;  yeah, it is a shame and it is all politics.  Dark orange color, persistant thin layer of foam.  Delicate sweet malt and fruity aroma.  A moderate fruity-herbal hop dominates the taste with obvious notes of, I agree, graham cookies, provided by the mix of malts.  Subtle notes of sweetness, getting more obvious as my glass was emptying.  Pretty complex aftertaste.  Crafty hopping for sure, acting on many layers.  Not overwhelming so, in Quebec, it is rather expensive for what you get, but it is still a very fine beer, easy drinking and totally enjoyable!

Bottle (in NZ). Pours a light amber with a thin white head. Sweet citrus aroma, hints of toffee. Quite a light mouthfeel for 6.6%, sweet stewed fruits and toffee again. The bittering finish has plenty of hops and spirits. Good, but doesnt really stand out.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2009 Draught at WBF. Pours amber in color with a good size white head. Sweet citrusy aroma with a hoppy base. Flavor is a little odd.... I havent had a beer like this one. Sweet, hoppy, and peppery. Very different, but good.

Bottle 355ml. Pours cloudy and amber, with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, toffee, and hint of citrus. Taste is malty toffee, crisp, strong bitter hoppy aftertaste and a hint of citrus. Overall a decent beer.

A nice looking copper orange beer with a decent creamy head that leaves lace but dissipates fast. Aroma is a nicely balanced mix of bready and sweet caramel malt and some spicy, earthy hops. The flavor is much the same, but more dominated by bitter hops. A nice little brew, definetly a west-coast approach to the style: just add more hops.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours a clear amber with a medium off-white head and an aroma of spices, citrus and toffee. The taste is is high on caramelly malts, with ripe fruits and strong bitter hops. The finish is also pretty bitter and a bit alcoholic too. A pretty good beer
Pours cloudy orange with a thick tan head. Aroma is sweet caramel and citrus. Smooth feel mostly caramel flavor with apricot and berry. Finishes with bitter roast and has excellent balance.
One of my favorites and the dead guy makes a great Halloween decor item too!

Pours a cloudy dark medium amber with a frothy light tan head. Aroma is nutty with caramel, some fruit, and a little smoked malt.
Flavor is well into the malty side. Flavors of rich caramel, honey, light roasted malt and toffee. Sweet, bitter, and hearty. Palate is just above average. Decent malty brew.
Light copper in the glass, thin white head, lively carbonation.  Strong bitter taste, hint of sweetness.

341ml bottle from SAQ. Pours clear light amber with a big fluffy light brown head. Lots of bubble flowing from bottom to top. Lacing head, good retention. Aroma is malty, caramel. Some hints of honey, spices, hops and red fruits.  Taste is light bitterness, spices, quite sweet. Alcohol is quite present. Carbonation is quite present but not too much. Great brew, just not exactly my thing.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2009 A clear golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma is malty sweet of fruits with notes of hop bitter. The taste is dry bitter, with fruits. Notes of caramel in the back. The aftertaste is dry bitter. 6/10-3/5-6/10-3/5-14/20
23-07-09. (New Review) Its stil a clear golden colored beer, with a thick foamy off-white head. The aroma is malty, with caramel, spices and many hops. The taste is soft sweet. It has hop bitterness and fruits like citrus. It has crisp with a touch of chocolate, The aftertaste is nice bitter and a little sweet.

Bottle pours medium amber with a creamy off white head.  Slight honey like aroma with some buttery notes.  Slight dryness at the beginning of the taste with some sweet malts, ,raisins, and brown sugar.  Slight off flavors at the end.
Bottle. Orange colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweetish malt. Flavour is sweet, malt, caramel with some dry bitterness. Medium to full-bodied and quite balanced.
big aroma of toffee and russian fudge. Caramel, honey and spice flavours. A bit syrup-like. More bitterness and hop would make it more drinkable.

Nice looking beer, the body is a cloudy burnt orange that appeared to be almost glowing sitting in my mug, very little head was produced and that witch was vanished instantly leaving zero bubbles and lacing behind. The sent had a good amount of hops in it they didnt overpower the smell, the rest of the aroma was made up of a floral honey, and as the beer got warmer a toffee like sent was noticeable, all together this brew smells great. Very clean taste nice and crisp and very refreshing, a good malty back bone with just the right amount of hops with just a touch of tomato soup, and what I think is some honey in the back ground. The mouth fell is also very crisp, strange how this beer had zero head but still had a good carbonation feeling going on. Great brew I would like to drink more of it if it wernt for the rarity and price of the beer here in the great white north.
Flaske: Flot orange ravfarvet øl med et fint skumhoved. Forholdsvis frugtet smag med en god del bitterhed. Bare ikke min type smag. Drikbar men ikke mere.

Im glad to finally rate this popular craft brew. It has a nice balanced aroma of fruit, toffee, and hops. It also seemed a bit nutty. It has a nice amber color with an off white head. Sweet, candyish flavors are what I notice first, followed by caramel, berries, and a nice, spicy malt character. Its balanced well with moderate hopping. I enjoyed this one.

Bottle - Pours an orange brown color, almost no head.  Nose is somewhat fruity with a hint of alcohol.  Hops taste is very mild, finishes with a taste of alcohol.  I personally like more hops, this is a good brew, but not something Im going to grab often.
bouteille brune de 355ml. bière de belle couleur orangée-cuivrée. nez malté, sucré, agréable. la bouche a une bonne amertume, puissante et longue. très bonne

Beautiful, red-brown beer, with medium and velvet-like beige head. Malty sweetness, dryed fruits, syrup and redcurrants. Flavour is similar than aroma but it is not sweet anymore and there are interesting "dry sweet" taste in the end. Surprisingly, nicely slippery and medium bodied to drink. Great beer with "weird" nuancees, definedly worth to try.

Sampled at Maizies in Phoenix. Pours a deep amber with minimal white head. Aroma is of amber malt candy and spicy American/Noble hops. Taste is a very interesting meld of malt sweetness and hop bitterness/flavor that intermingles very well. I had forgotten how enjoyable this beer is.
(bottle) Pours orange-red with a finger of head leaving some lacing on the glass.  Spicy, somewhat complex flavor yet quite refreshing.  Thoroughly enjoyed.
Bottle shared by Vinens Verden. Hazy orange body with a small off-white head. Aroma is hops, fruit and caramel. Flavor is sweet malt, citrus and hops.

aroma is grassy and somewhat like pool water? flavor is kinda spicy and citrusy that develops a heavier hop flavor as it slides down the tongue. definite grapefuit attributes. not my thing, but good at what it is.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with a big off-white head. Malty aroma, pine. Sweet tasting department, which turns peppery towards the end, nice one.

Pours a clear amber orange with medium off-white head.  Aroma very strong of sweet malt, grass, and slight floral hops.  Flavor similar with the addition of spices and honey.  Mouthfeel is a bit slick with a dry finish.  Aftertaste is just ok.  Altogether a nice drink and very refreshing.
smells of hops and lightly of fruit. the tase was very intense with a bit of grapefruit flavor. went down smooth and delicious, and practically begs you to grab another.

Taster at Vinens Verden. :-) 
Pours golden with a off white head. 
Aroma is hay and pine, with weak notes of fruit, caramel and honey. 
The flavour is quite dim and dry with sweet malt, citrus and weak notes of honey. 
Light bodied and with a nice bitter aftertaste.

Bottle kindly shared by Vinens Verden. Deep amber body with a medium white head. Hoppy and fruity aroma with a good kick of malt and caramel. Flavour is sweet malty with some citric hoppy notes. APA like beer. Medium bodied.

355 ml bottle. Finland.
Dark amber colour with small off-white head. Malty, yeasty, fruity (citrus) and some hoppy aroma. Sweetish malty, hoppy, citrusy flavour with some spices and alcoholic warmth. Slightly too sweet.
Rich aroma and plenty of flavor to follow up with.  Complex taste that encourages you to have another.

Bouteille de 12 oz. Arômes de malt allemand (munich), légère touche citronnée de houblon. Très belle robe orangée et petite mousse qui tient bien. Bien ronde en bouche pour le style, des notes de sucre dorge et de miel sont accompagnées par une touche fruitée et une légère présence de houblon citronné et herbeux. Finale légèrement amère. Simple mais efficace.
Amber colour, small off white head. Some lacing on glass. Balanced hop, malt flavour. Medium lasting hoppy finish.

355 mL Bottle.Deep honey body with a frothy off-white head that settles to a tenacious film lacing the sides of the glass generously. Aroma is sweet malt, crystal malt, tangy hops, honey, and grapefruit rind. This beer has a sweet malty-nutty flavor with crystal malt and hop bitter expressing in the aftertaste followed by a nutty-hoppy-honey finish. Nice, smooth mouth feel. I like the Halloween motif on the label.
Pours a light orange with a fluffy white head. Light fruity aroma and sweet malty flavor. Its maybe a little too sweet for this style, but this is definitely a good beer. LC

Lots of head when poured from bottle into glass.  When I first started drinking it was too cold, making the flavor very poor. As it warmed up, it was much better with hops and a little carmal.  It was very smooth and my first Heller Bock.
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2009 Douce bière, pourtant asser forte avec son 6.6% dalcool, aux saveurs de miel et de noisettes grillées. Elle termine avec un goût légèrement corsé de houblon.

amber, malty english butter smell. taste was a standard but pleasant bitter at first but turned milk chocolatey, very smooth with a deep taste including tea. pretty good and luckily am still confusing the lcbo employees and getting expensive beers as generic 2$ purchases... :shhh:

Good head carbonation strong colour misty orange amber like aroma earthy woody caramel honey nutty flavour honey caramel woody touch always good resinous hoppy taste decent bitter brown sugar toffee finish malty tastes bitter

This is what beer is supposed to taste like!  strong caramel and fruit aromas.  hops and caramel combine for a mildly sweet taste that is quite unique.  However, the aroma is certainly what stands out with this beer.

355 ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy orange gold with small subtly off white head.  Mild caramel malty aroma with slight hoppishness.  Malty flavour with notes of caramel, bread and spice.  Nicely balanced by decent hoppy finish.
Pours golden with a decent head and no lacing. Nice malty aroma. It was my first Heller Bock, and I thought it was pretty good.

My first heller bock I think poured copper to orange and clear around the edgeswith off white head that quickly dissapates aromas are of malts,yeast and caramel and the taste brings up notes of malts,pepper,bread and caramel slightly sour and dry finish

This beer pours a very crisp amber, with a nice size head. The nose is of a mild malt. The body is medium , and the flavor is of a light malt with mild hint of caramel. Very drinkable. A lot better than "The Texas Bock" wich is crap!

Pours light amber with some gold colour, white head, and nose is very faint & disappointing. Palate offers the traditional maibock malt forwardness, but it is somewhat fruity sweet and lacks the alcohol warmth that is a regular component of the maibock experience.  Very drinkable.

Aroma of "german" malt and smome fermented citrus...grapefruit.  Definite sweet, buttery malt aroma and taste.  Nicely balanced beer with hops and malt evenly matched.  Flavor is sweet, not overly bitter, and very easy to drink.  I would have guessed an ABV at around 4.5 - 5, so the 6.6 is very surprising.  Overall, an excellent beer that Id definitely buy again.

Pours a dark golden color with a little head lots of carbonation sweet floral zesty aroma mellow taste sweet with a slight hop bite at the end its well balanced gosh this is great beer you can definitely put a bunch of these down good job
On tap at Stone.  Amber with a quickly disappearing head.  Light swirly lace.  Not much nose at all.  Iced tea flavors with a lightly tart sweetness.  Mediciny finish.

12 oz bottle.... my second favorite from rogue.... i tried this beer when i first turned 21, and hated it... i decided to give it another try a few months ago.... great stuff.... shows how much your taste in beer changes over time.... disappointed that i have been missing out on this one for so many years

UPDATED: APR 17, 2011 Enjoyed via 12oz bottle.  Pours a medium golden color, darker than a pilsner, but lighter than an American Amber Ale.   I have enjoyed this beer on several occasions, and was extremely impressed by its latest incarnation.  The nose is totally malt-forward, caramel, munich, and perhaps a little bit of American 2-row sweetness.  Hops say, "Hello," but only to balance what would otherwise be a cloying sweetness.  The finish is just to the malty side of center on the sweet/dry spectrum.  Overall, extremely enjoyable.  Well done!

Nice amber color with a lasting thick head.  Definitely a pretty beer with a well balanced blend of malts and hops.  Smelling the 1pt 6 oz bottle produces a nice caramel/toffee smell stronger than when poured in the glass.
A fairly good one. Mellow but slightly complex flavor with a little bit of a hoppy finish.

Man, no rating for Dead Guy. One of the beers that opened my eyes to good beer. Still enjoy this one in bottles occasionally. Aroma and taste are balanced with malt sweetness and the right amount of hops. The body is nice and this beer is consistent.

After the hop trip beers Ive been into lately, this is a really nice walk on the malty side. I could lose myself in the colour. The aroma is of fresh pumpernickel bread and toffee. The flavour is a malt fugue of pure heaven, with an aggressively bitter follow through. Tasty. I want more but I only had the one bottle.

The one thing that really comes to mind when I drink this beer is balance. It comes across with a hoppy kick then follows with a strong malty finish that is not overwhelming. This is a great beer that will give you a little more to ponder than most others, while retaining its easy drinkability. Just a great medium bodied ale.
12 oz bottle. Pours a golden orange color with a nice white lasting head. Fairly strongly hopped with a hay, caramel and honey flavor. A great beer.

12 oz bottle (have had this one many time on tap while out and about with friends, so i have had a rating based on the draft version, just havent taken the time to write down my notes on it).  A well balanced aroma, fairly unique, not too potent.  Some spicy citrus zest, nutty cookie, popcorn, a little funky herb, leafy grass, and German pale malt.  Pour is decent, not a bad looking beer with the sleek dark burnt orange color, smaller frothy carbonation head, medium light opacity.  The feel on the beer isnt bad either as theres a good crispness that combines with a creamier fuller feel.  The taste is kind of muddled yet in general balanced as flavors come in and out, with no one player really solidifying its presence. Caramel cookie, citrus, leafy salad hops, and pale malts probably stand out the most.  As one of the beers that was there while I was first getting into beer, Dead Guy will always be remembered.  It may not be the best out there, but it really is a good sessionable brew and often the beer to get at bars when theres nothing else.

Pours a orange gold color with a nice white frothy head.  Has a good level of hops and a pepper taste.  Nice beer.

Pint draft
One of my favorite beers.  I am glad it is being more widely distributed.  It even made a brief appearance at my local Smokey Bones.

Poured from a 22oz. bottle into a pint glass.

The color is a hazy orange/amber with a foamy white head.

The smell is hoppy, a peppery, floral flavor..

The taste is again quite hoppy with some nice malty background. Some great floral feel.

Mouthfeel is a little strong, but is quite evenly manageable. Has a nice drinkable feel as well.

Serving type: bottle

Pours a hazy, murky deep orange/red honey color.  Aroma of sweet malts/caramel. Moderate head mostly diminishing with nice lacing throughout.  Definite yeast presence.  Roasted straw and light molasses.  Slightly sweet taste and light bitter finish, lasting a good measure.  Medium-bodied and well balanced beer.  Definite malty, caramel flavor.  Not very hoppy to me, even in finish.  Good malted beer - Cheers!
Sweet caramel and honey aroma. Flavor is much the same, sweet of caramel without being overly roasted. Some hop near the finish.

Bouteille de 355 ml. Nos yeux observent une bière de couleur ambrée qui possède un col de mousse crémeux et durable. Au nez on respire des arômes de caramel, de noisettes avec des esters dalcool. En bouche le corps est rond avec une effervescence faible-moyenne. On goûte des saveurs de caramel, de fruits et dalcool. Laisse un arrière goût métallique.
aroma is lots of sweet roasted malts. drinks sweet and rich with lots of malt and a little hops trying to come through. finishes sweet.
Malty to look at and malty it is.  Sweet balanced malts and alot of depth.  Very grainy.  Good beer.

huge sweet malty nose undermines the distinct hop base that shines through upon the first taste.  once the bitterness recedes, the sticky grains return for a sweet finish. nearly cloudy darkened gold.  palate is the real star here, bitterness and sweetness alternate at the speed of light followed by equally quick finish with just a touch of hops lingering afterwards.  very well balanced brew that does more then pay the bills, this is a true classic of american craft brewing -- and for good reason.
Draft at Shannon Rose.  Pours a amber body with an off white head.  Nice pine and citrus notes with a big caramel malt backbone.  Threw this pint down quickly.
Straight from the growler. Aroma of caramel malt and citrus. Sweet but not overly sweet.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a small white head.  Smells of honey, spice, citrus, and some malt sweetness.  Medium carbonation with a medium body.  Nice honey, floral, and spice notes on the palate.  Medium finish with some lingering spice and bitterness.  An excellent balance of malt and hops.  This is an great brew that is highly drinkable.  A great beer to have on hand at all times.
Bitter. Caramel, nutty and bit roasted malt. Fruity and woody aroma with stronger alcohol taste. Dry bitter hop aftertaste. Amber color.

Bottle. Pours a nice orangey amber slightly foggy colour with an off white head. Average lacing. Aroma of dark caramel malts.  Great flavour on this one. Really nice caramel, butter, butterscotch, dark fruit malts balanced by some bitterness.. Medium body. The finish is balanced to a tee. What makes this beer stand out is the unique clean malts. Rogues staple. Extra points for the label. That pink to blue sky fade is super cool. Could be the best label on a beer that Ive ever seen.

Great aroma you can really smell and taste the saaz. It has a nice colour. Kind of a hazy orange. Creamy mouth feel. The sazz hops dominate the palate. This is not what I would expect of a maibock but I think it is pretty damn good. Also, the name is kick ass.

This reminds exactly of a double/imperial IPA but they have used a lot of dry hopping to bring out the aroma instead of massive amounts in the boil for bittering. There is quite a nice amount of bitter in the flavour but its not too bitter. The aroma really is nice and heavy, a strong waft of saaz. The flavour isnt quite as strong as the aroma would lead you to believe. A very nice balance. I could definately enjoy a few of these consecutively.

Bottle.  Orange pour, light, lasting head.  Fruity aroma with just a touch of funk.  Ooh, maybe this is skunked.  Bitter and harsh right out of the gate, though this quickly fades. Not sure Im getting the sweet finish others have written about.  Its not a drain pour, but its not what I was hoping for either.
355ml bottle. Hazy orange color. Aroma is fruity, malty and rather sweet. Flavor is refreshing thanks to citric hops. Finish is very sweet. Pretty good nonetheless.
bottle.  good byt.  nice beer for drinking on a couch in the mid day.  overpriced in the midwest

2/7/09 On draft at the Boiler Room, Sun Valley, Id. Aroma is fruity, citrusy, almost candilike, with very low cramel and light alcohol. Appearance is clear gold with a well maintained white head. Flavor is sweet malt forward with moderate caramel, low sourness and low citrusy bittering. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with light cream and a moderate carb texture. Overall, very easy drinking, but just a little low on character.
Pours an orange amber with a small white head... malty aroma, earthy hops... Sweet malty flavor with an oddly dry hoppy finish, very unmaibocky... decent beer, but the sweetness is its downfall...

A nice amber with a huge off-white head. Aroma is pretty heavy hops with a decent malty-sweet backbone. Flavor is fairly balanced but the finish kind of has a weird twang to it. Kind of too sweet to be considered drinkable.

All I remember from this beer is that it put hair on my feet and toes. This was a pretty strong ale, but the actually flavor escapes me as it was a while ago so Ill have to give it another try when I have a chance.

Bottle conditioned, 650ml from Sainsburys, Banbury. Clouded amber with slight head. Sweetish malty beer, quite thick on the tongue with an apple caramel flavour to the foreground. A little too cloying to make it refreshing, but it does disguise the alcohol well. Reasonable without getting exciting.
Smells and tastes like a malty dough with yeast. Appears a cloudy golden  with white head.  Good balanced flavor with malts & hops.  A short chalky aftertaste.

Bottled. (12,64 oz) Has a reddish copper color with a big white head. Smells of banana, malt, hops, and other mixed fruit. Taste is fruity, and spicy, with a good crispness of hops, and a smoothness from A good malt balance. Great take on the style.

I really, really like this beer on draft but I think it loses something from the bottle. Caramel and deep maltiness dominate the aroma and flavor. There is a suble hoppiness that works very well for the beer. Love it.
it is what it is...
Bottle. Glowing red copper with a medium head. Great raisins and nuts aroma and flavours, dry nuttiness. A superior bock.
12oz. bottle from L.C.B.O. in Toronto. Amber color nice thick beige head. The taste is of malt and vegetables with a sour bitter taste added to it. Some hops but not enough.

What can you say about the dead guy? This is an outstanding beer with a wonderful array of malt flavors and aromas complimented with a gentle hoppiness. The munich and caramel malts lend a rich biscuit and caramel flavor that represents the german Bock style very well, a definite go to.
UPDATED: AUG 14, 2009 I just simply like this ale, it has a nice balance of flavors that are always pleasing to the palate.  Try pouring it over Guinness makes for a interesting blend
12oz bottle:  Poured cloudy semi golden brown color with a quickly dissipating off white head.  Scent of a weak IPA.  Taste is pretty much the same mild hints of hops with a sweetish aftertaste.
Had hints of orange peel with a decent aftertaste. A bit pricy though I would get it again.

Brilliantly clear and copper-colored, about an 8 or 9 SRM. Head is fluffly with excellent retention. Has a crisp pale malt aroma accentuated by caramel and mild, earthy hops. Tastes sweet and malt balanced but with enough hops to provide a full-mouthfeel and compliment to the nutty, toasty overtones. Hopping is proportionately low, however, as is bitterness. Flavor is not sweet like caramel but more a candy sweetness from the heavy dosage of malts, which I find agreeable to my tastes. A decent beer, if overrated.

Brownish amber with a small white head. "Balanced" aroma with equal amounts of caramelly malt and hops. Wow, this is sweet tasting. Very thick and syrupy texture. A medium bitterness only manifests itself in the aftertaste. Does that make this a balanced beer or no?t. I honestly dont know.
22 oz bottle  a nice ale taste slightly of citrus with a slight blend of hops. first pour has a beautiful head. A good quality beer that is above average but I would not call great.
Great balance.  Smooth.  A touch of chocolate and fruit.  Not a work of art, but a great beer to drink on a regular basis.  Good by itself and with food.  Copper color, medium head.
The beer I keep coming back to.  And back to.  And back to.  Nealry perfect combination of malt and hops.
excellent taste, great balance, great aroma, and goes down very smooth. love it!
Excellent tasting beer! Very flavorful with not too much bite considering the alcohol content.  Very smooth and delicious aftertaste. Really enjoyed this one!

On tap at the Union......love this beer!!!!!! Very nice copper/orange pour with a decent head. The aroma is slightly sweet, yeast and some caramel. Flavor is outragous! fall fruits....apples and pumpkins leaves and yeast. its like autumn in a bottle.Sits on the palate decent as well. Sooooooo tastey

Bottle at Oliver Twist.
Beautiful copper. At first there is just german hop flavour and dull, but after a while there is more complexity.
This is my favorite ale that i have had thus far. It poured a beautiful orange color that held a semi sweet flavor. Great beer.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2010 12oz bottle. $2.45 Julios Liquors. Pours a hazy orange. Found it to be a tad on the sweet and yeasty side for my tastes though Im sure others will like it all that much more for this. Overall a good ale though.

4-7-10 Bottled as "White Crane Bitter" Not entirely convinced this is the same as a dead guy but ratebeer says it is so. This one did not come off as sweet and yeasty.  This time around it had a nice hop bite and was more like an IPA.
pretty good beer i think it is good is it good I think so Do you? Drink It I will if you dont I dont need to describe the flavors that has been done
Bottle.  Pours a  brown/reddish with a quick dissapating head. Aroma:  some roast,  hops and honey. Flavor: light roast, caramel and hops.

Pours a pure honey color, lots of action, some sediment from the swirl, and an off white head that disipated.
Caramel malt smell.
Caramel malt dominates the taste with an alcohol finish and has some grapefruit hops in the background.
Medium bodied and has a smooth and resinous palate with a crisp carbonation.
Very drinkable, more of a an inline session beer as in to start with something lighter and finish with something heavier.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2009 En verns bayside en orcas island de san valentin con la bea. Tambien los sicilia. Esta rica esta birria hoppy y un poco de malta.  talvez es la mejor del viaje, aunque vienen varias en camino.

From bottle at local grocer. Pours a cloudy orange-gold with a large fast diminishing head with good lacing. Excellent balance of sweet malt and hops. Nice musty sweet aroma. Very drinkable with a bitter-sweet slightly yeasty aftertaste. Very nice ale, and I am not a huge ale fan.Nice malty slightly fruity nose. Overall a very nice offering from Rogue.

Straight off the tap, it pours a nice golden yellowish-brown with a thin head.  The taste is sweet, smooth, a little hoppy, with only the slightest hint of bitterness.  Ale lovers everywhere should try to make the pilgrimage to Newport, Oregon because Rogue is certainly one of the finest breweries in the world.
I love this ale.  Golden in color, flavor, and an overall wow.  Very smooth.  Taste the hops and sweet malts.  Great brew from Rogue.

650ml bottle.
Pours a "deep honey" beer with a tall cream coloured head. Hoppy nose, lots of Saaz and a little light fruits. Malty flavour of honey, syrup, a small amount of wood and just a hint of alcohol. Creamy smooth feel, chewy, sweet and bready finish. A little too sweet and creamy for me, I would have preferred a bit more bitterness and crispness to balance it out. But overall not a bad beer.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC. Pours a slightly hazy, deep orange with an inch thick, very dense, slowly dissipating, yellow-cream colored head with lots of nice lacing. More great work by the Flying Saucer in pouring its beers. Aroma of sweet malts and that familiar Rogue yeast. A bunch of dark toffee and caramels. Slightly woody and light orange hops. Flavor is a very full sweet malt with a touch of soft bittering citrus hops to balance this brew out. Lots of caramel and toffee and a bit of burnt sugar to it. Palate is buttery, smooth, and full with a light bitterness in the linger. Overall, one of the original beers that got me into the wonderful world of craft beer. A great representation of the style and a beer that really hits the spot for me any time. As always, solid and reliable.

Pours a nice orange-gold, small short lived white head. Lacing is there but not pronounced.

 Fruity-Hoppy nose. Very appealing, crisp and fresh.

 Medium-Heavy mouth-feel with very lgiht carbonation.

 Tangy and hoppy. The malty sweetness is a background note to a solid hop base. There is a yeasty after-taste that isnt the most pleasant taste.

 Good stuff, very good every day brew.
Bier Koning. Golden orange body with slight head. Hoppy and fruity nose. Taste of caramel, fruits, and hops. Really nice and balanced palate. Warming finish. Well done.
Was pleasantly suprised with this selection. A nice variety of malts and hops in good balance. Went down smooth.

"Heller" good bock - well almost. Wait, how is this a bock and an ale at the same time?  Golden color with minimal white head.  Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, maybe some light fruits.  Sweet caramel malts, fruity/floral flavors, spices, yeast, and some mild hops. Nice palate for the style.  Satisfying beer but not overwhelming. Enjoyed this a lot down at the beach.

Beer pours golden in color with a very slight white head.  Aroma is subtle with a slight hint of hops and malt.  Beer has a mild maltly sweetness that fades quickly with a slight hop bitterness.  Nice beer

This is a very nice ale. One of the best Ive tried yet, although Im a rookie beer taster. Pours a cloudy unfiltered honey amber with little head. The aroma is sweet malt with just a hint of hops and an even smaller hint of metal. The flavor is a very balanced sweet bitter malt with just the perfect hint of hoppiness. The after tast reminds me of a bitter sweet green bell pepper that keeps without turning foul like many other brews. The palate is moderate and dries out quickly. At $12 U.S. a sixer, I consider this a fair price for an excellent ale. I would recommend this to any serious beer drinker.

Good beer.  I liked the double dead guy ale a little bit better, but it is also steeper in price.  I found this beer to have almost a dirty/earthy taste (not bad).  It looks great out of the bottle and has a good bitter smell to it.  The cascading hops help greatly with the appearance.  Not going to be my everyday beer, but very good on occasion.

Now my rating for this is probably skewed. I was very drunk when I tried it. However from what I recall this was a smooth, mildly bitter beer that was very easy to drink.I should drink it sober to re- rate, but from what I remember there wasnt anything noteworthy to go back for
Golden copper pour into off white foamy head. Aroma of malt and piney hops. Initial flavor of sweet malt that fades into a well balanced slightly hoppy bitterness.

22 oz bottle. Pours an amber, copper color with a 1/2" white head. Aroma is malts, grains and hops. Palate is  average. A little thin, but ok. Nicely balanced flavor of malts, caramel and hops. This was one of my "gateway" beers into better beer. There was a time when I thought this was the cats ass.

Bouteille de 12 oz dégustée chez Arvads Grill & Pub (Waterbury, VT) Arôme: Odeur dagrumes avec une pointe de caramel et de noix. Apparence: La couleur est orangée voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes et de caramel avec une pointe dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence dagrumes en arrière goût. (Rating #2168)

Enjoyed the first couple of tastes 

but the hoppy middle/end was just a little too much for me
Wow!  My kind of beer.  rich, malty, thick, smooth, I didnt think that it was too hoppy.  Nice brown color.  Will be added to my repertoire.

Pours a slightly hazy copper color with virtually no head and an exceedingly thin ring of lace around the outside of the glass. Balance is the word that defines this beer for me. Malty, sweet caramel notes are equally matched by the bitter hoppiness. Easy to drink.

Nice head, good lacing, nice color.

Citrusy aroma, fairly hoppy.

Bold flavor, tends toward a hop bitterness in the middle and aftertaste of every drink.

Medium bodied bock, A biting bitter taste lingers on the palate, definitely indicative of a heller bock.

Good, but not great.

Pours golden with a white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is of malt, caramel, citrus, and nuts. Taste is of malt, caramel, earthy hops, and toasted nuts. Finish on each sip is very dry. Biting, spicy bitterness underneath. Not overly great, but a very drinkable beer.
Clear pour, large amounts of toasted nut and caramel, alcohol shows up well, finishes slightly dry with fair amount of hops.
Golden color with a decent head. Smell of citrus notes. Smooth mouth feel with just enough of a hop finish. A good beer overall.
Copper pour with small tan head.  Hops with some spice and citrus.  Smooth with no aftertaste.

22oz. Bottle:  Aroma of malts, toasting, fall leaves, nuts, and slight caramel.  Poured amber/orange in color with a large, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Clear.  Slightly sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of malts, toasting, nuts, leaves and light caramel.  Medium body.  Thinish, slightly dry, slightly sticky texture.  Average carbonation.  Sweet, malty, caramel and nut finish.
Pours copper with tan head. A light smell of citrus hops and malt with some spice. Smooth through the mouth. Pretty good.
Deep golden body with firm whote head, a little sweet on the nose, and a nice hoppy taste with good balance all around.

Bottle. Pours a clear copper with a one figer off-white head that leaves good lacing. Light aroma of sweet malt and a touch of floral spicy hops. Taste is the same as aroma but more prominent. Medium mouthfeel with a mild to moderate amount of bitterness. Good.
Golden amber with rapidly disappearing white head.  Not much aroma, just slight malt.  Malty, yeasty flavor with background bitterness, good example of the maibock style.
Bottle.  Pours and amber oragne cloudy color with a nice but small white head.  Smells a little tart, taste like citrus and spice and a smooth malt back.
Draft. All sour malt on this one. Intriguing in some senses but out there in not the best ways. Touch watery and indistinct.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2009 One of my old favorites.  Appearance is a cloudy orange-amber.  Didnt retain much head this time but I used a bad glass.  Aroma is somewhat sour.  Flavor I detected plenty of citrus (pineapple at one point), perhaps a little (very little) caramel and somehow bitter and sweet with a good hops aftertaste.  Tasty little brew, not everyone loves it but to each their own.

Pours a copper red with a nice white head - nice aroma of hops, fruit and some caramel. There were not any surprises with the taste - hops, citrusy, toffee, cramel and some bitterness.  Finished fairly creamy though with a little bit of an alcohol kick to it... definitely not as overwhelming on the alchol scent and taste as the Double Dead Guy Ale.  Solid Brew.

12 oz bottle. Hazy golden amber color. Nice head that left lace on the side on the way down. Nice hoppy head aroma with an undertone of maltiness. Starts hoppy and citrusy flavored, ends with a little hops bitterness.
Cloudy orange colored brew. Hoppy and citrus aroma. Hoppy and bitter flavor, slightly fruity and the texture is a bit thin.
Poured a nice orange amber. Had it in a draft and was no pleased. Would like to try it out of a bottle.
Light, fizzy, orange body. Citrus aroma. Quite Hoppy with caramel and peaches in the finish.

Bottled as white crane.  Pours a gently hazed dark amber color with a monstrous popcorn colored head white deflates down to a manageable size.  Aromas of sweet malt and toast and toffee.  Medium thick body with a bit of sweetness.  Slowly developing, but all too quickly receding bitter finish.  Nicely balanced, but almost seems like something is being held back, and that this beer could just be a little bit more forward.
Sweet malt aroma. Cloudy orange color with a medium white head. Sweet flavor in the beginning that mellows in the finish.
Bottle at Craigs house. bread, grass, golden, hazy, aminimal head, lightly bitter, light body, sticky,

This was my first love in beer. It was the first craft one I tryed and its been a stapel for me eversence. Nice malty backbone that compeats with its hoppy aroma. Super balanced beer. Highly recomended
Yummy.  Bottle to glass.  Yellow to amber color.  Bit hazy with not much head.  Nice hoppy taste, with maltiness mixed in.  I would seek a case of this...

Bottle. Poured a hazy amber color with a thin head. Aroma of sweet malt and piney hop. Smooth on the palate with light carbonation. You can taste the hops on and off with a caramel and grassy finish. This beer suprised me, it is better than it is rated to me.

Almost zero head. Marmalade color. Bouquet smells sweet like a cross between strawberries and cotton candy. Texture is crisp initially, and then warms up. Bitter. Citrus. This is a good beer, I enjoyed it!

Very light red / amber body with short lasting head. Faint caramel notes in the aroma, that was just sweet malts on first whiff, then some piney notes. Taste got better towards the end of the bottle, happens quite often, good body and good finish.

Bottle. always looked at this one and never tried it. glad i did. good nose of malts and pine trees. Amber copper color with a thin head that laces well. . . kind of sweetish, good pine and light grass notes. Hops seem to flow in and out of the palate. sometimes they are there, and sometimes not. Strange. A little fruit in there as well.. The spiciness of the Saaz hops shows through as it warms. leaves a funky metal bitter fruit aftertaste.Grapefruit I suppose.

Bomber. Shared this with a couple of people. Pours copper with light off-white head. Aroma is malt, grainy with some piney hops. Flavor is again heavy on malt with some grains and hops. Full bodied brew dominated by roasted malts. Nothing special.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2008 Copper colored, little bit lighter then I actually thought it would be. Sweet on the one hand and then kind of hoppy at odd intervals.  Not worth the 15 bucks I paid for a six pack. But good beer.

APPEARANCE: Poured into a pint glass, a somewhat cloudy copper gold ale with a cream-colored head was observed. Good head retention and nice lacing noticed.

AROMA: Bread, pine, citrus 

FLAVOR: Nothing really terrible here. Sweet honey-like grain flavors hit me up front, then a grapefruit-like bitterness in the aftertaste. The two did not blend too well for me. It was like two very separate parts with no harmony, the bitterness just did not finish as well as I would have liked.

PALATE: Rather light mouthfeel. A little thinner than I prefer. Carbonation is good.

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Overall, this is an o.k.  ale. The lighter body allows one to drink easily, but the after taste was just a little harsh. Others have given this a high rating. Maybe a different bottle will change my opinion. 

Serving type: bottle

A nice mixed nose of sweet malts and hops greets me as the top pops off the bottle that my wife brought back from her meanderngs. An average gold with a decent head in the glass.  Not much nose away from the glass.  No lacing.  Sweet slick malts step up and are overtaken as the beer morphs into an IPAish thing.  Tasty and refreshing.
poured slighly cloudy honey color - aroma of malts - taste is ok but not really my style - drinkable but not a great taste in my book.
Bottle: Pours a darker honey color with no head and very little lacing. Tastes of a piny malt with strong hops and alcohol. Nice and refreshing on the palate, well made brew.

355ml bottle bought from Cornelius Beer and  Wine in Edinburgh. Though I never was that great fan of the Grateful Dead, I took pride in drinking this one. Pours a clear amber body, with only a ring of foam, diminishing from a huge, initial white head. Straight smell of sweet malts. Malty taste profile with sweet, dark caramel added by fresh, tropical fruits leading to a bittersweet ending. Rather well bodied. More or less like the band. Edinburgh 23.10.2008.

Draught @ Berryhill - Pours copper with no head...aroma is toasted malt, rich grain, slight pine...flavour follows, caramel malts are out of balance with the hop bitters, but it is still enjoyable, finishes with a lingering bitterness...

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2011 (Draught at Pikkulintu, 20110805) The beer poured deep amber and clear. Its head was small and white. Aroma had malts, molasses and treacle. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, molasses, sweetness, fresh malts, hops and bitterness. Aftertaste was malty and mildly bitter. Decent malty beer.

Bottle on 2008-12-06. Amber and clear. Medium sized white quite quick head. Malty and roasty aromas nose. Full bodied and dry palate with medium carbonation. Malts, roastedness, toffee, sweetness, bittterness in taste. Toffee and bitterness in aftertaste.

Bottled. Amber/orange body, thick off-white head. Aroma like that of a fruity whisky... Cragganmore anyone? Fruits, something sweet and perhaps marshmallowy in the aroma. The taste is balanced and good, but doesnt have that little extra that gets me going. But the finish does a pretty decent job.

Pours a nice deep orange colour with a thick white head.  Nose is lots of caramel and some reasonably strong citrus hops and other fruitiness too.  Flavour is similar, lots of very sweet caramel and toffee sort of flavours, and a fair bit of light fruit flavours.  Finishes nice and bitter from hops, and there is a hint of spice or yeast at the back there somewhere.  Mouthfeel is just a little bit sharp, but not enough to make it unpleasant.

Bottle - Amber/brown in colour. Lightly hoppy aroma with chocolate, caramel and grapefruit. Hoppy and fruity taste with chocolate and grapefruit. The finish is hoppy and fruity with a pleasant bitterness.

After drinking some crappy beers I tried this one, and Rogue never fails to impress.  Pours an amber/honey colour with a white head and has a malty/hoppy taste and slightly bitter.  I drank this out of a shaker while eating crab cakes.
A very tasty strong ale from Rogue.  Hoppy and fruity, nice overall balance and good flavor!

Awesome deep translucent amber color that was almost pearlesent. Big fluffy, merange like butterscotch head that unfortunately disapeared quickly. Aroma of sweet hops. Crisp and dry on the palate with a nice bitter hop aftertaste that didnt linger longer than necessary. Malt undertones are welcome presence. No trace of grassyness like you get with an overhopped ale or IPA. This is one very well balanced ale. One of the best i’ve had in a long time. A pleasant surprise for me, as I have avoided buying it for the longest time. I’ve often dissmissed Rogue brews just because the  bottles and beer names seemed too gimmicky. I glad I was wrong

0,36 l bottle. Hazy reddish orange colour, thin but creamy off-white head. Sweet fruity-malty aroma, with berries and oranges. Medium-bodied and smooth. Caramel-malty flavour has some honey sweetness and a nice aromatic hoppy finish.
bottle. has a very odd aroma. almost like tomato. pours a golden yellow with a thick tan head.  has a bit of a metallic taste. still sensing tomatoes. not as good as expected.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Clear amber with a creamy white head. Aroma of malts and caramel, a bit of yeast. Flavour is a bit fruity, malty and caramel sweetness, dry slightly hoppy finish. Medium bodied. Very average.
Bottle.  Pours amber with off white head. Aroma is malty and grainy, with a touch of hoppy citrus. Flavor is malty with hop bitterness in the finish.

I liked this beer quite a bit more than I thought I would. (No idea actually why I thought I wouldn’t like it). Anyway, it was pretty delicious! Pours caramel amber with a medium body. Aroma is malty, grainy, nutty and pleasant. Flavor is much of the same, with a mild hoppiness. The whole beer is much richer than I anticipated. I eagerly refilled my glass.

Comes out of the bottle a dark, appetizing, clear amber with a very thick and fluffy yellowish off-white head. Aroma is strong and mainly malty with fruity and hoppy hints. Mouth-filling flavor is edgy, malty, with a good hoppy undertone and just the right amount of bitterness. Texture is lively and edgy, and it leaves a bitter but satisfying aftertaste.

Cloudy amber with a dense head. Malty aroma with notes of nuts and bread. The flavour starts out sweet with corn and yeast dominating, then it continues into a bitter ending - way more bitter than the normal Maibock.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2016 I have always enjoyed this beer.  When I began drinking it about 8 years ago, my palate was undeveloped and I thought it was a bit harsh.  As I have matured, this is the beer I drink more than any other. (And in frighteningly large quantities)  I recommend it for those just starting in craft beer, or for those who are tired of the rampant hopping of current craft ales and just need a break to an easy drinking, well balanced beer with just the right amount of bite.
Pours a deep amber with a 1/2 inch head.  Aroma is sweet and malty all the way around.  Flavor is sweet, but mildly hopped and well balanced for a maibock.
Hoppy perfume aroma.  Large frothy off white head.  Hazy medium amber body.  Bitterness in the finish.  Medium bodied with a creamy texture.  Not bad.

12 ounce bottle from Whole Foods Charlottesville. Pours a reddish dark amber with a huge head. Nice retention and lacing. Aroma is strong bready and grainy notes with some grassiness in the finish.Grainy and somewhat nutty taste with a strong hop component in the finish. Medium bodied.

Bottled. Gold amber body with moderate white head. Aroma is apricot, honey, berries, caramel and toffee malt, and citric hops; very nice. Flavor is honey, bitter citrus, and sweet malts. Well balanced, moderately complex but not cloying. Finish is sweet and nicely bitter. Good session beer. Can’t wait to try the double.

Bottle@home

Apperance: Pours a lovely golden orange with a small, white, head.

Aroma: Fruit, Caramel, Hops. Doesn’t smell much at all.

Flavor: Hops (plenty), Caramel, Nuts, Earth, Spices.

Palate: Nicely balanced with a initial sweetness and ends with a good doze of bitterness. Plenty of carbonation. Nice!

A good sessionbeer from Rogue that i’ll gladely buy again if i can find it. Very balanced. Yummy!

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2009 Very decent brew. Great coppery amber color with a decent foamy head. Fairly smooth and quite drinkable with a good hop/malt balance and hint flavors of orange and honey. Finishes sharp. Will drink again.
Deep amber, somewhat cloudy; has an excellent malty aroma with caramel tones; full-bodied, bitter taste but not too much; fabulous

Pretty good beer.  Looks great in the glass, deep orange amber.  Very good depth of flavor, starting with a lot of malt and citrus and then finishing on a hoppy hint of pine.  Not the greatest Maibock but certainly worth a try.

Very good, well balanced beer.

Very malty flavor with a nice balance of hops. feels nice on the palate, and has a pleasant after taste.

Nice gold/orange color, smell is nicely balanced hops/malt.

Bottle from the LCBO
I will defiantly revisit this one for further comments
Very good

I’ve never understood why this is the most popular (by far) of all the beers that Rogue has to offer. You can’t go to a bar or store in this state without seeing the damn thing, and it’s not that good! Way too malty in the front end and a somewhat hoppy middle with a disappointing finish. So horribly overrated.

Overall, enjoyable... refreshing. Pours a light amber with a short-lived off-white head. Flavor is not too malty with a bright hop finish. Citrus, honey. Alcohol can stand out a little bit towards the end.
Pours golden brown with a nice off white head.  The aroma is hoppy and crisp.  Taste is smooth and malty with a nice citrusy hop finish as well.  Good stuff.

From bottle.  Part of October Dayton beertasting event.
Pours golden Aroma is citrusy with malt notes. Tastes include honey and good blend of hops and malt.

Appears cloud, copper in color with a thick, white head that stays around for a while.  

Smells of sweet malt.  Nice lacing.  Crisp, slight burning mouthfeel.

Bitterness in the finished is chased away by the highish alcohol content.
Smells and tastes like cardamom bun dough with yeast. nothing negative though. quite tasty and goes with cardamom bun. Good hops flavoring the bunand gives a bit dry after. very nice and interesting
UPDATED: OCT 23, 2008 A great solid brew. Very full beer, poured with minimal head. Quite clear. Nice malty start and a moderate bitter finish. Good for a few

A classic. Pours a deep amber with a large fluffy head that lasts for a long time. This is probably the closest drink to pure melted butter. It is so smooth and creamy. Lots of malt, caramel, butter, and a hint of piney hops. Ends with a smack of hops. What an awesome, thick, filling, and satisfying beer. Rogue’s most consistently awesome brew.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2008 Poors deep amber with a light off white head that lasts surprisingly long.  Malty, with a little toffee sweetness, and light dried fruit flavors and then piney hops.  Pretty heavy drink, but still went down smooth.  Sweet bitter finish. Not bad.

Pours amber with a 2 finger chunky head that fades sloly and leaves good lacing. Aroma is grainy, and caramel malts, some buttered toast, and  a woody note like fresh cut pine. Hops are planty and herbal. Flavor is lots of malty notes at once right away: cereal, caramel, toasted white bread, toffee. Hops come in toward the middle with some grassy/herbal notes and then hit you like a ton-o-bricks with a dandelion green bitter, and lingering toffee malt finish. Mouthfeel is thin to medium and somewhat astringent. Overall this is a great beer I love the transition from rich buttery malts to pucker-up hops, its like a 1-2 punch.

Growler. Thick head and amber color. Smells of grains and caramel. The taste is heavy malt and a nice balance bitter finish. I was surprised by this. I guess I was expecting something more mainstream like a pale... I was pleasantly rewarded with a complex ale. This is good.
Bottle. Amber coloured with a small off white head. The aroma is grain, caramel and hops. Flavour of sweet malt, toffee, smoke, licorice and bitter hops. Went down very well..
Nice.  Dark malts great head and retention.  Very dark roasted malt character for the catigory of the brew itself.  I would say for being rogues flagship its very good.
This is a great beer.  Excellent mix of hops and malt. Color is pale.  Minimal head.  Strong appearance.
Bottle: Hazy amber coloured brew with an skeleton on a barrel at the label. Pretty sweet ale with hints of plum, citrus and slightly caramel.

Draught @ Maltainen Monni, Helsinki. Murky amber color, white head. Resiny hop aroma. Sweet, malty flavor with a great bitter background, some notes of plums. High carbonation, medium body. Pretty good!
Bottled from Jusco supermarket, Shenzhen, China. Clear orange coloured, lasting head. Nose of barley, some alcohol. Caramel malts in flavour, some bitterness. Not very special.

had this many times before but haven’t rated yet.  Pours nice golden applejuice color... fizzy dissipating head.  Aroma is malty honey sweetness with some floral hops in the background.  Nice honey flavor with hoppy balance.. smooth drinking, well balanced beer.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear amber with a full fluffy head. Slightly smoky nose with lots of citrus hop aroma. Very bocklike up front with smoke and caramel malts but finish with a very piney bitter kick. Its actually very tasty and well crafted as a session beer. It reminds me a bit of Bellhaven Scottish Ale with its use of smoke malts.

Bottle poured to a beautifully cloudy amber-orange with very little head.  A faint scent, mostly floral.  The flavor is wonderfully complex.  There are hints of citrus, floral hops, light malts and sweet - but not too sweet.  This tastes like Spring to me.  One of the better bocks I’ve had in a long time.  I will be a returning customer.

Bottle.  Pours a amber/caramel color with a large, creamy, light tan head that slowly fades.  Taste is mostly of malt and hops.  Is well balanced, but some alcohol can be tasted in the dry finish.  Has a nice hoppy and malt aroma.  Very easy to drink and quite enjoyable.  Well worth having again.

Aroma is not real strong, but there is some malt and spices there. Color of butterscotch. Decent head that settles slowly, never completely dissipates, and laces the glass all the way down. Pretty cool bottle. Flavor is alot like an IPA with more malt and more of a smoky flavor similar to a Porter. Good flavor...Pretty easy on the palate, leaves an aftertaste but more on the tongue than in the throat. It’s a good beer...just enough balls but drinkable enough to be an everyday beer...I like the smoky flavor added to what I am calling a Pale Ale...it’s a good mix.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2012 Draught at McGloughlins in Kyoto. Great malty aroma with decent aroma hops. the flavor is almost exactly the same. this ia a great beer--a maibock ale, so it tastes a bit like a maibock but fruitier, and lots of great hops. Great balance and easy to drink tons of. Fabulous. Much better than the bottle, I would add.
Pours a orange-amber color with a thin white head.  Aroma is very malty.  Taste is malty, some hops, and maybe some dark fruits.  New to this style, but it is pretty tasty.

Tasted 10/07/08.  22oz bomber.  Filtered with a golden amber hue.  Finger width of off-white head.  Cereal bready aromas with a touch cinnamon and spicy hops.  Medium bodied with a crisp effervescence and nicely bitter hops.  Nice sweet bitter dichotomy.  Rather zesty.  smooth malts and spicy Saaz hops.  Solid drinking.  Caramel malts shine as the beer warms.  This is a go to beer for easy Autumn drinking!

Tap @ OTH.
Pours orange/copper , white head.
Arima, hoppy fruity (citrus)
Taste, light hops, sugar, fruity citrus finish with light hop, floral with some pine hops.

Bottled, China. Hazy murky brown, quick beige head. Slightly toffeeish nose with marzipan and old barnyard hay. Some berries. Flavor is citric, malty, bitter hops with some nuttiness. Pretty good, but far from heller bock as I know them. More like an IPA maybe, or just a strong ale. Decent mouthfeel with smooth carb.
Orange amber, little hazy, malty, honey, caramel, citrus, little spice, light piney hop finish.

22oz. pours copper and not super clear but nice looking head. aroma is earthy with some a nice bit of citrus hop. mouthful is smooth with big malts but finishes with a nice bit of hops. decent balance and good all around drinker... now to be double dead...

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2011 Pours an orangish amber, with a decent whitish-tan head. I like this mai bock style ale. Rich malty flavor with a smooth and balanced finish. The hops are there too, but restrained.Thumbs up on this one.

65cl bottle from Village Wine and Spirits (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy orange amber color with a one finger white-tan puffy foamy head that settles slowly and somewhat laces the glass. Aroma is sweet and malty with some notes of honey and spice. Sight notes of hops. Flavor is also sweet and malty with stronger notes of honey, caramel, spice, and gentle grapefuity-hops toward finish. Generally a light to medium-bodied ale with a somewhat pleasing malty, sweet and slightly bitter finish.

Honey and malts whack you in the nose right away. The color is a rich gold, almost broth-like and nearly opaque. I certainly detect the honey in the flavor, but also a medium amount of hops. The palate is lively and prolonged. A winner in nearly all respects. I would have personally preferred a little hoppier brew.

A wonderful microbrew from the state of Oregon. Loved this beer from the first sip, poured with a dark gold color with an off-white head. Great malt flavor, would recommend to any US microbrew enthusiast. Finished the whole 6-pack.

Pretty orange color with a finger of off white head made up of medium sized bubbles that swell and pop rapidly to leave just a cover.  Mostly malty aroma.  Fruity honey and hops.  Some metallic malt flavors with piney hops and a nice toasty finish.
Pours copper with nice lasting head, flavor is malty, with a little hops, tastes balanced. Better than i remembered.

This beer pours a coppery color with a few fingers of creamy foam.  The aroma is slightly malty, very clean.  The flavor is malty with some caramel.  This is balanced out with some hoppiness.  The body is medium as is the carbonation.  This beer is pretty clean tasting.  Not a favorite, but definitely worth drinking.

Bottle.Reddish/gold color with a thin off white head that stuck around till the end. Aroma of caramel, bread,and malt. Flavor is warm sweet nutty malt,with just the right roast,maybe some honey notes,and a nice little hop finish, nice mouthfeel. Very Solid Offering.

Just as I suspected, I haven’t ever rated this perennial fave.  Bright amber/orange pour, slightly hazy with minimal off-white head.  Aromas of honey, biscuity malt, and bitter hops.  Similar on the tongue.  I find this beer to really capture a nice balance between malt and hops; slightly sweet up front and  a bit biscuity with good slight resin and citrus hops in the middle and then a crisp bitter finish.  A very easy beer to drink.
Very smooth beer that is a little bitter but still has a great taste.  Very easy to put down a six pack of these delectable treats.
Pours a dark amber with a moderate off white head. Aroma is hoppy with some malt. Very smooth and slightly bitter. The alcohol is well hidden. Finishes dry and clean. Good stuff.

Has a yeasty and malty aroma.  Pour is a cloudy, hazy dark orange with a thin, off white head that fades to lacing.  Flavor kinda weak in malts and yeast, has a metallic taste to it as well.  Palate is thin, light and slightly bitter.  Not too great.

Poured a hazy orange/amber with a smaller head.  Aroma was sweet with some grapefruit and malts.  Full bodies with some sweet malts and a touch of citrus.  A light taste of hops gives some bitterness to the finish.

smell was weak, appearance was coppery, flavor was sweet at first like citrus fruit, but had a hoppy bite afterwards, mouthfeel was crisp and dry, overall, not a bad beer but not something im really into

I haven’t had this beer in forever... didn’t like it that much when I had it, but here goes. bomber.  Dark amber with some fat carbonation bubbles and a nice off-white head that fades a bit too quick.  aroma is funky weird... maybe confused is a better word.  Really nutty, sweet malt with lots of sweet weird tangerine fruitiness that seems weird with malt character - its building on me a bit.  Flavor is unique but pretty good, less fruitiness more semisweet bock maltiness with a bit of biscuityness dough malt upfront.  Medium to light bodied and smooth on the palate with soft carbonation (probably because I swirled it around so many times while trying to figure out the scent.  Overall: nice brew, unique style.

12 oz bottle - Aroma mainly consists of a thick malty yeast with a touch of honey.  The flavor is also with a hearty honey taste that lasts.  Not as bitter as I usually like.  Good alcohol % but you wouldn’t even know it.  Not my favorite style of beer but would drink again.
user_location: originally from Michigan, New York, USA

text: Pours copper and clear, with a medium white head, little lacing. Subtle aroma, a bit like pineapple and cashews.  Medium body, satisfying and smooth.  Nutty and caramel flavor, malt is subdued, lingering pine hop aftertaste.
An overpriced session. Wonderfully mediocre without an identifying flavor.  Better than domestic.
Pours clear copper/amber with fizzy head. Aroma is sweet, fruity, caramel malt. Sweet honey malt flavor ending with a nice pine hop bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel. Tasty.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2008 Pours hazy honey tending amber with tan head. Nose displays dark fruits and some sweet toffee malt. Palate is more of the same, with caramel/toffee malt notes dominating and hinting honey driving a long malty finish.

Pours translucent copper color with creamy colored head.  Has a sweet malty aroma. Flavor is more complex, starts out with the obvious malts, accompanied by nuts, honey and has a very nice balanced piney hop finish. Has a nice creamy palate, an enjoyable brew.

22 oz bottle.  Pours slightly orange amber with a medium white head that disappers quickly.  Aroma is a mix of piney and citrus hops with caramel.  Flavor is caramel, hops, nutty, bready, honey.  Interesting beer, pretty nice.

Pours deep copper color with a soft fluffy head.  Aroma isn’t much to speak of, some malt, musty hops.  Flavor is sweet, and I think is the best part of the beer.  Not that it’s all that complex or mind blowing, but it has about the right sweetness for a german-style beer, and the hops linger on the back end.  Malt is definitely the biggest player in this one.

This bock poured a copper colour with a nice, fast living, creamy head. To the nose there are scents of hopps, juniper berries, sweet malt and a little caramel. First taste was slightly hoppy with a nice malty finish. Flavours of hopps/juniper not overpowering, nice amount. Palate is sweeter than normal with a slight taste of caramel and more sweet malt.
Bottle. Poured a rich golden color, with a marginal head. Has a very slight spicy taste with a mildly hoppy finish. A good alternative beer when you want something a little out of the ordinary.
Bottle. Pours an amber color with a two finger head. Aroma is pine and hops. Taste is sweet but has a little hoppy finish.
Shaker glass at Mellow Mushroom - clear ornage, with off white head.  Aroma carmel/malts - notes of hops, but not enough.
(Bottle).  Mild sweet malty aroma.  Color is orange amber with a thin white head.   Flavor is unexpectedly fruity, rather mild, and is followed by a very nice dry malty finish that lingers.
Reddish amber from tap.  Sweet with almost no hop taste.  Drinkable but nothing really stands out.  Just a bit flat and blah.

12 ozer poured into a shaker.  Poured a dark gold color with a small white head.  aroma is of sweet malt and some piney hops.  Flavor is slightly nutty with sweet malt and a hoppy bite at the end.  Medium bodied with mild carbonation.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a nice collapsing head, attractive dark honey yellow color, aroma of honey, other spices flow in, taste complex with multiple flavors that do not quite balance in my mouth, there is a bitter twang that comes in at the finish. Id really like to try it on tap.

Bottle........pours a nice golden color with just a hint of depth.  Smells intereseting......malty, sweet, minor hops.  Taste is interesting as well nice nut, malt, mix with a subtle fruity hoppy taste.

Well, this is my first Rogue brew, and I must admit, it’s not bad. I first heard of this brewer from hearing about it’s recent victories at the great american beer convention. This pours a dark hazy amber, with a good head and no lacing. It’s aroma is kinda subtle, but with some fruity back. The flavor is kinda subtle as well, but it has a decent mouthfeel, and some sweet maltiness on the finish. Cheers!

Bottle.  Pours a deep copper color with a medium off-white head and plenty of carbonation.  Aroma of malt, toffee, also kind of nutty and bread-like.  Flavor is a bit sweet, with citrus and spices, such as nutmeg and pepper.  Good hops balance keeps this beer from being too malty.  Soft, pleasant mouthfeel and good aftertaste.  Good brew!  I’d like to pair this beer with a wood-fired pizza topped with pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, onions and plenty of cheese.  Oh, and just to keep my doctor off my back, let’s put a mixed green salad on the side.

Bottle. Clear orange off white head, cream smell, malty mouthfeel, smooth and pleasant. Taste of copper, spice, pumpkin, slight orange cream soda. Nice, zesty finish. I would imagine that it must be spectacular on tap.

Opaque amber pour with a 1 finger off-white head.  Biscuit, toffee, and citrus aroma.  Sweet, bready, and nutty flavors hit the tongue first then fade to a spicy, balanced noble hop finish.  Medium body with a moderate amount of carbonation.  Overall a very nice flavorful and drinkable beer.
By far my favorite beer to date, I love the hoppy taste in the end.  Never had on tap, only in a 12 oz. bottle.  Tempted to make a long trip to try the draft..

On draft, Dead Guy came to me with a thin layer of foam covering the top of my liquid bliss. At least a fingers worth of head, I am greeted by a dry, hoppy nose with hints of lemon and orange. The hops are present up front in the swallow, fading nicely into malt smoothness with a hint of sweet caramel and nuts. Orange amber in color, the light coming through my glass makes it almost shine. Not as creamy buttery as Old Thumper for example, Dead Guy still exerts a nice malt presence as hops add their citrus zing to the palate. As Dead Guy warms and I near the end of my glass, I am left with the impression of lemon hops and an almost spicy peppery finish supported by a malt lightly sweet backbone.

Not overly carbonated, Dead Guy is a solid west-coast interpretation of a Heller Bock, and one of Rogue’s flagship beers. Ive had Dead Guy both on draft and bottle, and enjoyed it every time.

12oz bottle purchased from LCBO in Toronto.  Allowed to warm for about 10 minutes from the fridge.  Pours a clear, medium copper with a nice fluffy head which dissipates.  Medium aroma of straight-up malt.  Initial tastes are mainly malty with a tiny bit of sweetness and a slight hop tang.  Aftertaste becomes more hoppy as it warms.  Balanced.  Medium bodied.  S’alright.
Aroma is fruity and hoppy, pale honey color with a 2 finger head. This is what beer is about my friends. One of the best tasting beers Ive ever had. Theres nothing to complain about on this one

Light buttery carmel malt aroma.  Metallic + slighlty dusty.  Smell is clean like dirt after rain.  Light fruitiness and some spice (black pepper, nutmeg).

Mellow toasted malt flavor with big floral + fruity (fig, melon, orange) characteristics.  Spices (cinnamin, nutmeg, black pepper) and a subdued hops kick for balance.  

Palate is mildly astringent with a creamy texture.  The tangy bite and malty body give this brew its extreme drinkabiliity.

12 oz. bottle from the LCBO, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. July 2008
App.:  Medium amber, clear, fair off-white head.
  
Aroma:  Lots of nutty, fruity caramel and toffee, a bit of resinous hops, apples, pears, light Sultanas, a bit of vanilla, light tropical fruits.
  
Palate:  Medium body, medium-soft carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Much like the nose: lots of fruits, caramel, plenty of nuts, some resinous leafy hops; off-dry with a good shot of bitterness, burnt sugar finish.

Glad to have this at the LCBO.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2008 Deep malty hop aroma. Clear dark orange with white creamy head that thins to nothing. Sweet malty hop mixed with grapefruit bitterness leaves a dry bitter after-taste. Hides alcohol well, was thinking 5ish. Finally available at LCBO in Ontario, thank the beer gods.
Bottle.  Dark brown/amber pour.  tight head with nice grassy nose.  malty and full bodied.  well done beer at the price point.
Bottle. Dark amber, cloudy with almost no head.Hop aroma with a hint of citrus. Creamy palate.Nice hop start with a malt finish.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy orangish brown with one finger beige head and minimal lacing.  Nose is malty and roasted nuts.  Taste is nuts, toasted malt, some spice and a little bitterness in the finish.  Medium mouth feel.  Meh, kinda boring.

355 mL bottle.  Pours clear amber with nice head.  Aroma is very rich and fragrant - sweet and syrupy.  Flavour is bitter and a bit spicy, with a bit of a metallic taste on the palate.  Fairly bold beer, overall pretty nice.
Very tasty maibock. Unclear orange body with a cream-colored head. Light caramel, long-lasting flavor makes this a tasty brew.
Bottle.  Orange pour, nice creamy long lasting head. Malty, ripe fruit aroma.  Sweet, metallic and a bit rotten fruit.  Unremarkable palate.  Maybe if this was 8%, I’d rate it higher.

12oz in shaker at Lovejoys.  Seriously, did someone forget to ferment this, and they just mixed vodka in some wort and bottled it?  Sweet, malty, rich and cloying like a too-big bran muffin.  I know Im not being fair, but this is SO not my kind of beer.  Could not finish it.

[1373-20080518] 12floz bottle. Very faint grains aroma has a slash of lemon. Slightly hazy, amber orange body with a big medium-lasting creamy off-white head. Bitter toasted corn flavour has quite a bit of grainy malt. Medium-full body. Great blend of toast and bitterness and malt.
($0.99 from Premier Gourmet; labelled "White Crane Bitter Ale")
stuck at IAD for a few hours.  had a bottle at harry’s tap room.  nice color, nice pour, not at all what i was expecting.  liked it quite a bit.  made the delay more tolerable certainly!

Amber color with small lasting white head. Decedent caramel citrus (grapefruit) aroma with some unique yeast. Medium-light body with a quick yeasty, watery start and a dry bitterness in the finish. Lightly sweet and well carbonated. Nice brew, but could be more.
