Color is golden brown, with a fluffy white head. Smell is of malt, caramel, and a light sea breeze. Flavor is kinda weak. Malt, and flowers. Palate is fizzy like soda. This is a disappointingly mediocre beer.

Pours a pale yellow-ish orange with a small white head. Random clumps of lacing. Mild aromas of wheat. Flavors are sweet and slightly malty. Medium carbonation and thin body. Not bad, but not great either. Drinkable.
Bottle. Coppery, orange pour. Aroma of malt and slight hops. Taste is again slight hops, more malt. Not a bad beer, just not something to get excited about.
Bottle: Very good beer.  Almost tasted like a good Pale Ale.  Pours amber with a solid head.  Hoppy aroma and taste.  Very good.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma is rich with hops and malt. Taste is hoppy and floral.

pours a copper color with a white head.  aroma of citrus and hops.  mid-bodied.  taste is a good hop/malt balance with some extra sweetness, notes of date and citrus evident.  would try again, a good drinker!
A transparent orange color with a very nice aroma. Smooth flavor with a nice bit of hops and malt. A good everyday drinkable beer. Much better when NOT ice cold, too.
Nice gold colour. Smells sweet. Great full flavour ale. This is the second brew from Rogue I have tried and I must say I am a fan.
Bottle.  Copper hue.  Medium body.  Sweet and malty.  Smooth and enjoyable.  Very solid beer.

On Tap at Chicago Bar:  Had a wonderful, deep, rich color.  Also portrayed good head retention and left good lacing.  The carbonation was just right as well for this malty semi-sweet brew.  However, it lacked aromatics, and it also lacked the depth I expected from this style.  I anticipated the layers of malt unfolding in my mouth, but I really felt that it was not complex enough.

Fuck this beer. Fuck this shitty, overrated american company. (Dont misunderstand me: some rock: Stoudts, Bells, Oskar Blues...) This beer sucks. It is not a Maibock by any stretch of the word (my german friends are equally as horrified by this piece of shit as I am...) Fuck Rogue. (Except the XS Imperial Stout...but fuck them again for the price tag and gimmick packaging.....)
Poured a darker brown with an average head.  Had a malty flavor that was exceptionally smooth that finished great.  Not to much on aroma, but great flavor.
I bought a big jug and I fell in love with the taste of the rougr I cant wait to try other rough ales.

A pretty good beer.  Pours a beautiful copper color into the glass with a pure white head.  Aroma and flavor a little too hoppy for me.  Had this one with pizza and enjoyed it.

On tap, 12 oz. bottle.

Bottle.  Poured a murky orange brown with a medium sized off-white head.  Nice malty aroma with sweet citrus notes.  A bit dry but the hops and malt are very well balanced.  The finish is sweet and slightly bitter.
sweet, yeast, malts.  Goes down cleanly.  Had this several times lately - very nice
UPDATED: SEP 9, 2008 Pours hazy caramel color with fluffy tan head. Hoppy nose with a touch of caramel. Flavor was the same. Not very interesting. A tad bitter, and a clean finish.

Pours deep amber/ruby with solid head.  Toasted malts, caramel, vanilla, dusty and toased flavors characterize this brew.  There is a juicy malt quality as well as an earthy vibe to it.  Not a bad brew, with decent mouthfeel and drinkability.

Bottle of the White Crane Bitter.  I guess I paid someone to take this beer from Oregon over to Japan, and then from Japan to New York.  Anyway, good aroma of sweet caramel malt, a little earthy malt, and some apple.  Not a whole lot of flavor up front, but the malt and fruit follow close behind.  Oily mouthfeel.  Enjoyable.

Had on tap, starting to see this one around alot more, its a much more solid choice than say a Sam Adams.

Not sure if i would call this guy a Maibock, but whatever, anything that inspires Grateful Dead thoughts is good with me.  Dry taste, but much more balanced than a pale so the pitcher went over well with the whole table.  First pour went into a frosted mug so the initial taste was much smoother than it should have been.
22 oz bottle.  Medium head, cloudy.  Aroma of apricot.  Flavor fruity with weak hop, some caramel.  Unremarkable mouthfeel.  Decent citrusy aftertaste.
Well Balanced, citrusy and refreshing Bock.   Hops give it a bit of an IPA feel.  Still quite an enjoyable brew.

Had no idea that Rogue Dead Guy was a tribute to the maibock tradition. Prost! A solid standard from this prolific brewery, the Dead Guy is one of those beers I could easily buy buy the case. Full-bodied and totally balanced. Hoppy, fruity, complex, rich, malty, with loads of character. Whatever trendy beers Rogue might churn out, I hope they always stick to the tried-and-true.
Amber.  Mild aroma of caramel and bread.  Some citrus hops are noticeable upon tasting.  A blaise amber ale with a brillant logo.
from a 12 oz. bottle.  pours a dark red in color with a white head.  very good taste, not too hoopy.  a very good beer - hides the alcohol very, very well.  drinkable.

German-style Maibock?  Tastes a lot more like a mild IPA with a good dash of malt added.  I notice a good amount of citrus in the flavor of this beer and it finishes the same way.  This is one beer Ill share with an IPA-aholic friend.  Good beer for a session.
Bottled.Pours a cloudy amber w/medium head. A fair amount of hops and maltiness, less sweet than most bocks.  Pretty good.
Good complexity of hops and an extreme malty flavor, red tint to the color with a foamy head of about a dime. Goes down smooth with malty goodness following.

Bottle/Tap.  Good head.  Deep brown color.  Aroma is rich with hoppiness and a slight sweet malt smell.  Taste is rewarding with true amber notes of citrus and malt with a slight finish of oak.  A fine ale from Rogue and one of my favorite dinner beers.

Orange klar øl.
Bitter og let varm øl.
Minder om en lys dobbelbock.
Frisk og humlet.
This is part of a beer club. Had only one bottle but was decent for the price. Poured great and had a nice finish. Would do again.
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2007 12 ounce bottle purchased at ABC Liquors in Pembroke Pines, FL $2.29 Excellent ale!

Draft at Brixx. Dark caramel color, thin head, sweet nose. A smooth, easily drinkable ale, very malt-forward with hints of honey and maple syrup. It finishes a little flat for my tastes, but it is easy to drink and has a pleasant, interesting flavor.
An interesting mid-taste, almost bitter, but it dissolves easily into a smooth finish. Not what one would expect from the appearance, which resembles that of a Killians. Little head, big finish.
Little aroma, but what is noticeable is quite intriguing.  Slightly sweet smelling with a deep amber color.  If youre a fan of ales, this will rank high.

Bottle thanks to beeranarchist. Aroma is sweet candy sugar, brown sugar sweet but yeast fruity esters help out. Taste is similar, but sweet with raw bittering hop. Nothing like a maibock appart from sweetness, not really my scene, i almost wish i didnt have to drink a 660 of this.
All around a pretty good beer.  Nothing stands out just tastes good.  Has that "Rogue" flavor for sure.

hittin this one in a hotel with a plastic cup...Ive had it many times but never rated it....copper color with medium light tan head...aroma of yeast, malt and raw dough....sweet malty start...little bit of alcohol...slightly bitter finish...always enjoy this one
bottle-  One of the first microbrews I ever drank. for my money it is a damn good beer.
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2008 Bottle at Olivertwist , Stockholom ... Red ... light mellow fruity hop .. thin hoppy light malt ... very fruity nce enough balance... tk2 big sweet american hop

pours a copper orange with a one finger foamy off white head. aroma was caramel malt and hops. it has a medium body with spotty lacing and ok carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma with a little yeast to add to both. has a little dry aftertaste and is a little sticky on the lips. not my kind of style but ok i guess.

The color was a golden orange.  The head was thick, foamy, and off-white.  The aroma was mainly hops.  There was also a bit of caramel malt.  The flavor was very distinctly hops and caramel malt.  It had a very floral nose.  The palate was smooth and refreshing.  The finish was hoppy and clean.

The ale pours out quick with a cloudy translucent copper color with a medium light fluffy head. Its aroma is sweet with malty overtones which come through strong in the flavor. It finishes without a bit and it rather refreshing.
i like hanging out with midgets. you guys go ahead and rate your beer. im just keeping a list of things that i have drank. thanks. keep on keeping on

Honey in appearance with a very weak almost nonexistant head.  Aroma is very yeasty and reminded me of Pizza Dough.  Hops aroma was very herbal.  This is my third time trying Dead Guy and the first time it had a gingerbread taste and aroma but didnt detect that this time around.  Flavor had a light pleasing bitterness.  Nice...
thin white head, dim copper orange color, hoppy malt aroma, sweet caramel malt taste with a hint of hops, smooth light carbonation with some bitterness to it, decent beer

Bottle. 12oz. Pours a copper orange color with thin white head. Aromas are malty sweet, and a little yeasty. Body is medium with light carbonation. Flavor comes in moderately sweet and caramelly with notes of toffee, hops are present as well leaving a decent bitterness after the sweet rolls over the tongue along with notes of wood and trees. Finish is pretty dry but the lips feel a bit sticky from the sugars. Pretty good overall.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2008 Bottle.  Aroma is of sweet caramel and some floral hops.  Medium amber body with an off white head.  A little sweet with some medium bitters at the end.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.  Good brew with good bitterness on finish.

From bottle : Pours a hazy amber color with one finger of white head that leaves fairly soon.  I really like the aroma, malts with some citrus and bread dough notes.  Nice medium body to the beer, with a sticky feel, but not bad.  Nice malty flavor with a hint of hops.  Nice aftertaste.  Really good.

Bottle.  Nice white head with very nice lacing; very nice amber color on a slightly hazy beer.  A lot of malt in the aroma with a little citrus.  Taste starts with a mix of malt and citrus/floral hops.  Turns a litttle bitter, but very well ballnced.  I like the medium body - not too much but it has some meat to it.  OVerall, really like this one.
UPDATED: JAN 14, 2008 A malty aroma, dark amber color and a nice head on tap. A small amount of hoppy smell and taste. A pretty good beer.
Poured dark amber with off white head. Aroma of some hops and malt. Good malt flavor with some hops.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2008 Pours a medium brown with fairly nice, fluffy head. Nice hoppy and malty nose. Smells also a little like apricots. Sweet flavor balanced with hoppy edginess. Good beer for pairing with food.

Poured out of the 64 ounce growler. (the glow in the dark one) Color is a cloudy amber with a one finger head with some lacing. Nose is sweet with a berry tone. Flavor is somewhat sweet with a bitter edge on the tail. Mouth is smooth and a little bit heavy, with a slight bit of bubble that clings to your mouth. Extremely drinkable due to its smooth tone and flavor. Excellent brew - better than I remember. (maybe its the growler as opposed to the bottle)
Bottle. Pours orangeish with a weak head. The flavor is a nice blend of citrus, sweet malt and bitterness. A good beer by any measure.
UPDATED: APR 4, 2009 rossa buona schiuma piuttosto persistente in bocca corposa non troppo amara maltata il finale è luppolato un po particolare perche non si riesce bene ad inquadrare in uno stile

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2008 Gold with a ruby tint, very thin head.  Sweet honey strawberry raspberry aroma, similar fruity essence.  Sweet finish. I remembered this as boring, now I find it great! the fruity esters really come through the soft malt.
Had this in a bottle so im not sure about the apearence but it did have a hoppy smell, and a taste to match with the aroma.

On tap-poured a clear copper color w/a moderate fizzy head. Floral hop aroma. Had a lot of hops up front, much more than I was expecting. Tasted some grapefruit & yeast, but mostly hops Didnt get a lot of malt or sweetness from this brew. Pretty one dementional, no surprise from this brewer. Their beers always seem very hit or miss to me, Id call this one a miss. Served its purpose though; I was able to cross a Heller Bock off the stats page!

Aroma is a nice balance of nuts, dough, and grapefruit, slightly buttery and sweet as well. Cloudy copper color, with no head. Dry and moderately hoppy. Good hop finish that grows in intensity then gradually fades. A refreshing bock, very drinkable, relatively low ABV. Taste seems to be missing just a little something.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2010 
Date: January 26, 1996
Mode: Bottle
Source: new orleans
Appearance: dark amber color, whispy head and just a touch of lace
Aroma: malty aroma with a bit of hop essence
Flavor: good hop flavor with a strong bitter hop aftertaste

Name: MaierBock
Date: January 27, 1996
Mode: Draft
Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs
Appearance: light cloudy amber, whispy head
Aroma: complex aroma with a hop and malt mix
Flavor: rich malt taste with a good bitter hop aftertaste

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20
Rating: 2.6/5.0Score: ** /4

Date: April 13, 2006
Score: ii to iii
Aroma: nice earthy aroma with good sweetness
Flavor: good sweet carmel malt flavor, nice balancing hops, sweet finish

Date: October 30, 2010
Mode: bottle
Source: Bullochs
Appearance: hazy orange, fine beige head, streaks of drippy lace
Aroma: dry caramel malt aroma with lots of earthy hops
Flavor: dry and earthy flavor, just a touch of caramel sweetness, plenty of earthyness, light bitterness

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 14/20
Rating: 3.4/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *** /4

Poured a deep amber with a medium light tan head that left quickly. The nose was toasty malt aroma with grassy, citrusy hops. The taste was beady malt with orange and spruce hop esters for balance. The finish was a moderate citrusy hop taste. Easy drinking but average.
UPDATED: AUG 28, 2009 Bottle.  Poured murky orange-bronze with a solid head.  Malty and hoppy in flavor.  Delicious; cant wait to see what else Rogue has to offer.
It had a copper body with off-white head, and the smell and taste of hops, which covered the alcohol.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2009 old rating:
5/4/6/3/14 - 3.2

pours a cloudy light amber with a small white head, and good lacing.

smell is of burnt toffee, slight malt, and some earth.

taste is chewy, malt, hops, and earth, ends dry and hoppy, yet not bitter.

Draught at Flying Saucer (Nashville TN) - My first time with Maibock style, first impression was a wonderful color with aroma that was somewhat subdued by alcohol content.  Good drinking beer, but again the alcohol content was very noticible.  Beer hit hard and was filling, would try again.

Bottle. Light copper color with a good fluffy head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of sweet malt. Flavor of sweet malt with some pretty good hop bitterness and flavor. Hint of frutiness
Overlooked rating this for some reason. Another of Rogues fine offerings.
reminded me of the new belgium skinny dip for some reason.  a little lighter taste though from what i recall.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2007 I am re-rating this beer due to the amount of Dead Guy Ive been drinking. The more I drink this beer the more I enjoy it. This brew has a great floral hops aroma. Reminds me of a IPA that is more drinkable for the average beer drinker not ready for such a strong hop taste. A great beer anytime and look forward to drinking many more.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2009 Rogue never ceases to amaze me. Taking ales that arent as sexed up as IPAs and ESBs - and making them into something that could only be described as "the perfect ale."  I think its something in that Rogue River water that makes their stuff so amazing. ON SECOND ANALYSIS: This is not as great as I once thought. Sour and flavorless, yet there is some hop there.
I really enjoyed this brew.  Had it on tap at the Flying Saucer in San Antonio.  IT reminded me of shiner bock, but with better, sweeter flavor and palate.

Bottle- Fergies in Center City Philadelphia- Amber-brownish coloring, little to no head on the pour, smell is sweet/ candy like, taste is malt/hoppy. Pretty drinkable, liked it cold, but warmed very fast.

Bottle.  Nothing spectacular happened for me with this beer.  Aroma began as slightly malty (with hints of dried fruit), again - nothing great.  Medium to dark amber in appearance with short-lived head.  Carbonation was off as well.

Bottle from Shores Inn, SCS, MI.  Pours a little shy of amber, with almost no head.  It has a great flavor, most notably the sweetness of it.  I had this once before but was too *drunk* to truly appreciate it.  A very nice heller bock that Im sure will cross my path again in the future.

I really liked the true amber hue of Dead Guy Ale (bottle), but there was no head to speak of. Im surprised by the 6.6% listed here because the alcohol slapped me right in the face when I took my first sip. The alcohol obscured the flavors a little, so it took me a while to get a whiff of some brown sugar, molasses, or licorice (whatever it was, it was sweet and, it smelled great). Dead Guy seemed to a have a greater complexity than most other Maibock-types Ive had. Therell probably be another go round for this one.

Had this many many times, sitting here drinking one of these tonight, so I thought it was about time to rate it.   Tasty, easy to drink, and not super filling.  Pretty much a good all around go-to beer.
dark amber with a little layer of thin head.  starts sweet finishs bitter.  too me alot of rogues seem too hoppy,this however is well balanced.
This beer was fantastic.  It was very easy to drink, smooth and tasty.  Real nice color to it and  the head stayed foamy till the end.

Cloudy reddish brown pour.  Typically smell similar to the few other heller bocks ive had.  Sweet, tart taste and smell of dried fruit and honey with a touch of bitterness too.  Best one Ive had of the style, but its still not one of my favorites.  I will say this grew on me a little bit, but I dont see buying it again still.
Very drinkable.  Very balanced beer, you can taste the maltiness at the beginning, and mild hops at the end.  Would definitely buy again, a brew you can definitely drink in my climate.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2013 Amber-honey color, with a white fluffy head, nice lacing, smells sweet candy and hops. Starts sweet medium body with noticeable hop bite, strange for the style, goes down very smooth and easy
Nice reddish brownish color. smells fruity. Tastes sweet with malts really noticed the hoppy finish though. enjoyed, may buy again.
Pours a copper color with a quick disappearing head. Aroma is sweet with hints of yeast. Hops flavor with a hint of caramel. Bitter end. Nice Beer.

I really liked this a lot. A wonderful balance of malt and hops. Beautiful color, wonderful taste, and a wealth of flavor. Nice reddish brown taste with a nice frothy head. I know, I know...its an ale that calls itself a bock (which is supposed to be a lager)...but is DOES taste like a Bock...sweet but not overly so. Not overly hoppy, especially for a Rogue beer. I could (and have) keep coming back to this.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2010 Very nice ale.   It confuses my taste buds, but in a good way.  One minute malt, the next floral hops.  One minute biscuit, the next, tangerine.  This ale is tan and cloudy, with a nice fluffy head that lingers.  In many ways, the perfect beer.
with a name like dead guy ale i was expecting this one to have some crazy strong flavors but it was suprisingly well balanced, nice hop & malt flavors, very light for a bock, more like a pale ale.

For once the label is accurate: Dark, honey color, malty aroma.  Very light, lighter than I ever thought something like this would be -- even for a Heller Bock.  Dry finish.

Have to like it -- it uses hops named after an ancestor!
Arona.of malt. Pours a cooper color or an iced tea color with a thin white head that quickly disapates. Tast was  weak. Spicy hoppy.  An OK brew.

Murky copper orange with fading big-bubbled white head.  Aroma is quite malty, sweet:  honey, toffee.  Very fresh hop profile, slightly spicy with some grass and floral notes.  Taste is lighter than expected:  sweet sticky toffee, grass, spicy and slightly bitter finish with a bitter and rasping after.  Very high carbonation, slightly watery.

Enjoyed at a restaurant next to the Columbus (OH) airport.  Reddish brown color, doesnt appear as dark as say the Arrogant Bastard.  

Yeah, its a decent beer, sort of filling, the aroma is just "there."  Nice little bite from the hops.

"Dark copper body. smelled of caramel malts . at first flavors of roasty caramel malts , bitter hops in the finish. Full body, sweet, slightly bitter, good carbonation. its the only ROGUE ive has, and its a pretty good one"

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2008 Copper colour, small white head. Aroma: hoppy and oranges. Flavour: sweet hoppy, malts, with some bitterness.
Rerate: aroma nice hoppiness. Flavour fruity and hoppy. + 0.5

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2010 Very much american this beer, you cant find this kind of beers in Germany. Aroma is hoppy, bit caramel malty and fruity (oranges). Slightly, hazy, copper coloured with a lasting, off-white head. Soma flake-like debris in it. Taste is bitter, caramel malty with a mixture of different, mostly fruity hops. 
Rated as Yellowstone Ale 3.3.

Clear orange red color, short head, some debris floating around. Aroma of hop, caramel malt, slight yeasty. Malty taste, slight alcoholic, quite bitter. More of a typical American Ale than a German Maibock.

A very, very yummy growler.  Not usually a big fan of Rogue ales, this one is definitely an outlier.  Dark amber pour with a little head that as if on queue wisped away before the glass overflowed.  Aroma was spicy with oranges, melons, and hops.  The flavor was extremely well balanced.  I was actually amazed by the balance and how the flavors rolled seamlessly and effortlessly.  Similar to the aroma, the flavor was much heavier and filling.  The finish hinted with carbonation and lighted away with a bitter.  Delicious and goes well with Social Distortion and VA.

On tap.  Poured deep amber with thick white, beautiful head, lacking sparkle.  Loved the aroma with vanilla, syrup orange, honeydew and cherries, but too weak.   Around the mouth, medium body and wonderfully creamy, just the right carbonation to make it come alive.  After you swallow, you still feel that placating, smoothness.

Tastes sweet, but with a nice contrast of bitter hops.  Nice progression of flavors, gets sweeter then more bittter.  Starts with caramel, vanilla.   Leaves you with some pineapple and oak.   Went very well with a variety of foods too.

Simply delicious!  Im extremely impressed by what I had expected to be a middling bock.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with thick white head that was gone in a hurry.  Nose of citrus and malt.  Nice bitter and sweet combination to start leading to a healthy dose of sharp hop bitterness that quickly fades to a malt finish.  The hops come back and linger a bit with a touch of carmel and chocolate . . . very subtle.  Lots of complexity to this that creates a very drinkable maibock.  Great label and story about the brew.  Definate repeat purchase.  Need to try others from Rogue.

Poured a dark copper-caramel color with a good head.  But it also seemed a bit cloudy.  I noticed the malts.  Heavy mouthfeel and somewhat bitter-sweet. Not too bad altogether but it seems like I have tasted this before elsewhere.
Beatiful appearance: steady head, amber color, lots of bubbles.  Cool label.  Great aroma and balanced flavor.  Its worth the money.

Appearance: Pours a slightly hazy burnt umber. Head is two fingers, decent retention.

Smell: Citrus notes over a malt field.

Taste: Bittersweet malt front leads into a middle that demonstrates medium hop bitterness, with fruity citrus hop flavour and piney overtones. Finish is long and malty, with some lingering bitterness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied, maybe a bit over-carbonated.

Drinkability: Good balance between hops and malt. Very drinkable.

Bouteille de 12 oz, procuré à Belfast Co-op (au Maine). Cuivre miel, un peu de collet. Arome de malte caramel et fruits sûrettes, un peu épicé. Goût de malte de fruits un peu sûrette, des note dhoublon sucré au caramel anglais, légèrement épicé. Très agréable!

Pours an attractive orange/copper, cloudy, good-sized slightly off-white head. Pleasant aroma of floral, perfumed, fruity hops, sweet malt, slightly bready. Medium-bodied, a bit oily, appropriately bitter, lightly sweet, long, enjoyable hoppy finish. Nice.
On tap at the Oasis.  Pours golden hazy amber.  Nice carmel-sweet malt and good hop flavor.

Poured a cloudy amber color with huge amounts of carbonation.  Had a 1/2 inch head that lasted forever.  The aroma is sweet and hoppy.  The taste and mouthfeel were great.  A bit of a sweet malt taste with a nice amount of hops.

Pours cloudy amber with a large tan head.Medium lace.Taste has notes of carmel with medium hops presence and bitter.Overall a good ale,it was very 6 $ a pint, too expensive where I get it,too bad ,it is a very drinkable ale.

Poured from 22 ounce bottle.  Amber color with a big, foamy head.  Aroma of faint sweet malt.  Taste is malty at first, but difficult to put my finger on the flavor.  Maybe caramel.  Well balanced hoppy finish, with a nice aftertaste.  Decent beer.
Amber colored pour with meduim sized head.  A sweet malty aroma with a nice malty, fruity finish.  I really liked this.
Wonderful hop flavor with plenty of malt backup. A bit sweet as a maibock should be, balanced nicely by the hop bitterness. Nicely done to style.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2008 Bottled. Hazy amber body. Medium, but disappearing beige head with frothy peaks. The aroma has flour, sweet malt, and citrus hops. Full bodied. Flavor is earthy with malt and caramel, some orange. Moderately bitter finish and aftertaste but very smooth. Flavor was better as it warmed up. Refreshing, yet hardy and satisfying.

Side trip to Rogue Ales in Newport, Oregon during ABA Beer Tour 07. On draught at the brewerys tap room (second level). Pours a hazy golden amber brew with an average white head that has good retention. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, some rasins, bubblegum and some citrus. Taste is low carbonation, light to medium bodied with flavors of caramel malt and some toasted bread. Finish is slightly sweet with a bready aftertaste.
Bottle.  Poured orange copper with thick white head.  Malty aroma with some caramel.  Caramel in flavour, with malty body.  Mild finish.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Aroma consists of the sweet smells of roasted malts with caramel overtones. It has an very interestingly sweet aroma but then again was poured into a tulip glass. The mouthfeel was somewhat watered down but still retaining its sweet character of roasted/burt biscuit. Quite refreshing for a rather big tasting beer with nice bitter hops in the aftertaste. Good Choice for this style.

Not my favorite style and I was drinking it socially, so hard to rate. I remember the aroma best: malty with graham cracker and sweet bread notes. Flavor is smooth and sweet, with a decent mouthfeel. Good beer, but again not my favorite style. Probably within the style it a knockout. Someone, probably Andrew Crawford, brought this to me from the States. Thanks.

Pours a yellowish, brownish color with a high off-white head.  The aroma is of malt and some slight hop characteristics.  Smooth taste with a nice malt characteristic and some hop, pine, and earthy characteristics as well.  Ive never been a fan of Rogue, but this is a great beer.
Pours hazy gold brown with off-white head that remains.  Nice mouthfeel with slightly sweet roast malt.  Finishes clean.  Little hop presence
Tap at Ginger Man houston.  Solid white head.  Flavor is hoppy; floral and grassy.  Nice bitter finish.  Good

Had on tap at fox and hound in cordova.caramel, floral, citrus, raisin, red, clear, aminimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, Really enjoyed this beer,will have to try the bottle next.Another great offering from Rogue!
650 mL bottle. Pours an orange/amber color with a small white head that diminshes quickly. The aroma is caramel and malt. The taste is a sweet fruit with a smooth finish. Really enjoyed this one.

Bottle poured into a pint glass.  Pours medium brown with a large rocky/frothy off-white head.  The head is mostly lasting but it leaves a excellent lacing.  The aroma is alittle flowery.  The flavor is slightly of bubblegum and pineapple.  The body is light-medium with a dry and watery texture and soft carbonation.  Overall this is a allright beer, I think it is way to over rated.

Tap at Beer Sellar, Newport, KY.  It twas a lovely evening on the river.  We sat and drank pint after pint as the sun set... beautiful.  Anyway, this is one of the first beers of the night that I tried, and I was rather impressed, if not surprised.  At the time I did not know what style this beer was and neither did any of the clientele.  But the one thing that stood out more than anything to me, was a sweet, bourbon like taste and palate.  Other than that, the flavors were pretty mild, malt and caramel, late hop bitterness. Decent beer, eh?
on tap at the horsehoe pub. I wasnt blown away by this beer. It was good and a nice solid beer, but nothing really stood out. Would I have it again? Sure. Would I seek it out? No.
malty aroma; creamy one inch head; honey color; cloudy; grapefruit hop; slightly sweet; balanced finish
Hazy copper with a modest offwhite head. Aroma is malt and alcohol. Medium body. Sharply balanced--strong malt and strong hops. A quality beer, but fairly basic.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2009 on tap at mews tavern - golden amber in color with nice carbination and lacing. smells of the hops, malt, and some earthy flavors. taste is smooth, nice carbination, with the right texture and a refreshing hops finish. have had this in bottles many times in the past but on tap i could drink this all day.
pours copper colored, white lacing. strong caramel taste, sweet and full bodied. nice hop finish.

Bottle. Pours rich amber copper. Frothy white head leaves decent lacing. Loads of sweet caramel like malt on the nose. Firm and crisp on the palate. Peppery like dryness at first followed by some malt. Dry wheat toast. Decent mix of spicy dryness and sweet malt.
bomber- a well done, well balanced amber colored brew, with serious dark malt flavor, and a nice bitterness and hop flavor that is outside the norm of typical american offerings.

I went into this not expecting to like it based on other peoples opinions, but I was pleasantly surprised.  It has a nice clean taste with a good but of spice to it and some bitterness in the finish.  This rates very high on my list of "affordable daily drinkers"

Orange-brown pour with small white head.  Very earthy aroma with some bread dough and grass in addition.  There is also something strange in the aroma that Im not picking up on.  Has a honey-like sweetness with a consistent bitterness throughout.  Different, but not bad.

Pours a hazy honey gold, nice white head.
The spiciness of this really grabbed me.  I think there is some raisin, toasty, buttery.  My description does not do this beer justice.  Definitely different, but in a good way.
Light brown and not much head.  Sweet malty flavors with some bitterness at the end.  Good session brew.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008 Appearance: Pours an slightly hazy, orangey-amber body with thinnish, white head.

Smell: Sweet-smelling floral, yeasty aroma with hints of dried fruits and apples.

Taste: An overall sourish taste, with flavors of honey, dried fruits, and cider. Light hops on the finish and a yeasty aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: You know, if you can’t say something nice, don’t say it at all!

Time for an update! Not all too much has changed, except there’s a more distinct toasty, bready malt character. Still sourish, less cidery and more akin to a non-oaked white wine. Slight score bump overall.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass.  Beautiful but slightly hazy body with ample off-white head.  Aroma is sweet and malty with just a touch of spices.  Taste has an upfront sharp caramel flavor followed by a satisfying bitterness.  The finish lasts forever with biscuit-like malt notes.  One of my new favorites!
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2008 dark amber maibock with a nice malty aroma.    Medium body with a slightly hoppy finish.

On tap at Barleys Brewhaus in OP, KS. Pours a deep, hazy amber with a slight, off-white head. The nose is fairly muted but features sweet malts hiding behind floral/fruity hops. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied, lively and slick with a dry, bitter finish. The flavor is unusual for the style: round toasted malts followed by a dry hoppy finish. This one is interesting enough that I will be drinking it again.

So my theory is that the skeleton dead guy is sitting on a barrel full of drunken monkeys.  Good enough for me.  Pours nicely with hoppy aroma, dark amber hue.  Tasty, slight aftertaste.  A worthy try for the chiropractor in all of us.  Cheers!

Pours without much head but a lovely slightly hazy amber, slight boiled vege on the nose but with oranges coming through as it warms. Good body with a smooth crisp malt background flavours are reminiscent of spicy raisins with a buttery overtone. Also gains a slight citrus burst as it warms like pink grapefruit.

Poured a dark honey gold with some amber high lights, had a good off-white head, lots of pilsner malt and bread aromas, faint floral aroma with caramel and some sweet fragrances, sweet on the tongue, fruit, some toastiness, malt and pale malt flavors, nice hop bitterness, bubbly mouth feel, just a touch of alcohol, I really enjoy drinking this, its my love of Heller Bocks, all the pilsner aroma and taste, I like drinking beers made with pilsner malts and drinking a Heller Bock gives me the idea I am drinking a beer made with double the typical pilsner recipe, mmmm, all that pilsner
Oh its amber and its strong. Hoppy beer that rocks! Malty beer with caramel overtones! Dead Guy Ale is good!
This is a nice standard.  This bock brew pours light brown and shows nots of malt and hops on the nose.  The sweet and bitter work quite well on the mouthfeel.

Dead Guy is a hazy orange-brown ale with a smooth and clingy off-white head.  The aroma is of sweet malt and fruity hops.  Its rather faint and a little ciderish in the nose.  In the mouth, its dry and abundant in gravity.  The flavor starts with the sweet malt, like baking cookies, which turns a little sour before unleashing its wooden bitterness and alcoholic warmth.  It tastes much stronger than it is.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2007 Bottle, poured into a pint.  Deep cloudy honey color with a sweet malty aroma.  I like the Maibock style to begin with so I was pretty sure I would like this one.  Rogue did not disappoint.  Slightly sweet and perhaps could use a bit more hops for my taste.  Still, a good American beer.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2009 Orange-amber colour, small head however, good carbonation. Quite a hoppy nose with hints of malt. This has a sweet hoppy flavour with well rounded finish, I was sorry to see the bottle finish! Very enjoyable.
Bottle shared with Skyview, joebrew, and scluffman.  Not as hopped as I expected with a malt nose and some bitter hop on the body.

Date: 4/25/2007
Event: Junedale Beer Klub - April Beer Tasting (Maibocks)
Serving: 12 oz bottles shared by tmagee.
Tasting Notes
Aroma: Toasted malts and a hint of sweet honey.
Appearance: Cloudy honey color with a foamy, ivory-colored head.
Flavor: Toasted malts, a bit chewy.  Stong tea flavor and floral hops.  Average level of bitterness that lingers.
Palate: Mild carbonation; average body.
Overall: Good, but nothing special.

22 oz bomber thanks to padrefan78. Man is this company pissing me off. I rember Rogue beers from back in the day when I first tried craft beers as awesome stuff, just goes to sho0w you the ridiculous things that kids think. This company once again has let me down. Poured an orangey/amber with a smallish off white head. Aroma was weak, flavor was weaker and except for Shakespere Stourt I doubt you will ever see me buying a Rogue again.

Wow, this is one of those beers that Ive never rated.  Beautiful copper, with a medium off-white head that laces down the glass before even trying.  Malty, hoppy and a bit of corn in the aroma.  Malt,  dominates more than I expected, with a heaviness that I remembered.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: Didnt know what to make of this, although this being quite good. Very weird, vinegar, hops, raisins, nuts and dried fruits filled the aroma. Taste is full of hop bitterness. Surprisingly refreshing, hoppy and malty, well balanced. Reddish in looks with a small head. Must be the hoppiest heller bock on this earth

Perhaps I am just not a fan of the maibock style, but I did not care for this beer very much.  Disappointing, coming from a great brewer like Rogue.  Sweet malt, caramel, and spices come through.  Cant put my finger on it exactly, except to say that the combination just didnt work for me.  Ill put this one on the list to give another chance in the future.
This isnt bad beer but is reminiscent of many different microbrews I have come across. The hops is definitely evident, sweet, and bitter. OK
Bottle. Nice amber colour. Sweet malty caramel hoppy aroma. Flavour of caramel, good maltiness, hoppy and bit fruity. Tasty beer but not so much a bock though.

A slightly sweet malty aroma. Beer is gold/orange with no real head to speak of. Mostly sweet malty flavors with some alcohol warmth. A little dry on the palate. Not alot of hop balance though. It is also very fruity.

Color is deep gold to amber, with a small, white head.  Aroma is all malts.  Tastes a little sweet, fruity, kind of simple fruit punch like flavor.  Drinkable but doesnt thrill me on any level.  Wierd hint of cough syrup.  My first beer from Rogue, Im disappointed considering the fame of this brewery.
clear amberwith a fluffy off white head. nice malty aroma, very easy drinking beer smooth soft hops with a well balanced malty finish. pretty good

Pours a clear light amber color, with a very light, thin, white head.  Smells of some hops with a big malt background.  A little skunkiness too.  Taste is more hops, a little crisp citrus, and lighter malts round it out.  Just a touch of cinnamon as well.  Really smooth and easy drinking.  I could drink it a lot.  Nice session brew.

Rated 4/22/06:  Good brew indeed. Bought a bomber a while back and cracked it after a long day and a nice shower. Pours a burnt orange color almost looks like a dark rich honey. There is a white medium sized head that forms and soon dissipates to a white film, zero lacing is left on my glass and a steady stream of carbonation works its way up to the top. The aroma is nice easily detected but not too strong which primarily consists of delectable sweet malts. Very pleasant and appealing the scent lured me into a balanced flavor of sweet malts. I was expecting something over the top but this beer was simple and delivered, perhaps perfecting a recipe that relies on a sturdy malt characteristic only is what makes this ale so good. Creamy mouthfeel that goes down full and finishes slightly dry. I thoroughly enjoyed this beer simply for what it does right.

Bottle and on tap.  Slightly occluded copper amber pour, with minimal head.  Wonderful medium roasted malt flavors, with more dimensions emerging as the aftertaste lingers.  Medium bodied, and very well balanced for a beer with so much character.
I have had this beer by itself many times, but also at a tasting where we paired it next to an authentic German maibock.  It was a fascinating tasting as we got to really taste and tell the difference made by the use of the ale yeast instead of the lager yeast.  While the flavor profiles of each beer were similar, the Dead Guy had much more depth and layers of flavor.  It was almost like looking at something in 3 dimensions, when you had seen before only a 2 dimensional picture of it.
One final note on the Dead Guy.  As a bartender at a bar with a great deal of draft beer selections, Dead Guy is one of my favorite beers, not only because of my enjoyment of it, but also because it is one of my most useful selling tools.  Because it stands on the bridge between ales and lagers, I have found it to be more effective than any other brew we carry at getting lager lovers to step over that bridge and try some of the wonders the ale world has to offer.
This was an interesting beer...nice amber color with a decent malty scent.  Very balanced taste.  I did like this beer..and the next five went down smooth too.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy honey color with a nice white head and moderate lacing.  Nose is mostly sweet and taste is malty with some spicy notes.  Although this hybrid beer is brewed in the Maibock style, the PacMan yeast definitely makes it more of an ale.  Which kind of ale?  Thats up for debate... maybe an American Blonde?  Its an interesting novelty brew, but thats about it.
UPDATED: APR 19, 2008 bottle. pours a red amber, with creamy head. dissipates quickly. has an interesting tea/honey taste. easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours a slightly red amber with a small, creamy white head with some lacing. A sweet malty aroma is coupled with some fruity and sour berries notes. Flavour begins sweet, but has a distinct tartness to it. Woody, and dry. With a hoppy taste, though not that bitter.

This beer pours a golden amber color with no head at all. There is a very sweet and fruity smell to it. as you drink it there is a nice sweet and tart flavor to it. The after taste is not that intence.
Bottle.  Amber in color with a white head and lacing.  A little citrus in the nose, fruits and honey in the mouth.  Goes done well.
pretty decent maibock rep. Good malt base for sure, a little spice in there...good option at most bars around here...

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2007 Pours a dark amber, with small diminishing head. This beer has a lot more malt than I am used to, and it may have been thay I am just unused to it, but I thought that the barley wasa bit over the edge. Overall, not a bad beer. However, this isnt quite my style.
Pours a hazy copper color with a white head.  Aroma is malty, fruity, with a hint of honey.  Flavor is malty, slight honey, with a spicy hop finish

on tap at oasis in rockford.  Nice amber color with very little head.  plenty of body and a bit bitter taste.  Its a hearty ale for sure.  I know this beer is use to high marks but I didnt think the finish was that balanced, still a very good beer.

22oz bottle. Pours a dark amber with a light-gold head. Bread-like, malty aroma with very little hops. Flavour is toasted malt with some hop spiciness to follow. Has a honey sweetness to it. A little too much carbonation detracts a little from both the flavour and palate. I bought this basically because I could tell it was a craft brewer and it was one the few craft brewed ales available in a bomber at the local store, and Im certainly glad I took the chance. Although maltier than Id normally like, I do like the stuff and would like to try more Rogue brews in the future.
Pretty straightforward. Malty sweetness upfront and some bitterness at the end. High carbonation.

Bottle. Beautiful orange amber color and a tall white head. Decent lacing.  I think a fruity Honey is the best way to describe the aroma. Taste is much the same  like those little flavored sticks of honey you can buy at Cracker Barrel then with a pretty decent bitter finish. Pretty good and I love that Tennessee Orange color!

a Trappist aroma, light vinegar, honey, orange. clinging off white head over a barely cloudy deep amber. a little flat and thin on the tongue. well-balanced flavors of sugar, lemon, salt, finished like regular tea.
golden orange color with small head and lightly carbonated. citrus aroma and pretty thick body. bitter, sweet, carmel, orange with floral and spice flavors. good flavorful balanced beer
Beautiful amber color...light head...minimal carbonation.  A great tasting ale that I will be sure to keep on hand for every occasion.

WOW! Rate #666.How cool is this. Dead guy has malts and some spice on the nose.Pours an amber color with a small head.Nothing too special here.Has a slight sweetness to it with malts and hops behind it.Finishes slightly bitter

Bottle poured a clear amber with a large lasting amber head. Aromas of toasted malt, carmel and a hint of citrus. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, toasted malt, carmel, light earthiness and a hint of grapefruit rind with a smooth lingering moderatly bitter finish.
Get lots of sweet malt int he aroma.Pours a medium gold with a medium off white head.Lots of sweet malt dominate the flavor.Thin to medium mouthfeel with a bitter sweet finish.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2008 hazy apricot pour with minimal off-white head, Rogue Dead Guy is classified as a Heller Bock by this site, considered a Maibock by Jacksons Great Beer Guide.  I agree with the commerical description "malty aroma, rich heary flavor, well balanced finish"
Cant add anything to that!

Bottle. Tiny beige head over copper colored, slightly hazed body. Grassy, sweet malty aroma with notes of alcohol and cardboard. Taste is sweetish malts with a generous amount of earthy hops. Healthy body, oily mouthfeel, raw bitter finish. (Thanks to Beer_2000)
12 oz. bottle at Zenos, Penn State.  Poured clear amber with white head.  Decently well balanced between malts and hops.  Nothing special; Rogue lives off their marketing prowess.
Bottle. Dark golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is hop, fruit, alcohol. Flavour is sweet, fruit, hop. Ok beer.
One of my personal favorites.  great beer to drink any time.  strong taste that leaves very little after taste.

Bottle. Clear amber color with small frothy fair lacing mostly diminishing off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, toasted, caramel, light alcohol a bite like barley wine. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily,carbonation is osft, finish feel is light alcoholic.
Draft.  Brownish-red pour, small head.  Aroma is malty and sweet.  Flavor is very much the same, very little hop action in this one.  Smooth and drinkable.  I enjoyed it.

I am not very impressed by this one but I do not think its horrible either. Its very malty and I prefer to have more hops present (JMO). In addition to being malty it is also somewhat sweet for my taste. It is a nice tannish light brown color and pours a nice head. The aroma smells a lot like honey to me.

Again, a good beer but just not my style.

Warm malty beer with great taste and appearance.  I could drink this beer anytime.  a great starter beer for your friends who are afraid of craft beers or who want a quality beer without too much hoppiness.

On tap.  Okay so when I was in college I thought this beer rocked.  I havent tried it in some time and I guess my tastes have changed.  I was not that impressed.  Weak aromas of hops and molasses.  Sweet flavor (didnt seem to be all that balanced).  Not a bad beer but not what the 21 year old in me remembers.

I thought this was yet another lackluster brew by rogue. I had heard some good things about this brew, but it turned out to not be all that impressive. The ale itself was good, smooth, and crisp. As for body complexity, there wasnt much there. The aroma was barely noticable and the brew itself felt unbalanced and decidedly average.

Nothing special about this brew caught my palate.

This would be a good cold brew on a hot summer day, when the pure cold, smooth crispness of a beer manages to make up for a sub-par brew.

Bottle. It poured a clear golden, topped by an off-white head. Hops, beef-stock, malt and caramel on the nose. Quite hoppy flavor with malt and beef-stock. Medium to full body, and a balanced finish with pronounced hoppiness and maltyness. A nice beer, not the typical bock, but nice. (070413)
On tap at Mile Square in Hoboken.  For a west coast beer, it is surprisingly well balanced.  Not too hoppy, just malty enough that you can recommend it to almost anyone.

12 oz. bottle flown from Oregon, thanks to sister-in-law and boyfriend. Dark amber color, non-lasting white head. Aroma of rye bread, yeast, copper. Flavor is initially sweet, then yeasty, roasty, bready and quite bitter. Bitterness blossoms and then shouts in the finish. Soft and dry. Id enjoy washing down a cheeseburger with this beer.
Bottle.  Was not at all impressed with this offering - poured a clear copper color, sweet taste with some oranges.  weak!!
Nice sweet floral aroma. Cloudy pale red color. Sort of strong malts in the flavor, not much hops. Overall a good one.
initial smell of apple, citrus and coriander.  flavor starts woody with a crisp dry finish. reminiscent of lipton orange pekoe tea.

sample from the bottle at some party. pours brown with white head. nose had that past its prime random pick from some liquor store but wasnt too bad, sorta nutty with dark fruits. flavor wasnt too good either, nutty, toasted biscuit, and raisins and plums. feel was sorta watery. i really couldnt say i liked it.

650 ml bottle.  This was the first craft beer I had 10 years ago and I was hooked after having it- Dead Guy opened up my eyes to what a good beer tastes like.  Good head and hazy orange color.  The flavor is smooth, subtle, not a lot going on up-front, but then it develops in the back of the palate and has a nice bitter, smoky aftertaste.  Thanks Rogue!!
Nice, malty beer with a bitter finish.  Caramel color with an accordingly off-white head.  Good beer, but not in my list of favorites.

This pours a hazy light brown, with almost no head.  No real noticable aroma, just a hint of sweetness.  The flavor has a hint of honey, a hint of spice, and a nice sweetness to it, nice long finish, and a very drinkable beer.  A great one to session drink.
Bottle. Orange colour with a white head. Sweet malty flavour. A bit fruity apricot scent too. Sweet flavour, fruity & malty. Quite thin.

Wow! Happy Easter to me! Poured a pretty slightly hazy copper color, nice creamy head. Smelled of sweet malts. Flavor was sweet malt, some fruit, and a bit of hops...Very drinkable. Very well blended. Delightful Easter brew for me!
Red/Copper brew with a white head. Sweet maltiness in the aroma with some hints of plum. The taste is dry, sharp and lively. Some of the plum comes through before it finishes with a smack of bitter.

Bottle. 12 FL. OZ. Copper color with a quickly diminishing white head. Sweet, malty aroma. Thin palate with some fairly lively carbonation.  Dry, bitter flavor that lacks a little and seems watered down.  Ok, but nothing special.

bottle poured with a hazy copper color.  Decent head, biggish bubbles and some lacing.  Malty enough that I tasted cookies with my first couple of sips.  Hops come in later with a satisfying bite.  A good, solid offering from Rogue.

This is a comfort beer; the balances are pretty perfect. Itls hoppy, sweet, and has an alcohol kick that gets you fuzzy before you finish one of the big bottles. Im not too versed in this style of beer, but for what its worth, I buy this every once in a while the same way you throw in a cd you listened to a whole lot a long time ago.

Sweet malty aroma with a lot of hop spiciness in there.  Pours a light amber with a thick white head.  Hoppy up front, ctrusy, with a rich caramel malt flavor, with some decent roasted malts in there.  A lot of hop bite, it is Rogue.  I can see why this is one of their more popular beers.

Very malty, and hop-like aroma. The color is red/orange that is somewhat nice. Also my first heller bock, and I am not impressed with this type of brew. The malt flavor isnt strong enough, and the hop smell is not potent enough. A very weak brew, but not horrible. It is smooth, and doesnt go down to bad. Plus, there is a slight bitter kick at the end which is okay. I have to say Rogue could be a lot better of a brewer if it wanted to. Check out some of their stouts and you will know what I am talking about.

Little sweet malt aroma with a faint hop pine smell.     Color is a beautiful light brown with little head or lace.
Flavor is ...great!  A wonderful balance between malty and hoppy -  this is my "go to" beer for drinking at the bar.   Medium mouthfeel, neither too fizzy nor too thick.

Overall a great beer. Rogues best IMHO.
Complex and potent...my first Heller Bock...and I liked it. Do yourself a favor and drink a Rogue Beer if you havent already...

750 ml bottle. Pours a clear amber gold with moderate, creamy head that lasted through about 1/3 of the glass. Malty aroma with some caramel as well. The flavor is sweet malt along with some hops at the finish. There really wasnt anything wrong with this beer, I just found it rather ordinary.
i had this on tap at the mile square in hoboken. is this a reformulation? years ago it wasnt nearly this good. this beer was what a hop head like i love to drink.  hooray for reformulations!

Pours amber, with a small head.  Aroma is sweet and yeasty.  Flavor is very fruity (from the yeast) with some restrained hop bitterness in the finish.  Sweetness becomes cloying as it warms.  Not bad, but dissapointing from an otherwise great brewer.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2008 One of Oregons most lauded breweries, Rogue began brewing this German-styled Maiback in the early 1990s as a tribute to the Mayan Day of the Dead (November 1st aka All Souls Day) for Portlands Casa U Betcha.  With a creepily crispy malt presence, slightly candy caramel flavor and midnight purple hue, this gravely hopped brew quickly caught on a is now one of the brewerys top sellers.  Had this as Rogue White Crane.  What a rip!
This one is interesting because ador the first few sips.  The malt bomb gets a bit overwhelming after a while, but i still love this beer.
Decent head that dimishes quickly.  Patate was nice but taste didnt have any mmpf.  I see this beer is rated noticeably higher that I rated it, but its not quite that good imho.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2007 Amber color with thick head.  One of the tastier beers around that is getting more appreciation as Rogue gains more national distribution.  Excellent malty sweetness on the front of my palate.  Strong toffee notes and spicy hopped finish.
Bottle - Orange/copper color with nice white head.  Aroma is of citrus and hops.  Good flavor of grain, hoppy finish, sweet with hints of spice, some bread-like flavors, also.

Cloudy amber pour with a decent sized head.  Aroma is very nutty, with a bit of toffee and some cheese.  Tastes is all about bread and nut flavors with a rather toasty finish.  Sometimes the Rogue house character doesnt work so well, but with earthy beers it can be very nice.  This is a drinkable beer with more going on than a lot of other drinkable amber beers.  Good stuff.

Pours a copper orange, opaque like.  Buttery malt aroma.  Quite sweet with more of hops presence than expected.  Chewy and sticky. This is the first Rogue I have sampled and I am quite pleased with it.
by far the most accessible of the Rogue ales, nice color nice aroma but no big deal, and nothing special. Rogue has far superior ales...try those first!
A good beer, nice copper color.  Sweet hoppy smell, slightly honey flaovred.  light malt with one-finger head, nutty brown caramel taste as warms to room temp
A very good citrus and hoppy beer, really nice taste, nice color.  Another one I tried while on vacation that I will now be looking for locally.

Pours a deep orange with a tan head.  Remains fairly opaque.  Nice aroma of sweet malt, similar to a scotch ale.  Nice and heavy on the palate.  A lot of flavor...pine, citrus, and hops.  A nice beer, especially during the colder months.
This beer is always good for a change of pace. An excellent blend of sweet and fruit with just enough hop bite.  Medium body.  Very drinkable.
Nose of kraft macaroni and cheese. Not a very good beer. Taste is decent with the yeast overpowering the hops and malt. Would not reccommend.
About as stock as you can get.  Not bad, not great.  Definitely not Rogues best.

Pours a nice golden color with a fluffy white head that quickly dissipates.  The aroma is faint but has notes of bread and honey.  The flavor is watered down, otherwise they really might have something.  A slight bitterness and metallic at first.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2008 2008 rerate.  When this stuff is fresh it has a really tangy and zippy bite to it.  moderate bitterness but i love the hops used in this one.  Hides alcohol very well.  Unfortunately it’s hard to find fresh in my area.  and with it being pricey at $9.99 for a 6 pack at savemart and $5.49 for a bomber.  the stuff sits there for months.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2007 Pours copperish orange.  Wheat bread crust aroma with hints of citrus.  Flavor is heavily wooded to start.  Touches of copper, lemon, and those pine needle hops that manage to affect and in most cases dominate each of this brewers offerings.  Not much for the usual stylistic tastes here, and this is simply unworkable in this case.  Not everything with an indiscriminate weight of hops is bound to be impressive.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass, burnt orange with a medium beige head. There was little aroma, just a touch of sweet malt. The flavor was balanced between spicy hops and light sweet malt with just a touch of bitterness. Nothing special here.

I have had about a dozen of these beer and I am sorry I just dont get it. A bock with PNW hop bite. That god for artists !Page 389 of Michael Jacksons Great Beer Guide and only 283 of his 500 Classic Brews to go.

herbs, red, cloudy, aminimal head, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish, 

this beer tasted better the longer it was in your mouth, finished very well
Pours a redish color with a small fizzy head. Some lacing, hints of fruit. Some hopiness. Medium bodied beer with a sweet aftertaste.

Not a bad beer, just difficult for me to really appreciate fully.  Its got a nice hoppyness, but Im missing the richness advertised (but, at least it looks good).  To me, its not as balanced as it might be thought. Ive tried other Rogue beers which I quite like, but this one is not a favorite.  The ESB, on the other hand, is fantastic. With this beer, I just wasnt quite sure what I was getting, and thats probably part of the problem.
light brown reddish appearance with barely any head.  the flavor starts off malty and sweet but does not finish.  not very complex.  just an average beer, rogue is an inconsistant brewery

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2007 Bottle and on tap.  Pours a nice amber/copper color with a minimal head.  Malty and hoppy in aroma and taste.   Have not disliked a single Rogue product.  Bought a case of The Dead Guy at the Brewry while visiting Newport.

22oz. Bomber

Dead Guy poured a hazy copper with a one finger creamy white head. The head slowly fades to a nice coating.

This beer smells great. Its bready, sweet, and all kinds of floral and perfume. I cant wait to drink this stuff.

The taste would be hard to improve on. The flavors are like theyre coming from two different beers but they go together absolutely perfect. The first splash of flavor is sweet, caramel and just a touch of doughyness. The second explosion of flavor is floral hops and enough bitterness to balance out the front. It really is like two totally seperate beers.

The mouthfeel is right where it should be. Medium bodied and slick going down. Coats the mouth nicely. A good amount of carbonation tickles the tongue.

Drinkability is close to perfect. I could drink this all night with no problem besides the alcohol being a little higher than average. 

Ive drank this beer a few times prior to this review and I know it didnt taste this good. I dont know if its the batch I got or what but this bottle of Dead Guy is an excellent beer. Im going to go buy a bunch of these tomorrow. Its not spot on for style but it is excellent. Cant miss.

Sampled 10/4/06

Thought Id trot out an old standard for the big four-oh-oh.  This was probably one of the first beers that started really getting me into craft beers.  What it had those few years ago, it still has: a great blend of hops and sweet, grainy malt.  You are drinking a flavorful beer, but it doesnt slap you in the face with any of its elements, making the whole better than the sum of its parts.  Its not a super great, world class beer, but its well made and very nicely balanced.

Copper colored ale pours with a thin short lived head.  Malty aroma with hints of apple and spices.  Nicely balanced flavor.  Minimal  to no lacing in my glass.  After a swallow, I am reminded of apple cider for just a second.  Low hop bitterness.  Nice brew!

it was a nice drinking beer i enjoyed it it was light on the hop and u could really taste the spices. all the being said i dident much care for the price for a wopping 36$ a case not thankes it wasent that good, But still good
Vey light on the hops. Poured very nice gold color. Little aroma. Hard to pick up mosttones. Nice finish. Just average.

Received for my birthday in April. A nice brew with a classic hoppy flavor. Aroma is nice with a amber colored pour. Has a destictive flavor that probably includes cinnamon and roasted spices. Worth a try, but not the best Rogue ive ever had.
Very cloudy and quite a bit of spice in it.  Nice and toasty flavor.  Malt and yeast flavors abound.  I liked it.
I like this better than the American Amber, though both are very good.  A little bland by comparison to others like it, but a good bet.  Id love to try this on draught.

Rogue dead guy in a 12 oz brown bottle. I think this is my first rogue brew.  Interesting label on the bottle with the skeleton and all.  I am curious why they call it dead guy.  Oh, now I see, the Mayan thing. Pop the lid and you get the wonted beer aroma.  Perhaps it does have little perfumey hints to it. Once poured into my steeler stein it is slightly darker than a pale yellow lager, I think its orange with just a teeny bit of red in there. The head is off white and it is tinted some with yellow.  In the beginning the flavor seems sort of strong, but not excessively. Some malty bitterness and you can sure tell there is alky in here. I dont think heller is one of my favorite types. Carbonation is medium low.  This is on par with  Hofbräu München Maibock and Flying Dog Heller Hound Bock.  Seems to be well behaved but it sure does let you know you are drinking 7% beer.  I dont think the flavor of this is as good as  Nova Paka Valdstejn.  Finish is not as offensive as some IPA and imp stouts but it sure does have an ugsome linger that hangs around for a while.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Dark copper color. Almost no head. Pretty but lack of head detracts points. Smells sweet, some slight pinyness (I think). Wow first time my nose is working and I cant really describe it. It smells good and dad says it smells like falstaff. Slight bitterness and sweet. Maybe caramel... Not very complex though... Still like it. Feels like beer, not watery not jaggermeister. Overall it rocks.
Nice session brew.  Copper-amber colour, with a malty carmel aroma.  Is full bodied with medium bitter finish.
Good flavored ale.  Pours amber colored with a fair amount of head.  Head leaves a little lacing.  Good finish.
this is a great brew.  golden in color beige head.  bitter aftertaste but tastes great going down

355 ml bottle. Clear, golden amber body with a disappearing beige head. Aroma is malty, fruity and a bit yeast. Flavor is sweet malty, dry bittering hops and traces of yeast. Bitter aftertaste. Medium bodied. OK, but not the best beer from Rouge.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2009 Very drinkable.  Im not experienced enough to know what gives this beer its complex flavor, but theres a prominent nutty-citrusy flavor throughout.  Not real bitter.  I nice introduction to good beer. :::::UPDATE::::: Had this Halloween 09 after a couple more years of beer-drinking experience.  WHAT A GREAT BEER!  Its unique and easy-drinking...but with some muscle behind it.  [Raised a 4.3 rating to a 5.0]
Bottle. POured a golden color. Aroma of citrus and flowers. Taste is kinda hoppy with a malt finish.

Theres a dead guy chillin in my refrigerator.  Its sad because I cannot wait to drink it.  This is a great beer, and the label, tap head and name are just  the beginning.  Im a big fan of this brewer and this beer does not disappoint.  Pours with a foamy head, and nice ale color.  A great nose, and a great flavor.  The Rogue in me didnt need to brought out, but this beer definitely tickled it.
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2007 Cloudy amber with creamy, lasting head / Good nose / Medium body with flavors of raspberries, grapes, burnt sugar / Sweet finish.  Outstanding.
Not my favorite style, but this beer did have some issues I wasnt very fond of. There isnt much of a hop-malt companionship here; the malts are overbearing. Overall not bad, but not my style.

Bottle.   Pours an amber-copper color with a medium sized off white head.   Aroma is sweet malt, some floral hops, grape.   Flavor is toasted malts, honey, floral hops.   Palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, sweet finish.   Decent.

12oz bottle, pours nice a cloudy brown-amber color with a decent head, reminds me of a malty less hoppy IPA, VERY drinkable as a session beer, goes down smooth and lingers on the palet just long anough to pop open a new one and pour it, great beer as most of the rogues are.

Bottled. I drank a bit of this a few years ago but have not had any recently until this week. Just poured a bottle. Pours and smells a basic Pale Ale. Flavor seems slightly more malt directed than others. It is good and refreshing. Not a favorite but not crap either.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2010 Pours cloudy amber.  Foamy thin cream head.  No real aroma.  Quick carbonation on the palate which gives way to a subtle malt followed by a bitter finish that is short-lasting.  There is a little complexity in the middle that adds. Pretty balanced bock over all.  A curious beer by Rogue.

Tap. Thin and foamy head. Rich amber color with light appearance of carbonation. Smelled strongly of hops with notes of honey and something that resembled soy. Flavor was very subtle also tasted lightly of soy. This is a refreshing beer, but not very impressive.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2009 Draft at Nama. Clear, darkish copper color topped by a single digit, diminishing head. Nice palate. Fruity molasses aroma. Flavor is the same with slight bittering herb on the finish. Rerate for bottle: I liked this beer better in the bottle, seemed to have more flavor. Upped flavor and overall impression to bump score from 3.1 to 3.2.

Dead Guy Ale pours a cloudy brown hue with a light-brown, fizzy head that doesnt feel like sticking around, although it does leave slight lacing on the glass. Murky body with lively carbonation dancing around. Aroma is of sweet, yet tamed malts and alcohol. Intially, this ale is moderately sweet, although it turns to a light, malty bitter finish with an average duration. Slighty watery on the palate, it is thin bodied with soft carbonation and a vanilla taste.

Reviewers notes: Amber likes the smell. Smells like apples. Sean was expecting more from the smell. Ignace would say that this is not very balanced.

Reviewed in November, 2006.
on tap @ Coles Buffalo NY. Great tap handle. Good brew. Honeyish color, creamy, malty & tasty. Nice head & easy drinking. Well done

Pours a ruby brown with a respectable white head.  Has a nice aroma of alcohol and fruit.  Almost like cognac.  Soft on the palate with a sweet malt center and some good hopping.  A little alcohol apparent in the taste, but its dang good
draft. nice pour with lasting creamy head. Tons of great malt flavor in the German tradition. Faint taste of hops at the end, but this is about the malt. Awesome on draft.
Looks like honey.  Smells sweet and malty.  Complex malt flavors; they did use many malts in this beer.  Hops and bitterness are on the back burner.  Good Beer.
Amber with a full head that hung around awhile. Bready aroma. Nicely balanced. I have no idea what a Heller Bock is but this is a very good ale.
Bottle (12oz - $8.99) - First newbie tasting club - Lars brought it. Unclear red/brown - white head. Bread, thin, high bitterness, berries, thats about it !!
Bottle. Pours dark amber with medium head. Malty, with butterscotch and floral hopinnes. Smooth and perfectly carbonated. Nicely balanced finish.
On tap at firewaters....dark honey color...sweet aroma, nice caramel hops...delish!!
I confess i love thi stuff. its a great brew. I dont know what a heller bock is but I think this stuff is great.

Dark golden with a nice head and a strange name. The aroma has notes of hops and caramel. The flavour is initially slightly sweet and then fairly bitter in a dry and astringent way. It has notes of roasted malt, caramel and fruit. Its a complex and nice beer, but not the best I have had from Rogue, that holds a special place in my heart...

Has a clear dark honey with almost a red tinge in appearance and brief tan head.  A predominant malty aroma which isnt that strong.  Taste is smooth with a nice balance of malt and hops but rather uneventful.  Finish has a quick but light bite of hops to it with no residual aftertaste.  Im not picking up any of the powerful flavor that others have stated.  Not bad, but maybe a little over-rated.

22oz. bottle.  Pours deep copper with slight off-white head that quickly disappears - is this symbolic of the "Dead Guy" (headless)? HA!  Aroma is malty, subtly hoppy.  Taste is sweet caramel and moderately hoppy.  Full mouthfeel.  Very enjoyable ale indeed!

bottle. copper color with head that quickly goes away. Very balanced taste with good flavor. Had half this beer and then took a sip of my girlfriends Boddingtons and this beer made the Boddingtons seem dull, lame, and flavorless. Bitter aftertaste that i LOVE. i will continue to drink this beer. Cool label too.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy solid copper color with a mid sized slightly offwhite head that dissipates quickly, but leaves decent lacing.   Aroma of hops and sweetness.  Flavor is hoppy, but sweet, with some bread hints thrown in.  Fairly well balanced and it finishes fairly clean.
12 oz bottle - amber pour with decent head and a hoppy aroma.  Slight hoppy taste - seems slightly similar to an IPA.  Good brew - refreshing and enjoyable.

650 ml bomber - pours a bright rusty hue with a small white head that fades quickly.  Aroma is mainly hops upfront, but just as much malt in there, keeping everything superbly balanced.  Bready, malty and hoppy, this isnt hugely complex, but it is very enjoyable nonetheless.  There is a sweet almost cookie-ish note in the finish that is very welcome.  Plus, the label.....I mean, come on, is that the coolest or what?  Would be a great session beer (if I could buy it regularly enough for it to be sessionable).  The LCBO not carrying Rogue products regularly (or ANY other American micro, for that matter) is one of the great travesties of our time.
Draft.  Amber colored with a slight hoppy aroma.  Taste is very flavorful and well balanced.  Hoppy, malty, sweet and strong.  Im always impressed with Rogues products and this is no exception.
Bottle.  Poured a deep amber-yellow in color with a thick aroma full of maltiness.  Flavor packed with malts and slightly nutty with a faint caramel sweetness added near the finish.  Dry finish.

Pours a deep amber with about a half an inch of nearly white foam. The head doesn’t last all that long, reducing down to a thin ring, but it does leave a little bit of lacing as I drain the pint glass. Some light toasted malt in the aroma, along with a mild hop presence that I guess I would call floral or herbal.

It starts out malty, with definite caramel and subtle toasted grain, then it slides into a prominent honey malt. Spicy hops come into play with the honey malt, and the finish is clean with mild and almost peppery hops.

This beer is exceptionally smooth with a creamy carbonation. In its body and character, it reminds me of drinking a cask beer. Medium body, perfect balance, and very flavorful.
like a mix of an IPA, and a barley wine almost. Im getting the citrus hops of an IPA, but the flavour is sweet like candy. very very nice. i would definetly have again.
Darkish red/amber color with very little head.  Slightly fizzy palate with a bit of a hoppy taste.  Ill have this beer again, I enjoyed it.

Pours filtered and darkish amber.  Little to no head.  Smells of faint hops and Werthers Original hard candies.  Taste is watery and plain  the balance is TOO good here as the malts  and hops become bland. Maybe PacMan is eating all the flavor. Wish there were more Perle and Saaz in this guy! Tremendous palate--very drinkable for session drinking!
had this in bottle at old chicago a while back i remeber being a fan. tasted bitter roasty etc a nice beer i enjoyed it try one today!

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2007 Poured a dark amber, with very little head to speak of. Almost unnoticeable aroma, traces of Munich & caramel, and faint hops. Taste is MUCH more impressive! Great malting, hops to cover it, and a very pleasant balance to the finish. Reminds me of the Fullers Vintage Ales, but with more malty sweetness as opposed to fruityness. Good strong carbonation, slightly thin body but appropriate to style. An excellent beer - needs a bit of dry hopping to foster some sort of aroma, though.
Very attractive and drinkable beer with a nice finish.  Seemed to improve greatly as it warmed up a bit.

Hazy orange amber with a small creamy head.  Malty sweet aroma with a light hops background.  Very malty flavor up front but the hops do balance it nicely at the end.  Medium bodied with a nice hop finish and a good sparkle of carbonation.      Good beer.

Reddish pour with white head, a very attractive beer.  Smells of both hops and malts mixed with a bit of citrus.  A bit too many fruity flavors for me, but well done.  Medium mouth feel.  Not too aggressive or too docile, a good all around beer.
very average.  My friends like this one more than I do.  Worth trying once, not worth stocking your fridge with.

My first Rogue. And my first Maibock. Hazy deep amber color. Sweet malt aroma. white head disapates completely. Initially thought that this was very malty and that I wouldnt want any more maltiness...but realized that there was enough hop to balance it all out. It was suprisingly good and actually refreshing even throughout the temperature change. I will definitely be looking forward to having this again.

On tap. Pours a reddish amber color with a white head on top. Aroma is full of malts. Caramel, honey, toffee, and fruit are in the nose. Underlying hints of hops in afterwards. Flavor is malty, with bread, caramel, and honey taking predominance. Hops come in there too. A very drinkable beer. I have had this many times and this beer actually helped introduce me into craft beers. I need to get around to trying more Rogue beers.
UPDATED: AUG 14, 2008 One of my favorite ales, hoppy with a complex flavor. Very drinkable, the alcohol content is barely noticeable and is covered up by the taste of the beer.

22oz bomber.  pours kinda burnt amber haze, average bubbly head that dissolves fairly slowly.  there are many aromas on the nose.  hoppy, tangy, earthy, sweet, and even pleasantly malty.  it has a little pale ale in it, but also just a well-rounded ale.  also, its really rather sweet for an ale.  smooth finish too.  dead guy is very drinkable, moreso than other rogue brews.  theyre all pretty distinct, but this one gets an extra few points for its overall yumminess and high drinkability.  my only complaint is for the lack of definition for the palate.
[Bottle, January 2007] Gorgeous deep orange/amber color. Very strong honey aroma. Sweet, pleasant honey flavor. Mouthfeel is round. Oak and honey in the finish. A beer best described as pleasant.
reddish in color with okay flavor.  has a cool artsy label.  available in 6 packs and a 22 oz.  good offering from rogue

Clear amber hue, diminishing small white head with some lacing. Low carbonation. Nice sweet malt and fruity ester aromas. Medium boduthat starts with slight sweet malt, caramel, and hop flavors. Slight sharpness noted. Finishes dry with some hop bitterness. Not Rogues best but a very palatable Ale nonetheless.
red amber, slightly cloudy color, white head. Aroma is of bread with pine undertones. The flavor is pretty bitter but the sweetness of the malt balances almost perfectly. A very tasty and sturdy ale.

Bottle. Pours an amber clor with a samll off white head. Aroma is earthy, yeasty  and malty. Taste has a slight caramel flavor with a nice balanced of malt and hops. Nothing real exciting but overall not a bad beer. Has a bit of a dry finish to it.

12 oz bottle picked up at Cost Plus
pours a warm hazy amber with orange hues  with a nice medium tight off white head which slowly dissipates to a thin film top
Medium bodied with medium carbonation. with a nice slightly creamy & drying spicy hop finish with some hints of a pear like after taste
Aroma: Nose of bread, biscuit and a low noble hop aroma, some honeyed malts and some alcohol as the beer warms up
Flavor: Malt is the main big note with some sweet base malt, some biscuit with a slight pear like flavor. This is followed by a alyered hop flavor from spicy, earthy to drying in the end... with some alcohol as the beer warms
Overall: A very well made Maibock. seems close to the style for a rogue ale seems restrained. Not the best maibock but for one made with an ale yeast is good. Cheers... yet another good from Rogue

Over-all this is not a bad beer.  It was my first Rogue beer.  Amber color with nice head.  Taste has kind of been summed up many times here,  little bit of malt, carmel, and bread.  The finish was surprsingly hoppy, which was kind of nice.  Pretty decent stuff.

Nice. A nose of malty floral notes and barley, with a moderately complex palate of barley, earth notes, a bit of caramel, and pleasant hops underneath a fine alcohol warmth. Not great, but the best ale Ive had in a while.
Not my favorite beer, but none the less a good one. Amber colored with a nice head. A very hoppy flavor.
Its a decent beer. I buy it all the time. Had a 22ozer on New Years. Very light in flavor, aroma, and body. Not the best Rogue, but this beer is still far superior to many.

I was dissapointed in the lack of any real aroma, but was relieved to find that this one has a good flavor.  For a non-belgian ale, its very good, so Id recommend this one to lovers of fine ales.  Thumbs up to the boys in Oregon.
user_location: The United States of Texas, Texas, USA

text: A nice ale.  Nothing truly unique but has enough to distinguish it from others.
