little to no head, good taste and malt sweetness.  Tastes like a Belgian Ale.  Kind of caramel flavor.  Not bad.  Interesting.  Bubbly short lasting head ..kinda creamy...hazy copper color... goblet preferable , WOW
Fresh 1pt 6 oz. bottle, enjoyed with a herbal dish.  Good.
not very complex or overpowering
very well balanced for a  heller bock
Sehr gut

Cloudy golden copper with a small but long lasting off-white head.  Aroma is rather sweet (caramel) and woody.  Very malty (cookies) with a woody taste (juicy wood), moderately hoppy (dry woody hops), sweet (creamy sugar) and some berries.  All that mixed together gives it an overall hard-candy flavour.  Short finish.  Not very tasty.  Good but forgettable and a bit generic, the dead guy is probably John Smith.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2007 Dark orange amber with little white head. Malty aroma of caramel - easy sweet.. Flowery hoppy taste & easy spice. Medium filling body. Overall very pleasant, but not the best Rogue there is! Re-rating july 1st-07. Better than 1st tasting.  From 3,4 to 3,7
A dark orange pour with a small head. A mildly biitersweet banana taste mixed with a predominately malt flavor.

Rogue Dead Guy Ale is a very common tasting ale with a few great characteristics you may initially overlook.

As with some ales, this one doesnt reveal itself to you until two pints or so have been consumed (which is my general opinion on all British ales.)

Anyhow, this ale eventually opens up to its drinkers, a well-developed, flowery palate with a very smooth, velvetly delivery. Certainly dont drink this one too cold or pretend its not an ale. Itll turn you into a dead guy if you do.

Dark copper color, with an off-white head. The head didnt last long, but it did leave a tiny lace. Aromas of caramel and malts. Caramel, malt, and nut flavors to begin with, and then a very pleasant bitterness appears in the end to round everything off. Somewhat creamy and mildly-bitter aftertaste. This really is a well-crafted beer -- enjoy!

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2007 $1.79 12oz. bottle, purchased from Total Wine & More in Tampa. Served in a pint glass. Deep amber color, off white head, no lasting power. Aroma is all hops. I like it. Good carbonation, nice mouthfeel as well. Not overly astringent. Finish is all hops, slightly sweet and spicy. I like this one quite a bit. Good taste and a good price.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2007 Just good stuff....delicious, distinctive, tasty, and UINQUE! It doesnt taste like a maibock though. Regardless, really worth getting a bottle - one of my favorites and I got the tattoo to prove it.
Beautiful color, and decent head to this beer... Slight bitter and sweet taste, with a bit of nut flavour. For five bucks for 20oz not to likly to buy again soon.
Another fine brew from Rogue.  This one is spicy and malty with honey flavors.Hints of bitterness and smokiness.  A very sweet aftertaste. R.I.P.
i liked the texture, color, and flavor of this beer.  very malty and cloudy with a bitter end.

Pour is a hazy, orangey-copper with an off-white, farily small, and frothy head with little lasting ability.  Toasty, yeasty, malt and some citrus, almost berry-like, hops.  Flavor is simlar, toasty, bready, and slightly sweet malts with a berry character and some spicy hops noted as well (Saaz); bitterness is moderately low.  Palate is medium light, moderate carbonation, and a slick mouthfeel.  Finishes quickly with some spicy hops and a little toastiness.  Interesting and not like a maibock, kind of like a maibock, an oktoberfest, but with ale yeast.  Nothing to discredit this one, but just nothing too intriguing to credit it as a good beer.
Pours amber with thin creamy head.  Virtually no lacing.  Strong malt aroma, stong malt and light hop taste.  If this is a Maibock, then I think Ill steer away from this style.

Pours honey amber with a smallish head.  Nose is mostly malt with some spicy hops. Flavor is mild with sweet malt and a bit of hop bitterness.  A very clean finish.  Not an exceptional beer. but one that is very easy to drink.
Alcohol is barely present in this guy. Quite potent, quite drinkable, and quite average. Orangey copper color, small head, nice, even carbonation.

650ml bottle - pours a light cloudy orange/copper with a minimal white head. Aroma is very malty, with little to no hops present. Quite sweet and fruity, and sort of bready/cakey. Like a baked confectionary. Nice. Flavour is quite similar to this, just filled out. Quite sweet, but never cloying and very drinkable. Mouthfeel is wonderfully smooth and creamy, like it leaves a layer on the roof and tongue. Theres a light bitterness in the finish, which is the first trace of the Saaz hops aside from a light trace in the back of the aroma. I really like this beer, and the sweetness is perfectly offset.  Great bottle too. I wish the one intended for the Canadian market glew in the dark as well. Oh well.

A 1pint. 6FL oz. bottle with no brew date. The beer poured a dark copper body that is a pinch cloudy with a big creamy head.  Roasted malt with a mild hops smell. The taste is just like the smell with a nice smooth mouthfeel and good carbonation to it.  

The beer has a good taste but is a one or two type at most.

From a 12 oz bottle purchased locally here in WI...

The color of this beer was a pretty bright orange, with some haze.  The amount of head was not huge, but it had fairly tight bubbles and good staying power.

The smell was a sweet malty one.  It smelled like plain yellow cake...that sort of sweetness.

The taste was a big mouthful of maltiness, more so than other maibocks.  Very little hoppiness, which I believe is also consistent with the style.  I didnt especially care for the taste.

Mouthfeel was a little thin and watery.  Despite this, I would rate the drinkability of this beer as very high either based on the fact that I didnt really want to drink another one.

Not sure if I got an old bottle, but Id prefer Summits Maibock any day of the week over this one.

Pours slightly hazy orange .. with a nice head.  Pleasant aroma.  This is a nice round mouthfull of beer ... a little creamy on the palate.  Very slightly sweet, a little bitterness at the end.  Real beer, thats easy to drink.
UPDATED: MAY 2, 2007 Awesome, first german style maibock I have ever had. Could taste the sweet flavor with a bitter aftertaste. 6.6% alc = solid

(bottle - 12 oz) Clear brown color with a fluffy white head. Aroma is very malty with some candy and some dark fruits. Flavor is rather sweet as well with a malty backbone and a slightly bitter yet fruity finish. Not bad but could be a little more.

Brown color with cherry hue. Nice white head. Aroma of fruit and definatly malt. Fairly sweeter taste than I expected. Slightly bitter, adding a little bite (but not too much). Nice medium strength brew with a good backbone.

Reddish brown color on the pour with a nice white head.  The aroma said "fruity and malt".  The flavor was sweet without being too sweet and bitter without having too much bite.  A relatively light bodied brew with an abrupt, clean finish.
Awesome ale!  Slight fruity aroma, copper color with small head.  Bitter aftertaste.  The alcohol can sneak up on you too, hence the name...dead guy.
They dont call it Dead Guy for nothing!  This is a good tasting brew with a BIG kick.  Watch out, even though it tastes great, it can put you in your grave.
Copper color.  Malty and smooth.  Tastes of fruit, perhaps plum.  Very pleasant and drinkable.  Could have multiple in a single sitting.

Bomber. Pours a murky red-copper-brown. Aroma is initially flat and pedestrian- butterscotch is initially the prevalent factor but a some intriguing treacle and plummy fruit comes through when you delve deeper.  Flavor is earthy, bitter and fruity. Long bitter finish and a lot of sweetness to compensate. A nice beer and close to being exceptional if it was slightly more balanced.
expensive 12oz bottle.  dekcious.  bitter sweet. fruity.  pleasant fragerance. cut and killed by a sweet killer finish.  but alas, beer should be cheaper
Delicious and vague. This is a beer for those who dont know what exactly they want, but they do want a good beer.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12 oz bottle.  Clear tea leaves a thin tannish head.  Sweet & sour peaches; brown sugar.  Tangy sour apple bracketed by butterscotch.  Menthol drying, medium light.  Session stuff.
Bottle. Orangish copper color.  Very little head.  Nice heavy malt, with some roast in the aroma and taste.  I like the dry bitter finish quite a bit.

vigorously poured to create copious head. now only if i could get some copious head myself. smells like caramerl and malty and a bit cerealesque. hoppy sweet and a faint metallic twang. this beer is decent but i dunno what the fuss is about and why its liek 11 bones for a sixpack.

Theres not to much to say about this beer except that its quality is all over the place, a solid brew coming from a a solid brewer, Great head and Great taste, Orange-copper color. Nice bitterness, a little expensive but very pleasing in the end.

Very attractive burnished copper pour with a rich rocky head that fades quickly.   Nicely carbonated and lively on the palate.   I like the simple, upfront caramel/toffee sweetness of this bock...with just a light hand on the hop scoop...mainly european herbal and floral in nature.   Quite a repeatable, simple, thirst-quencher...and nothing more.
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2007 Orange/amber with a medium head. Well balanced hops in the slightly fruity sweet brew. A good middle-of-the-roader for anybody.

Finally a brew for the Gothic fetish crew!  
More malt  and carmel and honey notes than I care for but enough hops and fruit hints to be ok.

Not bad...from what Ive read, this is Rogues basic brew, so I didnt expect a whole lot to begin with. Pours amber with a little bit of head...smells of strong hops. Taste is slightly caramel and honey, but overall just strong basic malts. A good anytime beer.

also new to rating beers, but found  I liked the strong taste that was a problem for the prior reviewer.  I tend to like the stronger Islay malts when it comes to scotch, so I may be a bad data point for most people.

I am new at rating beers and I dont really know the ins and outs yet, but I found this to be a rather strong tasting ale that did not grow on me as I drink it. Not an overly unpleasant taste, but a robust one nonethless. I dont think I would buy this particular brand again.
(Bottle) Pours amber with not much head at all. Nice hoppy aroma was followed up by balanced hoppy notes. Malty as well with a perfect mouthfeel. I enjoyed this beer quite a bit.

Pours a clear amber with a medium head. Very (too) sweet. Loads of malts, caramel. Brewed solely on pale crystal malts. Caramel from beginning to end. Too much. Medium to full bodied. High carbonation. Drain pour.

Pours an orangey light bronze with a white film for head. Malty, caramel nose. Underying sweetness, glazed honeyish, bready, with a late light bitterness on the back of the tongue. Simple, nothing great.

Bomber; pours cloudy light copper with a nice head.  Initially hit with sweet fruity aroma with blueberry overtones.  Very subtle on the hops and malt, a very smooth beer that is flavorful and enjoyable with a great balance of sweetness and complexity.  Probably no surprise, but this is the Ale that hooked me on Rogue, and its been no looking back as Ive gotten to know this brewer better.

Wow, this beer caught me by surprise. It was my second experience with Rogue beers and it was quite great. Drank it at a punk show, in order to simaltaneously get drunk and enjoy a good beer. The flavour is substantive and enjoyably hoppy, but not overwhelmingly so. Need to swish it around in the mouth a little to truly appreciate its complexity though. Not a simple beer. All my friends took sips and enjoyed it quite a lot. Nice smell and consistent taste, unfortunately 7 bucks for a bottle.
Deep orange/golden color with a short lived white head.   Bready, sweet roasted malt aroma.  Flavor is a bit sweet, with some yeasty tones.  Bitter finish provides some balance.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2007 Re-rate.  The second time around, Im enjoying this beer much more.  Hazy amber color, nice head.  Strong malt body with flavors of orange and toffee.  A touch of hops at the end.  Rather creamy texture.  Quite good.

Rogue Dead Guy Ale
12 oz bottle
Recent bottling, resurrected 10/06
Medium pour in a pint glass.

Poured a hazy reddish copper with a medium off white somewhat diminishing fizzy head.

Smelt of sweet caramel corn candy, allspice, butterscotch.

Taste was upfront moderate grainy bitterness and moderate caramel sweetness followed by a moderate butterscotch and spices bitterness on a long strong hoppy grassy and sour lime, slightly candied finish.  Mouthfeel was medium to full bodied, syrupy, soft to lively carbonation with light to moderate astringency.

Overall, the smell alone makes this a must try.  A bit aggressive on the palate for some, but eccentrically balanced and   stands out beautifully.

On the red side of orange in color.  Mild carbonation.  Pleasant aroma.  Slightly sharp finish, but not overpowering or metallic, making for a pleasant lingering sensation.  Very tasty beer!  The 6.6% sort of sneaks up on you.

Somewhat opaque orangey color with a medium tan head. Taste was sweet with a crackery (possibly yeasty) character, and a little hop bitterness in the finish. Mouthfeel was thin with medium carbonation. $2/12oz

Heard so much abou this brew, purchased same from the local Lowes Food in Morehead City.  First poored outa the bottle, honey roast with a malty aroma.  Small head, white/beige in color.  Dark honey color with a tint of amber with medium carbination.  Has a slight malty, coffee, honey flavor.  Not quite a tinny as I espected from the other reviewers.  NOT a bit of heat from the little extra bit of alcohol, extremely enjoyable.  This is my first Rogue beer, and I must say I was happy with.  Not a knock out, but a very lovely beer to enjoy with friends and company.  Looking forward to trying other Rogue brews.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: bitter after taste, smooth carmel/honey/coffee flavor, with a slight smoke flavor. creamy, but light body. Wasnt bad.
Nice amber color, thin white head. Decent aroma, caramel, pretty thin. Light bitter flavor. A pretty nice beer.  High but not crazy alcohol content. Sessionable.

The kind of beer that makes you happy to be alive.  Cream head with a hazy deep copper body.  Aromas are as sweet as most bocks Ive had but definitely has that distinct Rogueness.  Quite a mild flavor for such strong brew.  Sublte dried fruit, grape, malt, and citrusy hop flavors.  Simply fantastic.  Cheers!

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2006 Bottle. Pours murky orange with almost non existent lacing. Intriguing vinous, cherry aroma with a slight hop presence.The palate is sticky, and the flavor is sweet (cherries again!). Bitter finish leaves a nice prickle on the tongue - although it is a tad metallic/grainy.

Draught at Greenes Ale House & Grill, trip to Beers of the world (Rochester) with Dum, Ian and Lubière, purchased on August 26, 2006; eye: amber with caramel reflections, nice white head, no effervescence, clear; nose: hops, citrus, malt, caramel; mouth: refreshing, hops, citrus, caramel, finale of average length in hops, mildly sweet and bitter, medium body, good carbonation

FRANÇAIS

En fût, bue sur place chez Greenes Ale House & Grill, voyage à Beers of the world (Rochester) avec Dum, Ian et Luc, acheté le 26 août 2006; oeil : ambrée avec des reflets caramel, belle petite mousse blanche, pas deffervescence, claire; nez : houblon, citron, malt, caramel; bouche : rafraîchissante, houblon, malt caramel, citron, caramel, finale de moyenne durée en houblon, moyennement sucrée et amère, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation

I think its fair to say that Dead Guy is Rogues flagship beer.  Its the most commercial and the easiest to find in different markets.  Poured a honey tinted amber with very little clumping off white head.  Malty aroma, slightly sugary with just a slight hint of hops.  Initial flavor is malty, grainy and slightly sugary.  Finish brings the citrus and just a slight acidity.  Watery on the palate with a touch of heat.  Good session beer.  Just innocuous enough to drink all night.

650 mL bottle.  Translucent brown - looks like apple cider.  Solid beige head.  Aroma is very fruity (apples, plums) with a bit of sweetness, and theres a hint of alcohol sharpness underneath.  Taste is sweet - brown sugar.  Sweetness is balanced nicely by spicy hops, that become a bit bitter on the finish.  Alcohol is evident.  Nothing subtle about this one, but I like it.
Not a bad beer, I was expecting more from it however. There was defenetly a hint of caramels and toffees from the smell of it. Taste was smooth and sweet. Maybe a little fruity.

Clean aroma with a hint of citrus and malt.  Clear with a fine tight head, little lacing.  Flavor is good with a good balance between bitterness and malty sweetness.  One of the better Ameican Maibock styled beers.
this beer is below rogue standards in my opinion, its boring, not much aroma or flavor compared to the other stuff rogue offers.  ill take it compared to BMC, but its definitely nothing special.
user_location: The Land of Milk and Honey, Ohio, USA

text: An aggressive pour resolves into a dusky cinnibar liquid, topped by a threadbare toupee of wooly beige bubbles. Intense maple and butterscotch nose bellows with mind-reeling ethanol exhalations and whispers campfire, raisins, sourdough, and pina colada. Rather nondescript taste treebark, almost-rancid butter, copper, flour. A maltless, poorly crafted bock. Finishes as austere and dry as a nuns diary.  Thin and chalky mouthfeel, like lowfat milk and muddy water, but atingle with pins-and-needles carbonation.  Metallic aftertaste reminiscent of rust, soap, and halitosis. Overall jagged, directionless, and completely off style. Aside: since years preceding Ratebeer, Ive nursed a few pints of Dead Guy (one was actually spot-on), and have never known a less consistent brew.

I have to say this is one of my favorite ales! It is somewhat sweeter than most beer, if you can call beer sweet at all.  It has a great aroma and is somewhat strong for what it is.  It is very tasty and defintely a treat to enjoy by yourself.  I found the flavor overall to be very smooth and satisfying as well as a nice finish which didnt end up a nasty bitter ending at all compared to some other ales I have had.  Though a bit more on the spendy side of other ales I have had I would say its all worth it to give this ale a try.  Very good.
lotsa malt, has a nice intresting aftertast, bought a few bottles at the lcbo,
Draft. I had this along time ago and didnt think much of it. Different story now. Malty and rich with a nutty buttery taste. Pretty good beer.

Golden brown color with a small but serviceable froth and rumblings of some malt are immediately apparent.  Crisp and malty mouthfeel give way to a distinct but not overpowering aftertaste which is more smooth than most bock beers.  An odd frankensteining mix of IPA and bock. A good beer given to me by a dear friend for a great occasion...cheers!
Semi-cloudy, copper, medium carb and nominal head. Piney and biscuity aromas. Rough and cripsy, smooth sweet malt upfront nad hop bitterness on the end.

Bottle.  Browish, copper pour with light foam.  Lighly hoppy.  Thin body but pleasing coverage of the upper roof of the mouth that lingers.  Sweet, almost sugary taste that gives way to hints of caramel.  Great staple craft brew to have around the house.

Bottle.  Poured a light amber color/honey color.  Carbonation very evident.  Head was a bubbly white, fairly large.  Aroma mainly of sweet malt, with trace of citrus.  Fairly sweet taste.  Tastes mainly of malt, citrus, hops, and bread.  Hops became more evident later on.  Grew on me, but not amazing.
A nice combination of sweet and sour, with an alcohol kick. A nice beer, but not quite as complex as it seems on first impression.
This was a refreshing and surprisingly sweet brew served draught at Logans Alley in Grand Rapids.  This was actually quite dark, considering the other comments about it...

Very cute honeyish color... nice thick head... aromas of flowers... nothing spectacular, hoppy flowery flavor... semi-sweet bitterness, predominant alcohol, dry beer.  Not bad but i would not buy this beer again.
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2007 Goooood beeeeeerrrrrrrrrrr. I like to drink it down the old hatch.......................................

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2008 Poured a peach amber color with haze. Had  a small short lived head. Smelled of sweet malts and citrus hops, with hints of peach. Had a very definite hop and malt balance, with each shining through. Alcohol was noticeable. The palate was waxy and bitter. The finish was also bitter with hints of peach and alcohol. Very nice.

650ml Bottle: I acknowledge Im relatively new to this beer reviewing/tasting scene, but this is the strangest bock Ive ever had.  Dont get me wrong, its exceptional, but more of a dark roast IPA style brew to my tastes.  Regardless, she pours a cloudy copper with a generous foam off-white head, thick streams of carbonation.  Aroma is beautiful floral Saaz hops balanced with caramel and roasted malts, quite nice.  The flavour is excellent with a heavy hit of Cascade-ish hops trailed by sweet caramel malts, some grapefruit and citrus tastes, and a nice roasted malt on the trail down.  Quite well balanced with a terrific use of heavy hops.  Great stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2007 I absolutely love this beer(IN THE BOTTLE) Stegosaurus and I tried it on tap twice and it is not as good. I say it pours and orange color. Good head retention and the taste hits you right away. Good hoppy taste and solid carbination.

GREAT BEER.
hay, citrus, butterscotch, ginger, vanilla, tan foam, cloudy, brown, lightly bitter, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, medium body,
650ml bottle; poured a caramel-amber; a bit on the hazy side.  Aroma is all malt...sweet, chocolatey.  Flavour is sweet...toffeeish...then the hops take over on the end of the liquid.

12 oz bottle.  pours a dark golden with a thin head.  Yeast, grapefruit and pine aromas come to the nose, tons of grapefruit, very nice.  Medium mouthfeel with a nice blend of carmel and grapefruit.  Finishes dry and tasty.  It would be easy to down quite a few of these.

Bottle. Light amber collor, with very little head. Yeasty and nutty aroma. Taste is very hoppy, seems similar to a IIPA to me. Citrus, caramel, and spices appear in the taste. Not the most complex beer, but complex enough. Palate is thick with a rather dry finish. An outstanding beer in its own right. If it was more accessible, I might have made it my standard session beer.

65cl bottle. Clear amber colour, malty and nutty sweet aroma. Hoppy flavour, full in the mouth, up there with good german maibocks. Would be good to taste with some appropriate food (thought this bottle will not last long enough). Great beer.

Bottle. Golden amber pour with some yeast taste. Aroma is sweet and malty, yeast. Some taste of sugar and Honey. Bittersweet taste, hoppy and crisp. Alternates between sharp and soft, but always full-bodied. Tasty, dark, and chewy. Rather dry finish. Not really a Bock, but very delicious in its own way.

650 ml bottle, brought to me from Washington state by a friend.  Nice dark amber colour, hoppy and citrus aroma.  Somewhat complex maltiness, hops (which I first thought was possibly cascade) are citrusy with cheese? Will have again.
this brew made me feel like a little girl again back in the old country with papa.
amber, red, clear, aminimal head, I dont like the style that much (im a porter type of guy) but for its genre i find it far above average for a domestic variation.lightly bitter,
Bottle. Amber coloured with a whiteish head. Feels a bit sharp. Malty and sweet with notes of alcohol, dark fruit and caramel. Not very wellbalanced.
bottle. amber gold color. woddy aroma. bit carpy. feels like a brandy. quite weak and thin.

Bottle.  Rich golden amber pour with some yeast sediment.  Aroma is sweet and malty, yeast, slight candis sugar, honey?  Dry, bittersweet taste, hoppy and crisp.  Alternates between sharp and soft, but always full-bodied.  Tasty, dark, and chewy earthy flavor is rather tasty and edges out the nutty-caramel and toffee-toast.  Rather dry finish.  Not really a Bock, but pretty delicious in its own way.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2009 Re-Rate: White Crane Bitter: Pours deep amber into an English pint.  Head quickly recedes to hug rim. Sweet caramel aromas. Sweet treacle upfront turning to a lasting bitter finish.  Nice.


Pours orange/amber into a tulip with a quickly receding medium tan head.  Spritzy citrus aromas.  Flat with a multitude of differing flavors sweet orange and lemon upfront which turns to molasses and a lasting bitter finish.  Intrigue. 7/4/8/3/16 = 3.8
Cold 22oz bottle:  Pours a cloudy amber color with a moderate ivory head.  Aroma is of malt and hops with citrus notes.  Taste is mostly bitter with some sweet and sour notes.
[2006 GCBF]  Delicious.  Has all the stylings of a good bock, but without the overpowering sweetness of one.  Really really good taste and stays strong all the way through.
bottle.  pours light orange with a beige head, nice notes, fruity, floraly.  Crisp, clean, and smooth, very nicely balanced beer.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2006 Pours orangeish/red with a medium white head.  Aroma is fruity, honey, some caramel malts.  flavor has a clear fruit taste, bits of apricot, light fruts, some honey.  Mouthfeel is smooth, shortish finish, but with a nice bite from the bitterness.
Amber / red color with a  small white head. Some malt notes with a medium body. Slightly bitter finish.

This is a real hearty bock style beer with brandy, apple, malt and honey flavors.  Rich hops create a lot of complexity at the front and back of the mouth.  The price is scarier than the bottle design. For that price, an expiration date would be very helpful.  Cheap-ass shopkeepers tend to retread expensive bombers on principal alone.  Ive tried this on tap and seem to remember more hops.
Malty aroma.  pours deep red with slightly tan head.  not too too sweet with a hoppy finish

Fantastic beer. Great, rich flavor that hits hard and fast. For some reason this beer tends to get me buzzed much quicker than anything else. Very unique flavor, also tastes good after its been sitting out for an hour. The perfect beer to sip while playing a game of poker or watching Monday Night Football.
Love this stuff! True, its nothing to write home about....but, its pretty easy to find bottled and sure as hell beats drinking a MGD or Bud!
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2010 Brass colored with modest head. Aroma is mostly sweet malt, but after-taste is mostly herbal hops. Lots of body for a 6.6% ABV beer.
A Mai-Bock as an ale? Why not. The most rated Rogue-beer because of its label.

Pours bronze with good carbonation and a light tan head.  Aroma has musty caramel malt with some richness and bits of cobwebs.  Medium / full body with some frothy carbonation.  The taste is musty / dusty caramel malt with some richness.  Finish adds some spicy hops.  There is a touch of staleness here - not sure of the age.  An okay beer.  Not worth the price of $9 a sixer though.  This beer generally strikes me as a great gimmick with good marketing more than a great beer.
A pretty good beer.  Pretty good aroma and nice full taste.  A decent microbrew thats available EVERYWHERE -->

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2007 (Bottle at The Rover, Göteborg) Pours hazy amber/red. Small white head. Aroma of Caramel and ripe fruits and hints of some alcohol. Sweet toasted barly. Toffee and some apricot. A tiny touch of citrus. Flavour of dried fruits and buttery, nutty toffee. Good bitterness. Ok malty backbone but I would like some moore body and aftertaste. Well done on its 6.6%
Rogues Flagship beer.  Last time Ive enjoyed this beer Was from the growler.  Reedish amber in color.  Rich malty aroma with a well balanced hop bitterness finish.

Tap: Pours a dark red in color with almost no head.  Taste of malt and I detected some caramel as well and typical Rogue hoppines.  Mouthfeel is thin too.  It had a nice smell of malt and caramel.  Not my favorite Rogue beer

Bright reddish-amber color with a huge frothy head that settles into a thin ring of bubbles around the glass.  Sweet aroma of malt, caramel, raisin, a hint of banana.  Similarly sweet malty flavors with hints of caramel, dark brown sugar, dried fruits (raisin, dates) and a yeasty breadiness... altogether balanced by a decently dry and hoppy finish.  Not too sweet or syrupy... a pretty nice beer.

Pours dark amber with a small white head. Aroma is light but picking up small traces of yeast and spice. Taste is mellow for me, I guess I was expecting something bigger or chewier mouthfeel.....something. The taste is lacking and weird to me, there are hops present and something else I cant put my finger on. From the looks of other raters Im not the only one who had this problem. This beer is so-so.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2011 The aroma was far from strong - I could only pick up a light yeasty aroma. The taste was tart with a bitter finish.  The more I drank of this tap beer, the more I appreciated it.  It was unique - not malty, but more citrus and bitter without the heavy hoppy presence of an IPA.
Amber beer with a nice lasting creamy head. Caramel/honey/flower malt dominated aroma, just bordering the cloying sweet. Malty but somewhat dry flavour thats very drinkable but not exactly complex.
Typical Rogue. You want to love them, but they always just cut it. A basic pale ale. Usually pours flat.

Havent had this in awhile, and I guess my hop head biass had gotten the best of me.  This is a drinkable beer.  Sorta maibock like...
pours a darkish brown with some amber colorings.  Very little cream colored head, that dwindled down to a small ring.  Little lacing, but that seams typical, i think.

Very caramel malty aroma, not much else present.  

Drinkable with ale tendencies [ as i read they use an ale yeast]  some bitterness present.  malty back taste.

A moderate malty grain and light hop aroma.  Pours a hazy amber with a fizzy off-white head that is mostly diminishing. Initial flavor is salty which opens to a good malty flavor that reminds me of lighlty sweetened tea. This is balanced by a good hop structure that leaves a nice bitter aftertaste. Good solid beer.

via trade with IrishBoy -  Pours an amber color with a slight haze.  Thin off white head with very spotted lacing.  Has a light hop and toasty caramel malt aroma.  Has a light toasty malt flavor.  A smooth medium body beer.  Very nice.  Thanks Richard.

bottle.  Aroma:  Toffee, yeasty/bready, sweet malt.  Appearance:  Deep amber in color and clear.  Off white head was small and frothy and soon collapsed into a film.  A little lacing.  Flavor:  Some malt sweetness with touches of caramel. A little yeast flavor.  Slight floral hop flavor.  Low level bitterness  cleans the palate and doesnt stick around.  Slight sourness in the flavor.  Palate:  Medium bodied and a touch watery.  Moderate-high carbonation.  Overall:  I havent had this beer in quite a while and now I remember why.  Not very interesting.
Amber Ale with a quickly diminishing white head with no lacing. Good mouth feel. Complex enought to give you both the malt and the hops. This is good.  I would not hesitate to buy this again.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2008 A very good Ale.  Interesting in that it uses a malt recipe for a bock, but uses top-fermenting ale yeast.  A little different than your traditional ale, it might not appeal to some.  If you want more of a traditional ale, try Rogue American Amber Ale.
Bottle, Smell of fruit, hops and little belgish, Brownish and a little hazy, Bitter aftertaste, Tiny-tiny-bubble feeling.

Bottle.  Deep orange to reddish brown  with thick frothy head.  Aroma of pop-tarts, and some light caramel or toffee. Very sweet malty flavor with some toffee tanginess. Mild hoppiness in the background. Not my favorite style, but OK for a "sweet fix" without totally jilting my hop friends. The sweetness plays well with the Halloween motif.

This is my favorite American beer.  $10 for a 6-pack is something I can afford (which may influence my view of Dead Guy).  I like the finish.  I like the aroma.  I like the dead guy on the bottle.  I drink this beer most often, and Im never disappointed.  Its no trappist, but its still good.
Pours a clear amber color with a thin white head. Good aroma and flavor of toasted malt and fruits.
Pours reddish brown, some haze, tan head.  Toasty aroma with some hop bouquet.  Generous body.  Maltiness is well balanced against hop flavor and bitterness.  Excellent finish.
Copper color with light tan head. Light malty aroma. Flavor is lots of malts but in a light weight beer kind of way. I taste caramel, hazelnutiness and grain malts. OK beer.
Tasted at Vinens Verden... WOW, what an Ale. Bitter, hoppy, sweet, strong but still smooth. Really worth to buy.
A must for all Rogue fans, Dead Guy was my first Rogue beer and Ive been hooked ever since.  Not my favorite Rogue, and not the best, but a staple nonetheless.
Bottle.This is an ale, that is right after my head, perle and saaz is just the right thing to put in an ale.

Bottle picked up at Morrissons, Aylesbury 8th August 2006, and drank this in a field at Cropredy, Fairport Conventions Cropredy Festival Thurs 10th August. Dont know what the colour was as I gulped straight from the bottle having forgotten to take a glass over the field. Very malty, smooth full flavoured beer, little bit sweet but very nice to sit back and enjoy the music too.
Great aroma belies the taste - which there seems to be very little of.  Disappointing.
Pours amber, with a white head. Aromas are hops, malt, and honey. Flavors are hops, honey, and alcohol.
Bottle. A nicely balanced beer that had a really thick texture that I enjoyed, wish rogue was easier to find.

Not too bad a brew here. Kinda typical ale in many aspects. pour and nose is the same. Some hoppiness, and smooth honeyed malts here and there. Thick flavour and mouthfeel. Probably the better of the Rouge brews Ive had.
Bottle: Malty aroma. A full mouthy texture (not a tongue slider) without stickiness. Some hoppiness but not a real distinct component. Smooth aftertaste

Bottle, nice golden amber color, aroma of malt and fruitiness with a twinge of alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet (possibly raisin and caramel) with hint of malt and alcohol.  Nice beer to sit back and relax with.
Bold beer.  At first it is overwhelming until you get used to it.  Malty aroma and ballanced finsih.
Very well balanced beer, almost too balanced.  Nothing extraordinary here but a nice malt/hops balance.  Clean with no off-flavors fromt the yeast.  A good summer beer

Had this one both in the bottle and on tap at the Carolina Draft House - Pours a redish amber with a decent off white head. The smell is bread and alot of malts. Taste is a slight sweetness and floral hops on the back end - Over all a good anytime ale

Bottle.  Just solid all over.  nothing over the top special, but very good in all respects.  Malty, peach/apricot aroma.  Sweet fruit, malty taste.  Copper/ orange color with minimal head.  Hint of hoppiness on the finish.  Very easy to drink - smooth, medium body.  A good beer for everyday use / drinking 2-3 while grilling, etc.

Tarnished brass color, slightly cloudy.  Nice white head, fades fast, no lace.  Aromas were bready yeast, malt sugar, faint peaches, some caramel.  Flavor is a sweetly fruity, with generously bitter floral and herbal hops, blended with sweet earthy malts.  Well-balanced and very drinkable.  Mouthfeel -- coats nicely and cleanses the palate.  Almost seems to be a beer version of a nouveau beaujolais -- very fresh and the antithesis of aged ale.
Clear brown red with decent white head.  Carmel toasted malt aromas.  Nice bitter flavor on the back end, malt dominates the initial taste with molasses sweetness.  Finish is sweetly smooth.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2006 Hmmm, this is a tough one to rate. Nothing special about, has a very nice malty vanilla aroma. Malty caramel taste, nothing like a bock though, and more like a lager than an ale. Slightly astringant aftertaste, but fairly well-balanced hops. This is a very good every day drinking beer and wil likely become an affordable staple in the fridge for BBQs and keeping on hand for friends.

Sticky palate with a slightly sweet flavor.  Tasted like a lager to me, I guess I could see it as a bock as well.  Pours dark amber with a foamy light-light brown head.  Enjoyable, even when close to room temperature because  it hasnt been in the fridge very long.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2009 Bottle. Poured dark brown, I think (club was dark) Soapy head little lacing.
Carmel was first then tasted the bitter, nice balance. Smoooth. Good stuff comes from Rogue!
$4.50/bottle @ The Bamboo Room, Lake Worth, FL
On tap. Red orange with off white head. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, and sour. Flavor is malt, caramel and bitter. Smooth and delicious.
Pretty enjoyable. Polished off a growler with 3 friends at the end of the night. Dont recall much of a description but remember liking it, but then again I am a Rogue fan.
Deep slightly hazy amber with a small off white head, medium carbonation.  Aroma is malty and spicy/floral hops.  Taste is also malty/caramel, with some spicy and floral notes across the palate.

Aroma is not much here, a little musty.  Guy has been dead awhile.  Nice head, orange honey color.  Flavor has a wee bit of carbonated bitter feel.  That slight bitter taste stays a while in the back of your mouth, but is not over invited.  Its like that right to the end.  Not as much flavor as I had hoped for from the folks at Oregon Brewing Co.  Thats about it.
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2006 Over-hyped, but not a bad taste.  Good all-around anytime ale.  Nowhere near many of their other brews though...........
Pours clean amber color with a slight head that dissapated quickly.  A pleasant malty aroma but slightly sour taste.  Otherwise a nice balance of hops and malts.

Very unimpressed with this one. The aroma was nonexistent. The look and taste of this beer were completely average. Very dissapointing for a Rogue product. The taste really did remind me of Miller Light. Im hoping I just got a bad bottle, but until I taste differently this beer is just not good."

Amber with a huge  off white head with a good lacing.
Hoppy aroma with a delightful  caramel or toffee flavour.
Great finish. Truly enjoyed this one. Went back to the store to buy a case to bring back home to Canada.
Amber color.  Smell of malt and nuts.  Tastes sweet and malty.  Can taste alcohol but cant smell it.

Bottled.
Nut brown color, small off-white head. Bready malty nose. Malty, slightly citric hoppy, balanced but mild mouthfeel. Some acidity in the aftertaste. Quite boring. Interestring to have an ale which is a bock. Far from maibock.
Dark in color, whiteish head. Hoppy, but with a good flavor.  My mother loves this one.
Amber with medium off white head. Nice beer flavor, nothing offensive, but nothing really spectacular. Thanks for hosting undie. :)
Bottle. Nice, clear dark golden colour. Almost no head. Bonbon aroma. OK maltiness to flavour and medium bitterness.

Pours Amber with medium beige head.  Some hops but you really smell the malts.  I hadnt realized that this was classified as a bock until after I drank it, but it made sense after what It tasted and smelled like.  Nice session beer.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2007 A good beer.  Pours an amber color.  Tastes like beer... some citrus, some malt, some hops.  A refreshing brew, but nothing that stands out.

Poured Amber, small off-white head.  The aroma was of mild citrus, some malt, nice balance.  Flavor was fairly complex, hit sweet, then some floral hoppiness, nice bitter finish, with hints of licorice.  A respectable beer, although Ive seen better from Rogue.

Bomber bottle. Pours a deep copper color with thin head. Mild aroma of some fruits, malt and grain, maybe wheat. Medium body with full flavor. Balance of malts, yeast and hops delivered a nice complex flavor. Reminded me of a red ale.
Medium copper color and head.  Hoppy aroma with a slight caramel flavor.  Middle of the line easy drinking American amber ale.

Rich malty aroma with a sweet buttery diacetyl aroma with some alcohol coming through. Beer had a small white head, is amber in color and had a lot of small particles floating in it.  Malty taste with some oxidation coming through. This is an older beer possibly last years version by the way it tastes. The oxidation takes away from the overall flavor. Ill need to try it fresh and re rate it in the future.
Medium copper color - medium frothy head.  Aroma of caramel, bread and a hint of roasted coffer.  Flavor is rich with notes of caramel, toffee, and a hint of chocolate.  Finish is clean and crisp.

A very nice beer from my home town Eugene Oregon. A nice fruity aftertaste compliments the mild lager mouthfeel. Very pale and lager like in appearance. Smells of dried fruits, wheat, and malts. Over-rated by my friends but still a great beer.

Bottle. Aroma is slightly hoppy, with subtle toffee notes. Appearance is noticibly cloudy, like a hefeweizen, but with no yeast visible. Taste is somewhat hoppy, but with strong notes of toffee, coffee, an caramel flavors with some slight citrus hints. Carbonation is satisfactory. The toffe notes a a little too opverpowering for me, as I was expecting there to be alot more hops present in the flavor than toffe and malts.

Bottle.  Poured very effervescent with a thin lacing head that rested atop this dark amber brew.  Sweet hoppy aroma with a solid carmel body.  A decent hop blast up front that gives way to a sweet body and a clean smooth finish.  A solid ale.
I found this beer in a gas station in a small town. I had to try it because the label was so cool. I would definitely buy this beer again!
I got a growler of this at Orange Beverages and More...Excellent malt bomb and very clear and crisp lager like. Very popular with friends very drinkable

nothing special,rogue has much better beers.I wasnt a big fan of the crap on the mouth of the beer...............................
.............
This had an orangey color.Aroma was quite fragrant of hops and malt.Head was about average.Had a unique taste of fruits and malt.I would like to tryt it again.
Great brew amber nice thick white head, nice rich hoopy chacter with multiple dimesions, very thick mouthfeel. Excellent finish

Pours a clear amber, near-nonexistent head. Can barely smell anything, though when I put my nose reeaally close (to the point of almost snorting in the beer, yikes) I get a whiff of caramel. Exceedingly hoppy, bitter aftertaste, not much else going on. I like the label though.

Bottled: Golden coloured. Hazy. Dense off white head. Aroma of cocoa, fruits and berries. Is quite herbal. Flavour as well is herbal and fruity. Quite dry mouthfeel. Medium bodied. Ends on a medium bitter and balanced note. Nice one.
Robe dorée très claire surmontée dune mousse blanche qui persiste. Arômes de caramel. Saveurs de caramel et de diacétyl.
Bottle: Full bodied, fruity taste with notes of red berries and raisin. Medium heavy head. Complex from start to finish worth the $7.00 for a Pint.

(bottle) Although the aroma is not very powerful traces of caramel, herbs and sweet alcohol can be detected. The colour is reddish with a quickly disappearing head. Quite a bite of hoppiness and a little caramel in the taste. The beer is full bodied with a nice bitter aftertaste. An excellent and well-balanced ale  but why call it a mai-bock?
Bottle 1pnt 6ozs. Pours a nice amber with a little head off white color. This is a deicent beer goes great with hamburgers.
Nice amber color. Has been about a week since I had it so I cannot remember much about it. I think I would probably try it again.
white frothy head and an amberish color.  Palate is good, aroma is not very apparent.  Could be thicker.  Pretty good.

Bottle. Amber color with creamy head. Sweet, malty and toffeish aroma with notes of raspberry and alcohol. Sticky flavor of toffee and malt with some floral hops in the background. More sticky toffee and raspberries in the finish. The sticky toffee flavor is unpleasant.

Enjoyed this one from Rogue. The label was cool, the flavor strong and full, and the color a beauty. Resembled a Sam Adams Lager on steroids with a nice malt and hops balance but stronger flavor. Everytime I drink a Sam I get this cedar type after taste. More prominent and similar with the Dead Guy.
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2007 A nice red that tempts you with its name and then dissapoints. It was sour and the taste lingered too long.

Bottle: Pours a hazy orange copper with a nice creamy off white head.
Aroma was subtle caramel and floral hopiness.
Flavour is fruity orange and floral dry hop, clean bitter finish. Very nice.

Pours a cloudy amber color with a thin off white head.  Aroma is of citrus, hops, caramel, and sweet malts.  Flavor was the same with a decent bitter finish.  Flavor and aroma doesnt really remind me of a bock, but it was a delicious brew.  Was better then I expected.
Light taste, almost a bock, as was mentioned.  Rogues finest, which is saying a lot.

Bottled. Pours copper and gold with a diminishing off-white head. Lighty floral, lightly roasty aroma. Creamy, full body with light carbonation. Tastes like toffee, nuts and shortbread cookies with just enough hops to clean things up on the finish. Almost a desert beer. I though it might be a good way to coax wives, girlfriends and other hop-averse types out of the realm of wine coolers, but my wife corrected me on this score. "Its yucky."

Thx to beerkönig. FG: 1012. Nice bottle, nice graphics too. Slight hazy orange amber beer with quickly dissapearing head. Nice oily lacing. Malty aromas with caramel notes. Some notes of toffees too. Quit well balanced nose.  Flavours of caramel, some orange and wood. Dry and fresh but the aftertaste gave me a bad end feeling about this one.

Slight hazy orange-amber beer with an off white to light yellow head. It has a nice nose of barley and tropical wood. Also hints of a good Cognac and a nice selectioan of fine cerials. The taste is well ballanced and has a dry caracter of white wood, hops and citrus zest. In the second fase, it turns over to a vegetal bitterness with a crisy edge. The afthertaste is a little out of ballance and ends with a touch of eucaliptus and some green tea.

A nice offering from Rogue, but what else would you expect? This is an extremely easy drinkin ale that pours a nice deep orange hue. Butterscotch, honey and caramel flavors pull through nicely with good floral flavors on the back-end. Very drinkable and a great beer to introduce beer newbies to. When I want something that isnt going to destroy my taste buds like a DIPA, or I dont feel like diggin into something deep like a stout, then ill more then happily grab a sixer of these.

Rogues Dead Guy Ale is orange/light brown in appearance, with a billowy creamy head. Smells quite bocky: rich, satisfying malts. The taste is similar to a bock (in my mind) but much more full and fruity. Top notch by Rogue.
Off-white lasting head.  Hazy red colour.  Sweet fruity scent.  Very musty fruited flavour.  Reminds me of the short story known as Fruiting Bodies by Brian Lumley.
Maierbock as the Elixir.  Who could resist a TAG line liek that.  Have had 2 of these out of the bottle and thoroughly enjoyed them.

Bomber.  Poured a crystal clear toffee color with a small, mostly diminishing off-white head.  Aroma of dough, moderately yeasty.  Moderately malty with caramel notes.  Moderate grassy hoppiness.  A really well-balanced nose.  Some notes of toffee.  Light to medium bitterness, flavors of caramel, orange, and old wood.  Aftertaste of buttered rum.  Very smooth and quite rich, medium bodied.  Strong carbonation.  Warms the belly.  I think I would drink this everyday.  Kind of a desert island beer, and definitely better company than many of my friends.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008 (Bottled, 5.1% ABV) Hazy amber color with a small, firm head. Toffee-malty, sweetish aroma with some berries, faint roastiness, and aromatic hops. Grainy, caramely-malty, berry-fruity flavor with honey, some aromatic hops, and a semi-dry, bitter finish. Medium-bodied, slicky palate with slightly foamy carbonation. Has a very nice malt profile, combined with subtle aromatic hoppiness, and surprisingly warming and full palate for the ABV.
A fine pale ale with a hint of red hue.  A nice malty taste with a light fruitiness.  A medium body with medium carbonation.
Strong color, foamy head that lasts.  Smokey flavor with some choclatey-ness, overall more subtle in flavor than I expected.  Very moreish.
I was bemused by the name of this Ale. Color & appearance was a golden auburn with a rich aroma.  Flavor was hoppy with a noticable after taste.  Not bad.  However, not memorable either.
Thought it was an APA..Boc is a better description now that I read description.Very malty nice almost APA hop character. Nice mouth coating great texture nice finish
Looks really good. The aroma s a little fruty. Tastes ok. Not my favourite kind of beer. Maby I´ll learn.
Bottle. Small white head. Clear amber body. Honey aroma. Flavor of honey and hops.

I really enjoyed this beer. It was slightly dark, with a mild head.  It was a real smooth, slightly bittery, fruity beer. It starts out with a mild sweet taste, almost like dark chocolate. Then, it turns into a bitter fruity normal ale taste. It was real smooth, but had lots of flavor.  I will buy this again.
Hoppy start gives way to unexpected spicy maltiness - I got hints of nutmegs. Smells good but average look with small head.
Bottle.  Great no-frills beer.  Pours golden brown with slight white head. Great on a hot summer day or a crisp Autumn night.

Bottle from Johns Grocery poured into tumbler - Pours dark golden with a 1.5 finger tan head; Mostly citrus and some kind of berry with some hops to the nose, though its a fairly weak aroma; Lots of hops to the initial taste with only a little of the citrus that was present in the aroma showing through; A little bitter backtaste that lasts for a while and eventually turns sweet; Alcohol does show through after a while, though not much. I dont see how this beer could be described as watery. Its a good one! Not something I would buy every day, but by no means is it scraping the bottom of the barrel. Good job Rogue.

Bottle - Pours nice copper color with very thin white head.  Aroma is hops and citrus.  Palate is a litte thin, but smooth.  Very hoppy taste with some bitter citrusy notes.  I cant put my finger on it, but there is something metallic in the aftertaste.  Alcohol is not too overwhelming.  Overall not bad, but probably not one Ill try again soon.
Beautiful reddish amber colour. Lovely fruity and hoppy aroma. Flavour is nice and ends in a fine bitter finish dominated by American hops I think.

Draft.
Great bock!
Sweet mild smell and nice apperance.
Nice well balanced flavor keeps this to be very drinkable.
Cheers!

Beer is a clear medium amber with a large, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting head.

Okay smelling. The aroma is malty with moderate notes of toasted grain, light notes of cookie and caramel; hoppy with a trace of something skunky-herby; yeasty with moderate notes of dough, light notes of cellar, sharp cheese; trace miscellaneous note of tea.

The flavor is balanced and clean. Moderately-to-heavily sweet, lightly bitter with a long, moderately sweet, lightly bitter finish.

The body is light, the texture is watery and the carbonation is lively.

There is something about the PacMan ale yeast (I tihink) that just doesnt work for me.  The rogue line-up with some exceptions gets rated lower by me than most others.  In this case its DGA - the apple fruitiness comes off as musty to me. too much bitter hop.
Amber orange, aromas of toffe and brwon sugar. Sweet palate with generous caramel malt, a hint of fruit & nuts. A terrific bock, although not as full-bodied as some of the other bocks Ive had.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Hazy amber colour, very balanced malt and hop flavours. Very rich and full bodied palate.

Rated on the 12 oz. bottle, but have enjoyed bomber as well. Poured to a hazy reddish-orange, with one finger white-tan head that lingered. This was a very active beer, as carbonation bubbles continued to work the entire drink. Aroma of fruit (apples?) and malt, with hops present. Bitterness combined with the fruit created a very good flavor and finish. Alcohols presence became more apparent near the end....even more so in the bomber. Overall, a very good beer.

clear amber pour, with a small whitish head. sweet malty aroma. sweet, caramel malt flavor, with a touch of hops to make it not too sweet. pretty full mouthfeel. i have drank this beer so many times. and it is good. great for when I dont want an abrasive hoppy beer.

Pours a foggy umbar with a promptly diminishing head.  I cant quite remember a similar looking brew, but still, it this beer inviting.  The aroma is straight up Fig Newtons.  Theres fig, honey, malt, and just a touch of apple and floral hops.  This beer sits about right in the mouth with a little tackiness.  The flavors are remarkably similar to the aroma, though perhaps theres a bit more cream there.  This is a bit sweet, which weirded me out when I first had this at a bar a few months ago, but this second time around, I have to say this is rather nice, though certainly not your average beer.

Orange-brown color with little head.  Smells like pears, dates, figs, apples (so, fruity!), and cookies.  Tastes very similar but with a bit more malt,caramel and hoppy flavours than the aroma suggests.  Smooth palate.  Good beer!

Pours a beautiful cloudy amber/rust color with head that dissapated quickly.  Tastes of malts, caramel, a bit of citrus, honey, and some light hoppiness.  Balanced taste throughout with a nice smoothness.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2006 Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt, citrus, alcohol. Flavor is smooth and refreshing, sweet, citrus, mild bitterness.
Nice dark color but I thought it had a rather strong after taste.  Probably would not buy this beer

This beer is a Rogue classic. Fresh on draught, this beer is amazingly good.  Not a true bock bier, this is a very flavorful, very malty, very hoppy ale. Pours to a slightly murky amber color, with a thick, creamy, white head, and a good carbonation. Lots of good sweet, toasty, and nutty malt aroma pairs with zesty/herbal hop aroma. The palate is firm, with good sweet, toasty, and nutty malt, with light touches of estery fruit, and roasted malt flavor. Dead Guy finishes with more good malt and roast up front, then ends with a vibrant punch of grassy/zesty hop bitterness that lingers. What a delicious beer. Perfect for all occasions, and would match well with just about anything.
A really good beer with a nice fruity - roasted taste that does not become bitter after a while.  Very full bodied and rich.
Now THIS is a great beer. Fruity and spicy with a great head. Full, rich body, but not overpowering. What a great brew.

Malty aroma... Pours out into a deep golden/honey colour with a nice head but varies on retention from bottle to bottle (and from 6er to 22 to jug). Overall very inviting appearance and scent, however the flavor is where this beer shines- Wonderful mix of maltiness and grains and hops- slight roasted flavour. Very bold and strong taste perception but mild and smooth on the palate (goes down smooth but begs for another bold taste)...
Pours a light amber with a fast head. Suberbly balanced; sweet in the mouth, bitter on the finish. Great ale, Ill definitely buy it again.
UPDATED: APR 8, 2006 Nice amber pour with little head. Malty nose.  Bit of a roasted taste. Great balance of malt, sweetness and hops. Solid ale.

Light amber in colour with a bit of haze and lots of carbonation. Very malty aroma and flavor, with some minor caramel and orange notes. Theres a bit of roasted grain nuttiness on the finish as well. I detected a bit of spicy hop bitterness, but this is one doesnt seem nearly as hoppy as other Rogue products that Ive sampled. Solid, but unspectacular.
Pours a dark color with a tan creamy head which disappears quickly. Malty aroma along with a roasted taste. Strong overall beer with a well balanced finish.
Bottle 12 oz--What should I add?  Over 1000 reviews and least I got around to it and I liked it.

(Bottled) Amber colour with a creamy, but disappearing head. Malty, fruity and slightly roasted nose with citrus (blood oranges), a bit like marmalade, and caramel. Full flavoured, roasted taste with hints of hops and oranges. Very nice balance between the malt, sweetness and hops, just enough of everything. Beautiful!
A very full-flavored beer that seems to evolve on your tongue. Hoppy enough to stand up to spiced/hearty foods but with excelent malt flavors prevalent.
Tap: Pours nice copper color with fairly sweet aroma.  Has a slightly thin body with average carbonation.  Tastes dominated by carmel malt and moderate bitterness.
amber, hazy, aminimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, long finish,
UPDATED: AUG 28, 2006 I like to tangle with this one every now and then.  Its more of a Winter thing.  Think chair lift while skiing here.

Mar. 26, 2006; 12 oz. bottle 

This brew is suddenly turning up everywhere in Central NY State.  Faint honey aroma; sweet (but powerful) honey/caramel malts somewhat tenuously balanced on the palate by interloping hops & a noticeable alcohol presence.  Bass Ale on steroids; a bit of a bumpy ride, but quite good, nonetheless.

A hugely popular beer around these parts. Dont see the attraction really. Certainly has a rich aroma and a unique flavor, but still is far to sweet and malty to drink with regularity. But I do love the bottle. Perhaps if I loved maibocks more I would really like this one.

On tap at Summits in Snellville, GA.  A dark gold color with nice lacing left on the glass.  They believe in serving beer all they way to the brim at Summits, so, I was not able to observe the head. It had a floral aroma and a floral/malt taste.   Im pretty sure I can get this at Greens in a bottle.  If so Ill come back and update this review.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2007 From 22 oz. bomber purchased at Tiger Town in Gardiner... I was surprised such a highly rated beer was available in Gardiner.  Anyway, on with the rating...  Smells unlike most beers Ive had... Maybe citrus or honey?  Looks really nice, yellowish/reddish body with white thick head that dispurses slowly.  Tastes slightly sweet, but pretty well-balanced overall... I liked the Shakespeare Stout better I think though...  Not a bad beer tho...  Think Ill try it again




Second rating.  This 22 oz bottle found at Lous in Augusta, where they also have growlers of this stuff.  Amber/red body with thin white head.  Smells malty with hints of hops and alcohol.  Tastes somewhat sweet and malty, similar to their brown ale.    Hops are a bit more present in this one though, but not dominated by them.  Medium bodied.  Finishes rather clean, very little aftertaste.  A decent little beer.




Third Rating: Murky dark amber body with two fingers of offwhite head that leaves a fair bit of lacing.  Smells of caramel malt more than anything.  Tastes malty, nutty, caramel...  The flavor has a malted milk like quality to it... On the heavy side of medium-bodied.  A rather good tasty brew.  Not as complex as it could be.  Not a "wow" beer... Not sure what it is about this brew that keeps bringing me back to it, but its a good beer, and pretty much the only Rogue ale I can find easiy around here.
A little too malty for my taste.  Pours a deep amber color, nice off wite head.  A good brew, I felt full after one beer.

i served this to myself much too cold and all i could taste at the first sip was the hops......as i let the dead guy warm up the maltiness came out....great balance of refreshment and flavor......but the abv is a bit strong to be a session brew

Tap. This is one of those beers that really suffers from being bottled. The aroma is yeasty and malty. It has a cloudy orangish appearence. Flavors of hops, yeast, and a faint citrus taste. It is Rogues national headliner.

Appearance: orange brown, clear with whitebeigeyellow head.

Aroma: Malt, syrup, vanillabuns, passionfruit (or other), cocoa, musty hops.

Flavor: Very godd, malty, bittersweet, good after-bitterness, slightly roasted, almost sourish

Palate: harsh, rich, warm, brown.

The aroma is rich and malty, with a hint of Saaz.  The appeareance is deep and dark but still clear.  The flavor is sweet and fruity with hints of malt and honey.  The most popular of the Rogue line but I prefer the Yellowsnow.
Amber.Off-white head. Flowery,sweet, toffee taste. The aroma is nutty and malty.

Bottled.  Transparant, caramely pour with a thin, white head.  Gentle aromas of grassy hops along with a slightly nutty maltiness.  Texture is rich and full with a surprising amount of hoppy bitterness.  The richness and full-bodiness of the flavor far exceeds the blandness of the aroma.  Nice, walnutty smack and clean finish.  Drinkable well-balanced beer, but doesnt have many features that jump out as being unique or outstanding.
17Mar06  six bottles for $8.62.  This is the most Ive spent for a six pack.  Dark amber color rich taste with slight bitter.  One of my new Favorites
Bitter. Golden, large head because i poured to fast. Bitter with a slight sweet finish. Satisfied with one try.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2008 A golden/amber beer with a small head that turned to a decent lacing. The smell of hops and malt were pleasant. The beer was slightly bitter and the start but not overpowering and had a good lasting finishing bitter. A very good sweet malt flavor and very solid full mouthfeel. Carbonation is off a hint but just that. Very nice beer.

Orange/amber clear body with quickly disappearing off-white head.  Aroma - malty backbone(sweet) with citrus hops.  Modestly malty flavor (light caramel sweetness and lightly bread-like) with faint hops(citrus).  Mildly bitter aftertaste.

On tap at the Landmark in Milwaukee WI.  Pours a reddish amber color with off-white head.  Aroma of caramel malts and hops with a bit of citrus.  Flavor follows aroma.  Light sweet finish.  Underwhelming aroma, but a good follow-up flavor.
22oz: Pours a red/amber color, medium-sized head, quickly diminishing.  Malty aroma, sweet, hops.  Malty-hoppy flavor, sweet.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2006 this would be great with food.  the aroma was initially underwhelming in power.  during the sip it complements the taste well, however.  pretty color, but unimpressive head.  im really liking the rogue flavor.  its not so pervasive as the goose island flavor, its a more muted nutty complement, but its very palatable/drinkable.  im surprised this beer is more than 5abv.  mouthfeel normal.

Pours an orange colored tea with almost no head.    Perhaps a few small blotches is all.  Aroma has a hint of honey.  First taste has a delightful little zing to it.  I expected more malt but those flavors are subdued.  Hops are very light.  There is some sour fruit flavor in there, perhaps grapefruit.  Well, I saw the 82%  rating and had higher hopes.  A good beer, no doubt, but not as good as hoped for.  The high alcohol content is evident.
Medium dark color, sweet, malty aroma. Taste of sweet malts, caramel, and a bit of hops.

Tried a 6 pack of this stuff from a reconmmendation of a friend and he was definately correct. This stuff tastes great, is easy to drink, and knocks you on your ass at 6.6%. The only reason I didnt give it a higher rating is that it was a bit pricy at $10 for a 6

Bottle, at home.
Dark orange with a beige head, fully diminishing, no lacings. Aroma moderate malty and hoppy (caramel). Flavor moderate sweet and bitter. Light to medium body, oily, soft carbonated.
Tastes of honey, flowers and spices. More on the sweet side than the beers I usually prefer, but this was great stuff. They call it a Maibock, I dont really know about that. Buy it if you find it!

Bomber. Poured a clear amber color with an off-white head that quickly disappeared. Sweet malts and dark fruits in the aroma. Dark fruits mixed with some hops and a chocolate hit in the flavor. Medium to full body. Sweet flavor that turns to a slight bitter aftertaste.



God bless you Weston!



http://www.ratebeer.com/Forums
Brownish golden body with a minial white head.  Good cherry, mollasses in the aroma.  Cherry, plums, grapes and slight hops dominate the flavor.  Malty sweet ending.

In the bottle: I was pleased with this beer. I wasnt expecting a lot given friends feedback but I like it. It pours a great cloudy amber with a little head. The aroma cast a great mellow fruit aroma that is followed in the flavor. This is not an ale for a hop head because of the minimum hop element. But this is a wonderfully tasty maibock. Medium body and smooth slightly oily mouthfeel make this a very good session beer. I will definitely have this again.

12 oz bottle, pours a dark honey orange color with an off-white thick head.  Smells like sweetness, mostly honey and hops.  The taste is very malty sweet through and through, from beginning to endtaste, with just a hint of bitter at the end.  Theres some sort of spice taste hidden in there as well, although unidentifiable.  It has a very medium-bodied bubbly feel to it.

Bottle, courtesy of deathrag. This one capped off a long night of beer drinkin, and tasty it was. Orange-amber color with offwhite head. Fairly hoppy nose, mainly citrusy, with some light malt sweetness present as well. Flavor follows, tasting a bit like a mild IPA. Nice bitterness throughout and more full than I expected, very nice.

650ml bottle
Pours cloudy orange with an ample peach colored head.  Aroma is friuty, orange maybe, with a little malt.  Im not sure how to classify this flavor.  I want to say sour, or maybe bitter, but its also spicy.  Peppery.  As it warms, it mellows and seems to become more drinkable.  I dont see myself rushing back to the store for seconds on this one.

This beer was not good.  Co-drinker suspects that I may have gotten a bad sample so I will re-rate in the future.

Amber color with clear body, spare lacing and small white head.  Aromas of locker room and arm pit.  Flavor short in duration, half of which was a watery taste.  Light body, thin texture with soft carbonation.  Hops picks up near middle.

this is my first straight bock. and i didnt like it. its called dead guy and it taste like it was fermented in a dead guys butt crack. yellow orange color. aroma is decent, malty sour with some floral hints. taste is way to sour for me. maybe its and aquired taste i dont know, maybe it was too old. just very sour with some weak malts and bitter dry finnish. almost like a dark lager, but more sour.

Bomber. Golden orange with a decent off white head. Nose is slightly sweet muted malt, and maybe a bit of orange. Flavor is slightly citrusy, with a soft malt background. A light spiciness on top. A quick hit-and-run bitter in the finish. As with all the Rogues I have had, a nice full, but not overwhelming, body.

Bottle from Swedish "Systembolaget".Dark amber color with a beige lasting head. Some yeast sediment in the bottom.Freash, a bit alcoholic, scent, also some sourness in it. Hoppy as well.Large body, good bite to the bitterness. A bit warming alcoholic after taste and feel. Hoppy taste as well.
What a good beer...i love the darker ales this one was a pleasure from start to finish...I would def. recomend this. Good flavor, and aroma.....if I wasnt so critcal I would prb. rate this higher.
From bottle.  Deep orange pour with thick off white head.  Soft malty nose.  Flavor follows with a bitter malt mixture.  Good bitter finish.

full great amazing malty fresh taste like I would drink this beer everyday. I dont even like most beers with under 8% anymore but this tastes delicious my favorite beer i can deal with the 6.6 for this one.
I found this to be a good and balanced drinking beer.  Its a medium body ale with a smooth slightly sweet finish.  Good stuff!

12 oz bottle. Poured with not much head at all. Copper and not as dark as some other maibocks ive had. Very malty but still a little more hops than other maibocks. Very smooth and carmely though overall.
Bottle.  rich, but easily drinkable.  i enjoyed this classic rogue.
pours a clear orange/brown with minimal head and lacing.   aroma is of wet hay malt while taste follows with a sweet malt, finished with a medium pine hops ending.
Nice beer.  Just enough fruit and spice to make it interesting, and the bottle is a definite plus.
Bottle. Poured smooth with an inviting head that was nice and fluffy. Has a toasted nut flavour that is slightly creamy. A very good ale.
Medium brown/copper clear body with medium tan head.  Caramel, dark fruit, malt aroma.  Flavor is malty, fruity.  Palate is very smooth and a bit thin.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Pours a hazy amber with a slight haze and a yellowish, creamy head. Malty nose with some caramel. Lovely, full body with loads of sweetish malt and some very dry bittering hops. Rather good and solid Bock - German style, but nowhere close to a Maibock as the label claims. 130206

I dont think Ill ever understand the hype behind this very simple session beer offering from Rogue. True maibocks, while more reserved and subtle in style, can be quite interesting without lacking depth of flavor. Dead guy simply falls flat for the purported style. It pours a simple flaxen colour with a weak head and a very basic "beery" nose. The flavour is one dimensional and unremarkable. A 6-pack beer that is an encouraging step up from Bud for the uninitiated.

Bottle  Pours a cloudy murkey amber orange with a small tan head.  Head left quite quickly but produced good lacing.  A good aroma of hops and malts.  Malts of caramel, molasses, and coffee.  Has a good touch of hops from citrus.  It is very nicely carbonated with a good palate.  It is not as malty as the aroma would indicate.  Has a very good mix.  Has a light to medium body.  A decent aftertaste and a good sweetness, which is well hidden.  A very tasty beer.

The aroma is buttery, yeasty, malty, and full of caramel and toffee. The appearance is amber with a smal head. The flavor is exactly like the aroma and very yummy. The palate is a little on the thin side but overall its very good.
A kinda dark golden beer with a white head.  Nice malty flavor and not a bad aftertaste.  An ok beer.
a really good beer. great taste that is to be enjoyed at least once. great out of a tumbler or goblet. has a good aftertaste that keeps on working. tasty!

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2008 A classic from Rogue and one of their best.  A nice grain profile in the aroma and flavor with integrated hops as well.  A well-structured body makes this quite a satisfying beer.
Aroma of honey and malt. Rich brown color. Has a balanced flavor of roasted malt and hops that have melon and pear notes, medium body and a sweet clean finish.

Bottle.
Clear orange coloured with an off white head.
Sweet aroma of malts and caramel.
Flavour of malts and caramel with notes of hops.
Pours slightly cloudy orange amber with quickly disappearing head. Aroma is flowery and metallic. Sweet, but with enough hops that carry throughout. Somewhat metallic. Average body.

pours thick with a small diminishing head,
color is a deep beautiful orangish-brown
smells heavily of honey and sweetness, mouthfeel is a little chewy and has a nice balancing hoppiness

A beautiful, slightly burnt, golden honey color. Well rounded flavors on the malty side with a slight hop and some woodsy flavors. Great ballance with a nice long finish. Not much of a head when poured, I like that. Very enjoyable indeed. Highly recommended.

Pours a coppery amber color with little carbonation and very little head.  Hearty palate, though not too thick.  A little hoppiness complements the flavors of honey and caramel.  Overall, an enjoyable beer.
Medium amber with thick beige head and caramel and a hint of chocolate aroma; light chocolate flavor, not any hint of molasses.

On tap. Deep red amber color with a short-lived head. Somewhat citrusy malt flavors, and toffee, caramel. Thick mouthfeel, but still not as intensely bready as German bocks. Added hoppiness is interesting, too. Strange for a bock, but as a new take, pretty successful.

You really cannot go wrong with anything Rogue puts out. Its nice to have a brewery that routinely goes the extra mile to make something beer nerds can rely on all the time. Dead Guy ale is really something to behold. Incredible colors in the glass, caramel in the nose and honey on the tongue (along with hops and malts..;^) Outstanding."

Pretty Good.  Poured a hazy amber with a decent off-white head and some lacing.  A sweet, slightly hopped nose.  Caramel, and honey up front, with a light hop finish.  A little more substantial palate than I thought it would have.  Again, pretty good.

12 oz bottle. Poured with little quickly disappearing head and pleasant hops/malt aroma with slightly odd and somewhat cloudy orangish dark amber coloring. Excellent malt flavor with warming hop bitterness. Very well balanced. My first Rogue brew - if theyre all this good Im sold. Incidentally I call the 6.6% ABVinto question as this beer is sold in beer stores and better corner markets in TN and therefore must be 6% or less.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber orange with virtually no head.  Surprisingly clean drinking with no aftertaste.  I was expecting some kind of kick to it after the sip, but the non existence of an aftertaste caught me off guard.  A very filling beer too.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2007 THANK YOU ROGUE FOR PRODUCING THIS BEER I WONT TELL YOU GUYS ABOUT THIS ONE GO AND DISCOVER IT FOR YOURSELF
A classic Rogue beer. Not bad but not ther best by far. head is fair, Aroma is fair, All is just okay.

1/2 gallon Growler. Pours amber with a brief cream head. Very flowery, fruity aroma, with sticky, malty tones besides. Tastes of rich, hearty, dark fruit and alcohol with a bitter crackle in there right after. Medium finish with sunflower seed and bitter forest tones. indeed a Decent beer.
Bottle:loght brown with an orange cast.  light on the carbination side though.  Sweet fruity aroma with distinct pine hop taste.  finish is the same as the taste, piney!

12 oz bottle.  pours a nice clear copper with a mod sized off white head which quickly dissipates to nothing.  Strong malts of some caramel and toffee and some dried fruits of raisins and prunes.  Some raisins right off the bat in taste and fades to a nice malty sweetness and a little nuttinessVery subtle hop bitterness.  Not a bad bock in my opinion, cant say how well of a Maibock it is, because I dont know the difference, and dont really care at this time.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: My first Rogue beer.  Pours an opaque amber color with a head that disipated immediately.  lots of carbonation on the side of my glass.  some malts in the aroma, but not much aroma to speak of at all.  it seems a bit subdued... either that, or my nose is subdued and not working properly.  Flavor is more malty, just a bit of hops in the end.  Something just slightly funky, like an astringent, in the end deters me just a bit.  not bad though

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2008 Reeks of yummy yummy maltness and caramel.  Little frothy head, leaves quickly.  Amber body. Sweet and over-malty taste.  Finishes pretty bitter and acidic.  Nice carbonation, but average overall.

12oz - Aroma is malty, subtle hops, and a touch of nuttiness.  A little boring.  Pours transparent light brown with nice fluffy head and great lacing.  Flavor is mild, mathces aroma.  I pick up a little roasty nuttiness as it warms.  Palate is sticky.  This is a decent session brew, but not something I would search out.
Had on tap, A nicely balanced beer.  Gererous amounts of malts and some good hops.  The appearence was the color of honey, the palate was good for a maibock

Poured from bottle into beer mug.  Off white head that quickly diminished with a deep amber (almost brown) body.  It might have been my imagination, but I thought I detected a very light sourness amongst the malt in the aroma.  I thought that floral hops were pervasive in both the flavor and especially the finish.
Good head off the tap and very smooth. The malt was sweet. This is a good medium bodied beer.
i love this beer, at the bar it is always the one that kicks off the night "round of dead guys" great flavor, smells great and is a definate crowd pleaser

From Bottle

Poured amber, with fast disappating white head. Carbonation good. Aroma sweet honey smell. Flavor slightly hoppy not overdone, caramel flavors in the middle, malty and sweet in the back of my tounge. Medium mouthfeel. Smooth and drinkable. Not a overly complex brew, but good.

The maltiness seems to take center stage in aroma and taste with a nice balance between sweetness and bitterness. But its not as flavorful as the other Rogue beers. Drinkable is the goal here. I find it kind of bland except for a touch of caramel which I detect.

Dirty, cloudly, orange in color.  Almost no head.  Slight citrusy aroma.  I dont know how this is classified as a bock, has a slight hoppy bite and bitter finish.  Nothing special here, but not too bad either.
Not my favorite of the Rogues.  However, better on tap than in bottle.  Not exremely hoppy.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2006 Good color (dark gold), and a very sweet flavor.  Crisp taste and decent head, though nothing out of the ordinary about the head - like most Rogues.  Sharp and only slightly bitter at the finish.  Im a fan.

"This one i am a huge fan of. Had a good blend of hops and malts. Pour a hazy amber color with a frothy head. Has a sweet flavor, and to my surprise not to hoppy like most of the Rogue beers. This one i will come back to often "
The aroma is slightly malty.  The color is dark golden with a tan head.  There is a malty sweetness to the taste and the finish on the palate has some bitterness.
Poured out a honey color with a light,short lasting head.The taste was sweet and malty and just alright,nothing special. So-so.
Golden colored with light head.  Taste is fresh and crisp, with a sweet after taste.
[22 oz. bomber] Pours a fizzy, golden color. Taste is quite malty- nice hops to round out the finish. Good, but not great. Pe
Cloudy and honey colored with a nice head.    Sweet malty flavor with very little aftertaste.  Great, refreshing mouthfeel.  Not bad.

Light head. Highly carbonated. Deep coppery- amber color. Very malty caramel flavor nicely balance with sufficient hop. very pleasant mouth and finish. tasty beer! Had it on draft at the Bodega, where its gone now except in bottles. Dowtown La Crosse.

Draft. Amber color with diminishing small white head. Aroma is dominated by fruit and sweet malt, very little hops detected in my sample. This drinks very smooth and balanced.
